I have spent hours on the phone with the tech people and they give me the impression that they don't know all they should know about their product to provide help.  Just try this, try that, try the other thing.  Nothing makes it better.  The last time I called them they were not available at all. We bought this unit hoping to expand into more of the Nest line of products like their doorbell and security systems but due to the poor performance of the thermostat features and pretty much non-existent technical assistance we will not be investing any more of our money in their products.
title: Bought this expecting it to work as advertised ALL of the time but sadly disappointed

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Show Me MO
content: Great thermostat until it doesn't work anymore. I purchased two Nest (3rd Generation) Learning Thermostats. The first lasted 8 months, and the second 14 months. After the first one failed, Nest sent a replacement. It was a different color, but I kept it, just so I wouldn't have to deal with their support people again. The second failed and their tech support gave me a hard time and wanted me to try every trick in the book before agreeing to send a replacement wall plate. When the replacement wall plate failed to fix the problem, they gave me a hard time before sending a replacement thermostat/display. I was frustrated and felt like throwing the thing in the trash. I spent $500 for the two thermostats and although I received replacements, they should not have failed, especially at that price. In addition to the $500 I spent on the thermostats, I paid my heating company a $127 service call to check my furnace, which was fine, then replace one of the bad thermostats. Luckily, the Nest warranty is two years and I was able to get both replaced. Time will tell how long they'll hold up. It's frustrating to spend that kind of money for something that doesn't hold up. The Nest app is great, however, and it's nice to be able to control air settings remotely or while away from home. I'm disappointed and I would advise caution when purchasing. I'd get the extended warranty if possible.
title: Beware

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Amanda M
content: ( May 2020 update at bottom!) I am slowly diving into the smart home world, which is made more challenging by the fact my house was built in 1953 and barely upgraded since. So while I wanted a smart thermostat, I knew it would be a challenge due to old wiring and possibly uncommon set up as this was definitely a house with central air added later. Install was a piece of cake. I am only minimally handy, and install took less than 30 minutes (most of which was spent fighting with screws into a plaster wall)... The wire ID stickers don't stay on well, and there was no info in box or in app on how to link up to Alexa (turns out you have to go through the alexa app first)... But it is working beautifully, no power issues at all. I can start warming my home back up from my commute. I do budget billing so will have to update later with any actual savings. As a nurse who works 12 hour shifts on a constantly changing 3 day a week schedule I think I may actually just confuse the schedule learning trait but we shall see. UPDATE: So I have had this thing installed over 6 months now. And even with what I thought was more time home than normal (thanks quarantine!) I just got an update that my monthly electric bill.is dropping by 29 bucks. And this thermostat is literally the only big change I have made. All previous attempts at energy saving (new doors, new siding) brought me down 11 dollars a month. This thermostat alone is helping me save over 300 bucks a year. This thing pays for itself. Get it.
title: Easy Install in an Old Home- and HUGE SAVINGS

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ld
content: Had the Nest installed for several months in our new home, controlling a new Trane Heat Pump. Then out of nowhere on a Friday evening , just as the typical Texas Summer was getting in full swing, it quit working completely. After several rounds of texting with Nest Support, resetting, sending photos of wiring, etc., their conclusion was there was a problem with the wiring and a Service Tech needed to call. An interesting conclusion after having the Nest operate for several months with zero changes to the install or set-up. Switched out the Nest to the basic Honeywell thermostat it had replaced and did have a Service Tech come out to check out everything the next day. No wiring issues were diagnosed and the Service Tech, who installs the Nest Products for clients regularly indicated that this was not an usual situation. That the Nest products were known peculiarities like this. Left the basic Honeywell thermostat installed since, and have no intention of further experimentation with the Nest reliability in the midst of a Texas Summer.
title: Disappointing Investment

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bill Bigelis
content: I was excited to get this new-fangled smart thermostat, and hopefully save on sky-high electric heating bills. Packaging was lovely. Installation fairly easy. Downloading the app, ok. I like the 'internet' connectivity, where it will display the relevant outside temperature, and detects when you walk by and shows whats up. But, after setting it up to smart learn, I found the device is just not 'smart' enough.  Frequently found it cranking up the heat when not needed or wanted, and often i find it set to some bizarre temperature.  I used the app to try and clear all of these (the app is horrrrrible at helping you set schedules and on/off) - and still, it seemed there were 'ghosts in the machine' to borrow a phrase from "I, Robot".  It still behaved weird, turning on the heat in the middle of the night. Maybe Nest developers dont realize here in the Northwest, in summer months we use cool mornings as our 'A/C' and dont want the heat on in the am . I finally just turned it all off, and manually set temperature. I would not buy again.
title: Ghosts in the Machine

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ninefinger
content: Extremely overpriced for what they are especially the new version is very cheap feeling old ones felt robust and what you would expect new ones have cheapie basil it feels like it won’t last very long  also had a really hard time while doing set up To not pull faceplate off wall does not seat to backing plate very well I am in the HVAC industry and for this kind of money there are much much much better thermostats on the market  but why many people purchase them has nothing to do with functionality but because they are trendy
title: New version is very cheap he feeling and does not attach to backing plate very well

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: cmsk
content: So I’ve had TWO of these units installed for several years with pretty much no issues.  That is until the dreaded OFFLINE due to low battery issue popped up — on BOTH devices within a month of eachother.  Apparently this is an ongoing issue that seems to plague these NEST units.  After exhaustive support — which I will say is very good from NEST.  It’s been determined that the NON-REPLACEABLE battery will not keep a charge.  From the troubleshooting performed, the issue seems to point to a faulty WiFi chip that’s draining the battery. From a design standpoint, this whole situation makes NO sense.  A battery issue should NOT be a problem when the system has constant power.  It should ONLY be a problem during a power outage, in which case the entire system wouldn’t work anyway.  Regardless, I have a whole home generator, so the system is NEVER without power, so regardless of the battery charge level, the device should not SHUT DOWN and go ‘OFFLINE’ mode when it has constant power.  This is obviously a design flaw. Side note: when the low battery/offline issue happens, the thermostat starts ‘freaking out’ and doing pretty much whatever it wants at random times.  Woke up last weekend to the house boiling hot because the NEST decided to crank up the heat… mind you, it was set to OFF at the time. This has been extremely frustrating and disappointing, especially considering the cost of this product. I’ll be replacing these two units with some other brand!
title: Low battery failure only a matter of time.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: shellshocked
content: I had two of these before Google bought Nest and they worked great.  I bought two more for a new house and the whole experience is horrible.  First I could not assign two thermostats to the same house - I had to create two houses - you guessed it a known problem that has not been solved.  Second every time some update comes out I have to go back and reset my setting for away and home assist - don't find this out until the house starts getting hot.  Third you have to go through Google home to set this up.  Google home itself is a nightmare and not something I want to fool with but had to sign-in with a gmail account and navigate that mess.  They would not let me use my old non-gmail email address.  Thanks Big Brother.  Online help is absent - you have to search forums to get simple answers to how the different features work.  Overall - take my advice and stay away - I am going to remove these and replace with Ecobee which is getting rave reviews and does not force you bow to Google to make things work.
title: SInce Google bought Nest these are a disaster

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dan Artamenko
content: First I have to say I love the nest thermostat, this was going to be my 3rd purchase of the product.  Its almost must need for me now.  The copper is amazing. This review is solely about what was delivered.  I paid full price for the main product here on Amazon, sold by Google.  The box seemed to be a new package.  Upon opening and then install it became clear this was a repackaged product.  First taking the protective cover off the face revealed a nick/scratch.  Not sure if that's a google QC issue or maybe it was nicked and repackaged? Upon install, the device was locked with a security code and obviously had been installed before.  I spent hours on the phone with google troubleshooting (including connecting to computer, sending xml file, etc.).  The tech questioned me about 30 times where i got this product and was I sure it was never used before.  He had to escalate with a response expected in 48 hours. I don't know what happened but I just returned the product and bought directly from Google.  I am a google guy (through and through).  I would give 5 stars for product, but this was not acceptable.  Dont know whose fault it was.
title: Great Product - but Amazon seller gave me refurbished

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dennis Hamilton
content: I'd been putting up with an ancient forced-air system with inoperable A/C and a thermostat that was impossible to program and then adjust later.  I had been fascinated by Nest, but was concerned that it might not function well in my situation, especially because of the apparent reliance on Apple and Android smartphones.  Being Alexa-ready was attractive, and I was satisfied that nest.com can be used from a PC and I could do without a smartphone/tablet app. The TL;DR: This is my favorite in-home technology.  I have not yet ceased walking up and checking it every time I am near its hallway location.  Although it is still "learning" in the first week of installation, the ease of manual operation and some simple energy-conservation moves are instant rewards.  I look forward to a nice rebate from my "energy service" and also future suggestions, at the Nest, for energy-saving and relief of peak demand.  And there is the yet-to-be experience of the trained Nest. INITIAL INSTALLATION The video on the Amazon page for the product is very useful, with great tips about removal of the existing thermostat.  The Nest package also recommends going to a site for verification that the existing system is compatible and the available wiring can be used.  Do that.  And follow those instructions carefully. For the connection, the most physically-demanding operation was mounting the white base plate (for covering the marking from the previous thermostat) and the Nest base.  The two screws are long and I encountered frightening moments with about 1/4" inch to go and sudden very tight resistence.  I overcame that, but the supplied reversible screw-driver was not good enough.  I recommend drilling pilot holes, something I failed to do.  The built-in spirit level is a wonderful nicety. I had some trepidation about how the built-in Nest first-time setup procedure would go.  It was easy and a treat. WIFI, INTERNET, THE APP, AND AMAZON ECHO My WiFi access point, on a household router, is secured but visible.  The Nest found it.  It did take three tries to get it to both recognize the WiFi and get the passphrase it needed.  Entering the passphrase was challenging, with nothing like a keypad, and it worked.  Think dymo labeler. I had created an account on nest.com, even before the Nest order, to satisfy myself that I could do what I needed for internet connection at the nest.com web site.  After local setup and Wifi Connection, I adde the device using nest.com through my PC browser.  It just worked.  The PC use of nest.com provides an equivalent of the phone-based apps.  The only thing lacking is a way to have GPS detection that I am away, although this works on my wife's phone.  If I travel with my non-GPS laptop, I can at least use a browser to control the Nest via nest.com and my incompatible-smartphone browser might accomplish that too. I wasn't certain that Alexa connection was working and I saw reports of difficulties in other reviews.  In my case, difficulties in tying alexa.amazon.com and nest.com accounts was because the nest.com service was down and I couldn't tell that from within the attempt.  It also helped, when then the nest.com server was back up, that I was already logged into nest.com over my Internet browser on the PC.  I learned immediately that Alexa will tell me what the temperature is at the Nest, if I mention the name ("Hallway") of the Nest.  Reports of inability to do that are apparently out-of-date. All-in-all, a great experience and I look forward to more adventures in economizing household energy use with the Nest as the instrument.
title: Becoming my Favorite in-home technology, even without smarphone app

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Melissa G
content: This 3rd generation Nest is my second, only because I've moved and didn't want to take the old Nest. I've been using Nest for a few years now and the features I love the most are: ability to modify the temp via phone app and eco mode (to save money). The smart thermostat is kinda like Santa Claus, as it knows when you're awake- or at least knows when you pass in front of the device and activates "home" status rather than "away" status. There is probably a ton of technical data out there if you are inclined to research. My reason for my initial purchase a few years ago, was my interest in adjusting the thermostat from the convenience of my phone. I thought it was great for when on vacation, or away on work trips. Now I'm too deep into the Nest to go back to the old boring thermostats that demand batteries for the clock. Overall, I'm happy with the Nest products and would recommend to anyone who travels away from home for work or leisure.
title: My 2nd Nest and I'm hooked for life!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Anthony S
content: If you have a Dual Transformer system, you MUST run the C "common" wire to the A/C system, NOT the heating system!  I have completely SEPARATE heating and A/C systems, which is quite common in the northeast where I live.  I have an oil burner in the basement, and a central air handler in the attic.  The compatibility checker said this would be fine, but it was not.  I preemptively ran a common wire to my heating system.  When I installed the Nest I was getting Wiring error codes (E79) stating that I had no power to the C wire.  I confirmed the power on a digital multi-meter was 27 volts.  I called Nest phone support and they told me my C wire was "not grounded properly" which made no sense.  When I disconnected the A/C wires from the baseplate, the wiring error went away, and then the thermostat was working.  As soon as I added the A/C wires, wiring error codes and the thermostat just shuts down, will not work and will not charge.  I called again and spoke to a different tech, who determined that I had a defective baseplate.  They sent me a new one, and as soon as I installed it I got the same error code.  I spent over an hour speaking to 2 different Nest support techs, and many hours reading through Nest reviews and info on the internet before I found this bit of information buried towards the end of the Nest Pro installer guide:  Dual transformer systems must have the C wire connected to the A/C system, not the heating system.  That bit of info shouldn't be so hard to find. The other BIG issue I had was that the thermostat would not automatically switch into "Away" mode when I was not home.  I set it up to use my iphone 6 to know when I was away from the house.  Well, I would check it everyday from work and find it thought my phone was still home, even though I was 10 miles away.  Checking nest online support was again not very helpful, as it states that this feature may not work if you are not far enough away, but it doesn't specify how far.  So one day I went about 100 miles away, and checked, and it still thought I was home!  I double checked all of the location settings on my phone, and restarted the phone to no avail.  One day I decided to switch the phone associated with my account to my work phone, another iphone (SE), and the feature immediately started working properly.  Which does not make sense! Lastly, Nest began emailing me to send back the "defective" base plate, but they never sent me a shipping label, and I am not going to pay to mail something that was not properly diagnosed by their own technicians.  I had to contact them yet a third time so they could send me a shipping label. Overall the Nest experience has been very frustrating, but it's working as it should now, and it sure looks pretty!
title: Frustrating to install and set up on a Dual Transformer system & customer service not helpful

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: sdo
content: Check who the product is ‘sold by’ on the right: My wife ordered this 2 days ago and we got this quickly. What she did not realize is that this is not sold by amazon even though it is sold on amazon.com and shipped by amazon. You have to be really careful not to miss that you are buying from a 3rd party. I received this nest thermostat today and I have no doubt that this is a great device. It seems to be a great thermostat. HOWEVER, I was very sad to see that the humidity sensor on this device is faulty! It is measuring at 77% humidity (which is very high for indoors!) when my hygrometer measues at 52% (much more reasonable) I literally put the hygrometer next to the nest thermostat and took a photo to show the discrepancy in case I Needed proof that my house is not at 77% humidity lol. Apart from the fact that there are no drips and mold everywhere. And no, this thermostat was not installed on an outside wall so the air from the outside could not be messing up the reading.  I recommend that you buy this product directly from google because right now when you buy it from amazon you are buying it from a 3rd party. Definitely hold on to the package if you do buy it here. I do not know what options I have. Google cannot help me and I already threw out hte box so cannot return it. When you buy from a third party, you are taking a gamble. If there is an issue, you are on your own. Also even if I got a replacement I would have to uninstall it and reinstall it again which is a pain that I really did not want to go through agian.
title: Humidity Reading INaccurate: watch out for lemons  buying from 3rd Party “Beach Camera” Company

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Walter E. Gillett
content: I bought and installed two Nest Thermostats myself and highly recommend this product. Some parts of the setup were a little confusing but ultimately I was able to do the installation without too much trouble. Aesthetics: the industrial design on the thermostat is lovely. I really like the way that it automatically lights up and shows the current temperature and setting when it detects motion. The scheduling UI is very intuitive. Nice to have apps on the iPhone and iPad. I’m ambivalent about the “learning” feature - do I want tight control over the temperature schedule vs. having the thermostat figure that out over time? Not sure yet. The big win here is being able to monitor and control temperature remotely & start heating up the house when on the way home, to have it at a comfortable temperature on arrival.
title: Easy to install and use thermostat - controlling heat remotely is a big win

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Anthony Ryan
content: Woah, my home looks so cool now thanks to this little guy. I feel like my home is controlled by Jarvis from Iron Man *Thanks Amazon*! I had read the reviews and did my homework so I was a bit prepped for possible failure. The install was simple and the WIFI UI connection wasn't too difficult. I did find the initial instructions forgot to mention "multiple reboots possible" and while my unit updated and rebooted 3 times, each time asking me to confirm settings I already entered it works great. I never new a unit like this was so easy to install and I am so happy I got it. *** update from July 2018 During the winter months I noticed the nest started causing my unit to power off and on fast. Along with that I noticed a loud noise coming from the unit. In the early summer i assumed some maintenance issue was occurring on the unit outside. After getting 2 certified technicians to review the unit, they determined the Nest is the culprit. For whatever reason the Nest is causing my unit to power on and off even when it hasn't reached to temperature I had it set for. It would disengage the cooling each power off which created a loud noise. I still haven't found a solution and my unit is now louder than an airplane, scaring a few dogs on my block. I'll have to research this some more to find out what is wrong with the Nest product. It still functions well aside from creating this loud noise.
title: AWESOME Tech TOY!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: — Odie
content: Before ordering, I did a little bit of research online. I found the Nest website very helpful to ensure the wiring from the old thermostat would be compatible with the Nest unit, and it provided excellent visual aids as far as how to wire it correctly. Once I received the new thermostat from Amazon, I did the swap in about 30 minutes. I felt I was unboxing an iPhone since the packaging and instructions are top-shelf. Watching a few YouTube videos helped a lot with the install and I advise you to do the same. I’ve had the Nest thermostat for about a week now and it’s still learning my preferences, but one thing I noticed almost immediately was how much better calibrated it was compared to the old unit (which dated back to the 1990s). The old thermostat kept the a/c running far longer than needed, I assume because of its location in the hallway. The Nest thermostat keeps house temps even and far better without running the a/c for long periods of time. This will save me money as far as the electricity bill is concerned. That alone will pay for the unit in less than a year. Anyway, very pleased with my purchase! Thanks for reading.
title: Very Easy to Install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ken
content: Got this unit installed quickly and easily. Went through unit testing successfully. In operation the unit would only heat, baking the house. Attempted to test again, the unit refuses to test if outside temp is <60 degrees?! It was 59 outside, 80 inside thanks to unit. Attempted to chat with service, 53 ahead of me, obviously lots of malfunctioning. When you allow a machine to control major home systems, you must be able to trust it. Don't trust this one! Found others with the same problem, probably software. I have not found anyone successful with this product.
title: Not ready for prime time!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mark
content: Love it, but for the premium price, I think they could do more. CONs 1. Unable to use home/away mode. With auto away mode (eco mode), even when I schedule the house to be warm at the specified hour when I usually get home from work, Nest senses that I am not home and keeps the temperature at 62-degrees. Not until I get home does it start to try to warm up to the desired 68-degrees. (So I am cold for 2 hours). 2. I have even had to disable auto-schedule, because no matter how many times I told Nest that I wanted to sleep at 66-degrees, it would always decrease the temperature to 62-degrees. Disabling auto-schedule is the only fix. 3. Does not allow me a one-time hold at a constant temperature; something even a $20 thermostat allows. For example, if I am working from home I want to tell the thermostat to hold at 68-degrees. Not allowed! Instead I have to wait for the thermostat to set itself to 62-degrees, only then can I reset to 68-degrees.  My schedule is complex so I have 6 adjustments times per day. Lack of a simple hold temperature feature should be considered a non-starter 4. Lots of lost opportunity. My steam boiler behaves much different that hot water boiler, because mine needs more time before the steam (212-degrees) begins to circulate; hot water circulates at 140-degrees. Nest only allows Boiler vs furnace (and gas vs electric).  My radiant heating is even slower still, which Nest could easily optimize. Optimizing boiler cycling is the key to keeping your utility bills low. 5. Doesn't have full integration with Alexa. I would love to be able to: -- say, "Alexa what's the heat set to" or similar. But it only lets me ask the current actual temperature. For example, 62 is actual and 68 is what the thermostat is set to. -- Allow Alexa to automatically take it out of Eco mode (away mode). I could then use existing Alexa functionality to being heating when I leave work. 6. While it will "work" without a C-wire, it will abuse your heating system to charge its internal battery. Don't do it. 7. Tech support for advanced wiring is abysmal. They only tell you to hire a technician. (I wanted a wiring diagram to connect to 24v (with positive and negative wire), since I don't have a C-wire (single wire); but they never gave me diagram; only told me to hire a technician). PROs 1. Beautiful and simple. 2. The functionality that does work with Alexa is wonderful. I love adjusting the thermostat from bed. There is an issue with not allowing new Nest Accounts (instead forcing you to use a Google account) 3. Even given the limitations, I ended up buying three more thermostats to control my future radiant heating zones.
title: Good, but not perfect

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tracy
content: I ordered and received this product without issue.  Easily installed it following the video online -- took very little time.  I've had it about a month and it's worked beautifully.  Fast forward to today -- when my entire house is filled with contractors -- thermostat decided to die.  Battery issue.  Recharged it, still won't work.  It shouldn't need recharged if it's only 1 month old.  I've been on chat with customer service because apparently Google, the tech company, can't figure out how to roll customer service calls in rep's homes due to COVID.  We have been chatting for nearly an hour now -- she is having me do everything 10 ways to the sun to try to fix it -- except NOTHING fixes it.  I'd like them to send me a new one, but they are resisting.  I have lost complete confidence in this product and am deeply disappointed.  For the cost, I don't expect to have these types of issues.  In speaking with friends, another had the same exact issue.  Shame on google for not fixing and not easily replacing the defective product.
title: Easy to Install -- If only it worked

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: raproia
content: Easy to install and can be done by a novice, just like the instructions state. I bought three of these. Two of them work perfectly. The temperature reads exactly what I set it to. The third, not so much. I’m not sure if it’s the product yet or what. The temperature is reading a steady 68 degrees even though I have it set to 71. I didn’t have this issue with the old thermostat. I need to troubleshoot it. It’s only been two days so I’ll give it some time to figure it out. However, this has fixed the issue in my mother’s house, where I suspected she had a thermostat issue because her heat wouldn’t kick in. It works great now. Each took about 30 minutes to install. It would have been quicker, but I was having trouble getting them to connect to the main.  By the third one I realized that the units needed to update the software. Once they went through that process, they connected no problem.
title: Easy

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ray
content: Bought the 3rd generation NEST in May 2016, had to get a new furnace system and does not work with two stage, variable speed furnace? Worked fine with one stage furnace and is SUPPOSED to work with two stage gas furnace but sends wrong message to gas furnace (calls it a heat pump?) technician here for over 6-hours trying to troubleshoot. replaced thermostat with a Honeywell, everything work great. Was sold on Nest but now I am very disappointed with this NEST thermostat as it says it is supposed to work. STAY AWAY if you  convert to new furnace and A/C systems.
title: DOES NOT WORK WITH TWO-STAGE, VARIABLE SPEED HVAC SYSTEMS

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: db
content: After 6 months battery stopped charging and thermostat would not work. Customer support is only online; you can't talk to a human being. Tried all the trouble shoots but could not get it to work. Had to call HVAC technician. He took a look and said, oh, one of those; I've replaced 16 this last month alone. . He said they used to work great but recently since Google bought the company the quality has been terrible. Totally bust, need to get a new thermostat. HVAC technician said he does NOT recommend Nest any more to his clients. Then the saga of trying to get refunded for a bad product began. It was a war of attrition that Google won. If you go to the Nest website, it directs you to tech support. After getting to chat to someone in  tech support, that person told me they don't deal with refunds and redirected me to support chat w/the Google store. When I got to chat to someone, they told them since I had not purchased the item from the Google store I should... talk to tech support! I told them that's where I had started and they said I should go back to them or try Amazon. I looked online for the Google Nest warranty info and they have a phone number. So I tried *that*... and got a voicemail saying please contact tech support via chat! So after 35 minutes I was back where I started, only frustrated. I contacted Amazon customer service over chat and described the saga. They said they are not supposed to take back returns after the return window has expired but they would do it since I'm a "valued customer." They emailed me a return label and will refund my credit card. They said there might be a restocking fee... which is not ideal, but what are my options?
title: DO NOT PURCHASE. Broke after 6 months of use. HOPELESS customer support.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: tjsoren
content: Initial install went well and the thermostat functioned well. This was for a weekend house so when we left I put the thermostat in the off mode. A day prior to going back I used the app to turn the furnace on so our weekend home would be warm when we arrived. The app showed the furnace was on but when we arrived there was no heat and I couldn’t get the furnace to turn on at all until I removed the Nest and reinstalled my “dumb” thermostat, the furnace worked perfectly. I contacted Nest support and after an hour the technician told me the Nest was not compatible with my furnace. I tried to explain. that it worked fine prior trying to access the remote feature using the app, but he couldn’t veer away from his troubleshooting script. Took it back off and reinstalled my original thermostat and the furnace worked fine again.
title: Poor product, poor tech support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RTaylor
content: Not sure what the heck is going on.  First one came broken. We had to send it back.  24 degrees out, NEST took 5 days to get the new one to us.  Set for 65, but the heat comes on when it's 70 in the room.  It must be "learning" we are coming home, so warms the home well beyond what we want.  The display is UNSATISFACTORY.  It displays only the temperature setting with a 4 pitch font display of the current temperature in the room. I want to see the current temperature in the room first.  Worthless.  I would not buy this again.
title: Not worth the money. The display is UNSATISFACTORY.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sylvia Garcia
content: I can schedule when the a/c goes on and off and program from a remote area.. this is better than having to call my kids and have them try to attempt in doing this.. or getting upset while they run the a/c without knowing and everyone else is away from home.. This tool will definitely save you money and a lot of angry moments with family over the use of the a/c considering electric bills have gotten super high for me at least. In addition, about 2 weeks into the installation which was extremely easy btw. I had an issue with one of the  thermostats. I called the 24hr customer service line and I was helped so quickly and efficiently that I was extremely satisfied, certainly not something I expected from previous experience with other companies. The tech was able to tell me on the spot what the problem was and how to fix it, so it took no more than 10 mins on the phone to get it fixed.  I can't say enough great things about this tool.
title: love this new technology

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brian T. Alvarez
content: Oh boy here we go. So this was a Christmas gift for my father. A few days after Christmas Day we opened the box to install it properly. The first thing I noticed were the instructions - ergo lack there of. There are NO instructions included with the package, except a paper that says go online to find the instructions and use your phone. Ok no big deal, whatever right? Ok I continue with the app, which doesn’t respond about 20% of the time (I’m on an iPhone X) and the Instructions were some of the worst garbled up concoctions of steps I’ve ever seen. I’ve taken engineering classes, built a keyboard, built a dozen computers and fix my own car all using YouTube and online instructions mostly. But this? Boy this takes the cake for the worst instructions ever conceived for this millennia. It expects you to know what everything is and what every piece is called without ever telling you anything. Anyways I get through the god awful instructions to the point where it says something along the lines of “go turn off the breakers for the house to keep you safe, and make sure you switch to cellular data so that you can continue with the instructions”... Are you joking? I happen to live an area where there is no cell reception. I mean NONE. So because google was too lazy to make some paper instructions I had to go bust my butt turn off every single breaker in the house one by one to find out which breaker will turn off the wires connected to the thermostat and not my WiFi (it’s an old house and the breakers are not labeled, and it shouldn’t be my job too considering they say it takes 15 minutes as an easy install). Several painstaking flips later I find out which is which and start to plug them in. Again the instructions are terrible so it takes me and my father who is also helping me with this, a very long time to figure out what the hell to do. After we get past the terrible Installation of the board and wires we begin the setup. Before I can even turn the nest on, it just flashes “low battery turning off”. And shuts down, I can’t do anything, nothing will turn it off even though it’s connected to the wall, so now I waste more time plugging it into a micro usb. It decides to act normally and we get past the setup page. We find out it only shoots out cold air and no hot air. We try for over an hour flipping switches, switching the wires etc to no avail. My dad has given up at this point. It being a Christmas gift and not for me, I called customer support and they make me do all the basic stuff even though I told them I had already done it. A few minutes later they have me doing slightly more complex steps to no avail. It takes about 2 hours on the phone for the lady to say that she’s going to escalate it to a senior technician. Why this took so long I don’t know. The Senior technician was very patient and kind and helped me throughout this process. After another hour I mentioned that we have a gas furnace and he says “oh well in that case put (a) here and (b) here”. It worked instantly, it’s too bad that no one ever asked me that question to begin with or had it been on the INSTRUCTIONS, this problem would never have happened. I will give customer support props for staying on the line and being patient, but this really should not have happened in the first place. It left me disappointed, embarrassed and enlightened as I will now be very careful when purchasing products from this company. Tl;dr: Took 3+ hours to install this product because of terrible instructions and customer support’s lack of knowledge.
title: Not a good Christmas gift

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jennifer
content: Took me two weeks to get it right. It would not connect to WiFi so I couldn’t work it on my phone during that time. It has a mind of its own and is very complicated to figure out initially. I would wake up to hear blaring when I turned it down to 64 to sleep. It takes some getting used to but I finally feel like I got it figured out. It works okay now. I like to be able to control it from my phone but I wouldn’t buy it again. That’s the only perk. I have to keep my heat higher than I did with my old thermostat to keep it comfortable in my house.
title: Complicated. Takes time to learn. Has a mind of its own.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Big Dawg
content: I installed the Nest and had it set up in less than an hour and that included having to charge the internal battery for about 20 minutes with the micro usb port on the back. It wouldn’t connect to the internet until the battery was charged enough. After connecting to the internet it was easy to set it up with Alexa. I set a few schedule points for the first few days and it worked great. I noticed the first couple times i’ve left the house it hasn’t gone to the away mode without me doing it myself but it has gone back to home on its own when i returned. I am very pleased so far.
title: Works great

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kindle Customer
content: We purchased this unit as a replacement to a traditional thermostat, that was no longer working properly. The set up was very simple. The instructions that came with the unit were easy to follow. When one of our existing wires wasn't making good contact, the unit gave us an error code and were able to make an immediate correction. The ability to test the system and troubleshoot it so quickly was just amazing. The app is easy to use and the unit user interface is great. We've only had the unit installed for approximately a month, so our experience is limited. So far though, we're very happy. *Feb 2019 update* We'e had this unit installed for over a year now. We absolutely love it! The app is so easy to use and the user interface is great. It did have trouble going on and off line, but the device told us there was a problem and the support page explained how to fix it. I appreciated the fact that I didn't have to spend so much time researching the issue. This has helped us understand how much energy we're using and make effective changes, while keeping our home a comfortable temperature.
title: Excellent upgrade

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mature Customer
content: After extensive research, we decided to buy the Nest learning thermostat (Gen 3). It replaced an old programmable thermostat that never worked correctly. After watching a couple of YouTube howto videos, I felt ready to tackle the install. After I took pictures of the back of the old unit (for the wiring connections), I removed the old thermostat and patched the drywall, then painted up to the hole in the wall (for a nice finished looking install). I had to use hollow wall anchors for the Nest base, but it went on without incident. The wire connection process was a no brainer due to the Nest website and their wiring compatibility section. I made the connections and installed the front of the unit. I had a bad couple of moments when the Nest reported that the R wire had no power. Wait a minute....I had switched the furnace breaker off for the install. (Woops!) Switched it back on and problem solved. The Nest itself led me through the rest of the setup process. Total time for install (minus drywall patch/paint)--about 20 minutes. If the only thing holding you back from buying this is thinking that you can't do it yourself, I recommend taking the plunge.
title: then painted up to the hole in the wall (for a nice finished looking install)

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Reviewer
content: Lovely design. Great to be able to control the temp from your phone. However, the Home/Away Assist is completely broken (with Android 9.0). I've woken up to a 50°F house because the Nest thought my phone left the house at 3am (!?) and turned off the heat. I've also come home to a house where the furnace was on all day because the Nest thought I was home. I've disabled this functionality... but really, that's why I bought the Nest. Now I have to manually turn on/off the furnace... the same way I did with my $30 dumb thermostat.
title: Not much better than a dumb thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tim
content: Overall, I like this thermostat as a programmable thermostat that I can control with my phone. To be honest though, I thought that the thermostat was going to have many more options and much more flexibility. To start, the auto-schedule feature is absolute garbage. Don't use it, end of story. A little background on my issue. My electric company has a program where electricity costs more during certain hours of the day. So, I have the nest set to pre-cool my house before these hours, then bump up the temperature during the high cost hours. The issue? Nest goes into "auto-away" mode during this time, so it never pre-cools my house. There is no option to have it ignore auto-away mode for just the pre-cool. And without the pre-cool, my house will get far too hot and won't be energy efficient during the high cost hours (I have a very old A/C unit, so it takes awhile to cool down the house and a lot of electricity to even maintain it). So now my only options are to either turn off auto-away (a feature I normally like, by the way) and basically make this a normal dumb thermostat. Or, I can keep the auto-away mode on and minimize my cost savings. Overall, at this point, I'm disappointed with this thermostat. Definitely considering returning it for a cheapo 5-2 programmable thermostat, as that is what this has basically become for me (albeit with a much nicer programming interface). Two stars instead of one due to the great UI, instructions, and help on Nest's website when it came to installation.
title: Not Impressed - Customizability needs a lot of work

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Richard Shindley
content: NICE!  Bought one to "upgrade" from a second gen Nest t-stat.  Larger display AND it shows the local weather forecast when you pass by, if you choose to have that. Turns the heat down if no one passes by it for two hours (you can turn that feature off.) You can link it with other Nest products and all report to your smart phone.  Can control house temp from you phone, if you choose. Nest provides excellent service if you need it, and they are generous with the warranty.  I have a ham radio station and accidentally coupled excessive radio energy into the furnace control wiring. It damaged our 2nd gen Nest t-stat.  Nest sent a new one overnight at their expense even though the 2-year warranty was expired! (I moved my radio antenna far from the house...)  No more trouble. Nest sends monthly energy usage reports via email.  Nice.  It is a "learning thermostat" so it learns your lifestyle and uses that information to finesse the heating and cooling of your home.  It communicates with you router to get local weather updates and uses that data to its learning The 3rd gen Nest also can control your whole home humidifier as well. I removed the control electronics from our Aprilaire humidifier on our furnace and simply connected the water solenoid to the Nest's "humidifier" terminal. No more outdoor temp sensing for the humidifier as the Nest knows the local weather!
title: A very smart, useful, cost-saving thermostat and humidifier controller!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Duncan J. Gray
content: I own two NEST thermostats.  The first one continues to work flawlessly while the second one, which I purchased from this company  in January of 2019, quit working after about one year of ownership.  I have tried everything suggested to reboot the thermostat including redoing the wiring etc., etc. but it refuses to connect to the internet (stating "no networks found").  I have been adjusting the temperatures manually for many months now.  That, of course defeats the purpose of the thermostat which had previously allowed me to monitor its activity via my iPhone.  Now that I have some time on my hands, I will try to contact customer service to get to the bottom of the problem.  There is no question in my mind that the Thermostat is defective.  Hopefully NEST will rectify the situation by sending me a replacement.  We shall see!  I'll post a followup review after contact NEST.
title: Quit working and refuses to connect with WiFI.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: R. White
content: Installed in November of 2019, Unit suddenly stopped functioning in September of 2020, with an error that there was no power present, on the RH wire. Checked with DMM, and confirmed 27V on the RH wire, Checked all connections and made sure that the interface between the nest and it's wiring base were clean and free of any obstructions. Bought a $19 thermostat from the orange big box store, so that I could run my HVAC (which worked just fine, with no problems). Re-installed the Nest just to confirm, and observed the same problem. Been going back and forth with Google Nest Tech support for a whole week, for what should be a simple warranty replacement. Their strategy seems to be to ask the customer the same exact set of inane questions 400 times to get you to give up and to leave them alone. They are so completely incompetent, that they could not even understand what I was showing them, when I sent them a picture of the DMM display showing that there is power on the RH wire. Will never, ever buy another google home product, again.
title: Google Warranty Support is HORRIBLE

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: vando
content: This may be the best purchase I've made... Like, ever. I had a Nest Thermostat in a my previous home and it was great, but for my new home, this bundle is ESSENTIAL. I have a boiler system with radiant baseboards from 1961. It is awesome but the original mercury thermostats weren't registering and the system was on constantly. We have two zones, upper (which covers main and upper), and lower which covers a lower floor. The upper floor of our home would be in the 80's while our main floor, set in the high 50's, would be about about 70-75. Our bedrooms are on the upper floor so we'd have to crack a window and let the 40* air-in or roast. I was unsure about having multiple Nests in the house, but I put one one the lower and it started regulating the heat properly down there, so I bought this bundle for the upper zone. I placed the thermostat in the main living room and the sensor upstairs. Oh my god.  You guys. We have it set so that the Nest automatically switches from the thermostat to the sensor overnight and back in the morning, and it has saved us. It is (unexpectedly) exactly what we needed and is doing exactly what we need it to do. Our sleeping temp is perfect and when it switches back to the thermostat in the morning and starts getting warmer we naturally wake up and go down to a perfect temp main floor. LOVE it.
title: Life (and money) Saver!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Scott A
content: A few things to mention on this thermostat. 1st off- it works great. From 1500 miles away my wife or I can control and monitor the temperature of our house in FL without being there. This is a huge plus. As far as installation, I had some questions regarding installation with a heat pump. I called customer service and they were clueless. Although they were based is US, and were friendly enough, they didn't know how to install the unit, which I think would've helped a lot. They actually told me it wasn't compatible, and that I should return it! Have such high expectations, I went online and did some research of installations on a 6 wire heating/AC system. I still had my doubts, but I installed the 6 wires the best that I could, call it an educated guess- and it fired up and worked fine. Some better documentation would probably save the a lot of returns and calls to customer service. All told, it is a fine thermostat, even lights up when you walk by it, which fascinates everyone that visits me.
title: A few Tips

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: e_arcos
content: I'm so happy I decided to make this purchase. It works amazingly and already started paying itself off. I live in Texas so it's already hot over here and I like it that it's saving me some cash. It looks very elegant and it's very easy to install and set up. It took me about 15 minutes to finish everything up including setting it up with my echo dot. I like it that I can ask Alexa the temperature inside and adjust the temperature with my voice. The mobile app however, is not the best but it does what it's suppose to do. I also like that it automatically updates the software and so far has never lost wifi connection. Highly recommend getting it!
title: Nest at its best

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: D. Mitchell
content: I wouldn't recommend this product. We have a couple of Nests and they've worked okay for us in terms of function until we've had issues. They've been installed for about 1.5 years and we've encountered some temp setting issues with each (one resulted in the Nest blowing out a board in the furnace that cost about $1K to fix). For these issues we've spent about 60+ hours talking with Nest support and they haven't been helpful. It seems like their goal is to create the most time consuming frustrating experience for customer as a means to discourage customers from seeking a solutions to issues they're having. Each support member says they'll follow up with you and they rarely do. They have each offered solutions that they then rescind which means that the process essentially restarts every time you talk with them. And, each time you contact them (via phone or chat support) it takes about 30-45 mins for them to find out the information they need to in order to help you which means that each time you talk with support you have to block out 1.5 to 2 hours. We were finally able to get them to have someone come out to check out the issue we're having (which involves something they've told us is covered by the warranty) and the company they contract out with told us that it will take them almost a month to have a technician come out to look at the problem despite us living in a major metropolitan area . The company, Service Live (who is the only company that Nest contracts with to do work), said that every customer they have from Nest has said that their experience with Nest support mirrors mine. The tech hasn't come out yet, but I've already received contradictory information from Nest about the service appointment so my 2 month saga seems far from over. We'll likely go back to the non-smart hassle-free easy to have a tech check out issues quickly for free thermostat that came with our heater. If you do end up buying this product a service tip is to call Nest Support at (855)469-6378 and ask for a Tier 2 agent. It's helpful to do this once you have a case number. When you do this, the person will ask if it's okay to take a couple of mins to find out more about your case, ask them again to transfer you Tier 2 support. They'll likely ask once more so ask them again for the transfer and say that Tier 2 support will have to look up the same info so you'd rather not waste time. If you don't insist on being transferred then you'll spend at least an additional 20 mins on hold with the first person you're on the phone with. Again, I would highly discourage anyone from buying this product and if someone does I hope that they will never have to contact customer support.
title: Don't Buy - Worst Customer Service Ever (feels like purgatory)

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: EC
content: I installed one myself at my home earlier this year. I had no problems, and really liked how easy it is to control with Alexa, even though it came with a Google Home Mini. My parents are in their late 70s, but my mom is pretty good with a smartphone, so for Christmas I ordered them this Nest thermostat and an Echo Dot. Now they can monitor their home's temp and humidity even when they're away, and can control their thermostat from bed using their Dot, so that they can warm up the house before they get out of bed. The giant display is also easy for them to read. And my dad, who still cannot work the microwave and struggles with the Comcast voice remote, can figure out how to change the temp with the giant dial. Luckily for mom, he still doesn't know how to talk to Alexa, so she can win the temperature war.
title: Works so well I gifted one to my older parents.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kurt
content: I have been buying these since they came out and I've installed about 6 of them, for myself or friends. Everybody loves them, even if they barely use all the features. I turn off the learning because my schedule is random, but if you have a pattern, the Nest will learn it. Actually if you don't have a pattern turning that feature off is must or it will drive you nuts. Nest will also figure out your HVAC system's response time and predict how long it will take to heat or cool. That way it is better at achieving desired temperatures at desired times. App integration and wifi work great. For some reason it is just way more fun to to turn the heat on remotely using my phone from the couch than actually walking across the room. But it is also a pleasure to touch and operate this device. Like an iPhone, it so well designed you just feel smarter when you operate it. And of course being able to control the heating and cooling when away from the house is a very convenient feature.
title: Still the best

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael Angel
content: Pro: Looks nice. I now know a lot about HVAC systems and how they are wired. Cons: After 2 days getting support from Nest, 4 blown fuses, and a unit that Nest determined to be defective I had to go back to the original thermostat. No refunds, No returns, No in-person support. Altogether I've done 4 installs of a Nest Thermostat and I can say it takes WAY longer than the "20-30" minutes Nest quotes.  If everything goes right and there are no hiccups then you need 1-2 hours to install the thermostat. You need to have access to your circuit breakers, some tools (screwdriver, drills) and know a bit about your HVAC system. Nest more or less encourages people to install the thermostat themselves but you need to have at least those basic preparations (and some luck). But on this latest install not everything went right and I was unlucky. I was working with a heat pump system which Nest seems to have compatibility issues with, or at least that seems to be the case and it's what one of the senior support staff alluded to. The regular support operators know very little about HVAC systems, they are Nest specialists and don't know much more than "Y = Yellow wire, G = Green Wire...". One of the support operators directed me to test different wirings and we ended up blowing fuses on the heater circuit board (all the circuit breakers were off when the wires were put in place so it was the wiring that did it). I had to go to a local hardware store to pick up new heater fuses ($4), new heat pump fuses ($14) and a voltmeter ($49). Another support operator directed me to test if a B wire (heat pump reverser control) was hot by directing me to put it in the G hole (fan control), it was indeed hot and my fan control got a current that it wasn't set up to take. The support operators had me reinstall the old thermostat twice (they still worked just fine) and my hands are still tore up from manipulating the wires. There were frequent disconnects in their digital support system which stemmed from connection issues on my end and on their end. Overall I spoke with upwards of 10 support staff. When they exhausted their trouble shooting abilities then they would tell me to hold while they transferred me to a senior support staff who would 'be with me right away', and then I waited 2 hours before getting disconnected. Another staff member attempted to transfer me to someone senior and I waited another hour before getting disconnected without help. Waiting 3 hours on hold is unacceptable in my book. After 2 days of chatting online with their support and messing with my HVAC system Nest is confident that I have a defective Nest Thermostat. I still suspect that it's an incompatibility with my heat pump (Rheem brand heat pump that uses a "B" wire instead of an "O" wire for reversal control). What's the resolution?, no refunds, no replacements, no in-person support. I now have an expensive piece of garbage. NOTE: Because of COVID all Nest phone support is down and everything is online only.
title: Nightmare Support, Misleading Guidance about Install and Compatibility

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Maddie
content: CONS: I bought this Nest for a rental property. However, when the thermostat is set under the "Heat/Cool" Mode with LOCKING feature is ON, my guest can NOT change the temperature to fit their needs.  I deducted 2 stars for this discrepancy.  I can only set the thermostat under either "Heat" OR "Cool" Mode ONLY when using LOCKING feature. Under the SINGLE mode (HEAT OR COOL), LOCKING ON, guest still can change temperature. So if the house is TOO HOT or COLD, and the thermostat is set under the Heat or Cool mode, my guest CANNOT turn on the AC/cool or Heat to cool or heat the house, respectively. Now, I have to search/buy a different smart thermostat! PROS: While if the thermostat is set under either  "Heat" OR "Cool" Mode alone, with locking ON, guest can change (increase/decrease) the temperature as they wish.
title: Guest Can NOT Adjust Temperature Under "Heat/Cool" Mode When Locking Feature is ON

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: mess
content: Thermostat worked perfect for 9 months then decided to not connect to my wifi. I thought it would be an easy fix. Went through all of the recommended trouble shooting issues and still would not connect. I took an extra step and had a  ATT rep come to the house and make sure my wifi was strong enough, and he determined there were no issues. Next step was to call Nest customer service. 1st phone call, I explain what was happening to the thermostat, and Nest determined that it was an issue with the Thermostat. No Problem. We will ship a replacement on Monday morning and you will have it sometime on Tuesday. GREAT. Best service ever. Fast forward 5 days and still no package from Nest. 2nd Call. I call customer service and wait for a senior Manager for about 30 minutes. Finally got a manager on the phone and he was very apologetic and told me it would ship the next Monday morning. Overnight. Didn't happen. 3rd call I had to explain everything that had transpired over the last 10 days to another service agent who put me in touch with another senior manager, who I had to explain everything once again. Long story short. This manager told me that Nest had run out of the thermostat that they would be replacing and didn't know when they would have back in stock. REALLY? Nest ran out of thermostats? Yep. I told the manager to refund my $ and I would go with an other brand. He said that would be my best option as he didn't know when my replacement would be in stock. If one of my Employees or Managers told a customer they would be better going with another company, they would be terminated immediately. The fix. The last manager actually has problem solving skills. Should be promoted.  After talking to 6 plus Nest employees he asked me, Would you be OK with a stainless steel model, Instead of the brushed nickel? Do you have it in stock? Yes Sir.  Can You over night it to me? Yes Sir. Will updated, if it ever comes.
title: Horrible customer service

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: David
content: This thermostat was something on my wish list for a long time. I decided I had waited long enough.  When I received it the wrapping on the box said " check the compatibility chart ." I did and the words we all dread popped up. " Contract Nest customer service." I thought that I was getting ready to invest a few hours getting in contact with someone,  trying to explain what I needed, etc.... I called and the support team was overwhelmingly helpful.  Five minutes later I had a diagram e-mailed to me and a contract e-mail if I needed anything.  As I opened the box my heart sank a little.  There was a pin head size chip in the finish on the outer ring.  I had waited this long and was not going to let this slow me down.  I installed the nest thermostat,  entered my WiFi info, set it up and downloaded the Nest App. on my phone in about twenty minutes.  Easy! I sent an e-mail about the minor flaw and didn't really expect anything to happen.  The unbelievable service this company provides is amazing!  They contacted me right away.  They explained that any flaw is highly irregular and they were sending me a new control unit. The new control unit showed up and I exchanged it. It took about five minutes.  The entire experience has been so awesome!  Such a great company and the flexibility of this thermostat is exactly what I had hoped for.  The App. work with it flawlessly and I am completely satisfied!  I just wish I hadn't waited this long to get it. Order yours now and enjoy all of the benefits this great product offers!
title: Get this now!  You'll love it!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Johndee
content: Worked for about a year, then the troubles began. I’m on my third thermostat now after receiving 2 replacements. My recent issues involve the base failing. One day I woke up and the thermostat had issued an error saying low battery. It was claiming not to have power coming to the thermostat. I checked the wire with a meter and it was reading 24v, so it isn’t the wiring. After going through the troubleshooting with tech support (running through everything to prove it’s not my fault), they decided to send another base, which is also faulty.  This time the base was saying that there was a problem with a different wire.  My air conditioning works fine with a cheap old thermostat, so I know it is not my wiring. I’m guessing they are going to send another base, but I’m not sure. Communication has dropped off somewhat with Nest Support.  I had big plans of utilizing Nest.  I have a Nest Secure and 3 Nest Protects and had planned on adding many more. Now there is no way I will purchase any more Nest products. They’re just not durable.
title: DO NOT BUY!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: A. Sudol
content: I currently own 4 Nest thermostats. All purchased and installed around November of 2019. My home has solid WiFi coverage I currently run three access points. It worked fine until May of 2020.  I noticed one unit failed to connect to WiFi and then two weeks later failed to power up.  I took it off the wall mount and swapped it where one of the good thermostats was working. Nope even after charging externally and putting back it works for an hour and dies. Time to replace with the warranty. If there a number you can call for help...NO. Is there one person you can email back and forth to reach a resolution?  NO!  You need to enter a chat window where you have to prove to them you did all the troubleshooting necessary to validate a replacement.  So how long does this take?  It’s about an hour.  Is my issue resolved?  NO.  I never received an update or replacement from Google/Nest. I’ve been through online chat sessions 5 times, yes 5 hours clocked in on my part.  Each time they give me a different case number and each time nothing comes of it and my replacement never happens.  All said in the chat an email update with a replacement is coming just wait for it and then... nothing.  We are in September and the old thermostat is going back on the wall and google is now dead to me. OMG I’m so glad I didn’t choose them as my security system , can you imagine? DO NOT BUY, they don’t stand behind their products!!!
title: DO NOT BUY, they don’t stand behind their products!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Patricia A
content: Once connected Nest was connected to my older system,  it worked like a dream for a few months on heat mode. I had to hire professional electrician to install and the devise wiring was less than self explanatory with the devise to devise blue wire designation, so they guessed  (later no AC, out they came, reset blue wire and the AC popped on).  NEST dropped the internet connection within a month and no amount of tech support reconnected or electrician skill could get it to set.  This meant I could not easily control the schedule (it did not know the time) and would not respond to touch control, or know the outside temp.  It is under warranty and I am returning it for a new devise.  I really like the light comes on when you approach, displays the date, time of day, indoor/outdoor temp (if connected to the internet), and was so easy to program.  The AC is working and great and I will pay the electrician to install new NEST when it comes in.
title: Must have internet connection -

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JLP
content: 11/7/15 - I am downgrading my review. I am very frustrated with this thermostat. Not effective in between seasons when switching between air and heat. HATE that can't see current temperature to assess. House has mainly been hot when air should turn on. I do NOT understand a thermostat that doesn't display current temp?  What knucklehead man thinks that's OK?  Rethinking my decision and may consider another thermostat. 10/23/15 - I'm still getting used to this, installed it 2 weeks ago.  I am a single female in home that is 14 years old, and installation was easy.  I do not like that you can't see the current temperature, that just doesn't make sense to me.  You can only see the "target" temperature settings and you can see the outside temperature, but not inside???.  Doesn't really allow me to gauge the accuracy of the settings.  I have turned off the "Away" setting.  Just doesn't work for me daily.  I work from home and am home much of the time, but my elderly mother also lives with me and she is always home.  The thermostat was switching to "Away" and changing the temperatures, without rhyme or reason, and we would get hot and cold.  I have now set a "schedule" and will see how that works for awhile.  I really installed this as I wanted a thermostat that did a better job of switching to heat or cooling, during season changes.  This one seems to do that, I just need to get the target temperature settings right.  I do like being able to control from phone or iPad, and I can also control if traveling for business and my mother says she is uncomfortable (she never can figure out any thermostat), so that really is a nice feature.  I also have DropCam/Nest video cameras, and is nice having those integrated with the app.  Verdict is still out, but I think this just takes some time to get adjusted correctly.
title: Downgrading my rating.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DJS
content: I’ve had the Nest a few weeks now and at first, I hated it!! I decided on a wireless system because my roommate is battling cancer and I wanted something he could adjust from his bedroom. It was fairly easy to install myself, except they don’t tell you that not all the wires from the old thermostat will necessarily be needed even if there’s a spot for them. After a few errors and a chat with Nest online, I found out we did not need the “C” wire. Once it was functional there seemed to be another issue in that it t always seemed to be 5 degrees colder than what the temperature was set to be. I set it at 69 during a few 20-something nights but it seemed to not heat past 63 so I’d have to turn it up to 73/74 to get comfortable. We live in a 1200 sq ft condo so it’s not a huge place to heat and the old thermostat never had an issue keeping things running correctly. After a couple weeks researching online, I decided to make tweaks (disable the “schedule” and set everything manually) and purchase a 3 pack of room sensors. I placed one in each of the bedrooms since they are opposite sides of the condo and since doing these two things I’m coming around more and more. Temperatures have become more stable and consistent throughout and no longer requires adjusting well above the desired temp just to get comfortable. I’m taking off one star for installation issues and half for having to purchase another $100 worth of equipment. So 3.5/5
title: Unsure at first...here’s my detailed, honest review

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Some guy
content: First off this is my first "smart home" device that I've installed in my house. The level of ease of installation was incredible, I was able to install and test within 20 mins ( I surprised myself even). Then afterwards you instantly notice the difference as the AC is not turning on every 15/30 mins. It cycles the air much better, it senses the ambient temperature with way more accuracy than those old mercury thermostats that suddenly got triggered when you move by them. So this all translates to savings on your electric bill and the fact that you can now change the temperature from your phone...c'mon that's just cool.
title: A must buy for the household. Instant savings

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MICHAEL M.
content: I think Amazon didn’t post my first review.  I’ll keep it simple.  This is a nest problem.  I’ve had problems with my thermostat before google merged with nest.  Either way it’s a terrible product.  It doesn’t hold temp after the display says its set for the night. It doesn’t learn from habits.  I’ve really noticed it since being indoors during Covid.  At least 30% of reviews here and on google website are negative reviews. The customer service refuses to address the problem.  I’ve reset my device numerous times and it still doesn’t keep the correct temp.  I’ve gone thru and changed all the settings to make sure everything was correct. Still not working.  I bought this about 1 year ago.  Didn’t install for a few months due to remodeling.  It’s good for a conservation piece when you have company.  Show everyone how you can control it and how it learns from your habits.  They are definitely selling a product that’s defective.  Time to move on to another brand.  This will increase your power bill instead of saving money.
title: DOES NOT KEEP TEMPERATURE

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ramman
content: I bought 3 - two for our office and one for home.  The only redeeming feature is remote monitoring and control.  The scheduling and energy saving is total crap. I used to come home to a cool home with my simple Honeywell and its schedule. Despite entering a schedule and turning on "early on", I still come home to a hot house even after 3 weeks of "training."  At our office, during a really hot spell both units shut down all weekend and didn't precool at all beforehand despite weeks of training and a manually entered schedule.  Took three days of miserable heat to recover!  Worst investment ever!!!
title: Total waste of money!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J F
content: I can control it just fine, and it works well. But, my spouse is not very happy that she can't control it also. After tons of research, I've concluded that there is no way to share control with her through the Nest App (because it's basically defunct) nor the Google Home App (because it is not yet ready for prime time wrt Nest Thermostats). There are tons of forum posts about this. Google knows about it. But no fix. And of course you can never get anyone on the phone at Google. Zero responsiveness. On the online forums, one month replies are standard. I wish I'd known before I bought it. I would have gone with a Ring or other option. P.S. Apparently it used to work just fine through the Nest App before Google hobbled that app after acquiring Nest.
title: My spouse can't control it due to Nest - Google Home App integration issues

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SandyW.
content: As a thermostat that promises to save me money by adjusting the temperature when I’m not at home, I couldn’t ask for better. However, since Google bought Nest, I have yet to integrate it with Alexa. The directions on how to migrate my account to Google has not worked so far. (Google wants you to use Google Home with all Nest products. I want to use Alexa.) Waiting until after the holidays. This is not the thermostat’s fault. Just be aware that using Alexa is not as easy as it use to be.
title: Great Thermostat but Trouble Connecting to Alexa

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gary
content: I like that it updates the home compared the faded white box. Scheduling is easy, I don’t use the Eco due to my medical issues. I purchased the echo combination and I think I need a hub because Alexa only tells me the temp, the AI doesn’t change the temp for you. However the app is nice to change the temp once you’re  comfortable in bed and not wanting to get up, lol. Oh!, install is simple!!!!! Please check your wiring before ordering and do your research. It took me three years to finally bite on this thermostat (Black Friday sale) I personally don’t think it’s worth the full price amount.
title: For the most part....
