product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: joshua147
content: I can't recommend the nest enough! This thing has saved me so much money. My power bills are consistently never over $60 even after running the AC while I'm home in the evenings and overnight. If your schedule is pretty regular, I would recommend using an app/site called IFTTT. It uses my phones GPS to set the NEST automatically. As soon as I leave for work, the Nest shuts off, and stays off I leave work to come home. This saves so much energy! I think they have similar functionality bit into they app, but I like the fact that as soon as I leave work, the AC kicks on. It's nice to walk into a cool house, or at least get it started by the time I arrive. I'll be replacing my smoke detectors with Nest Protects as well. Don't forget to check for rebates! AEP here in Ohio gave me a check for $75 for replacing my old thermostat for the Nest. I do have one complaint. I really wish they would add Apple HomeKit support. I know this is an Apple Vs Google issue, but they should think of their customers. I have had an iPhone since they were first released. I'm not going to switch to Android because my iPhone doesn't support my thermostat. It's making me think about switching to Ecobee who does support HomeKit.
title: Great Product, And Will Save You Money While Using Less Energy

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: CSN
content: I bought this thermostat at a good price on black Friday. I have no problem with my current programmable thermostat, but I wanted one that connects to the internet to check and change the temperature when I'm not home. I have a very consistent schedule so I know exactly what I want it to do and when. I set up a schedule, but turned on eco mode as well. Heads up, when you turn on Eco mode, it seems to ignore your schedule - I got home from work and the house was freezing. Over Christmas, I set it to away so Eco mode kicked in. This time, it seemed to run my schedule. Three days into my vacation, when I thought my house would be about 55 degrees, I checked and it was 72. For some reason, it was running the normal schedule. UNLIKE MOST THERMOSTATS, THERE IS NO HOLD/VACATION MODE. Eco mode/away mode is not the same thing. So, during my vacation, I ended up shutting off every "smart" setting and deleting my schedule to make it keep a constant temperature. When I came home, I left all the settings off but had to remake my schedule (this is not difficult). In conclusion, I feel this thermostat might be great if you're a complete idiot and want minimum control over your houses temperature. Technological improvements aren't always necessary or even better. If I were to buy something different, my experiences with honeywell therms. have been great and I see they make several wifi ones with less features, which is exactly the way I think it should be. Unless you get a great deal, save your money!
title: If you want no control, this is the thermostat for you

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Steve H
content: I've been looking at wifi connected thermostats for several years, but never could find one I really liked or wanted to mess with. The Nest was on that list for a long time. We have an odd schedule that changes frequently, so I was afraid the "learning" would be tough to get set in. I learned you can set a schedule with the Nest, but then the price was a hangup. Like several other things I finally broke down and shelled out the money and wish I had done it sooner. So many great features about the Nest, but the iPhone and iPad apps may be my favorites. Our weather can change drastically in short periods of time. It is not unusual to use the ac at bedtime, but want the heater in the morning. Now I can roll over, grab my phone or iPad and have the house warm before getting out of bed in the morning. I also like the energy use tracker aspect of the app. Great to see how the weather and personal choices can greatly influence energy use. This is a great product.
title: but never could find one I really liked or wanted to mess with

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: John G.
content: This is a nice looking thermostat.  However, the Home/Away function never works properly, and after multiple resets and contacts with customer support to change Iphone and Nest thermostat settings, it still doesn't work.  When I am home it often spontaneously goes into "Away" mode, even though my phone is connected to the Wifi in my home!  Sure, you can manually change the settings, but that defeats the purpose of a "smart" thermostat.  When I notice the house is getting hot or cold, I go to the app, and sure enough, it has put itself into "Away" mode and I have to readjust it.  It also has trouble "learning" changes in my schedule.  Totally annoying and if I had to do it again, I'd buy another brand of smart thermostat.  Not recommended even though I wanted to love it.
title: Glitchy and not worth the purchase price

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Aaron
content: Bought this a couple of years ago for my one house worked great. Now that Google has bought nest all the compatible devices are no longer going to be compatible. Only with Google products and maybe* Alexa. Will not be buying this product anymore will migrate to the EcoBee which is what I have in my beach house. Far superior to the nest unless a huge deal to get the nest for $60 I would not invest since Google is taking it over very shortly now. Will be changing the Nest out for another EcoBee will donate the nest to Goodwill.
title: Migrating to EcoBee

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: D Haught
content: This thermostat seems pretty great so far. I like the features of it and the minimalist design. We've had it over a week now and it seems to be settling into a routine that works well for us as well as reducing the daily run time of the AC unit. I didn't like the way it jumped around between temperature settings at first but those peaks seem to be smoothing out. It still does some weird stuff but I have the app on the wife's and my phone and I'm not sure if the settings on the apps are conflicting. So far so good though. The initial setup process and descriptions of some of the functions could be a little better. Edit: 11-16-18. We've been using this thermostat for 6 months now and I really like it. In the early fall the temp varies enough here day to day that we may require heat at night and AC during the day and I like the feature of being able to set dual temp thresholds so I don't have to remember to switch it from heat to cool on the same day. In the last couple days the wifi chip in the thermostat failed and it lost wifi connectivity. After trying the troubleshooting on the website and emailing a trouble report I waited a couple days and finally called customer service. Customer service was great and friendly and immediately upon telling them of the problem offered to send me a new thermostat 2 day express to replace the faulty unit. I decided to come back and bump my rating to 5 stars because I do like the product and I especially appreciate good customer service.
title: This thermostat seems pretty great so far

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jason P. Walters
content: Nest is a great product.  It was way ahead of the competition, but I think over time they somewhat stagnated, probably because of the Google acquisition.  But my real beef is not with the product but the online services and product positioning.  So, I upgraded both of my old Nests to the Gen 3 product.  In Nest's mind every person is a thermostat, and upgrading is not a valid use case.  There is no upgrade/migration path in your online account.  Every 'stat is treated like a new one.  There is no ability to migrate your scheduling for winter (heat) or summer (cooling) across a new thermostat.  That can impose a lot of time on someone to re-create.  There is no ability to replicate settings across multiple thermostats.  I had to set up the new ones from scratch and then delete the ones I replaced from the account.  There were also a lot of wrinkles.  I had to remember to zap the firmware's of the old ones first.  I didn't in one case...  I actually had to rewire it up to zap it.  Would be great if there was a document that described some steps for a smooth upgrade.  Right now Nest is more concerned about the "new" customer experience, with bedazzling boxes, and QR codes.  I get that more people have not seen the nest than have, but it seems like every box is positioned as a new home/customer and we all get shoe-horned into that process.  Look, the product has been out for a good 5 years or so now.  It's 2017, and the business model and experience hasn't been upgraded.
title: Great product, online site needs some modernization.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Steve G.
content: Google has discontinued its support of Nest legacy 3rd party Integrations and is requiring users to migrate their Nest accounts to Google. Free Google Gmail accounts are supported but for some insane reason paid G-Suite accounts are not. I bought several thermostats a year ago and now I am no longer able to use some of the features that made me buy this product in the first place because I have a paid Google account instead of a free one. Do yourself a favor and stay away from Google products.
title: Does not support Google G-Suite Accounts

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Todd Santoro
content: If you like having control of your own data via an API so you can integrate it with other smart home devices I would stay away from Nest. I am getting ready to remove all 324 nest devices in my vacation rentals and replace them with Ecobees so I can shut down down the AC when tenants open 2 or more windows for more than 10 minutes. Nest took away their API so now all my automations do not work. Tenants on vacation do not care about the AC bill so they open doors and windows with the AC on. Living on islands makes water and electricity very expensive so having an API to monitor my homes is paramount. I’ll have hundreds of used ones for sale on EBay soon.
title: Bye bye Nest!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Big Daddy K
content: Installed super easy. Set up was simple. Love seeing the usage data and using the geofencing. Rebates from power and gas companies plus the discount at Thanksgiving, pretty much paid for itself in the first month. Look forward to seeing the savings when the AC comes into play. Update: Just got my power bill adjustment, which I do equal pay on. Last year in August I did not have this installed, this year I did. Same average daily temps. Power usage was around $80 less. After around 10 months of use, my equal pay payment is dropping by $30 a month. That pretty much pays for this thing in a month since I got it on a Cyber Monday sale last year, and my power and gas companies both gave me $50 rebates. If you don't have one yet, you probably should. The ability for it to turn off your compressor early and use the cold AC  condenser to continue cooling has to save a bunch. For heating, the saving may be more in my mind, and the use of Ecco mode. The ability to look at your history and see how much the system is on really makes you think about the temperatures you keep your house at.
title: Love it.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: steve
content: I was unsure about spending 200+ on a thermostat But I am glad I did. So far it has was worked flawlessly with and without using the app. I like the big numbers, No need to go get my reading glasses to see what the temp is set too. It was real easy to install and it is working on my system without a C wire which all other wifi thermostat require The wires on my system are yellow, green and red. Update 10/11/19 I bought another to use on my heat system which only had a red and a white wire. It works great Glad I bought it
title: Works with No C wire

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DM526613
content: This thermostat may be GREAT for many people, but it just didn't work for us. I think there were three reasons we didn't like the Nest: 1) we're control freaks, and this thing just has a mind of its own; 2) the "maintenance band" is too large (more on that below); and 3) the "away from home" settings do not allow you to keep the house below 76 (or at least we couldn't figure out how to do that). The maintenance band is the range of temperatures around your "target" set temperature. In a larger home like ours, it simply takes too long for the Nest to turn on. It allows the temperature to go a couple of degrees above the set temp when the AC is on, and then it runs until the temp is well below the set temp before turning off. This meant that the AC would run for long stretches of time, and the changes in temp were very noticeable. Finally, we didn't like coming home to a warm an stuffy house in the summer. Perhaps if we had given the Nest longer to adjust to our preferences, this would have improved, but my review of info online indicated that this likely would not change significantly over time. We returned the Nest and purchased an Emerson Sensi. We are very happy with the Sensi after two weeks of use.
title: Not a great thermostat for a a larger homes/control freaks

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MC
content: I really like this thermostat. It's so convenient. Setting schedules is easy if you don't want to rely on it setting itself. Going from heat to cool was a trick, but overall it was super easy to install. Wasnt 5 minutes to install. All with the screwdriver they sent and I was up running. I didn't have all the wires they said I would need, saying I may have to find auxiliary power. And it works fine, charges fine and been running since last year fine. Nest support was great, I wanted to be sure I had AC wired correctly before assembling it back to the wall since I couldn't test the AC in the winter. A couple of quick pics sent back and forth and all is well. It's now 100 degrees outside and AC works like a charm. In winter I watched it carefully. Love how it tells you usage. My gas bill was reduced between $5-10 dollars each month in coldest months.
title: Love it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rob Seaman
content: I ordered this product thinking it would help me save $$'s at one of my rental properties in Hawaii. Unfortunately it seems that the temperature reading calibration was off on install so when it was reading 78deg it was actually 74deg which means a renter would set it to a temperature they thought was reasonable it was over cooling the condo. this resulted in higher than usual electricity costs instead of the lower costs I was looking for. I'm confident that the device would help us if it was reading the temperature correctly. Unfortunately the install technician just un-installed the device instead of working with tech support on it.
title: Temperature reading incorrect

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Raiven Ellinwood
content: I love how easy it was to install, even with an house that's over 20 years old all you had to do is follow the amazingly simple instructions, they include a photo of which wire goes in what port, and all you had to do is basically snap it in. So no twisting wires! After that the nest will sense the wires you installed. I've had no problems with any type of delay in turning the AC up or down and the phone app is extremely useful (especially if you forget to raise the temperature before you leave the house like I do) if you dont like doing manual temperature changes, it will learn your day to day pattern and do it itself. However if you have a very random schedule like I do, you'd probably turn it off which defeats the purpose of the "learning" aspect in my opinion. The one thing I wish I could change is the lowest temperature setting for ecomode, the minimum is 75, which is great for most people but I have an elder dog that doesn't fair well in that temperature. Plus any warmer than that can cause mold growth (especially in high humidity climaxes like I live in) so I like to air on the safer side. But that's definitely not a deal breaker and probably just unrealistic on my part for an ecomode. Other than that I throughly enjoy getting the energy reports from the nest and the different "screen savers" like the clock, current weather reports, or just the current temp in the house Plus you can make it where it displays any of these whenever you walk by or approach it, and it does it amazingly well. It also has a safety feature that if you turn the air on and off without delay it will have a timer (usually about 2 minutes) before itll send the signal for your ac to kick back on. If that's a good thing or not is up to you. I also recommend buying a different back plate off of amazon because the white one is comes with is...not great and takes away from the high quality feeling the nest has. Needless to say I'm very happy with my purchase and get comments of how good looking it is all the time!
title: Easy to install, Great looking, but not big on the learning feature.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: k
content: I bought two 3rd gen Nest thermostats in October 2017.  It wasn't too difficult to set up and using it was pretty easy as well.  I was happy with it while it worked.  The app worked ~90% of the time, which was fine with me.  Almost three years later one of the Nest units stopped working.  It took a professional AC guy a 1/2 day to figure out why the AC went out.  We installed one of our older Honeywell thermostats and the AC turned back on.  I called Nest to see if they would replace it or offer a discounted price on a new unit.  No such luck.  I was advised to buy a new one.  It was out of its warranty period.  Pretty bad customer service, especially since Google is one of the richest companies on Earth. Honestly, this product is nice in a lot of ways but should work longer than 3 years.  I definitely think it's over-priced and I will move on to a different brand.  Or maybe just stick with the ol' Honeywell.  That plastic thing is waaayyy older than 3 years and is still working fine.
title: Short life - pooped out after < 3 yrs

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shadywood
content: Just installed the unit 4 days ago.  I am optimistic that I will be completely satisfied once I address one installation issue. This unit upgrades and replaces a Honeywell programmable thermostat.  The Honeywell was essentially a dry contact device with no internal logic.  The Honeywell unit also only had a hysteresis of only 1 degree Fahrenheit.  The narrow hysteresis design is not as energy efficient as the wider hysteresis of the Nest, approximately 3 degrees Fahrenheit. The installation issue that I have encountered originates with the 2-wire connection to my 30+ year-old ThermoPride furnace.  The Nest will allow connection to a 2-wire system (Rh & W1 for heating), but it has operational limitations.  The Nest is more than a dry contact for the furnace operation --  it has a processor for its "smart" operation.  The processor has a battery that requires a power source to recharge the battery for continuous operation.  On a 2-wire installation the only source of power comes from that furnace circuit that was never designed to provide power for recharging a battery.  The Nest makes a best effort to share some of the power from the furnace when there is demand for heat, but the available power is not sufficient to maintain the battery power during a long heat cycle.  The result is short cycling of the heating operation.  The Nest will interrupt the furnace operation in order to take 2½ minutes of "battery recharge time".  The Nest clearly tells you that it has to do this when you are monitoring the "power" function in the technical info screen on the Nest.  After the 2½ minutes have passed, the furnace is returned to its heating operation.  The Nest will interrupt furnace operation multiple times during a long heating cycle (i.e., morning setpoint increase after night time Eco operation). The solution to this issue is to install a 24V power source with connections at the common and ground terminals on the Nest.  The 24V power source will maintain the Nest battery independent of the furnace.  I have ordered a basic 24V power source that will delivered tomorrow.  It will be a simple installation for me.  I will update this comment after I have installed the power source and verified that the fix worked.  I am confident that the fix do the trick. Nothing that I have found in the Nest literature indicates that the 2-wire type of connection will lead to possible short cycling.  This is potential problem should be mentioned upfront.  It appears that Nest would like to promote installations by Nest Pros.  If you do go this route of employing a Nest Pro for the installation (at $99 minimum cost), I assume that they would be prepared to install a 24V power source if necessary.  The power source would be an additional cost for parts and possibly labor Update: The 24VAC power supply fully solved my issue. The Nest is working perfectly now.
title: Opitimistic that I will be completely satisfied after I address the 2-wire limitation

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Nathan L. Hughes
content: I have several Nest products in my home and have had nothing but problems with most of them.  While they work ok once you can get them installed, it still feels to me like technology isn't quite ready for these smart products.  Purchased the NEST Thermostat after hearing several friends have one and with moderate levels of success.  I desire to have a smart thermostat, but I'm beginning to believe NEST is not the right option.  Got my NEST in the mail and started the installation process, including removing my old thermostat.  This is where NEST went wrong.  Did not realize it would need to be charged.  After removing my old one and installing the NEST, I quickly discovered the battery was completely dead.  I called NEST and they recommended I charge it for 30-45 min to get a small charge going before trying it again.  Ok, annoying as nowhere in the pamphlet or in the app did it indicate a charge might be needed.  I would have kept my old unit in to keep the AC on and just plugged it in for a nice full charge for a few hours first.  After removing my old one, turning off my AC for 40 min (I'm in Texas so its still 100 degrees), I popped it back on again.  Still didn't work.  Plugged it back in to a different USB outlet just to make sure it got a good charge and left it there for 2.5 hours.  The first agent I called said a good charge of 3 hours would fully take care of it.  After the 2.5 hours, I popped it back in again.  Got to the first couple of screens to allow me to begin the setup and the screen goes black.  I called again and the agent said its probably a lemon.  They are expediting a new one to me.  Great except in the process of taking out my old unit, we basically had to destroy the thing to get it off so it can no longer be used.  The wires are all fine so its not that.  So, now its 100 degrees out, I have no AC and hopefully the new unit arrives in a couple of days.  This is a huge hassle and I had a similar experience with my Nest Secure.  We finally got my Secure working after probably a dozen calls and an executive escalation to get the issue resolved.  This will be my last Nest product and I would not recommend them.  They seem to work ok, once you can get it in and working.  Its just a huge hassle to get to that point.  There are likely better options in the marketplace and if I use any other smart products, I'll go with something other than NEST and just use different apps.
title: Typical of Nest - only partially works or is confusing

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Elmedin
content: This thing is to control temperature, right? Don’t buy it! It us the most frustrating thermostat you’ll ever have. It cannot read accurately. It will always be too cold or too hot. The cheapest thermostat will do much better job. Also, these things fail on cold nights. I think its hacking but cannot prove it. I has all the bells and whistles you’ll turn off anyway.  Only good thing is to set temperature over your phone, but that’s whats dangerous about it! We are so happy with good old Honeywell!
title: So many features you don't need! Accurate temperature - nope!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mike J.
content: This thing is great. A bit pricey, but great. I noticed when I moved into my new house that the old thermostat had a mind of it's own. I would turn the heat down before bed only to be woken up in a night sweat at 3AM. Turns out my old thermostat loved to randomly increase my temp to 76! Searching the model of my old thermostat I couldn't find any explanation as to why this was happening. I assume it was just old age. So I decided to give my thermostat an upgrade. Searching around I kept coming across a nest thermostat. I was skeptical at first because of the ridiculous price but I couldn't find any competing device that offered everything this did. So I broke down and bought one. Boy am I glad I did. This thing is so handy. Between the ability to set a temp schedule, the home away assist and the ability to manually set temp from your phone I have reduced my bill by 40%. And the first month I installed it and saw the 40% reduction, it was on the coldest month of the year (Feb). That is nuts! By my calculations this thing will pay for it self by end of spring. However I still think this device is way over priced. Let's be real here, it's a thermostat with a few bells and whistles. It's not a smart phone or a rumba. If I could do it over I think I would try to get a used one instead. As far as installation goes, it's pretty simple. Just follow the instructions. First shut down power, then pull the current thermostat out (with wires attached), label the wires with what ports they connect to, take out the current thermostat, add nest mount, wire in nest using the labels as a guide, turn power back on. EZ
title: Pricey but an easy and effective cost saving tool

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kirill B.
content: The product works as expected and I am very satisfied with the purchase. I compared it with competitors, found out that ecobee does not really support a connection for old thermostats which have 2 wires only (no common wire). I have an old heater and it only has 2 wires, W and R. There are many confusing answers on the internet in regards to whether this product would work with 2 wires, (when there is no Common wire). My experience proves that it does work with 2 wires only, I connected them as Rc and W1. Initially nothing worked, and thermostat was complaining that there is no power on the wire, this was because on my old thermostat the wires were mislabeled, i.e. I ended up connecting a wire that was labeled as W, to nest's Rc and the wire labeled as R, to W1. Now when everything is connected, I am fully satisfied, the product is simple to use and I did not notice any glitches. Also I was amazed that technical support works on weekends and very prompt. Please note that technical support was not actually able to resolve my "reversed wires" issue, the support referenced me to a "certified installer". But that's ok, at the end of the day I was able to figure out the issue myself.
title: Good product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Wilson Customer
content: This product has a fantastic marketing strategy, but that's where it ends. I've had two different heating/ac service companies to my house and both said the Nest was a good product for consumers, terrible for service people as the diagnostics aren't compatible with most heating/cooling systems. They said the error codes meant nothing in their industry--that's two professional opinions, not mine. I tried using the tech support at one point--there's two hours of my life I'm never getting back. I went thru four "tech experts" and one tech supervisor. Product knowledge was nothing more than I'd already learned by watching You Tube Nest videos! This was a pricey purchase and for the 44 days we've owned it, it's been nothing but trouble. Now the window for return has expired and I'm stuck with it. Both service people recommended the Honeywell Pro 6000. That's what i'm off to buy. Live & learn.
title: Don't Do It!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Douglas Rhoads
content: Had to return for credit after I ordered the NEST thermostat, three remote sensors and a wall plate.  I started opening the packaging and noticed a small sticker with a warning that the thermostat doesn't work on all systems and gave a URL to check.  Turns out my 4 wire ABCD system can not work with the NEST thermostat.  I have a high tech, high efficiency Bryant system.  I don't know why Google would exclude some systems, especially one that is only about 6 years old!!
title: BEWARE: This doesn't work on some systems!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Danielle Serena 💚
content: I really like the UI and the interface, especially the ability to schedule and change the temperature from wherever I am. It's easy to use and set, and has helped us track how often we actually turn the a/c on. I wouldn't go so far as to say it's saved us money as our a/c habits haven't changed, it's just made it more convenient to regulate. It has seemed warmer in the house since switching to this thermostat, and I'm not sure if that's a result of previous inaccuracy or if it just cools the house over a slower, more extended period of time to reduce cost. Previously (last summer), we could keep the thermostat at 74 and sleep comfortably throughout the night, but lately we've been having to turn it down to 70 or 69 to keep things cool. I've also been home a few times but the thermostat registered that I was "away" based on my phone's location (which was also at home), so the thermostat would turn off and I wouldn't notice until things started getting uncomfortably hot. Aside from that small glitch, it's worked pretty well! A bit pricey for convenience, but the cost may be more justifiable to others if they're upgrading from faulty or lesser systems.
title: Nice interface

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jon
content: I have used Nest products for several years. Thermostats, smoke detectors, the works. Ever since Google integrated with Nest, the Nest app does not communicate or support the products. Tech support is non existent and they lack knowledge and have difficulty communicating properly to the consumer No follow up support. My instincts tell me they know there is a problem with the integration since the software updates with google but don’t want to tell you because you will just use the thermostat at home without being able to set them remotely. Very disappointing. Returning all my products and deciding to go with a system that supports the software changes.
title: Very disappointed.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: EV4Life
content: Got two of these with the Elago Bronze/Chrome plates to match my hardwood floors and trims. Here is what I learned. 1.  Copper must not be very popular, batteries were almost dead, so I strongly advise that you leave yours on a micro-USB for one hour before or during install. 2.  Temperature right after installed is 5 degrees higher, even on the first unit which I did not initially charge. No worries, it normalizes in about 12h, just set it higher. 3. Lock your machine, use strong passwords for access, or could end up with a nasty IOT hack. 4. Alexa works great, once you installed the Nest skill. Make sure you assign this device a static IP so Alexa will always find it. 5. Phone app is great. 6. Four wire, Y,G,W,R system here, T went to Rh for symmetry, prior Rc and Rh were bridged in the old Honeywell, no need for this here. I just want to play with it, now I got the Alexa skill bug, "Alexa raise downstairs temp by one degree", "Alexa start Espresso" (Belkin WeMo) "Alexa start climate control in Tesla at 70 degrees now" (another Elon victim with third party app). Hitting 50 here, we came from fountain pen and pencil to using Adobe and reading Kindle, now this, amazing!
title: Alexa works great, once you installed the Nest skill

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Robert A. Simpkins
content: I have a house that is well integrated with Alexa connected products.  Since I had previously owned a nest and liked it very much, I decided to add it to my current home. It was very easy to install and works beautiful as a learning thermostat.  But, when I tried to connect it to my Alexa system, it became a nightmare.  No matter what or whose directions I followed, it kept telling me I had to transport my google account or my Alexa accounts, etc.  Every time I tried, it said it couldn't find the Nest or I had already transported my account previously.  Nothing has helped.  This is not a user friendly Alexa product!
title: great thermostat, but difficult connectivity

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brent Smart
content: Love the NEST so far.  The installation was straight forward and simple.  Install and set-up are easy for the DIY novice as well as the pro.  The learn mode took about 4 days to synch with my heater adjustments and begin giving me daily usage history and schedule recommendations.  I have had NO issues to-date approx. 90 days now.  I will further review in another 6-9 months, but don't expect anything less in the summer months with the A/C cooler running.  Highly recommend!  Suggested: I do advise doing the Nest "pre-purchase" flow-chart to confirm the "type" of A/C-Heater unit you have prior to purchase.  In some cases there is an additional interface from Nest-Google that needs to be purchased to make the thermostat work with certain systems.  My unit was Central Forced Air heating-cooling by Lennox - approx. 10 years old.  N/A on the tech support as none was needed.
title: Nest Learning Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: W. R. James
content: The install was very straight forward.  I went to the Nest site and checked compatibility and they have me the wiring diagram for my unit before I ordered.  It arrived and it was an easy install. Very good menu and setup. Connected to internet with no issue.  Maybe if you have dual heating units or some more complicated system it might be different but mine was easy squeezy.  Installed the app.. created my account... done. Our thermostat was old and I had quit trying to schedule the heat/cooling long ago.. and then if you decided to stay home or whatever you had to mess with it.. then it would get screwed up .. aaaand there you go.  It would also turn the heat on and off.. on and off - just poor and out of date This is SO easy to switch to away and it is warming the house when you walk in... and I can see the impact on the app... I anticipate a greatly reduced heating bill - and cooling bill in the summer.
title: Easy Install and money saver so far

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: James R Hollingsworth
content: These are good thermostats; I have three. They do a great job with all of the normal thermostat tasks and have many advanced features, some of which I use. The preheat option is great as it uses stage one heat for a longer period of time instead of stage two or aux for a shorter period yet still gets the zone to the desired temp on time. The cons: the thermostats create a lot of data that would be great to visualize over time. Unfortunately, you can’t see much of it, and what you can see is only available for 10 days. I can understand limiting the history on the device, but the mobile app and website should display all data from the day the thermostat was installed. The other downside is the lack of HomeKit support. Overall, I like them but wish I had easy access to all of the data and HomeKit compatibility. A note on their support: one of them died. They overnighted me a new thermostat. Hard to complain about that...
title: Great thermostat but no HomeKit support and limited data access

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: NativeTexan41
content: I recently installed a Nest thermostat for the heat pump system in my house and am generally pleased with it.  The installation was relatively easy and the Nest customer service people emailed me the wire hookup for my particular Carrier system.  They were quick to respond and very helpful.  The only thing I haven't been impressed with is the Nest's learning mode.  I'll have to call it a slow learner because during the first week every evening when I returned home, always at about the same time, the Nest hadn't brought the system up in cooling mode and one evening it was 80 degrees in the house.  I turned off learning mode and simply used the Nest online app to program the temperature sequence I want for an entire day.  The thermostat I replaced was also a programmable device, but programming had to be done at the thermostat looking at its tiny screen.  The Nest, on the other hand, is a snap to program.  I'm generally pleased with my purchase and will probably retry the learning mode once cool weather arrives in East Texas.
title: Good thermostat but a slow learner

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JD
content: The Nest thermostat works well for simple systems.  It is easy to use and reliable.  For single stage systems it is great. It’s not great for multistage heating or cooling systems.  First it is quite dumb.  It will only turn on the second stage AC once the temperature gets 3 degrees more than the set point.  This is not adjustable.  Therefore you are sweltering before the second stage kicks in.  For heat you can only turn on emergency heat at the thermostat not via the app.  Again it’s dumb. Other cheaper thermostats like Honeywell handle multistage systems better and are cheaper. Bottom line is Nest is great for single stage systems.  Get something else for multistage systems.
title: Great thermostat not made for complex HVAC

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lauren Steinberg
content: It has been several years since my thermostats have been replaced. They all seem to have lost their accuracy. My house has 3 heating zones, two on the first floor and the third on the second floor. I was looking for a smart thermostat that I could easily install and control from either my iPad or smartphone. My house also is old, and the thermostat only has two wires, a red and a white. To this end I was looking for a unit that does not require a “c” wire. Nest advertises that in most cases it does not. So, I ordered 3 Nest 3rd Generation thermostats. I have installed two so far. They took me very little time not only for the physical installation,  but to also connect it to my WiFi network, and the Nest App on my devices. Everything works perfect, and I did not need the “c” wire. This weekend I will go upstairs and install the  3rd unit. Great product, easy installation, and lovely features. Glad I found this product.
title: Great thermostat, and for me did not require a “c” wire.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Skilla
content: I have to write this review as this product just easily paid for itself. I have three Nests in my house and one is in a remote room over my garage. Typically I only use this room in the winter when entertaining a few times a year as it is expensive to heat. I got an alert two nights ago to my phone that the heat in that room had dropped to 40° despite being set to 50°. Long story short, that heating zone had stopped functioning and this alert let me know in time to save me from frozen and burst pipes during sub-zero temperatures. Pros • Easy installation. • Attractive. • Great convenience to adjust and monitor temperatures from Alexa and smart phone. • Super easy to set up schedules. • Reliable. Cons • Expensive. • Auto-adaptive features might be overstated. Conclusion: I love them. I had two in my old house and immediately bought three new ones when I moved.
title: Great convenient Thermostat with features that might save you from a disaster.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: L. W
content: We had it professionally installed, so I have no comments on how easy it is to install. Once set up its performed flawlessly. The temperature is exactly correct (our old thermostat ran 4 degrees cold, which made me realize that the most fundamental thing you need from one is room temperature accuracy. The nest passes this basic test). It's reassuring to be able to see the temp of the home when you're away, and be able to control it. The scheduling feature is very easy to use once you understand how (watch videos on YouTube if needed). The history feature is fun, seeing how much energy is being used, at what times, and adjustments the nest made because you weren't home. And plus, it looks really good.
title: Great thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Name withheld because stalkers Google me and I find it annoying
content: I installed one of these a few years ago at my house, but recently sold that house.  Moved into a new place and they had a Honeywell digital thing installed.  I REALLY tried to like it, but that stupid thing wasn't even programmable - not to mention anything about using it with an App.  I have an 18 year old girl who is home when I'm at work and I want to be able to address it if she has the heat or AC up too high. The thing is crazy easy to install. Helping my kid trying to figure out how to read a sewing pattern after installing it and just kept thinking "it shouldn't be harder to follow a sewing pattern than it is to install a thermostat".  Seriously, Simplicity needs to take a cue from Nest. After installing this at my last home, I had much better control over my heating bills.  Of course, I had also just installed a new furnace and sided my house... but I'm crediting the thermostat too.
title: Moved and missed my Nest!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: BCM1
content: Nest should win an award (and probably has) for the design of this thermostat.  The installation was absolutely effortless.  TIP:  go to their website before you buy and make sure it's compatible with your system.  They have an easy online tool to do so.  Then before you install you can snap a picture of the wiring on your existing thermostat and print out a wiring diagram for your install.  I flipped my breaker and had it back on in 15 minutes start to finish.  The interface is very intuitive, testing was perfect first time, and I'm very happy.  Only had it a day so far and will report back with any issues, but with the $75 rebate offered by my utility company it was a great deal.  Also had it set up to my Echo Dot in no time and can control it with my voice flawlessly.  Just check the Alexa app for the suggested phrases but it's pretty straightforward.  Fantastic product!
title: It's like the iPhone of thermostats

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: chris
content: Bought this thinking I could have alexa turn my heat on in the morning so I wouldn't have to leave my warm bed. I thought wrong. Alexa can only change the temperature of the thermostat if it is still on. So I thought okay I will schedule my heat to turn on in the morning. Again wrong. The schedule will also not work if it is not on. Now if I leave my heat on a low temp so its not on all day and all night it keeps the fan running. And I also bought it to try to save money which having the fan on all day will not do. Installation was a whole other issue. I watched the video and it looked simple enough. I checked compatibility it should have worked, but it didnt. I turned on my heat and it blew out cold air. Messed around with it, tried to google somethings, and I still couldnt figure it out. Had to pay an additional 100$ to have a AC tech link the rc and rh with a wire. WHICH WAS NO WHERE IN THE INSTRUCTIONS. Anyways, I am too invested at this point to not keep it, especially since my dumb self threw away my old trusted honeywell thermostat. Do not be me and just stick with what you have. If it aint broke dont fix it.
title: Do not buy. It is in no way a smart device

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jay B. (Michigan)
content: I love the Nest smart thermostat. I fist became familiar with it after staying in an AirBNB that had one installed. I bought one for our home shortly after staying there and then immediately bought another one for our store, and another one for a gift for our son-in-law. It’s so easy to use and really looks great. I love how it adjust temperatures based on your cellphones returning to home. It learns your activity and adjusts the schedule for maximum efficiency. For the store, I love how I can easily check the temperature remotely from wherever I am and make adjustments when necessary. It only takes a few minutes to install, and anyone can do it. His is such a great investment, and I’ve recommended it many times to friends and colleagues.
title: Love This Thermostat!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: NONAMEHERE
content: I'm definitely regreting getting the Nest.  Our energy bill has almost doubled because of Google's crap algorithms that keep getting forced on you. There are 4 features which don't work.  Learning, Eco, Home/away and schedule.  We have turned off everything (except schedule...  you can't.)  Yet it will constantly put random temperatures in the schedule. For example, I just deleted 80 degrees at 10 am, followed by 73 deg at 4pm.  (Hmmm...  I wonder why my freaking electric bill has doubled!)  Also, Google made deleting these values a tedous pain. The app isn't very good either...  Definitely needs a lot of work. It does look pretty on the wall, though.
title: Pretty on the wall...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AmazonCustomer
content: Installed in winter so learning is going to be off, I only care about summer learning. The Eco mode has auto changeover from max 68 heat to min 72 cool and so far it's been on eco mode for a week and haven't had to adjust it, it's been 30 degrees outside in the mornings and late night and it's been 72-80 in the day and it just does what it needs to do and I don't have to think about it anymore. No more forgetting to change to heat or to cool so the wifi thermostats are actually keeping the temp right. Def worth the cost, even if I had paid full price. Why did I wait so long. It's like buying a color tv for the first time, sure black and white works for a TV program but color just makes it so much better, same thing with this thermostat, by switching back and forth to heat and cool it is so much less frustrating.
title: Better than WiFi programible thermostats

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J.wal-KCCO
content: Very easy to install. Go to the Nest website and verify your existing wires and if it will work with the Nest. They have an easy to use program that will let you know. Take photos of your existing thermostat wiring before removing the thermostat you are replacing. Cut the power and remove your old unit. Mount the backplate of the Nest to the wall and then place the wires to the corresponding locations. The wires attach with a push of the tab and inserting the wire. If you have a jumper on your old unit between R and RC, you will no longer need that as the Nest has an internal jumper that it applies if it recognizes it needs it. Place the face of the Nest on the backplate and begin the setup process. Takes a min for it to load but once it does, it's quick to set up. Download the app and I also is simple to log on and connect the Nest to the app. I love the home/ away part of the app. It uses your phones location to know if you are not home and go into your Eco temps. You set the eco temps and when it sees no one is home it changes to that setting. Once home it goes back to your scheduel/ or preset you choose. Should have bought this years ago! As you can see by the photos I attached, I noted the wires I had and the post they went to, then applied that to the Nest backplate. ( note the photo of Nest back plate is through the app and shows you what wiring it has attached. Update.... still very happy with the purchase. I have set mine to operate off my phone and my finances phone location. This makes the unit go to eco soon as we have left the house instead of it waiting ( sometimes hours) to see if the sensors notice anyone home. This has helped me save a good bit. I have my eco temps set at 60 and 80. When home it's on 74. I do not use the auto/ learning temp scheduel as both my days and times of work along with my fiancé change week to week. My thermostat is either on when we are home and at 74, or in eco mode when we are both gone. This has helped with savings that are reflected in the history photo attached. As you can see in the history screen shot, my finance or I were home most all day and the heat was 100+ outside... so use was high. But a few days later we were not home much so eco saved a good bit of running!
title: EASY INSTALL, GREAT app, no negative.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: pink fluffy slipper world
content: A few weeks ago my furnace died… I bought this and it was installed with my brand new furnace. The nest thermostat has been great. I already had nest cameras, and I'm looking forward to at least one doorbell. I have been saving an 1800s little house and creating a garden with tons of sweat equity… But no matter what I do it's going to be a tiny old house....  I decided adding smart devices is the way to go. I can turn up/down the temperature via Alexa, from phone/tablet/Echo Dot. I don't know if my gas bill will be lower w/nesr... The new furnace is pretty high efficiency, so wouldn't be just nest alone that would bring it down.  i'm happy with my purchase and haven't had any problems yet. I bought the black-copper color. To go with my copper apron sink… Once I install it… After I install the soapstone countertops… After I finish putting in cabinets… After I gut and insulate… better get to it..Or maybe I will just stare at my thermostat for a while and imagine everything done.
title: adds cool bling

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rachel K.
content: It's been installed in our house for about a week but so far I love it. The install itself was very easy, and Nest has made checking whether or not the wiring in your house is compatible incredibly easy as well - so no issues there. We upgraded from a thermostat that had a slider to select the temperature and it didn't seem very accurate. With this, there is no confusion at all. The interface is super sleek and minimal, and I love that it programs itself to the temps that you like as time goes on. My mother who lives with us is known to sneak by and turn the temperature down so everyone is freezing without knowing why. Well ha! Now I can change it back on my phone! Although with this she hasn't touched it once because she sees the little leaf on the thermostat and is settled by seeing it saving money. Definitely recommend, picked it up for an insane price on Black Friday, but it's worth paying the full listed price!
title: Worth the investment - who knew buying a thermostat would be exciting!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Drjb74
content: While the Nest in expensive, I think it is definitely worth the cost. It has a very sleek appearance (looks modern, minimalist, high-end).  Installation was extremely easy.  The app asks you to tell it what wires you have from your current thermostat, and then it tells you exactly where you attach them on the Nest.  There is no guessing at all. The auto-program feature is great.  You tell the Nest what temperatures are the minimum and maximum you want, and it begins learning from there.  I have found that the Nest has done a great job adjusting the temperature to fit our desires. The auto-away feature is great.  With our old thermostat, I had to set a temperature and time when I wanted the thermostat to change.  If our schedules were different that day, we would have to go and manually change the thermostat.  With the Nest, it automatically senses when no one is home, and goes into an energy saving mode based on the min/max temp you set. I like being able to change and/or monitor the temperature from my phone as well.  While it isn't the most used app on my phone, it is nice to be able to adjust temperatures if I need. I have other smart devices and this is connected to them.  It will turn on when I walk in the house at the end of the day.  I can also program it to begin warming or cooling the house before I get home.  I have it connected to an Amazon Echo, and also with an August Smart Lock and Nest Protect CO2/Smoke Detectors. When I leave the house, the August Smart Lock communicates and sets the Nest to "Away" Mode.  When I return home and unlock the door, the Nest then turns back on (that is the way mine is set up).  I have seen a decrease in the utility bills as well.  Only had the Nest for a couple months, so hard to say if that is driven solely by the Nest or by the weather itself.  Either way, I will be interested to see how it pans out over the course of a year.  I would guess that it will have paid for itself in the next 1-3 years in energy savings. Great product - expensive, but definitely worth it.
title: Easy to Use, Works Very Well

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jake
content: Slick unit. Looks nice, and great user interface, with a beautiful display. One of the main reasons I invested in it, is that it is supposed to LEARN and predict/adjust accordingly to make sure when I get home, it will be comfortable at the temperature I set it to. Well, the ENTIRE summer, it still hasn’t learned to turn on the A/C so it isn’t 85+ degrees when I get home. I get home around the same time every day, and EVERY day, my home is hot as can be. I have to wave my hand in front of the thermostat for it to kick on, and have it tell me it will go from the current 85 degrees to a comfortable 76 degrees in 2 or more hours. Gee thanks “smart” thermostat. Sure doesn’t seem to learn very well... so far it’s taken all summer and it still hasn’t figured out that an 85 degree house is not what I like to come home to. At least my power bill is low I guess!
title: Learning thermostat has a learning disability.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bo Lorentzen
content: My unit "work" however per support I must setup a separate "home" for this ONE unit, as it can not be in the same home as my other unit..  meaning I can not show TWO nest in the same home.. I tried over and over, and in the end support staff told me the only way to install this would be to make a separate home.. however I have installed these many times and had no problems having more than one in one home address. Unfortuantely waited for Nest support promising to get back to me with a solution and am now stuck with a $200 piece of crap that is not working.  thanks for nothing nest.
title: Unit unable to work as advertised.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael P
content: As of October 2019 you can no longer invite a user to your "Nest" account.  They are forcing a migration to "Google Home".  So now, if you want to give anyone access to control the thermostat they can: Add new devices, like speakers, displays, or a smart light bulb Use and change the settings of the devices in the home Automatically link their media services, like YouTube, to speakers, smart displays and Chromecast built-in devices in the home Add and remove other home members, including you I gave guests who i just want to control my thermostat and nothing else.  What the heck?  Why is there only 1 level of access? Can i have my money back? LOL
title: 2019 - Forced "Upgrade" major security risk... NO LONGER USABLE

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ProfG
content: I hired an Air Conditioning/Heating Repairman to install this device. It was really easy and he was familiar with similar smart devices. It synced with Alexa with no problems. There were only two concerns. I ordered a plate, which we used since the hole in the wall would be noticeable. It actually came with one, which I didn't realize. The kit has a rectangular plate while the additional plate I ordered was round. It looks nice. I also ordered the three room sensor bundle but had difficulty trying to get the unit to recognize them. I suspected a dead battery so I purchased one (they are kinda pricey) but by the time I got home, the thermostat performed an update and it found the devices with no difficulties whatsoever. Really pleased with this purchase.
title: Smart Thermostat Makes Adjusting Temperatures Easy

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: NYNJ
content: I just received the Nest Thermostat in the mail today and installed it without experiencing any issues. I switched from an ancient Honeywell double mercury switch thermostat (see photo) and replaced it with the more nimble and operation intuitive Nest. The entire installation involved shutting off all power servicing the HVAC (make sure it is not high voltage before buying), disassembling/removing the Honeywell unit, labeling the wires with the Nest-provided adhesives, mounting the Nest plate and connector base and finally clicking the Nest Thermostat into the base. I turned the power back on at the breaker and, voila, the Nest Thermostat powered on and commenced the booting sequence. Setting up the unit by supplying it with WiFi information and data about the home and location was a breeze and easy to manipulate using the dial which feels very nice and responsive. And after 5 minutes, I was good to go and tested the system. It took about 5 minutes for warm air to begin circulating but after that, Nest Thermostat responded fairly quickly when increasing the temp. The app is also very easy to use and all functions can be controlled from your smartphone remotely or while within your home. The "Away" function is very useful and is what the analog Honeywell thermostat lacked which makes Nest Thermostat useful in being more energy efficient. I also like that the Away mode can be sensed (via motion detection) or switched on by pressing "Away" on the app when away from home -- with just one press. I have read the reviews about the scheduling function being a bit cumbersome -- I disagree. It is very easy to set the temp and time on each day. Just choose the day, click, then set the temp, click and set the time, then click "done". There's not much else to it. "Farsight" is also a nice feature as it provides real-time data about the system and the current interior/exterior temperature (you can also set it to display the set temps or vitals (outdoor/indoor/humidity, etc.). The only downside is that language support is lacking. I was hoping it would be more comprehensive as with most smart devices, but it only contains European languages at the moment. Hopefully this will change to include Asian language support. I am not an experienced electrician by any means, but have installed dimmers and switches with very little help. The Nest Thermostat is, by far, one of the easiest high-tech devices I have ever installed and I am horrified by anything that involves electrical systems and even a little static shock. I initially was advised to hire an electrician but I watched multiple videos on Nest and various YouTube install videos and it looked easy enough so I gave it a shot and it was truly a painless experience that took no more than 10 minutes. This is Day 1 with the Nest Thermostat so I will provide a more detailed update a few weeks from now and again when the temps warm up. For now, I love it and recommend this if your electrical system is compatible and if you're looking to heat up one general area of the house!
title: Easy Install and Setup

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: KH
content: I am changing my review because the problem was not the nest product and was the connection I have to the nest. Still I needed to upgrade the connections (cables) and forced air system to be able to provide nest enough and stable energy to function. As soon as I started to use nest, my ConEdison bill is halfway less. Hard to believe but the only thing we changed was to have the nest thermostats.
title: Perfect Thermometer

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SDSAILMAN
content: I'm not amused.  Even though I have EXCELLENT WIFI coverage via mesh-router system throughout house, this thermostat regularly drops 'off-line' for days (some times weeks) at a time!  Here's the rub - we DON'T live in the house full time.  This is WHY we wanted the smart thermostat that we could 'see' and control remotely. Even though NEST Tech-Support was good to talk to . . .  you HAVE to be at the thermostat to "restart" it, and talking to Tech-Support to do troubleshooting, without being at your thermostat, is useless! I need a second smart thermostat there, but won't go with the Nest unit . . . . at least until we live there full time and can deal with the drop-outs of service.
title: Works Well .... WHEN IT WORKS FROM APP

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: gaithersburger
content: We love our nest thermostat. Helps control from phone using the nest app. Also integrates with Alexa for some basic operations like temperature control. Ours sometimes goes offline which I had not had a good handle on. It comes back automatically after the nest thermostat comes up online and working. It also has reminders for changing filters which is good. Also several utility companies reimburse for portion or whole of the nest thermostat cost if you want to check with your utility provider.
title: Great addition to your smart home

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: K. Biegler
content: Worked fine for a number of month then started dropping off the network.... Today it's gone off the network when everything else is functioning fine all wifi devices in the home are functional. Finally got thru to tech support the agent was patient and helpful so I will upgrade this back to 5 stars he even stated that a ticket will be open and they will watch the thermostat for 24 or so hours in case the problem recurs and needs further assistance.
title: It was great until  ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gary Pearce
content: Welcome to the world of high tech.  I followed all the instructions and everything worked fine.  Boy is it pretty! A couple of weeks ago I just happened to look at my power bill which is auto-deducted from my bank account.  I almost fainted when my typical $50 bill had jumped to $850 last month.  I called the power company and they read my meter by computer and told me this month's bill would be even more, noting all of a sudden on August 2 there was a huge jump in power usage.  They told me it was either my water heater or HVAC.  This is just my small vacation condo that has been vacant since April! So I called the AC man, had him check everything- he said it was likely due to the Nest and I had him replace it with an ordinary thermostat.  Power bill is now back down to $50/month.  So I had the Nest working properly for 4 months, improperly for 2 months and spent about 2 grand. NOT WORTH IT.........I suspect somehow the Nest went wild and just sucked up electricity to the AC perhaps running both the the AC and the heater.  It was crazy!
title: WATCH YOUR POWER BILL!!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Glenn A. Gore
content: Okay, some really in depth reviews to tell me everything about this but dual mode. I am no expert but I will tell you my impressions if it is important to you to have it in both heat and cool mode. Dual mode works sort of but not like I wished, it doesn't seem to know that I wished it knew the outside temperature and would make the house a little warm or a little cold because of it. See to make it work it can't cross-over the temperatures. Not sure if this makes sense, so let me try to explain. I have to set the heat side to 68 and the cold to 71 and either the display will be orange if it is heating or blue if it is cooling. So the house is always a right around 70, but if it is cold outside I wished it would heat to 72 so it would be toasty inside, nope. Or if it is heating up outside I wished the cooling would come on sooner so that is doesn't heat up to 74 before the cooling can finally compensate and cools it down to 71. Maybe it will just get better and better as it learns, or I can switch to heat only and warm the house a little extra or to cool, but I could do that with my old thermostat, I just wanted to be lazy and never have to mess with it. To be perfectly honest that is happening now and I'm just living with how it works and to be frank, that is pretty good.
title: I am no expert but I will tell you my impressions if it is important to you to have it in both heat and cool mode. Dual mode works sort of but not ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Trollingstone
content: Love this thermostat.  Reasonably easy to install and set up, works very well.  The Eco mode is especially useful and the app works well, allowing monitoring and reset from the road.  Was nervous about spending the money but worth every penny so far.  Only very minor downside is NEST room temp is one degree different from actual room temp.  Can't find an adjustment so just compensated in temp settings.
title: Worth the Money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: sandman3333
content: Wanted so much to use the Nest thermostat.  However, despite fairly easy instructions to follow regarding the wiring, etc.  the unit just would not operate with my system.  I was not about to give it the benefit of the doubt, pay a contractor to attempt to install this at my cost and then still have it malfunction.  It’s a thermostat for God’s sake.  It should be ready to go on home systems that the homeowner can install or simply that that this may require professional installation.  Google better go back and do more field testing on why so many other users had similar issues.  Look at the reviews and buyer beware.  If it works correctly the first time, good for you, otherwise you’re in for a huge hassle.
title: Absolutely frustrating

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Carl J.
content: The install was easy, the website that allows you to check for compatibility is marginal, it was supposed to call out the connections for your setup but didn't. Fortunately I have some experience with electronics and thermostats so I was able to figure it out but the average person would have difficulty. The unit was not very difficult to setup once the physical install was complete. I had a smart/digital thermostat prior and the Nest seems to have a better result in house comfort and temp control. I have added the remote temp sensor so I can have the second floor monitored during overnight (sleep) time. Wife says the house is much more comfortable now. I would like to see a software upgrade to allow the temp sensors to be schedule for monitoring more granular than preset time frames.
title: Helps keep your house climate consistent

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mike S.
content: I recommend that you NOT buy this product.  Heating and cooling systems often do not have a power wire called a C wire. Sometimes a home can have multiple zones.  I have suffered through 2 horrible tech nightmares and recommend that no one ever buy a nest again.  When something goes wrong, they ask you to send them photos of your wiring.  Then they try to trouble shoot it.  We are talking hours and hours on the phone with a person trying to tell you what to do by identifying your HVAC, furnace, internal house wiring...and even your horoscope.  Then they say they have to send a tech but NO tech is available in your area...so you have to wait 3 days and then, that person does not come so back on the phone for another 2 hours trying to figure out why there is NO next tech in the state of CT????  Just buy one of the old programmable thermostats with the battery and be done with this garbage.
title: The NEST C WIRE NIGHTMARE

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sabra
content: Used this to replace an old  2 wire heat only mercury wall thermostat.  The first nest thermostat was faulty and would not charge even on a cell phone charger. Honeywell chat support took a while, but diagnosed it and sent a new one to replace it. No C wire was present at the old thermostat and although I ran one, the second nest would not keep power for a whole day and would lose wi fi in the mornings. Frustrating !!  I think I  actually needed to run 2 wires so that the C had consistent grounding. Despite Honeywell and the furnace maker declaring it would not work on our system, i just tried a plug in 24V ac power supply (300ma) that I had on hand and the problem was solved at once! Then remembered that is what i did previously on another Honeywell wi fi thermostat (although that needed an additional switching 24v/120v switching relay also).
title: Needed independent power supply !

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mandy
content: When we bought our house a few years back it came with a basic Honeywell thermos installed. We wanted to join the 21st century with a smarter, wi-fi enabled thermos that we could control with an app, so we purchased this thermos. Installation was incredibly simple. I was impressed that the base even came with a built in level for proper placement. The wiring was very straight forward and frustration free. Once it was installed, the software setup on the Nest was a breeze. It is even smart enough to detect wire connections and provide a graphical display so you can catch bad wire connections. So far the thermos is simple and enjoyable to use. It takes some getting used to using the rotation and single button for navigation. I look forward to using the more advanced features.
title: Easy to setup and use

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: bek
content: This is the second Nest I have purchased, once for my primary resident and another recently for my second home at the beach.  I love the nest.  Temperatures are fine, no issues with that.  The remote control is really the winner for me.  I can check home temperature, outside temperature, and humidity remotely.  Humidity is very important for me at the second home, as the whole area there is very humid, and I'm trying to reduce my humidity as much as possible.  The Nest is a very attractive thermostat as well.  I love how it lights up when you walk in front of it (it's a setting).  Sometimes it does reduce heat in the winter down even when I'm home, and I'm not sure why, but I just turn it back up.  Really love my Nest.
title: I have two Nests, and love them

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brady
content: Google "nest thermostat shuts off before reaching temperature" before purchasing. My nest thermostat is shutting my AC off before it reaches the desired temp. At first I thought my system just simply wasn't keeping up on hot days so I changed filters, cleaned the fins on my outside unit, and had an HVAC tech come look at my system. He recharged my AC and said he didn't know why else my AC wouldn't be keeping up. The problem continued so then I looked at the thermostat as possibly being the problem and sure enough a simple google search will show you that this is a common problem that has been going on for quite a while. I haven't called Nest to try to see if they can offer a solution yet but I figired I'd leave a review pointing this problem out so other people are aware of it before they purchase and end up in the same boat as myself. I'll try to remember to update my review after talking with Nest. For now I'm pretty disappointed in the product though.
title: AC doesn't reach desired temp before shutting off

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bill
content: Tech support was misleading but product is great. When I contacted the tech support they said my A/C system is just NOT compatible, period. However, upon hiring a professional I was able to install it and it has been working fine since. Product-wise, this product fixed my cold nursery issue. My old Honeywell thermostat couldn't wrap its head around with my nursery temperature. I keep it closed overnight while my toddler's asleep, and boy, that room gets cold. It gets so cold it dropped down to 72 [F deg], but my Honeywell thermostat used to log marry and happy 77 [F deg]. Never had that issue since we replaced it with the Nest Learning Thermostat, along with this Temperature Sensor placed in the Nursery. Fantastic Product.
title: Tech support was misleading but product is great!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: K. Marcantel
content: Love. This. Thing! My son has been urging me to purchase this for my home and I finally broke down and committed to one. It was a little awkward setting this up for use with a Nexia bridge, but once connected; it works brilliantly. The build quality is impressive, and I don't think I've ever encountered a product with such thorough documentation to aid in DIY installation. I wouldn't imagine anyone having too much difficulty installing this unless they were connecting it to a very old  Air Conditioning system. After a month of use, it is now beginning to make changes to the aair handler based on what it's learned so far and I'm impressed!. I finally don't have to remember to switch modes on the AC during those weird times here in south Louisiana when you run the cooling during the day and heat at night. And I expect it will help the electric bill because it shifts to ECO mode when it senses I've left the house. Why didn't I buy this sooner...
title: The smartest "smart device" in my smart home so far.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lucy Love
content: They should tell you that the minute you turn off the power to your furnace for some crazy reason, your internet goes down. I have a iphone, iMac and iPad... all of them lost connectivity making the install a royal pain in the ass! That means the Nest app doesn't work either, which is essential to setting up the thermostat!!! Go figure!  Ended up calling Nest and the guy who tried to help had never installed a thermostat before so he had me make all sorts of mistakes that ended up costing me time and made for more holes in my walls! He didn't understand my request to at least get the Nest app up and running... I ended up taking 2 hours and a ton of sweat to do the install. I now have to patch and paint and pray the damn thing works. Pain in the ass install!!!!
title: Takes a pro longer than an hour to install...helpline is feeble
