product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jeffrey M Harkavy
content: I just moved into a new apartment and while it was mostly very much up to date, the thermostat was not.  So I decided to replace it myself with the Nest.  Let me say that I am reasonably intelligent but not the handiest guy when it comes to building, installing or repairing things.  But the instructional video and the materials that came with the Nest made removing and replacing my old thermostat quite easy.  The thermostat is very easy to operate and really does learn your routine.  I love the fact that I can control the temperature of my apartment from my IPhone.  So if my schedule changes, I can easily change the settings so that when I arrive home, my place is very comfortable.  Also, please check with your utility company about possible rebates.  I get my power from Southern California Edison and I will be getting a $75 rebate just for purchasing and installing my Nest thermostat.
title: Great product and a real money saver!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jared Hay
content: I was surprised how easy the installation was since I had no idea how I would go about doing it.  The instructions are very clear and I love when companies go above and beyond when writing them.  It comes with all the tools needed such as the flathead/philips style screwdriver and the thermostat itself has a built-in leveler on the back panel (this gets covered up later by the front panel/device.  I love how smart this thing is in that it has a lot of options and I didn't even realize it was compatible with over 50 other devices.  I will be using my Amazon Echo to control it too.  Probably what I love most about this device is how easy it is to control the temperature up and down by simply rotating the grey ring around it.  It also responds much faster than my old thermostat in actually starting up the heater/air conditioner.  It's instant.  I also love how it can tell when you leave the house if your smart phone leaves the vicinity.  It's also easy to change the temperature remotely, wherever you are.  A feature I wasn't expecting was how the screen turns on when you walk past it or just in front of it (mine is in a hallway, so it's mainly when I walk past it).  The screen is vivid and instead of being a touchscreen, you control it by moving the outer ring and make selections by pushing the whole device in like a big button.  This is interesting!  I recommend this to anyone and be sure to check if you are eligible for a rebate from your electric/gas company.  I applied for $50 back, so be sure to check that out.
title: Impressive

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mitch
content: It's been a great addition to our home and seriously works wonders, but I have yet to find/see a single thing that hints at it being Alexa-integrative.  It can work with Google Home, but nothing is saying 'Alexa' anywhere on the instructions, on the app, on the box....  Even my Alexa is all "nope, sorry, don't see any smart thermostats".  It is possible I'm doing it wrong, of course, but even if not it's been great regardless.  I love having it, Alexa-integration or otherwise!
title: Well I love the thing, but it DEFINITELY DOES NOT work with Alexa as far as I can tell

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lateef Alabi-Oki
content: In a way, Google Home, influenced my decision to by the Nest thermostat. It's a euphoric feeling telling the Google Assistant on Home to set the temperature in the house without lifting a single finger. Setup was easy. The app could use a little work on Android, but it's very usable. And smart options, all of which I've enabled, is supposed to save me money in the long run. Time will tell. So far, however, the experience of using the Nest has been delightful and pleasant. The fact that I can adjust the temperature from my Android Wear smartwatch, or phone or tablet, from anywhere is worth the price of admission. Apparently, the best temperature for sleeping is between 60-65 degree F. The nice thing about the Nest is that you can set a Heat.Cool mode where you can assign temperature thresholds. The Nest will automatically use Heat or Cool air to maintain the temperature thresholds. This use case works perfectly for me more than anything else as I want to maintain certain temperature thresholds at night when sleeping, and a different set of thresholds during the day. The Nest is perfect for this use case. The Eco features are also a nice bonus. I'm not particularly enamored by them, but I'm glad they exist and I have all of them enabled. I also have had the Nest long enough to know how well they work. I'll update this review after a couple of months of usage. This is a fantastic top-class product. I have no hesitation recommending this product.
title: Paired with Google Home, The Future is Here

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: OkayParkay
content: This product is fantastic! I originally had purchased the EcoBee because I was interested in the room sensor function and its product ratings through trusted resources like CNET. After the EcoBee blew a fuse in my furnace because I was required to use the PEK tool (basically provides a C wire if you don't have one) I called a HVAC repair person. They followed the same installation instructions and blew 2 more fuses. I had installed it perfectly. I immediately returned the EcoBee and bought Nest and it works perfectly! I did not have to do anything strange to my furnace and I did extra research to confirm it is fully capable of recharging itself through your heating and cooling wires. I am very happy with the purchase as well as the application. It works great with my Alexa and there were not setup issues. This takes less than 15 minutes to setup. My only criticism is for folks looking for features in EcoBee - remember this is a learning thermostat. If you want to set your own schedule this application on Nest is a little clunky but that did not bother me at all since I like the learning feature.
title: Bought after returning EcoBee! FANTASTIC!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ron
content: Ive read other review complaining about it doesn't learn exactly how I expected it to ......waaaaah, get over it.  For starters it looks cool as hell.  Just a slick piece of hardware.  Integration with both Google and Alexa is seamless.  I turned off all of the learning features and set my own schedule, super easy through the app.  Basically I use it like I would any other programmable thermostat. I love that i can talk to it to make changes.  I have dogs so iv i go on vacation i simply turn off the schedule, if summer i just set the temp to 77, if winter I set it to 68 and I know they are safe.  Great product, a bit pricey when considering I use it like I could many other , less expensive programmable units but again......Its Just Cool!
title: Its just cool!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: CMD
content: Unit is a dramatic improvement over the 1st gen Nests in terms of feel and appearance. The profile is slimmer and the black on black color scheme is more attractive in my home than the shinier Gen 1 Nest unit it replaced. This should be a 5 star product but for the following cons: 1) Entering information, such as a complex wi-fi password, is exceptionally tedious using the rotary dial. The dial can only cycle through the alphanumeric screens in order, so you have to cycle through a bunch of unnecessary screens to switch between capital and lower case letters. A faster, easier way should be available -- like being able to go back to the previous alphabet or symbol selection. 2) The unit develops a mind of its own over time, which would be a great thing if it could be appropriately contained. But no matter what I try to do, I find my unit switching back to a cool setting of 80 sometimes without explanation. The Nest needs a simple way to set up ironclad rules for automatic temperature adjustment. It's especially hot where I live. Under no circumstances do I want the thermostat to go above, say, 77. Additionally, although the system allows for scheduling the fan to run, there doesn't appear to be a way to incorporate running the fan as part of the overall cooling settings. You have to know in advance when you want the fan to run to circulate stagnant air without actively trying to cool the home further vs when you want the system to actually cool the home.
title: Still not perfect.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: gtran
content: This is my second time ordering the Nest. The first time I did not have a common wire. Nest claims that it will work. It powered up but caused my system to short cycle. This time I had a common wire installed but the Nest would not boot up. When I removed the C wire, it did boot it. This was very strange. Some people online were experienceing the same issue. I even went as far as removing the C wire and bought a venstar 4 to 5 wire kit. Still no luck. After much research I finally gave up. Bought the ecobee and it worked.
title: This is my second time ordering the Nest. The ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: GISGUY34
content: Install was simple and straight forward, I had all of the needed wires including the C wire for power at the old thermostat location.  Make sure to run the compatibility checker with the wires going to your current thermostat before purchasing.  It took an hour or so for the firmware/software to update after the thermostat was installed and initial settings were entered.  Afterwards, I used the Android App on my smartphone to set a schedule and I linked it to my Echo and Insteon apps.  Auto Scheduling was useless to me since the thermostat is in a room rarely used.  My furnace has two stage heating and the Nest thermostat can control it with an extra wire, but after reading the furnace manufacturer's website, I felt it was better to let the furnace determine for itself which stage to run.  I also came to this same conclusion for running my whole house humidifier.  The Nest Thermostat can run it, with an extra wire in the * slot, but I believe the manufacturer's humidistat with the outdoor sensor and independent blower control does the same thing and is geared specifically for my equipment.  I like that I get a daily view of the furnace on/off cycles and how many hours it runs per day on my smartphone.  I really love the ability to control the thermostat remotely via my smartphone app and through my Echos, my main reasons for getting it.  As for the energy savings, that still has to be determined.  If you're replacing a 7 day properly programmed thermostat, you'll probably see very little difference.  If you are replacing a non-programmable thermostat, then the savings could be substantial, especially if you use the ECO temperatures at night and when away from the home.
title: Great for Smarthome Integration and Remote Access

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bald Seagle
content: You’re much much better off buying a cheap $15 thermostat. This has lots of issues, the biggest being that it shows the wrong temperature. Alsways about 8 degrees higher. So it doesn’t come on when it’s supposed to and we’re freezing. To compensate I started setting the thermostat higher and now we’re boiling. There are literally 100s of cheaper alternatives that can do this very basic operation properly. Also, this Seems to be a very common problem with nests, and there is no fix yet.
title: Consistently shows +8 degree higher temperature. Pretty poor for a thermostat.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Laura
content: The Nest was very easy to setup--this is a thirty minute job that can be completed by a novice. The install and setup instructions were easy to follow and the wire tags were helpful. The thermostat and App are intuitive to use. The learning Nest has done a great job recognizing my patterns and adjusting my home temperature appropriately.  When I deviate from my typical occupancy schedule it is quick and easy to change the home temperature with the Nest App. I also really like that I can control or check my house temperature on my IPhone at any time and from any where. The Nest App provides me with a periodic report that is useful in evaluating my energy usage. As a side, I still find it to be amusing and convenient to change the house temperature using Amazon's Alexa.
title: Intuitive and helpful device

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Happy Doc
content: When my old programmable wall unit gave up the ghost, it was time for a replacement. I wasn't sure it would be worth the added cost but figured the benefits of the Nest may be worth it. I installed it myself with the enclosed instructions and I'm very happy with the unit so far. It learned my favorite temperature when I'm home, when I sleep and when I'm out for the day. Wakes up as I pass by and shows the weather and outdoor temp. Adds a cool-factor to my hallway. My furnace repairman came by for my annual maintenance, saw that I had just bought the Nest and was able to get me a nice rebate from my utility company. That dropped the price $50 and made it a fantastic deal.
title: Marginally costlier than a programmable from HD but so much better

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: wrl73
content: I have been very happy with my nest thermostat. This is the second one I have purchased. The first one I bought brand new to use downstairs. This one I bought to use for my upstairs unit. Being that they are so expensive, I took the gamble of buying the refurbished one from Amazon so I could save some money. I have been very happy with this purchase. It works just as well as our other one that we paid more for brand new. There were no blemishes on the thermostat, it looks brand new and looks great on our wall. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because there is a slight fit issue with the wall bracket and the thermostat. But, it's very minor and not a deal breaker. It's up, and working just as it's intended to do. And quite frankly I'm the only one that's aware if it because I installed it. No one else is aware of that issue. I'm happy with this purchase.
title: Refurbished is the way to go to save some money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Charles
content: This is a downgrade from my old thermostat in some respects.  I upgraded from a Hunter thermostat that was in use for a decade, and it kept stats for the day, yesterday, this week, last week and all time.  This new fancy thermostat can’t even tell you today’s usage until the next day.  Then it only keeps 10 days. I don’t get it.  It’s totally lacking.  The monthly report is a waste. It shows total hours of usage, and the rest is self promotion. They removed IFTTT support, and support for every other “works with nest” service. Save your money and buy something that does more for less.
title: Overpriced and best functionality removed.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jonathan & Meredith
content: Our AC unit recently went kaput, so my husband upgraded to a dual system. Our old WiFi-enabled thermostat didn’t have the capability to kick on the second system, leading my husband to bypass it entirely. It really wasn’t a good situation. We got this Nest thermostat to replace it and are very impressed with the sleek design and learning aspect of the hardware. The item is easy to install, use, and access the information from. We are supremely happy with it and the fact that it’s copper (I’m obsessed with copper) is an added bonus. My husband didn’t like the backing plates, so he just patched the wall where the previous thermostat was. So far we are incredibly happy with it. I’m going back to work after a year at home and we believe the eco feature will save a lot of money when we aren’t at home!
title: Excellent Performance

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Aleatha
content: (Edited) Upgrading my rating and review because the problem I had recently was with my HVAC system, not the thermostat. (I will say, however, that the Nest support page led me to believe the problem was with the thermostat, through some somewhat vague wording. Otherwise, I think their online help pages are pretty good.) We've been using this thermostat for a few weeks, so I'm still learning about it. I do like being able to control it via Alexa. I haven't tried it with Siri yet. I like the large, bright display, and the fact that you can dial in a more economical setting just by looking for the leaf. I'm frustrated that I can't seem to figure out the finer points of the HEAT/COOL mode (so we've just been toggling it back and forth between HEAT and COOL modes). Will update later after more use.
title: I like this thermostat a lot

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Roberto Lito
content: I purchased it on February 22nd.2019. On February 6th, 2020 it stopped controlling the temperature and the AC Unit did not turn off. We woke up one morning with the house at almost 80 F. My AC technician came and tested the AC and proved that the thermostat was not controlling the AC. I contacted Nest. They sent me a refurbished one but I am not installing it. I asked the Nest person what I was going to do if it failed after the 2nd year of warranty. This would be the last year. She answered:  "We would see." Well, I don't want to see. I want a product that lasts at least 4 years. Otherwise it is not reliable. So, I am selling it and taking another brand. Possibly Honewell that my technician says they are more reliable though they don't have all the bells and whistles of the Nest. I'd rather have a thermostat with less features than have to replace the thermostat every year.
title: It lasted 1 year then did not control the AC Unit anymore

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Doru C
content: Product is not made to serve the customer. It is a way to hook the customer into Google's platform. Google purposely denies integration into standalone home automation systems. The thing has to talk to mother ship and everything be controlled through it. At times you may see your settings tweaked without knowledge. Had to call and ask for an explanation. Was told that the tuneup will save me money. This is pretty much an act of digital trespassing. The only option left for privacy conscious customers is to not configure internet access. This would leave you without the ability to reach to it remotely, even if inside the house. YMMV.
title: Not your best, just Google's best

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: hermes rodriguez
content: This thing is amazing, yet very expensive. It was installed in less than half an hour and the instructions provided are say to follow. It’s heavy and well built and it feels like it won’t break any time soon. I personally love the ring and button press combo, it’s easier to input a password or email address on this thermostat than it is on most smart TVs when signing into an account and the testing feature is great. Right after you install the wires it lets you know which wires it detects and then troubleshoots to make sure they are in the right place. I can’t think of anything that would make the installation or programming easier, maybe the price could come down but I would hate for them to compromise build quality, even the little screwdriver that came with the thermostat is something you won’t throw away, it’s better than most $10 screw drivers I’ve seen and definitely better than any I’ve ever seen included with a product.
title: Works out of the box and installed in 30 minutes.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ScubaJen
content: Being able to control this thermostat from my smartphone while I'm buried under the covers in my bed and need the heat turned up just a little is the best feature!  I don't have it paired with my Alexa just yet, but the installation was so flipping easy!  There is a video, if you need it, but the instruction manual walked me through the steps pretty well.  I had it installed in no time.  My wiring is a good 20-30 years old, and I was able to easily connect this thermostat to my system.  The testing part to make sure everything is connected properly also helped.  I had no troubles that I needed any support for, plus I saved a lot on the installation cost to pay a professional to come and connect it.
title: I like that it's a learning thermostat, very easy to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DG
content: I bought my nest December 2nd 2017. On  May 29th 2018 nearing the beginning of Summer.  It's 74 degrees outside, my AC is on, and it 76 degrees inside. Thermostat  has a message of delayed for 4 hours. This is apparently a known problem with Nest thermostats. People have reported spending hours on line with Nest support for the same issue. My nest is only 6 months old and now it has this problem.  It also now has a problem of occasionally setting my AC to 50 degrees and I have come home a few times now and found my house to be a meat locker. I have had a truly horrible experience with my nest thermostat. And some of the issues seem to be known issues. It would have been nice to know before I bought it. One expensive piece of crap. I do not recommend this for anyone. Will never by a nest again. I refuse to have to spend hours on the phone debugging my thermostat.
title: Known problems with delay heating and cooling that can'r be fixed.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rex0725
content: My learning thermostat arrived yesterday.  Installing it was easy, I did need some sheet rock anchors that were not included.  But, the wiring was simple, or so I thought.  My particular wiring was strange and even though I followed the directions the Nest thought I had a heat pump, which I do not.  I contacted customer service through Facebook messenger.  They went back and forth with me all day trying different things until we got it figured out.  They drew different diagrams and had me try different configurations until it worked.  Truly, some of the best customer service I have experienced in a long time!!
title: Customer support may be dead in most places, but not here!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: thomas
content: Worked great for about a month and a half then suddenly dropped wifi. Most times it doesn't see any networks but when it does see my network it won't connect. Battery is at 3.8 to 3.9 volts wifi shuts down at 3.6 tried restarting resetting and nothing works I have a nest Gen 2 upstairs that connects  fine guess I get to see how warranty department at nest is. (UPDATE) Contacted the support department and they were outstanding! I am a network administrator and I know about connection problems and a was about 99% sure the network card in this unit had failed.Support walked me through all of the troubleshoot that i had already done and came up with the same conclusion that I had come to and is sending a replacement unit in the mail. I am very satisfied with tech support and the thermostat itself is great build quality and nest stands behind their product 100%
title: Great product I just got a dud but nest stands behind their products

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: GTimBama
content: Where to begin...I purchased 2 of these for our new house since we have 2 units. Installation: I've installed several thermostats before and this was probably the easiest I've ever done. Setup: Connecting to WIFI, naming the device, linking to the App, and setting up schedules were all a breeze. The only concern is that you need to know a little about your unit before you begin. You need to know ALL of its capabilities (like 2nd stage/emergency heat, etc..) You can look it up online if you find the make/model of your unit. Likes: Ability to remotely change temperature for up stairs without having to go up the stairs. Also, setup Geo-Fencing (in the Nest App) with all the smartphones in your family, it will auto-detect when you are away and reduce the cooling until you get close to home (which saves $$$) DISLIKES: Constantly battling the thermostat to "save money" with the green leaf and having a comfortable temperature. After 3 months: We moved from a 2100 Sq/ft house with one unit to a 3600 Sq/ft house with 2 units and my power/energy bill has REDUCED!! I live in the South so we average upper 90s temperature during the summer. Needless to say, its hot and the A/C runs a lot! Will update during the winter months
title: Saves $$$$

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JMason
content: The ambient temperature sensor overheats (probably due to the wifi module) and heats the unit itself up 6 degrees or more.  This makes the AC run constantly which freezes the the lines.  I've called NEST support 3 times regarding this.  They are unable to help and say there is NO issues with the unit heating up.  I've loved nest for years, but whatever update they pushed out in the last year caused this issue.  I just read on a forum that you can turn off WIFI within the nest and it will cool off and read normal ambient temps...  I'm doing it now.
title: Have 5 units.  One major flaw.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brandon DiDonato
content: Installation was fairly simple..I say fairly, because I got lost a few times. This is of no fault of the product, just be careful when you are taking your old thermostat off. Take pictures and pay attention. It looks extremely clean in my living room. It has a weird sensor that was not explained before..the screen goes dark when no one is near the unit. As you walk up, the screen turns on and shows you the temperature. Pretty cool. The bezel on the exterior of the unit is fun, it's very easy to set your temperature. I really enjoy being able to put my house to 81 Degrees before I leave. I put it back down to 74 Degrees about an hour before arriving home. (I do this through my phone!) You can automatically set schedules. You can have it to auto "away." (If you leave for a trip or for work, it will go to ECO mode, and not leave until it detects you back home.) So far, I am saving a ton of money doing this. The application on my phone is a little weird. It has all of the basics there, but some of it is not clearly described.
title: No Real Complaints at All

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chris Babcock
content: This thermostat is the biggest piece of garbage I've ever installed. This thermostat does not do the most basic of things such as control the temperature in my home. I thought that Amazon would back up my purchase but apparently they do not. the seller has decided I can no longer return it after 30 days. Which was reflected nowhere on the page where I bought it. It takes hours to cool my house down a few degrees.  it lets my house heat up too much and then cools it down too far.  Tech support is virtually nonexistent. All they can ask is whether I have it in cool mode or not. Amazon tech support had me on hold for 30 minutes just to tell me that I should contact the seller and return it. Under no circumstances ever buy any product from Stelli.
title: The biggest piece of garbage I've ever installed

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: michaelsean
content: I bought the Nest unit for a couple of reasons. The first was that I wanted the ability to control our house temp from my phone. The other main reason is I wanted a smart thermostat that had the potential to save me money over the long term. I think the Nest thermostat is a win on both fronts. It took me all of about 10 minutes to remove my old unit and replace it with this one. The directions are easy and the unit itself will show you what wires are connected to verify what it is reading.  Once installed you create a Nest account and download the app for your Android or iPhone. Voila, you have a smart thermostat! Having owned it for about 6 months I can confidently say it saves us 10% - 15% a month off our heating/cooling bill. I figure it will pay for itself in savings in about 14 months. Our heating/cooling bill is probably more than most as our house is at 7100 feet and the weather changes frequently. Your mileage may vary.
title: Perfect form and function for a smart thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alexandru Barabas
content: I calculated that this product saved me $100 over the past year. However, it suddenly stopped energizing the reversing valve and after tons of diagnosing and spending $100 for an AC company to confirm, I'm stuck without cooling and waiting for a new part to show up 5-7 business days later. Not sure why Nest is so confident that it's the base because the thermostat could also be producing these exact same symptoms and none of the diagnostic steps isolate the base vs the thermostat. Also, no homekit support. First and last Nest I will buy. The competition has caught up and has excellent products worth considering.
title: Has been great for a year, then failed base, still no homekit support.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cynthia A. Derosier
content: I purchased this to replace a thermostat that was no longer operating correctly especially in the winter. I had to have the temperature set to 77 to keep the house 70 degrees. My gas company was offering a $75 rebate so I went to the nest website and followed the instructions to see if the nest would be compatible with my furnace. I was happy to see that it was. I purchased the nest and installed it as soon as it came in. Installation was easy and getting it connected to my Amazon Echo was simple. I was happy to see that the nest is reading the correct temperature. I have my nest set to heat/cool and when I walk by it shows me the temperature setting. If I was closer to it it shows me a dial image and what the temperature currently is in my living room. I haven't done much with the learning portion. I usually set a temperature and forget about it. I am looking forward to the eco features that will adjust the temps when I am gone.
title: I was happy to see that it was

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AM
content: One of the few products that I regret buying, Nest is on the top of the list. It's not a DIY thing. If you get into any problem - there is virtually no help. There is no where to raise a case or ticket. The documentation of Nest is terrible. However, it'll keep asking you if you want to spend a 100$ to get 'professional' installers. Connecting the same wiring as my last thermostat & confirming from my equipment doesn't make this work. Very elusive errors are thrown which you can't understand. No resolution in online help too. Its summer and I regret changing to this device as my AC unit won't work now & Nest isn't ready to help either.
title: Regret buying this

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ranmar
content: I do love it but the temperature sensors are not calibrated properly... Meaning it states a temperature approximately 5 - 8 degrees warmer than it actually is. States its 75 degrees when its 68 degrees. Ive searched high and low for a solution and found it to be a common occurance with folks all around. Hoping it'll be fixed in a software update.
title: Wrong measurements of actual temperature.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: melanie
content: I purchased three of these in copper, very reluctantly if I may add. My hubby is a tech nut and wants everything to be “smart”. I personally just want something that works and isn’t too complicated. I am not very tech savvy, and personally find it difficult to work most apps and smart products. I have to say that I was presently surprised and have to give my hubby kudos for convincing me to purchase these. They are very pretty, super easy to install and run, and have drastically reduced our electric bill. I didn’t think that our new energy star home had much room for improvement, but I was wrong. We cut our already low bill of 130 a month to about 90 a month. I couldn’t be happier.
title: Very pretty, easy to use, and saves money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rebecca B
content: We love this thermostat in our house. It's great for saving money with the adaptive temperature control, especially for when you come and go. It will tell you when you have the temperature set in an eco friendly range. You can also set it up to notify you when your electric provider has surge pricing enabled so that you can save money then. Our bill has soberly seen savings since getting this. We also put the thermostat in ourselves. It take probably 30 minutes, which is not bad but you should have minor repair and home improvement skills. Also, double check on Nest's website that your system is compatible with this thermostat. Not everyone's is.
title: Great thermostat for saving money, not too hard to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: My Two Cents
content: Do not purchase this if you on an iPhone  The app will continually crash if you are using an iPhone ever since Apple added some additional VPN functionality  to their operating software.  This is additional security that Apple had added to make you iPhone “invisible” when you are away from your home WIFI and exposed to public WIFI signals to protect you and your data.  However, when VPN is activated (and your iPhone defaults to this automatically), it confuses your Nest app which results in the app crashing after a minute or less.  Making the app useful for only quickly changing or adjusting your Nest thermostat. I learned this design fault recently after “speaking” with a senior customer service rep (via online chat)  where I learned the only way to avoid this crash is by turning off the VPN When you are in your hone on your iPhone thereby potentially exposing your iPhone security to others if you would forget to to turn VPN capabilities back on when you leave your home!  It was very interesting that the Nest representative indicated that i was the first that contacted them about this problem and after I stated that online customer reviews state otherwise, the rep magically came up with the “VPN off” workaround.  He also stated that a team is working with Apple to address this issue, but did not offer any information when it will be resolved.  Overall, his initial statement indicating that the problem had not existed before was completely disingenuous So, until Nest resolves this issue without  jeopardizing your iPhone security, I would go with an Ecobee instead
title: Not fully compatible with iPhone

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alexandra Leigh
content: I have loved the look and the idea of Nest; we have three. I keep having the same issue with one unit that has had to be replaced now two times. We have a 2 stage heat pump and the nest, after working correctly for about 11 mo each time, stops turning on the reverse valve for the AC (well, this is how I understand it after about, all told, 7 hours on the phone with customer support over 2 years and 2 visits from my AC guys). I feel nest should have paid for my needed third unit (what thermostat breaks after 11 mo each time???? And especially at this price point!) but because its been over a year, no dice. Im going back to a simple, "dumb" thermostat.
title: Lovely Customer Service, Unit keeps breaking...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Car
content: Let me start this review out saying I'm not tech savvy at all. We recently bought a new house and knew we wanted to upgrade to more energy efficient and convenient devices. This makes adjusting the temperature and saving on our energy bill so easy. It uses my phone's location, and also my SimpliSafe home security systems status (home or away), to determine when to switch to eco mode, which I have set to be a certain range of temperatures. The dial and screen are easy to use. I can control it from my phone and from my Google hub Max. It looks great on my wall and I like that when you walk by it automatically lights up to let you know the current temperature inside.
title: Thermostat simplified and glamorized

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RHJ_pops
content: I have two thermostats in my home, one up, one down.  I decided to replace my downstairs, perfectly good,  programmable, thermostat with a Nest.  I admit I was concerned about installing it because I was way out of my league here.  Wait for it...Piece of cake.  As a man, I hate to follow directions but in this case, I did.  I knew if I screwed this up, it was going to be cold downstairs for a while.  More importantly, my wife would say, "What was wrong with the old one?"  Well, nothing of course.  Anyway, I had this thing working inside of 30 minutes with no runs, not hits, no errors, and no extra parts left on base.  I would buy this again.  Oh wait, I did!  Now I am replacing the perfectly good thermostat upstairs.  I bet I don't even read the instructions this time.
title: Of course they do the job; the problem is, they are also fun.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael S.
content: Let me count the ways: Google and Nest have a list of incompatitble HVAC units, but they don't share this list publicly.  Instead, they send you to a simple compatiblity url that asks which thermostat wires you have to determine fit.  This is not a proper check and they're aware of this based upon my conversations with their support team. In essence, the Nest I purchased did not only work in improperly with my HVAC unit, but it has likely been hurting my unit.  It was making harmoic buzzing sounds periodically.  I had the HVAC installer out multiple times and even the manufacturer's rep.  They all told me it was likely the NEST causing the issues because it was power stealing.  We have a 'C' wire for what it's worth.  That doesn't matter. What we found, two months later, after calls with Nest support was that our furnace, a York Affinity 9c series, was not compatible.  Nest employees have a list, which they won't share of incompatible furnaces and or AC units.  It's unacceptable they won't share this publicly before spending $200 and worse, before it might damage your HVAC unit. Trust me - HVAC professionals have a great disdain for Nest thermostats.  Don't buy this.
title: Don't buy this trash - Google is nefarious

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: G. R. D'Anna II
content: One of the most important features for a connected device is its ability to work with IFTTT. Because this functionality is being removed, this product and brand deserves a big rating reduction.
title: Will no longer work with IFTTT

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Customer
content: I have had this product for less than 2 years. It has failed twice. The first time was when it was still in its 1 year warranty. It worked great for the first several months. Then suddenly one day, towards the end of summer, when AC was activated, it would turn on the heat. It was NOT a wiring problem. An A/C tech diagnosed the problem to be caused by the Nest. Luckily, we got a replacement Nest under warranty, and even got compensated for our A/C tech cost. (That was nice.) Unfortunately, now about a year or so after that incident, it has failed again with the exact same issue. Again, not a wiring problem. I double-checked it. The A/C worked fine just last week. I have removed the Next, and put my old Honeywell back on. I regret this purchase, and I fear others will too. The convenience is not worth the once a year headaches it has caused. It remains to be seen if Nest will give me a new one or not so far out of warranty.
title: Two failures in less than 2 years

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JT
content: I bought this thermostat primarily because of the Home / Away Assist feature, which is supposed to automatically adjust the temperature to eco mode when cell phones are away from home. This function has not worked properly, if at all, since purchase. I have contacted the Nest support department and I can report that there has been no change to the operation of the product. On a positive note their service department was very responsive but not helpful. It seemed that the service representative keyed on words that I said and gave me responses and suggestions based on that. All in all not helpful.  If this product was not installed I would return it and get a credit. I will use it as a simple manual thermostat and remind myself each time that I pass it in my hallway to not depend on technology.
title: Home / Assist Away function does not work properly.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: George E. Cela
content: Unfortunately for me - I purchased a new house last year and I purchased/ordered this copper colored nest at that time - by the time I went to unbox and install the date for allowing me to return/exchange the thermostat has long passed. No matter what we've tried (we have installed several nests over the years) we cannot get this one to work...we purchased a honewell wifi thermostat and it's perfect right out of the box...I sent emails to seller that never even were replied to at all...two different emails without reply. I hate to write a poor/negative review for anyone, but during these tough times, companies need to focus on customer service more than ever. Two emails to the seller without reply is simply unaccepatble and leads me to believe they knew there was something wrong with this thermostat...too bad I'm out $240+ without any recourse at this point.
title: BEWARE: This thermostat does not work

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Oscar
content: The first one didn't work. I did an exchange, and it wasn't prime shipping. It took 10 days to get a replacement. During this time, the heat didn't work. Living in the Northeast, it is not good to have no heat in December. The problem was with the wifi connection, the battery & the connection itself. This thermostat I had one previous to this one, it works great. The replacement works great. Having no heat for a month. We ordered it on November 30th, and it was delivered and installed on December 1st, reordered, and delivered on December 30th.  It took 10 days to receive a replacement.
title: The first one didn't work

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sherita Sullivan Sekul
content: This is our 3rd device. Recently, we had to have a new AC unit installed in our out of town condo.  After the AC installation was completed, my AC guy states that my Nest would only turn the fan on and not switch the unit from Hot to Cold. He suggested contacting customer service. He removed the Nest device and reinstalled our old thermostat so our new unit would work. I contacted Nest customer support to get a replacement Nest unit. I was told that my AC guy would have to give me an invoice of all the steps he took to troubleshoot the device OR I would have to reinstall the device and troubleshoot with them over the phone. Those were my choices. 🤷🏼‍♀️ I hope my other 2 units don’t go out. This unit is no even 1 year old and allegedly under warranty until 2022. So much for the warranty and customer service. My review is the device is good if it works but a pain to get replaced if it doesn’t.
title: Warranty issue

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DRB
content: I have caught it shutting off the furnace(keeping night time temp) just minutes before starting it back up to bring the house up to daytime temps.  If it was truly smart it wouldn't turn off for a couple minutes just to start up again!  That's inefficient!!!  It says that it learns your schedule and programs itself!  It has yet to learn my schedule and I have owned for almost two months.  My schedule repeats every 28 days.  It seems to want to repeat a schedule every week.  The app on the phone makes creating a schedule rather easy to overcome the lack of program learning.  After rebates I got the thermostat for $90!  It has some nice features but it is waaaay overpriced without discounts and rebates!
title: Not as smart as it thinks it is!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: BigBlueLeaf
content: Love it.  Another smart way to control your home and help reduce your energy expenses as it learns your routines/ preferences when you are home & recognizes when you are not home so it will automatically o into eco mode to save you $$. I’m not the handiest of people especially with any type of electrical work, but the online step by step guide to install he nest was super easy to follow even for a novice like me. Took maybe 20-30 min from start to finish. Easy to control from the app on my phone & iPad,  I haven’t tried to connect to Alexa As of yet.
title: Easy to Install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: justfmax
content: I bought two Nest thermostats for my two-story condominium.  I was attracted to Nest's rich feature set and sharp appearance.  I am generally satisfied except as noted below. Likes: Easy to install.  Sharp appearance.  Intuitive interface.  Programmable functions.  Controllability though the Nest app. Ambivalent aspects: The Nest's schedule-learning capability will be wasted with me.  My schedule is utterly changeable to the point of near randomness.  This is due to my professional obligations.  I understood when I purchased Nest that I wouldn't fully benefit from its learning capability, and that is fine with me.  I chose to pay for a feature that can't be reasonably deployed in my environment and that's not Nest's fault.  My schedule modulates from one day to the next, one week to the next, one month to the next, and so on.  Machine learning -- pursuant to my schedule -- isn't going to happen here. What ultimately disappoints me about the thermostats is that they have no idea whether I'm home or away.  I've been home for two hours now and just noticed on the Nest app that both thermostats are engaged in ECO mode.  This mode is supposed to trigger only when one is away from home. So, while I have zero concern about never realizing the full benefits of Nest's learning capabilities, its inability to properly determine whether I'm home or away (a presumably basic function and the foundation for ECO mode) is, frankly, puzzling. I'll be keeping the thermostats and hoping that Nest comes up with a fix for their home/away non-functionality.
title: Falls short of its potential.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: tom m.
content: I bought the Nest Thermostat on May 5th. today is August 21st. My heating and cooling system was confirmed to be compatible. I have a 4 wire setup. I installed the unit successfully to find it working great. Communication with the app was great, and it cooled/heated the house properly. Then after a couple days I began to notice the system would be cooling, and turn off and right back on immediately. I timed it and noticed it did this numerous times per minute. I reached out to Nest Customer Support. They seemed great! After a 3 calls and approx 120min waiting time, they determined it was short cycling due to power sharing because of a lack of a Common Wire. They said they would send a technician out to fix this issue. I was pleasantly surprised since the unit cost $250 and it may cost that much to fix the issue via an onsite technician. They set the date. It came and went and they said the technicians are too busy and had to push out. The next date that was scheduled came and went and again was said to be because they are too busy. After a few calls I found a customer service rep that finally admitted that they DO NOT HAVE ANY NEST technicians in the area and they cannot provide the support. I am not 90+ days after purchase so I cannot return the item. I now have a $250 paperweight. WORD OF ADVISE, BE SURE YOUR SYSTEM IS COMPATIBLE AND HAS A 5 WIRE SETUP BEFORE PURCHASE BECAUSE NEST SUPPORT MAY JUST LEAVE WITH LIKE THEY DID ME. So... the unit may be great. But i cannot say that was my experience.
title: COULD BE A GREAT UNIT

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: S. Christian
content: I wish I realized it came with a mounting plate so I didn't waste my money on one of those stupid metal circles. With an older thermostat, everything turned out fine with install but we had to look at a couple of diagrams and search some details online. The only issue we had is we did not properly seat one of the wires, it worked but it was blowing heat instead of cold and cold instead of heat and running hard while we were trying to figure out what we had done wrong. Reseated that red wire and its been great. I noticed the system wasn't running as often and the nest seemed a lot more accurate than my old thermostat. We have had it for a month now, we did have our AC break in the last couple of days, I don't think its related but one of the ways I checked was in my history, we were normally running the system 5-6 hours a day and it was suddenly running for 10 hours. Looking forward to seeing more improvements. I plan to get the sensors later and I love yelling at Alexa to make it warmer or cooler at will.
title: I wish I had gotten it sooner

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Miss Kritchel
content: I have had the new thermostat for about a month now and am very, very, very pleased with it.  The instructions were incredibly clear, especially with the YouTube video and I was able to change it out myself, which is a big deal since I am  not in any way an electrician.  The only negative comment that I have is that the written instructions that came with it contained wiring labels that did not match my original thermostat and because I have little experience with these things, I wasn't sure if the labels were interchangeable.  However, the YouTube video put out by Nest did match my wiring and the confusion was quickly cleared up.  The mechanism itself is extremely easy to learn how to work with, it learns very easily and being connected by internet to our phones makes the efficiency quite good.  When it can't contact our phones, it turns the heat down.  When we come home and our phones are contacted, it turns the heat up.  I love the ease of use and how well it works.
title: very pleased with it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Redheaded Reviewer
content: I really struggled on which smart thermostat I would get - the ecobee, the Honeywell, or the Nest.  Ultimately, the Nest won out due to aesthetics but the concerns I had from the negative reviewers here kind of haunted me. I was able to install this myself in MAYBE 5 minutes.  My 5 wires were C, G, Y, W, and R so I wasn't sure exactly where to connect them to the Nest.  I did a quick google search and came to Nest's support where you click on what wires you do have and it tells you exactly how to connect them to the Nest.  That was a neat feature. I did have one issue with connectivity but it was trying to connect via wifi to my Apple Airport (from 2007),  The nest said it was connected to my network, and it was, but it couldn't get past firewalls or something.  Anyway, I just disconnected my Apple Airport and had the Nest connect straight to my wifi router and it worked like a charm.  I've had similar issues with other things trying to connect to the Airport so I knew that it wasn't the Nest itself. Last thing - I was hoping that I could install the Nest just bare against the wall, but I couldn't.  There were still holes outside the Nest.  If I had to complain about anything it would be that the trim plate included isn't quite as nice as what I think they should include.  For this price, I feel like even a rounded piece of sheet metal that would compliment the sleekness of the Nest should be included.  I bought a metal back plate from Amazon for $25 but it's bigger than what I needed and kind of takes away from the aesthetics. The Nest has been up a week in my house and has functioned exactly as expected.  Two days after me setting the thermostat to my wake up temperature and going to bed temperature and it did it automatically.  So cool! OH!  And I almost forgot to mention...they include a cute, higher quality screwdriver to disconnect everything from your old system and connect it to your new system.  This was an absolute unexpected delight to find and I wanted to mention it
title: So glad I took the plunge and bought it!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MKS
content: Appearance and function were great.  Easy to install, but really need C wire.  Google Nest does not support (works with) using Alexa.  I have Amazon Echo and wanted to use it to control Nest, but too many warnings on Internet and Google's own statement so I returned the unit.  Really liked it and the way it worked, but want support for Alexa.  Bought Ecobee.
title: Beautiful unit

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: a
content: Installed and it kept on restarting. Found out from google search that another wire (C) has to be added. Chatted with nest support and they promised to reimburse if I use a nest-certified installed. I did. Then uploaded the invoice to Nest support (chat link) as asked by the agent. TWICE. and still waiting for a response after 9 weeks. So it looks nice thats the only positive. Its wifi connected so it can be controlled remotely. Other than that, its overpriced, ill-supported. I regret buying it.
title: They promise but don't reimburse for installation problems.Not buying again.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MrPrice_isRight
content: I received my Nest Thermostat, when I went to screw in the base plate where you plug in the cables and screwed the screw right through the plate and broke it. Now I don't know if I am really strong or if the materials of the base plate were just super weak. But now my thermostat isn't working.
title: Poorly produced

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: UNCLEGIA
content: I have 20 of these used for my home and office.  They were fine in the beginning when adjusting them from the app or computer, but now after a bit of time, the Nest system is not responsive.  It either locks up or is unable to connect to the Nest network rendering it unable to change the temperature remotely.  I am assuming that since so many people are now using the Nest, their system is overloaded and they are unable to service that many stats at any one time.  I know this because it happens more frequently at peak times. I would try another brand without so much network traffic.
title: Terrible Product!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: xander
content: I could not be more positive about this product. While pricey, you might qualify of a $100 rebate by your natural gas source which makes this a rather attractive price for the capabilities that it has. The installation is super easy, the guides both online and in the box could not be more clear. The usability is very high and the features are phenomenal: - history to show you your usage identifies when your adjustments are saving or costing you energy identifies whether increased or lower usage were caused by the weather conditions monthly reports to show you your energy usage compared to people in the local area - learns how fast your heater or cooler can warm up or cool down the place and when making a temperature adjustment it will give you an estimate as to how long it will take to get to your desired temperature - testing application is very robust and useful - mobile app is very useful allowing you to make adjustments on the go or review history and schedules - web app is same quality and usability as the mobile app - auto away feature I like a lot, it knows when you're not home anymore and automatically shuts down this can be a bit tricky if the thermostat is at a location where you don't necessarily walk through all the time, so if you're watching a movie on the couch you might find it shutting off thinking you're away, but that is easily to workaround by walking by or using your phone to make the adjustment/correction. - ability to cool the place just using the fan without the compressor (saves LOTS of energy) while providing the right amount of cooling - ability to check and verify humidity and in/outside temperatures with a good indication and anticipated impression for today's weather. All around a great product with great features, can be installed by any level of expertise with the guides provided Not only for the home automation enthusiast, but also for the energy usage minded and for people appreciating ease of use in a very fancy appealing to the eye package.
title: Not just for the homeauto enthusiast, but also for the energy usage minded, high ease of use in a greatly designed device

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Joshua A. Nehlig
content: We ordered one during black Friday since it was a good deal and I've always been curious to try it.  The installation was extremely easy and straight forward.  Once installed, uploading the app and then linking the thermostat was also very easy.  We did you the included wall plate to hide the screw holes from our existing thermostat and it was nice that it was included as an option.  So far the app has worked very well and we were able to adjust the heating and cooling of our house remotely from our phones while traveling.  It will also use your phone to "sense" when you are not home to automatically adjust to energy saving mode.  We also linked it to our Amazon Echo and can now easily adjust temperatures by voice commands.  The display is really nice, being big and bright and the adjustments are very intuitive using the dial and then pushing the screen for selections. We liked it so much that we ordered a second one and I installed it just as quickly and easily.
title: Easy installation and great connectivity with Amazon Echo

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chris Delgado
content: This nest learning thermostat was something I picked up to have better overall control of the climate of the apartment I lived in.  The apartment came with an analog thermostat that wasn't programmable at all. We used the nest to set schedules, which many thermostats can do.  My personal favorite feature was how the app knew when you were away from home.  This allowed the nest to go into eco-mode, even when the schedule would normally cool during the day. Installation was super easy.  Setting up wifi was fairly easy, maybe a tiny bit tedious to scroll through the letters to set up the password. Pros: Easy to Install Easy to manage Integrates with some energy providers to reduce power usage for bill credits during the day. Works with Alexa and Google Home. Saves money in the long run by reducing energy usage. Cons: Tad bit expensive upfront.
title: Easy way to reduce your energy bill

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: An Tran
content: I bought this thermostat after hearing many great reviews on it, and also because I kept forgetting to turn my AC off when I go out and having to pay those extra usage every month. I decided to pull the trigger on this product. Instructions on installation is very easy to read and understand. I actually really like the screwdriver that comes with the box! AMAZING. I guess I spent about 15-20 minutes taking the old thermostat out and install this nest learning thermostat, and spent an extra 10 minutes installing the app and registering the new thermostat in the app. Now I don't have to worry about forgetting turning my AC off. Highly recommend this product as the User Interface is pretty amazing as well. LOVE IT.
title: No more worrying about not being able to turn on/off my AC

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shant H. Mardigian
content: I purchased this new device as a replace to the previous generation of thermostat I had. From the beginning, the nest kept being disconnected from my apps for periods (few hours at a time), and this occurred few times a week, until it fully stopped connecting to my network. The device worked but didn't work with my apps. After talking to their tech support, they determined it was a malfunctioned chip and they promised a replacement. However, they asked me to first send them the defective device before they ship a replacement, and the process was suppose to take between2-3 weeks. That mean staying without an AC for 3 weeks in August where temperatures get to over 100F where I live. They didn't accommodate, hence I went and bought a competitive device with much cheaper pricing.
title: Nest Products and Tech Support have degraded over years.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: WSW
content: For now, I can only provide an initial review. It will take some time to learn how to use the thermostat.  Google provides plenty of on line videos and instructions. It just takes time to digest it. Once you  have determined your current wiring is compatible and where the wires go it is easy to install. I’m still working to understand the thermostat scheduling process. Not sure if I can set a daily schedule via the Nest app. I can’t get Alexa to recognize Thermostat. Need to work that with Amazon.  For now, the AC is operational.  My wife says it looks good.
title: Be patient and follow the instructions

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: srwilliamstx
content: No phone support, there is no way to contact Google relative to 1 of 2 nest 3rd generation thermostats stopped connecting to wifi, out of the blue, with a "W5" error code, which requires that you contact the Google Nest team and yet there is no way to do so. UPDATE July 13, 2020; In an attempt to continue using the Nest 3rd Generation Thermostats I installed a c-wire to ensure enough power was getting to each unit. I moved the malfunctioning unit to the location the other Nest was working just fine in. It continued to not be able to see any of my wifi networks, so I purchased a HoneyWell RTH9585WF Smart Color Thermostat, installed it yesterday, and it immediately connected to my wifi. It has been working just fine and it does not depend upon an internal battery being able to hold a charge for it to work. During the summer here in Texas I cannot take the chance of not having any AC during these 110 degree Temp/Humidity days so I will be replacing the other Nest with the same HoneyWell unit very soon.
title: No tech support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ellen from long island, ny
content: apparently the nest thermostat is NOT compatible with all systems. when i opened my old thermostat i saw that onloy 2 wires were being used instead of 4.  i contacted NEST and they were very helpful and very nice.  they explained that my system is called a priority system and is not compatitble with the Nest. I was very sad because it would have been great to  use for my weekend house. i could have left the heat low all week and cranked it up for my arrival on Friday. OH WELL  :(
title: DID NOT WORK WITH MY SYSTEM

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Nicholas Conrad
content: Installation was a weeks long ordeal of reading help articles and multiple rounds of emails to support. Once I actually called them though, the phone support guy was super helpful and in a few minutes decided I needed a new part and had it overnighted to me. After that the unit worked as it should. Not, however, exactly as expected... It turns out it doesn't actually do much more than a $30 programmable thermostat. The 'smart' features are vastly overstated. The app is a bit clunky, and is the only way to set the schedule for the unit. I can ask Google about the temperature, and have her turn it up or down, but the problem is it thinks it knows what I want, and keeps fighting me over deviations from its schedule. The design isn't even so great, it doesn't really fit in in a non ultra-modern home. The interface is not intuitive, people are always trying to touch the screen. They eventually get the scroll, but I have to tell everyone to push on the bottom for 'select'. If I was doing it over, I would get and ecobee.
title: the phone support guy was super helpful and in a few minutes decided I needed ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ewgigem
content: Bought this thermostat 5 months ago and it started creating electrical issues with my AC unit.  I have paid numerous costs in HVAC technicians until I had to finally just take the nest off and replace it with my old school thermostat. I am not even able to return the product but I cant use it because it does not communicate well with my AC unit.  Fancy but not worth the money for having issues and support technician fees.  Wish they would allow me to return it!
title: Electrical and Communication Issues with my AC - DOESNT WORK!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tony
content: I purchased this thermostat about 6 months ago. It's great when everything works, 6 months in and I'm no longer able to connect to wifi. I followed their troubleshooting guide and no luck. Thermostat now restarts itself over and over till it asks me to plug it in and  charge it, what!!!!? I researched online about the Wi-Fi issue and it's a common problem with the internal Wi-Fi card. I contacted customer support and I'm receiving a replacement in 7days. Grade A customer support, I got instant help through chat. I'll update once the replacement gets here, 2* for now for the inconvenience.
title: ⚠️WiFi ERROR⚠️

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: silversmith
content: Nest third generation purchased from Amazon reseller. The box showed evidence of a label removed. Shrink wrap meticulously razor trimmed around removed label and damaged box area painted white. Not sure what to make of that but the product was not damaged and worked fine. Just what you would expect. Simular to an iPhone, everything just worked. The free app is simple and functional. Scheduling is fast drag and drop. Love the connection to my iPhone location. My old programmable was basically a set temperature and press hold device. Programming was too difficult to constantly change to my irregular schedule. Not sure if it will find me close to home and adjust temp automatically. We will find out. Price $218 + tax-free shipping. $100 ComEd rebate. Four stars because packing was fondled without disclosure. At the end of the day I hope to recoup $118 over the next year's heating cost. I use propane  heat and pay about $2000/ year. If it saves 6% there is my justification. I will probably never audit the savings and just assume happened.  I will settle for just coming home to a temperature adjusted house. As a traveling empty nesters we like that we have access to our home temperature from remote and that it will alert if something is wrong. My furnace went out twice last winter 2016 with my old controller (igniter then exhaust blower). I was home both times. No alerts, just a cold house. That feature alone is worth the price of admission.
title: Happy with installation experience. Hope it saves money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: C. Morris
content: Nothing but problems with this. First It burnt out my boiler, which was only 3 years old. Then the 'smart learning' feature overrides your not only your programming of it, but also your online commands when you are away from home. What does that mean. It means that when I went away to Japan for a week, the stupid Nest shut off my heat because it didn't sense me around. So when I got back my house was freezing cold. For the price.... you just get jobbed in every direction.
title: Avoid at all cost

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AeroPnk
content: This is my second Nest 3rd Generation Thermostat. I recently upgraded my home system from a single zone to a dual zone and added this second thermostat to control the upstairs zone. It seamlessly integrated with the Honeywell HZ322 zone controller. One piece of advice for those installing: once you have everything installed and running well. Reboot power to your air handler and heat pump (or AC unit). Sometimes, the thermostat would say it's cooling but the system wouldn't respond, doing this reboot once after the initial install fixes the issue for good.
title: Love my Nest Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lucy
content: I am not a super techy person, and didn’t expect to love this thermostat, but may I say:  FIVE STARS!  It was relatively easy to install and is very easy to use. I LOVE being able to adjust the heat from my phone in the middle of the night, without having to get out of bed!  I also like being able to check the temperature in my house from my phone.  My only complaint is that the wall plate is rectangular rather than round, like the unit, so it detracts from how sexy this thing looks on the wall. A non-issue if you don’t need the plate to cover old holes/etc. That doesn’t keep me from considering this a five star product!  It was worth the steep price!  ⭐️
title: Worth It!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: John
content: Helps get *some* people squared away with their heating, cooling and energy use.  For people who are *already* squared away with these - not such a big deal, in fact it can be a little annoying. For folks who just crank up the heater when they feel cold and don't really pay attention to the temperature and how their home heats/cools, this is the fix.  It will do the 'brain-work' for them.  For folks who pay attention to the finer points of the actual temperature as well as how and when to heat and cool, Nest can try to 'teach' you things you have known for a long time. The best feature for those who are already on top of their heating and cooling (and the reason I got Nests) is the ability to view and control the heating/cooling remotely through your smart phone.  Away in Hawaii in December?  Let your house turn into a near ice-box while you are away.  When you board the flight to come home, log in and turn the heaters back on.  Arrive home to a warm house - without having wasted money while you were away.
title: in fact it can be a little annoying. For folks who just crank up the heater ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: A Thomas
content: This product has been defective. Recognizing a heat pump wire which is not how it is installed and not what I have. It is now breaking my air conditioner because every time the heat comes on, it triggers the ac instead and freezes my ac unit, thus breaking that. I have contacted nest numerous times to which they tell me to contact an hvac representative. I have and they have charged me for 3 separate service calls only to tell me that the best I purchased a little over a month ago is faulty. Now my return window has closed and nest has not done anything to rectify this. I would strongly recommend getting a different system, they have had numerous issues with this system and Nest does not offer support.
title: Caution in purchasing this

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Guy Clark
content: Physical installation easy with instructions provided. Same with wiring, but not so much with programming. Yes the basic program setup is a piece of cake, it’s when you get to temperature settings and echo that there is no clear logic to your decisions. I set it manually only to discover latter it has reset the temperature to some other number that’s a problem. 60 degrees in the winter, who does that. There is no literature or you tube to explain in detail this anomaly.
title: Difficult to understand settings

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SIMPLEMANDAN
content: This little piece of technology is nothing but awesome. From start to finish it has exceeded my expectations. I was actually dreading installing this thermostat because when it comes to your heat and air, that's something you don't want to do without for any length of time. I unboxed the nest and the directions were very simple and thorough to the wiring to the settings. I have had it installed for about two weeks now and I feel its the best purchase I have made in a long time. The first week it learns your routine and after that its pretty much auto pilot from there. I downloaded the app for my android phone and I can check it or change any setting, any time. There is not a doubt in my mind it is paying for itself as I'm writing this review. If your shopping for a new thermostat don't look any further, this is the one for you!!
title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Win
content: Install was very easy. Initial app setup/connection went smooth. This was the story for about 2-3 months then everything changed. I noticed that the thermostat was offline and attempted many reconnects but found myself frustrated after a day of trying. Waited another day to call tech support, had i known about the minuscule amount of help that they would offer i would've just attempted to return my thermostat. In the end and about a week of not being connected i randomly attempted at trying to reconnect and it worked. As i researched potential issues i've found nothing but issues and complaints by other customers. My immediate family members who own a nest product have not complained at all so i guess i am the odd ball.
title: when it works it works smoothly but a lot of connection issues

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: bagman
content: I am NOT a techy, but I was able to connect and program this device within about 30 minutes. It told me that my air filter needed cleaning, and I like the fact that it senses motion and illuminates to show the current room temperature. It is very nice to be able to adjust the room temperature without leaving your bed!!! If it wasn't so expensive, I'd buy another one to replace the other unit even though it is working properly.. I'll wait until I need it, and will definitely get a second Nest.. I was considering Nest's video camera, but, alas, it is 3-4 times more expensive than a highly rated competitor.. I'll let you know how that works out...  "Security IP Camera, Elebor".
title: and I like the fact that it senses motion and illuminates to ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jennifer L Delesie
