content: Do NOT buy this product from Amazon. I purchased a defective Nest.  I tried installing it and it didn’t work  Called Nest for support. They said I had to charge it with an android charger. I didn’t have one an android charger and it wasn’t supplied. I bought one bought one the next weekend and charged the Nest.  It still didn’t work.  I was going out of town for two weeks and thought I would figure it out when I got back.  Got back and tried again. Called support.  They suggested it needed to charge longer. Tried that.  Still didn’t work.  Called amazon to return it and they said I have to deal with Nest through their warranty because i was three days past 30! Days.  Home Depot would happily exchanged this if I had bought from them. So frustrated and I still don’t have a working thermostat.  I can only imagine how long it will take Nest to replace this.  I wish I hadn’t bought from amazon.  So disappointing.
title: Don’t buy this from Amazon

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: P Richmond
content: This was set to stay at 66 all night and get warmer at 7AM. It was 60 degrees in the house when I got up at 5. The kids are freezing, I’m freezing and no matter what I set it to, it will not leave the furnace on long enough to get even close to what it’s set to. We’ve turned off the eco controls. Disabled the away settings and nothing allows the house to get to a slightly warm temperature. We don’t have AC, so it never really ran all summer and now I can’t return this useless thermostat. We’ve been fighting this for a month.
title: Does not heat to set temperatures or keep furnace on.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: James Michael Hitchcock
content: Unfortunately, the Thermostat failed to regulate the temperature. The Nest Installation was quick and easy - after maybe 30 minutes, I had the device installed, tested, and connected to my Nest account. Everything worked well until the second night with the device when I woke up to a temperature of 82 degrees (with a setpoint of 74). After a repeat of this the next evening after work (where the temperature in the house quickly raced past the 72-degree set point), I tried to call customer support. 90 minutes on hold with customer support convinced me to reinstall my previous thermostat and return the Nest device. Here is a link to an article which convinced me to return the device [...] I have little patience for known issues that are not at minimum documented on a produces support site. The nest thermostat is attractive and easy to setup. The location aware and amazon echo integration worked great. However; it failed at the most basic task for a thermostat - controlling the temperature.
title: Nice technology, but fails at being a thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alex
content: The Nest is supposed to function without a common wire. Let me tell you now, this is 100% false. I hooked the thermo up and it came on. Easy to set up, easy to program. But it pulses your fan to keep charged without a common wire. And that's all it did. My AC would not run. It was blowing hot air. Within hours my home was up to 89 degrees. I contacted tech support who was of no help at all because they think the nest works without a common wire. Fortunately I was able to dig the wire bundle out of the wall and connect the C-Wire to the thermostat and then connect it at my heat pump. Then it ran perfectly and does an excellent job of painting temperature in my home. I just feel that the pulse charge is false advertising and the tech support entirely denies the fact that this was the issue. The Nest itself is an excellent product. The low stars comes from the terrible support and mislead capabilities.
title: Great! If you troubleshoot hooking it up for 3 days.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chad P.
content: This is my 2nd Nest thermostat, and I've installed both of them myself.  In both cases, there was no existing connection between the old thermostat and the "common" power source on the furnace (the old thermostats were battery powered).  And in both cases, I lucked out because the original installation of the furnace had a wire run with several spare leads on it.  So I was able to use one of the spare leads to carry constant voltage from the furnace's common connector to the Nest.  Other than that, it's just a matter of attaching the base plate to the wall, connecting the correct wires to the tool-less slots on the base plate, and snapping on the face plate.  If an amateur like me can install these things, just about anybody can.  As long as you have a way to supply a constant voltage, then you're golden!
title: User-friendly, easy installation, smooth operation

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brett
content: I've had this unit for several years. Overall happy with it, but recently the WIFI stopped working. After some troubleshooting, I learned that the battery voltage is "too low". What the? If the thing is hard wired into the wall and receiving a constant 24 volt power source, why on earth would it start disabling functionality because of battery voltage? OK So I can just pop in a new battery right? Well yes and no. I have found shady suppliers that will sell a battery on Amazon or Ebay. It requires you to disassemble the unit, replace the battery, and then reassemble it. It may not be a simple process for some users and it definitely will void your warranty. Dead battery should not disable functionality. They should have used a standardized battery like triple AAA rechargable, and they should have put a simple door on the back to make it easy to replace the batteries. This will likely end up in some people throwing away their thermostats to the landfill and replacing them. I would have expected better from a company producing a "green" product designed to help the environment.
title: Overall happy with it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: louisut
content: While the Nest's core function (regulating temperature) isn't really all that different than a conventional programmable thermostat, it has two main strengths: ease-of-use and connectivity. Prior to Nest, programming a thermostat required wading through menus. With the Nest, you simply adjust the temperature manually a couple times, and it learns on its own. Its sensors help learn your schedule faster. Most thermostats only have four time slots; there are no limits with Nest. Lastly, if you want to enter a manual program, it's easy to do so online or using their app. This brings us to another strength--connectivity. If you connect the thermostat to Wi-Fi, you can do everything remotely. Forget to turn off your AC while on vacation? No problem, log in and turn it off. Want the house cool by the time you get home? Open the app and do it. Don't want to leave your warm bed to turn up the heat? No problem--do it from your phone. The one feature I feel is missing is geo-fencing. With this feature, your thermostat looks at whether your mobile device is nearby. If it isn't, your thermostat switches off/away, regardless of the programmed schedule. This can further improve your energy savings. Fortunately, there are third-party apps such as "Coming Home" for Android which take care of this function. It also supports IFTTT, which allows additional event-based programming. Overall, great improvements on a traditionally boring device. Also, check with your power company to see if they offer any incentives. Initially I had reservations about the price, but the subsidy made the decisions easier.
title: easy to program, good features, 3rd-party apps fill in the gaps

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ray Harris
content: Like most Nest products, this one is high quality. It works as advertised, but the thing I really like is that it REALLY works well with WIFI (unlike a lot of other products). It is a good feeling knowing that if I go on vacation and forget to set the temperature correctly, I can change it literally from anywhere in the world that has Internet. My wife and I are retired, so we do not worry too much about the set-back temperature for when you are absent. That just does not apply in our situation so we really have not experienced the savings that would result from that feature. I'll bet it works just like it should though! It lights up, telling us what the current temperature is, every time we walk by it. Self-installation was easy and anything that is not readily apparent can be found by watching the numerous videos available. The WIFI connection was very straight-forward.
title: Works Well with WIFI

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sparkee
content: We have both the Nest thermostats and Nest security cameras. The Nest thermostat is easy to program and works well to control heat/cool our home. My reason for the low rating is that the Nest system goes offline way too often. One of the best features of this system is that I can use my phone to change the temperature or check security footage. What good is it if it is offline every time I want to do that??? On the plus side, the Nest works very well with Alexa...when it’s not offline. It is offline so often that I have quit using the phone app.  These products are very expensive but unfortunately do not work as advertised. Save your money and get a different system. In the photo you can see both a thermostat and a security camera offline.
title: DOES NOT LIVE UP TO EXPECTATIONS!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tom
content: Had this thermostat installed and operating for about one year now.  It has been nothing but trouble since installed.  Latest is the thermostat now heats when it is set to cool.  Nothing has changed from when it was installed last year and  cooled the house except the mode setting from heat to cool. Set it to cool when the house was at 74 degrees for the first time this year.  After about an hour the house temperature rose to 78 degrees and climbing.  Tried setting heat pump balance off, clearing the schedule setting temp values, and finally disconnecting the aux and emergency electric heat wires but it still heated the house when set to cool through the heat pump.  Finally just took it out and put the old mercury switch thermostat back.  AC now works fine.  I believe the nest is stuck in heat mode when set to cool now.  Would not recommend this thermostat.  Since it was installed last year my electric bills have increased by 25%.  Very dangerous also if you have pets and it decides to heat the house continously when the mode is set to cool on a hot day.  Wish I didn't waste my time or money on this product. What a piece of junk!
title: MIND OF IT'S OWN!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: R. Collins
content: The only reason I purchased this was because my apartment's thermostat location is behind my TV.  The heat from my TV was causing the thermostat to read up to 5 degrees higher than the rest of the room.  I replaced the original thermostat with the Nest, and then purchased Nest's remote sensor and placed it on the other side of the room.  In 1 month I cut my electric bill in half because my air conditioner wasn't running as much.  Plus the other features of this thermostat are great.  I never thought I'd pay $200+ for a dang thermostat but the savings will help pay for itself, plus AEP is giving $100 rebates for electric furnaces.
title: Plus the other features of this thermostat are great. I never thought I'd pay $200+ for a ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Reasonable Person
content: Let me begin by saying that I am tech savvy and have 3 nest thermostats. I cannot maintain any desired temperature in the house. The device overrides my choices and while I am away, it wastes crazy amounts of energy.  The exact oppposite of its purported design. 3 trusted contractors have told me to remove them as they refuse to use them. I will not promote another device other than to say, the nest thermostat is a major disappointment and a complete waste of money.
title: Do not purchase; poor performance.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Reedster
content: Initially installing this device was a pain. I failed at it twice, and then it somehow started working on the third try. The first two times the device caused my HVAC to blow heat nonstop. But after the third time it mostly works as expected. I can control it from my Google Assistant and Google Home app. Not sure if it's a setting, but sometimes I'll set the AC to a certain temperature and then come back an hour later and it's set itself to an even lower temperature. Fun device if you want your home to be "Smart" but just know there's still room for improvement with this device.
title: Once installed, it's nice

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kelsey Dimock
content: I loved this thing at first. Now 6 months into using it winter is here and I have no heat. Low battery and ive done the remove charge with usb and reinstall the thermostat. Yes it works for 1hr or so. 1 week of this now the unit is so hot im scared to charge it again. If I remove from USB charger I have to set temp to 88 to heat the house thats 60 degrees. Trying to warranty this has big a massive headache and all im trying to do is heat my house. Nest actually suggested installing old thermostat to see if the problem goes away.  I did not keep my old thermostat.  I also know my heating system is working as it should as this will work after charging with USB. SO NOT BUY THIS UNIT. HORRIBLE COSTUMER SERVICE. IT SEEMS PRETTY STRAIGHT FORWARD.  THE NEST UNITS HAVE BAD BATTERIES THAT WONT STAY CHARGED. THESE ARE NOT REPLACEABLE BATTERIES FYI. THE UNIT IS ALSO NOT DESIGNED TO HAVE TO REMOVE TO CHARGE IT. ITS DESIGNED TO CHARHE ITS INTERNAL BATTERY OFF THE VOLTAGE FROM YOUR FURNACE.
title: DO NOT BUY THIS. THEY ALL HAVE BATTERY ISSUES

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: monika bieniewski
content: product worked fine for 1 year  one star review for customer service 6 month old furnace "trane  " started acting up  at 2 am  it would start then shut down after 15 sec..  called my HVAC  installer at 3am  to figure out what is wrong with it  he came over determined that it was the nest  that is malfunctioning  installed a temp thermostat .  told me to reach out to nest for a replacement,  I have been on chat  and on the phone with Nest for the last 5 days  and they are refusing to  cover the Repair man bill  " as they did n not send him  "  they told me  that it would be 5-7 businesses days before they can  send me  a new thermostat.  they don't care about their customers , though we like the products will never buy another product  from NEST do to customer service
title: customer support is horrible

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Clark G
content: I installed this myself in about 30 minutes. It works well and I love that you can ask Alexa to adjust the heat. However, Alexa will not turn on or off the heater or air conditioner. It will only adjust the thermostat. I only have one thermostat in my house and it is downstairs, so I felt I needed this. I do wish it was less expensive.
title: Works well

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gregory Johnston
content: Purchased two units as we have two AC units (up & down stairs). I had enough of crazy high electricity bills this summer with. 3600sqft home. Took less than 30 mins to install two units (clocks were off by ~30mins). I was being careful, and realistically it takes about 5 mins to remove the old unit and install the new one. Setup took another 2 mins. If you use a smart phone, there really isn’t any excuse to not be able to set these up right the first time.
title: Easy setup

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: North Star
content: WILL NOT ALLOW A SPECIFIC TEMPERATURE TO BE SET TO "HOLD" PERMANENTLY...  Absolutely Mind-boggling... Want to go on a trip and simply set to "hold"?  There are ways to manipulate the device to get want you want but it's a huge pain when it use to be so simple with programmable thermostats back in the 1990's
title: NEST WILL NOT ALLOW A SPECIFIC TEMPERATURE TO BE SIMPLY SET TO "HOLD" PERMANENTLY

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SAMUEL YAPELL
content: Was working good for 5 months [february to june]  after that, ac started to take forever to cool down the house, sometimes it turned off the unit and all of the sudden sent the signal to start again making the compressor to do a super loud noise. I contacted customer support via chat and after 1 1/2 hours i got the to send me a replacement.  I have my doubts about those nests products, y son also have a nest thermostat and had to replace it aftes a few months.  I also have a nest smoke alarm i had to replace after 2 months because it was not working ok.
title: i have my doubts about the nest products.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Satheesh Padmanabhan
content: I highly recommend this product , Very high quality , Very easy to install , and super design , Wifi APP is easy to set up , and The customer service is awwwsome . I had a Honeywell T5 Thermostat , I replaced for Nest third generation , the honey well customer service sucks . I had to wait one hour and forty minutes for the honey well customer care support but for NEST I had to wait only fifteen minutes . The Honeywell tech was ignorant and she told me their device will not work with Apple phone ( But I found out it was not correct , she was a fool ) but Nest tech was amazing he was very patient and helped me until everything is set up correctly . Highly recommended .
title: Excellent Product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M. Cotter-Brown
content: I loved this thing so much when I first got it. It is beautiful and worked great for several months. Then the wireless connection inexplicably crapped out and I couldn't get it to reconnect no matter what I tried. I used it as a standard thermostat for another year or so, still pleased with the way it looks, how it lights up when approached, and how easy it is to read. Fast forward to hot, humid midwestern summer time and NOW it has stopped charging, which means that the AC will not turn on unless I plug this thing into a wall charger several times a day. Not at all happy and can't figure out how to fix it.
title: very frustrated with this device

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tammy L
content: Excellent product. Was very easy to install. Did it myself. Don't buy into the complaints on the app either. Those people clearly don't get how it works. I have had this since the beginning of summer and now into winter. It does exactly what I tell it to for both heating and cooling. Here what people don't get and therefore complain about: If your house is hot- say 85 degrees- and then you set it to turn on and cool to 78 degrees, it will tell you how long that will take to achieve. So it says "78 degrees in three hours" ding dongs think this means it won't start cooling the house for another three hours. No, it starts cooling right when you tell it to. Your house will not be instantly 78 degrees from 85 the moment you turn it on. That's why it says "in x amount of time" Got it??
title: Excellent product. Was very easy to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: K. Robben
content: My brother-in-law bought one months before we did and we knew he was saving money and loving the away controls w/ Nest. We have had our Nest just a couple of weeks now but I already feel so much more comfortable. We’re in an area where temps can swing wildly. I love keeping Nest on Heat/Cool combo mode and giving it temp ranges. The auto-learning scheduling has been cool, too!! It’s doing great learning when I’m home alone working I like to be cool, but in the evening hubs and kids like it a couple of degrees warmer. While we’re sleeping under heavy covers we can afford it to get a little cooler again in the winter. Very easy to install. Great instructions as well as easy precheck for compatibility before opening up everything. I had it on the wall before husband was home. Love it!!!
title: Cozy, Efficient Home with Nest

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Arthur S
content: Great product - I have two of them - just added the second one. Only minor complaint is that the instructions mention the 'Optional Wall Plate" this implies that you would need the wall plate to cover up the old rectangle thermostat. In fact the 'Optional Wall Plate' is INCLUDED so should read the "Optional Wall Plate (included)". I know its minor BUT when you make the connections and discover in the bottom of the box under the thermostat card holder there is the Optional Wall Plate was a little annoying.
title: Optional Wall Plate IS included

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Linda Burton
content: The nest is installed, but the directions and tech support are not the best.  Remember to download the Nest App first before you begin the installation. You are not instructed to do this in the instructions. It is working great, but if you have a heat pump the installation is a bit more tedious. Once it is installed and up and running go it is great.
title: Next Heat Pump

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RW
content: Worked for about 2 weeks, then started telling me it had to power down to recharge, all the while the fan is blowing (cycling on/off) with no heat. Got down to 48° in the house while we were gone over the weekend. Started troubleshooting using recommended methods on their website, nothing fixed the issue. Read an article about a software update causing issues that resemble mine, not sure if it’s that what the culprit is but I got sick of what I was reading and what it recommended (charging via usb cable for an hour) so I jumpered red and white to get our house up to temp and then wired in the previously installed programmable non “smart” thermostat, which works reliably!
title: Worked for a couple weeks. Did software update kill it?

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Trina D.
content: While I was hesitant to buy one because of the price, I was lured by the rebate incentives that SoCal Edison and SoCal Gas. I qualify for $125 in rebates just for buying and installing a smart thermostat! I even found one that was “Like New” for less than retail. Done deal. Turns out it must have been a restock because all of the original packaging was intact, even the plastic tabs on the box and the Nest unit itself. Score! It was an easy enough install. I watched the video beforehand and then I went to task on my old thermostat. I followed the instructions which were fairly easy. My only issue seemed to be that the preexisting wiring was where I was drilling the holes for the Nest. The previous thermostat’s screws were aligned horizontally while the Nest has them aligned vertically. I hope I didn’t fray anything back there. I used the back plate because I wasn’t sure I had the right paint color to touch up the white wall were my Nest is now installed. It doesn’t really bother me but if it comes to it, I’ll go hunt for the paint. So far it works great. The app is really easy to use. I can turn it on when I’m not home, which is a great feature. My dog is really grateful for that. It tells me how much usage I’ve accrued and I can schedule when to run my cooling or heating. It also has an ECO function which is a range of where I’d like my home temperature to be. I like that it tells me what temperature it is when I approach and what temperature it is outside. I’m not sure why I didn’t get one sooner but I’m glad that I did.
title: I can't believe I waited so long before I bought one.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: C. McDonald
content: Very easy to install.  I had a 2nd generation Nest at my old house and bought this one for the new home.  I ended up using the included wall plate because there was a large hole in the wall from the old thermostat.  Eventually I'd like to patch it up because the Nest looks cleaner by itself. My 2nd generation had a little more resistance to turn the dial - this one turns smoother which I like. I wired in single stage heat, single cooling, and a common wire to avoid any battery charging issues.  I'll add a whole home humidifier to the * input this winter which I had at my previous house.  Nest controls the humidity flawlessly.  One thing I would like to see is some type of frost control algorithm - at my old house, when the temp was -20 F in the winter, I'd start to see frost on the windows.  Would be nice if the Nest could use the outside temperature to dynamically control the humidity.  Or just allow programming the humidistat based on outdoor temp. I turned off the learning schedule feature - my schedule was too erratic for this to be useful, so I just program a 5+2 schedule.  Big benefits I see with the Nest is Auto Away and the ability to remotely control the temperature/humidity.  Being able to see the usage history is nice as well. Great product.
title: Very easy to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: jcoman
content: Alongside a brand new "top of the line" TRANE HVAC system, we purchased a Nest Thermostat. We had the installer put it in along with the new system. We were warned by the installer at that time that they had a low success rate with NEST. It passed the initial test. The system was installed during the summer so is was installed for a couple months before it ever needed to flip over to heat. That's when the problems started. We started getting E106 errors, indicating a problem with the wiring, but the wiring was correct. Make a long story short. The NEST monitors the Aux Heat wire for small changes in voltage - its part of its protection circuit. Most other thermostats use a standard switch/contact closure. Any over current on the wire is typically managed by a fuse on the wire that will blow if there is a short. I'm not sure what system do work correct with the NEST. The app is great. I like the learning feature. I am very disappointed that I had to return it.
title: Check for Compatibility - Even that may not be enough.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: margaret o.
content: For a time I lived in California and had a home on the east coast and had nests in both locations. I had the Cali nest first and all was well. Then I added the GA nests and realised they are all displaying California time/weather/location. I  would think it would at least know which time zone it is in. I think they are just following my phone and wherever it is. I have to manually program location to get accurate time and weather. Not so sure about the temperature control. I seem to have to adjust it an awful lot. I don’t think it’s any better or worse than any other thermostat. I admit I bought it for looks.
title: Not so smart

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Eve
content: I called Nest customer support before I purchased and verified that the existing wiring would allow us to install the Nest thermostat.  The thermostat went on sale and that combined with a rebate from our electrician provider prompted our actual purchase.  We did our own installation and called customer support for assistance.  Customer support was excellent, able to send us a custom set up diagram based on the color of the wires that we had. I set up a nest account and, after registering the unit with our account, programmed the thermostat operation online. We also installed the nest app on our android smartphones, associating one smartphone's location so that it could automatically revert to its away temp (preset through prigramming) when that phone leaves. If it sees activity (me walking past it) it will automatically reset back to the preprogrammed temp for that time of day wuth someone at home. Our pets do not trigger the thermostat. We can not only change the temperature using our smatphonesecure, but can also use our Amazon Echo. The display is easy to read and the unit has a simple, clean design. It comes with a back plate that was just large enough to cover the hole left by our older, larger Honeywell thermostat.
title: Attractive, east to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ginger Thiesen
content: This was so easy to install! I was up and running in about 5 minutes.  My only gripe is the scheduler on the app. The days of the week are down the left and the hours of the day are across the bottom.  If you want to schedule a time/temp, you just go to the day, then click on the time you want, then adjust to the temp you want it to be.  Seems easy enough, however, you have to add every single time you want to change the temp, and the hours are in 2 hour increments, so if you want to have the temp go down at 10:30, it's almost impossible to get the right time.  I usually settle for something close.  I've only had it for a little over a week, so I really can't tell yet if I've saved anything on utilities, but by looking at my usage (usually less than 2 hours each day and I live in Wisconsin), I think I may be pleasantly surprised.
title: This was so easy to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Larry Wixom
content: For the most part I like the unit for what it can do.  Our issue is after 7 months it won’t connect to the internet anymore.  I have been messaging Google back and forth to try to figure out what it wrong but after 2 weeks of messaging them they have not come up with a fix.  I feel it needs to be replaced. We have tried to reset it several times doing it different ways without luck.
title: Great when it works

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chuck
content: No problems for me, but builders and furnace repairmen hate it.  My builder refused to install it so I had to pull out a brand new thermostat and install this myself (easy to do).  I've had two furnace problems and the first thing the installer does is blame the thermostat.  Both times it turned out NOT to be the Nest Thermostat.  The professional folks report that they have nothing but trouble with Nest, but it has always worked great for me.  So, be prepared for a fight whenever you report an HVAC problem.  The only other annoyance is that I cannot set the time limit for motion sensing before it goes to ECO mode.  If I'm in my office for long enough and don't walk down the hallway by the thermostat, it assumes that I've left the house and it shuts down the heat.  I can't find anyway to require more time before it does that.  One can control the ECO temp settings (just a little cooler or warmer) and, of course, you can turn off ECO mode; but then you miss the advantage of having the unit reduce heating and cooling bills when you are away.
title: Works great with a couple of odd annoyances.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bryan Stevenson
content: First I would like to say that if you are at all considering buying a Nest thermostat and are having any doubts, be it price, ease of use, installation, etc, go ahead and do it and be sure to check with your local energy providers for any special offers or rebates.  I state such because my only regret is not getting one a lot sooner.  Plus you'll want to make sure you existing system is compatible with the thermostat which they provide a guide on their website for checking this as well. Installing the Nest thermostat was very easy with the instructions(Including a recommended instructional video) that step you through the process of installation and it takes about 20 minutes to complete the installation and setup and you're up and running. Operation is straightforward with the added convenience or being able to control the thermostat via an app on your phone or tablet or even through voice commands though the in home assistants be it google home or amazon's own alexa.  The information available make it clear and concise and overall the way the thermostat operates is more sensible than simply running on timers like older thermostats might do.  This results in a more consistent temperature in the home and energy savings from the heating/cooling units or the fans not running unnecessarily even when I do set the thermostat for what I would expect to be an uncomfortable temperature with an older thermostat it is actually consistent and pleasant.  This takes some getting used to but once you get things setup how you like it's wonderful The application and the thermostat show a decent amount of useful information and the far-sight feature is nice as it  can quickly show you the state of the thermostat  as you approach it and other useful information at a glance. and although the controls on the thermostat itself are a little kludgy they are still easy to use and well thought out. Subjectively I think that the unit is also aesthetically pleasing even though I had to use the provided back-plate for installation but I understand that others could/would find contention with such and it would be nice if there were options for those individuals as well to better fit their decor In summary the nest thermostat is a great product that is easy to use from installation to integrating into your every day life.  It's best trick is that it  can make you forget its there because it  learns from what you teach it and adjusts accordingly.
title: Great product that speaks for itself

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lauren G
content: I love the flexibility of this, being able to change the temp from my phone or via Google Home or Alexa. I also like that it learns when to set the temperature. What I wish it could do though is totally silly... but I want to be able to change the background! Seriously, why can't I seem to do that? I hate the boring solid blue background.
title: Feel like it could have a little more functionality

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Matthew
content: Install was a breeze. Followed the online video and installed in about 25 min. The device worked great at first. After about 8 hrs it started saying offline, no power to the Rh wire. Switched to Rc wire, nothing. Pulled C wire, nothing. Called support. Went over every single option. Nothing we did would remove the E73/E74 error. I ended up taking it off and re-installing the old thermostat. HVAC system works fine again. I even took the unit off and charged up via micro-usb port. Again, nothing. Going to return the Nest thermostat to Amazon. Not buying again. We’ll try the HoneyWell or Ecobee next...
title: Worked great for about 8 hrs..

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Will
content: I've had this for less than a year and it has failed. It no longer connects to the wifi system, even after completing all the troubleshooting with the company. The tech finally, after 45 minutes, reach out to a supervisor who advised a replacement was required. Two weeks later, still nothing. I contacted google again and it took them 45 minutes to process a replacement even after I supplied all the info and complaint number from the previous call. It's overall disappointing. It also loses connection to Alexa frequently.
title: Great Concept, Bad Device/Support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SandyD
content: I purchased this for my daughter for Christmas.  She was beyond excited when she opened it. She has a baby and in the middle of the night she would walk downstairs to the dining room to adjust the temperature during cold nights. She went on u-tube and watched how to install it. She installed it herself in less than 10 minutes. Now she can adjust the temp from her cell phone at night.  It is also connected to Alexa so she can use voice command also.  Best product ever!!!
title: Best thermostat ever

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ruthie
content: I have been locked out of the Nest app many times and unless you buy a subscription to Google help you cannot get help at all.  I have tried to reset and since I bought this thermostat it seems as if everyday, I have to reset my password and they do not offer help to those who don't subscribe.  You just have to search for help.UNBELIEVEABLE!
title: DO NOT BUY if you have an Apple phone or other IOS products

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Steve Wigginton
content: Installation instructions are easy to follow. Everything worked great on the first try. Flexible configuration works well. We are on a time-of-use plan, so pay more during certain hours of electricity use. I configured the Nest schedule to pre-cool the house before the expensive time period. Even on 100+ days the A/C is not running during peak times, but the house is still reasonably cool. As a bonus, got a $50 rebate from our local electric utility. Very happy with this purchase.
title: Easy to install. Great festures

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: George P. Burdell
content: Currently living in a HOT and HUMID place. I purchased two of these and they are great when you do not work from home and it remains empty while you are away, or don’t care about humidity building up in your house. This thing is beyond TERRIBLE and you would think for this price point that you would be able to have manual control without setting a schedule, without sharing your whereabout with google, and be able to stop it from TURNING OFF!!. The two main issues is with the AWAY mode and the ECO temperatures. If you don’t want to share your phone location with nest (google) or a family member is home without the nest app then it has to rely on its motion sensors to determine if you are home. We placed the motion sensors in the hallways where are bedrooms are, so we don’t trigger the motion sensors while in our home office which puts the thermostat in AWAY mode. There is NO WAY to disable it from going into AWAY mode! Once in AWAY mode, you can have it use ECO temperatures, but guess what?! I can’t set my temperature to be anything below 76 when I am in “AWAY” mode. This product is a complete joke, I loved it until COVID happened and have to work from home. Google/NEST, please allow complete manual control by allowing us to disable AWAY mode and allow us to set the ECO temperatures when we are AWAY to cool at any temperature we want instead of your arbitrary lower limit of 76F.
title: Do not buy if you work from home!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shang
content: The compatibility guide in nest online manual is misleading - i live in a single family house(2013 new construction), which doesn't have RC wire and previously short circuited RH and RC wire for power. Nest told everyone that it doesn't need the short circuit and only need to connect one wire(Rh or RC). I followed exactly however that damaged my furnace after a few days. Nest is design to steal power from the Rh wire, which in some systems would cause the furnace to turn on and off repeatedly. Spent hundreds to fix the furnace problem and returned the unit. Not like other amazon returns for defective items, Nest won't issue you refund until received the item for inspection. Not a big deal normally, but in my case added my negative feelings about this product and its customer services
title: May harm your heating system with recommended wire connection

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: T. Boyle
content: Was a breeze to install and setup and the instructions are easy to follow for anyone that is practical. A lot simpler to use setup and program than the traditional thermostat and provides a very clear indication.  The motion detector is a nice touch so the screen will wake up if you are close.  The phone app is easy to use and gives great flexibility especially when away.  Have not connected with Alexa yet. Also looks great as well! Finally check with your power co - I got a rebate for purchasing this which was an added bonus
title: Very easy to install and simple to use

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mike Gerend
content: I purchased a Nest thermostat for my cabin that has an infloor heating system.  After a few attempts to install it on my own, I asked an HVAC tech to come to look at it.  He spent a few hours looking at it and in the phone with Nest.  The Nest rep said that the battery was likely not getting enough electricity or was faulty and agreed to replace the unit.  I had the same experience with the second one and gave up.  I have spent hours on the phone getting the run around from the Nest call center.  They ask me the same questions, transfer me to other people, put me on hold for long periods, etc.  It seemed pretty clear to me that they did not want me to return the unit for a refund.  I had my last call with them last night and they accused me of using the unit and trying to return it, said that I had it for too long, but would not say what the return window was that had lapsed, and then hung up on me.  Other than DirectTV, this is the worst service organization of have ever encountered.  If you are buying this unit, you better hope it works.
title: Horrible Experience

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: G. Craig
content: Nest again produced a fantastic product I can get completely behind. I rented a house a while ago and it came with a Nest thermostat, I believe it was a Nest 2. I never really thought I would enjoy such a simple product that was such a small addition to the house. However it was great to see your usage, how long your ac/heat ran yesterday, and settings to set it at to 'save' some money. I don't live in a super efficient home currently, but it's great to be able to control the temp via the wifi app and see my usage there. I travel super often for work, and having the convenience to set the thermostat (if I forget to turn it off) is great. It's truly one less thing to worry about and if it saves me a few bucks each month, I'll be able to pay for the device in savings after a year or two. The device itself is super solid feeling, very heavy and the stainless steel turning knob feels very good and 'expensive' if you can say so. It looks great on the wall, and many people have already commented on the device and want one for themselves. I have electric heat/air, so the wiring was super simple to install and use. I've heard other things about people who have mixed systems or older systems running into issues, but if you live in a regular apartment or home, you shouldn't have too much of an issue.
title: Great solid product, bringing one more device in your home to the 21st century

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Whitewater
content: Really easy installation - and I'm no electrician. Easy setup. Works well with Alexa. Though I wish I could ask Alexa what temperature the Nest is set at, and what temperature the room currently is - there doesn't appear to be any information that comes back to Alexa - Alexa only sends orders. Also, I've read that you should be able to say, "Alexa, I'm cold," or "Alexa, turn up the heat," and the Nest would get set up two degrees. That has never worked for me. Instead I can only tell Alexa to set the thermostat to a specific temperature ("Alexa, set the heat to 72.") Finally, we have a wood burning boiler, but Nest has no option to identify wood as your fuel source. I asked customer service for advice, and they suggested setting it to oil. It doesn't seem to make a difference, ours works great, but it is the one confusing aspect of setup that we encountered.
title: Wood Burner

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: NovaLamp
content: This was very easy to setup.  Instructions were quite clear.  And Amazon had a very good price at the time. But, as I don't have c-wire, after approximately 10 months or so, I started to get a low power message. I call Nest, and they send me a new thermostat. They don't mention "why".  My new one had the same message after a year or so. The non replaceable lithium battery "seems" to not charge as well using the "R" wire after "a while".  So I replaced this nonsense with a  a $40 dollar Orbit thermostat as I don't need wifi etc.  And Nest must connect to wifi.  lol.  I am giving this away.  :) .  And the $40 dollar Orbit thermostat works fine.  All in all, this is just real interesting.
title: Not great without C-wire

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: John K
content: Tried using app to wire new nest. It said to call nest. Dis it and they had me send them a picture of the old wiring.  They next sent me into the basement to get the model number of the air handler, then out side to get the numbers of the heat pump. They then sent me a wireing diagram.  It did not work. I got fan but no ac. I called again. I was runnibg up and down stairs. Turning off and on the heat pump. Changing wires on the nest. They finality called in the big gun.  Two wire changes more and several more times up and down the stairs, the ac finally worked. Thru out this all, The people at nest where very helpful.  It seemed like hours and I only had a few precent of charge left on my phone, but we got it working. Now we can turn the ac on and off and set/change the temp with alexa. Its too hot to check if the heating works. That will have to wait until this fall.  After the pain of installation, the nest works very well. I love it.
title: Great product. Took time to install correctly

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Joe
content: Before Google purchased Nest I loved the product and company. Fast forward to today and Google has really dropped the ball with Nest and after searching online for recent reviews on various websites it seems like my problem is becoming more common. Keep in mind the Nest has at minimum a one year warranty (sometimes longer). So, this particular Nest worked great for 5 months until one random day it stopped connecting to Wifi. I ran through troubleshooting with Google and no luck (which they are only doing online and not over the phone anymore). The chat though isn't an instant response and sometimes it can a day for them to send a message back.  Fast forward about 3 weeks from when the Wifi stopped connecting... now the device won't hold a charge. I start charging it with a usb cord, but each day the charge lasts less and less until now it won't hold a charge at all (this means no A/C or heater now). I contacted Google again and it has been multiple days of back and forth to the where the last message sent over a day ago was "We'll keep you posted." It seems, after reading others' stories online, all of the above-listed problems are a common theme. It seems as if Google has a problem with their product and does not want to honor their warranty, but instead kicks the can down the road hoping you'll give up.
title: Stopped Working After 5 Months - Getting Run Around From Google

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Matthew Kilburn
content: Not so easy to install. But once installed it works great. The Wi-Fi and Alexa integration works good, but can drain the battery. It could be turned off if not needed.
title: Excellent

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Loyal Customer
content: The Nest Thermostat is a nice looking piece of hardware with a vivid display screen, however this is all worthless if it can't reliably turn on the heat when needed. This is my first winter with Nest and I came home to find that the thermostat had shut itself off. After reviewing the history logs, I discovered that the previous day showed an entry stating "Thermostat switched off by Auto-Schedule." (see screenshot.) According to Nest, this situation should be impossible, as Auto-Schedule isn't able to turn off the Thermostat. Furthermore, the Auto-Schedule function had already been disabled long ago, as I prefer to have heat on a simple and predictable schedule. Nest customer support acknowledged that this is a software defect, however they had no insights into the conditions that caused this defect to occur and expressed no concern with the damage that would be caused by turning off the heat during a week with temperatures in the single digits Fahrenheit. Nest's proposed solution was to offer to ship a new Thermostat, which would be running the same software containing the Auto-Schedule defect. A search on the net shows that Nest was aware of other reports of this issue nearly a year ago, yet it appears they have never addressed it. Nest declined to issue a refund, so I am instead left to either roll the dice and hope my house isn't damaged by lack of heat, or throw them out and pay for a reliable replacement. I also have the Nest Smoke Detectors and I now wonder about the reliability of the software on those, as the consequences are even higher...
title: Software Defect Turned off Thermostat Unexpecidly, beware of Reliability

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MK Sharma
content: This learning thermostat not worked good. I set scheduled in the device but in evening/night when no body walk around the device artificial intelligence understand no body at home and set the Safe temperature like 65°. I call on the helpline number for tech support and the agent ask me he send someone at home to chack the instrument and when I ask it's free or paid and it's surprised for me it's paid visit. I email for tech support and at final reset all setting I turn off schedule setting and use like normal thermostat because the return window is closed.
title: Learning is not good.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Joseph A Little
content: It is SO nice to be able to turn my AC on an hour before I get home on a hot day.  Brilliant idea. Also I ha an issue with the wiring. (the people that built my house originally did something unusual) I made one phone call and she was able to talk me through a problem that I couldn't figure out in a matter of minutes. Great product, even better Customer Service.
title: Good product Great Customer Service

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Amanda Hagan
content: Purchase the Nest in late May and started having issues in September. Most disappointed with customer service because when the product worked it worked great. At first response was good, went the normal troubleshooting, but then got run through again. I did a YouTube search and found post for the same issue (W5), this is where it loses the ability to find a WiFi network. After about 2 days I was contacted by email saying they where going to replace the unit but wanted me to send my unit back first. My thermostat was still working at the time just not able to connect to WiFi. It took another 2 days before the support through Facebook (oh yea you have to reach out to the Customer service through social media but any action happens from email). Then was told yes they could send me a new unit prior to receiving mine back just had to place funds on hold, ok. While waiting for email 3 or 4 days the thermostat stopped working. I contacted customer support serve time last ask for them to please send email also asking to speak to a supervisor and got nothing but the run around. Over a week later I received the email for the new until (by the time I receive it it will be two weeks), I had to go out a purchase a new unit since now the Nest is not working at all and still have not heard from a supervisor. Great product when it work but customer support is very much lacking so be aware if you start having issues or if you purchase this product keep your old/buy a cheap backup.
title: Didn’t last long/customer service very disappointing

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mikko
content: This is a very nice smart thermostat. The installation was very easy too. My apartment has 2 wire system and it works perfectly. I was a bit worried that I was missing C wire but everything turned out just fine. Alexa integration works too. You can tell Alexa to set temperature and eco mode. Just note that if you enable eco mode Alexa can't turn it off. Integration with Alexa could be much better still. You cant access nest properties when creating a routine. For example if you want your smart lights to turn red when it's hot or blue when it's cold. Just an example.
title: Integration with Alexa works but could be better.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rick Faraci
content: This was the worst experience I ever had with a thermostat. the geofencing is a joke and you come home to a cold house. The auto schedule also never turned the thermostat on after turning it on manually several times. Turned off eco and boom, it's in eco again, even after shutting it off. I really tried to like this thermostat, I really did. But eventually could not see wasting $230 on a crappy product. I went and bought the Emerson Sensi and am much happier.
title: Don't waste your money.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AH
content: I have had maintenance men in and out of my house all day for MONTHS just to figure out the issue was the Nest. For a very expensive piece of equipment that is NOT an okay lifespan. The A/C stopped working suddenly and was pumping hot air out. The Nest was activating auxiliary heating even when it was set to cool, heating up the cold air that the A/C unit was pumping. I updated it, reset it, took it out and put it back in, and nothing. Absolutely ridiculous and a MASSIVE hassle and major discomfort while waiting on it to be fixed.
title: Crapped out after less than a year

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Vargha
content: Hate hate this junk. The worst $500.+ (Bough 2 units )  I’ve ever spent on something. The absolute junk. The app has countless of communication problems with the thermostat. Logged me out at least 3 times a day. Basically every time I need to change the temp I have to log in and sometimes right after logging in it logs out. So pretty much was forced to Download the google home app to get the thermostats to work but now on the home app it’s not allowing or giving the options for room sensors only the thermostat. It was keep turning of it on the heat and ac for the first month  and had to disable all the scheduling and auto to make it stop. This is a waste of time and money
title: Absolutely junk

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dawna Butcher
content: I loved my nest. It was cute and I was able to set a schedule on my phone.  I could check in on the temperature while away to verify furnace was working and have the home heated upon returning from a tropical trip to frigid minnesota winter. Unfortunately it quit working after 3 years. It happened to be one of the first cold spells of the year and we now have a baby. Since our thermostat wasn’t very old we thought something was wrong with furnace. The repair man wasn’t able to get to out house until after 11pm and found the nest to be the culprit. After complaining to the company, they did send a new base even though the warranty was up. Come to find out the in laws had gotten one and it only lasted a year or so. I loved it when it worked, but it’ll probably be the last one we invest in
title: Limited lifespan

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Melvin Jensen
content: I love this thermostat!! It is sleek, able to be controlled with my smartphone. It is paired nicely with the round black wall plate. I turned off the learning part of it, as I didn't like it adjusting my temperature on its own, but other then that there is alot of features and should satisfy whatever you are looking for in a thermostat, it can be easily set up or you can delve into playing with the learning aspects of it if you wish and other programmable features. Just a great thermostat.
title: I love this themostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kazoo 62
content: Love, love, love my new thermostat! Can't believe what a difference it has made. My husband was not happy about the price until it had been installed for a couple of days and even he said the house feels warmer with it on. Talking about installation, couldn't be easier, took me about 5 minutes to get it installed. It was so easy that I was sure that I had missed something but I had not. The app makes it easy to adjust the temperature from anywhere. I know the price seems steep but we were able to get a rebate from our electric company and that helped. It truly is worth the money you put into it.
title: Fantastic thermostat and so easy to install!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: P. Trip
content: Was working great for 5 months then I lost Wifi connectivity. That wouldn't be such a bad issue if it did not take several calls to google support and a painful two hour ordeal to have it replaced.. Buyer beware... known issue.... Sorry Google but you fail miserably when supporting this product....
title: After 5 Months lost Wifi - Known issue

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Owen M.
content: It worked ok for the first few days but it has refused to start the ac for the last couple days. Says that it is set to cooling but does not turn the ac on. I bought 2 of these and the other one seems to behave better, but master bedroom has been >80 degrees for days now and it never shows it as cooling. The picture shows it having been set to 72 but it hasn’t turned blue to start the ac in days. I disconnected it and put the old thermostat on and the ac started up no problem
title: Refuses to turn on ac when outside temp is >88

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: steve albright
content: I purchased a Nest 10 months ago. It stopped communicating with WiFi last week and I’ve been trying to obtain a replacement under warranty. I keep getting the run around from the Google/Nest tech support group who until now will not send a replacement. Very disappointing to say the least given it has a 2 year warranty. Since I’ve not found a way to contact Amazon to complain, my next stop is the Missouri Attorney’s General’s Office. Update: I did receive a replacement unit today, so I changed to 3 stars. Still not pleased a $200 thermostat only lasted 10 months.
title: Do not buy this item!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mel M
content: It was very simple to install and it programmed itself exactly how I would of done it. But the best part is controlling from another room or across the world. (recent traveled to Ireland). To save electricity, I often let it run 10 minutes and then turn up the temperature until I start feeling hot and then turn it down again. All from the comfort of my easy chair.  If I wake up in the middle of the night hot, I reach for my phone and turn it down, if cold I turn it up. Without having to get out of bed.
title: Totally awesome

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: G. Brinton
content: Beware.  Installed a new Trane outdoor AC unit and it started occasionally making really loud noises when the compressor turns on.  Turning off the unit and back on always fixes it.  Had my AC guy come out on multiple occasions and found nothing wrong with the unit.  He contacted Trane and they said that it is the Nest that causes this issue as it sometimes tries to run the outdoor unit fan without the compressor causing the issue.  The recommended fix is to go with a better thermostat. I also could never get the thing to learn my cooling/heating habits.  The “learning” part is pretty much a useless feature.  The best part was being able to control the temp with my phone and remotely.  That part worked like a charm. My recommendation is to go with another brand.
title: Slamming Compressor loud noise due to Nest

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rich
content: Just bought a house and had to fully upgrade the HVAC system.  I really was looking to get a Nest as I've been reading about them since the first generation release.  Like any tech, I always approach with not going first generation so I figured I'd wait.  Plus, I did need a house for it! It's been great from the start.  Our HVAC installer said once it was connected to the heater and central AC units, it recognized both instantly.  They are Trane units for those that might be curious.  It's only been a week and the Nest has already started picking up our habits and automatically adjusting the temperature of the house. One side note, one beneficial thing for me was that it didn't need a WiFi connection right away for set-up.  Our HVAC was going to be finished installation before we had internet services in our new house, but thankfully that was not an issue.  Once WiFi was available, the set-up was easy and it's great controlling the Nest via my phone.  Hopefully I'll be able update soon about the energy savings.
title: Nest in a New House

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MAGApede
content: I bought this thing three years ago and was happy to get rid of it by the time I sold it last year. The "smart" features never worked correctly, it struggled to hold the temperature steady, and the app/website are down CONSTANTLY. It happened so often I started logging the outages and was up to 15 by the time I decided to dump Nest. The thermostat gets no updates from Google, they didn't fix anything and all of the issues it had were fixable with software. Big disappointment, there are better options out there!
title: Another abandoned Google product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: legna
content: It works good for 7 months and then the wifi stop working as soon as this happen to you dont waste your time, anything you do wont work , search for videos on youtube , a lot of people having the same issue ,from other hand the software has a malfunction that will damaged your unit, it will damaged the reverse valve and if you  have a new ac ,the manufacture will void your warranty if they found that you  have the nest thermostat , me and a few of my coworkers bought this product pretty much at the same time and all us had to replace the it ,great idea but they havent come out with a solution , and you have to go through a difficult process for then to send you a replacement and probably you wont get it , but even if they send the replacement dont install it cause it will damage you system trust me
title: bad will damaged your unit

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Reneggade
content: Although the description and google/nest website would have you believe this works in most homes, it requires some rewiring in most.  I know this because, after many hours on the phone with Google because the thermostat would shut off for no apparent reason, Google/Nest offered to send a technician to install it.  The technician was unlicensed and decided to rewire my AC units, rendering them inoperative.  I had to call a real technician to fix the units for a cool $574.30.  Google would not reimburse me after weeks of back and forth email, including this gem: " I have some unfortunate news, ServiceLive has responded stating that they will not reimburse at this time. I am unable to speculate on their reason for this decision. I also have other news, effective immediately I have accepted a new position on another team. I have made arrangements for someone else within Executive Care to take over on my behalf as I will discontinue working with you from this point forward. " The new rep from their ironically named "Hardware Executive Care" team contributed this, "Because ServiceLive is a separate company, I can only recommend that you reach out to ServiceLive in order to appeal their decision and continue to pursue reimbursement." In other words, "screw you." Save yourself headaches and dollars.  Don't buy a Nest thermostat.
title: do not buy this

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Richard L. Eaton
content: Installation was a snap.  Connecting it to our home automation hub and to Alexa was easy as well.  The learning thermostat is probably better suited to a family with more structure.  We sleep and wake at varying hours, and come and go at varying times.  So there really isn't much of a pattern.  I had hoped that the Home/Away feature would at least reduce the temperature when we were gone.  That only happened once so far and that was after we were gone several hours.  At least our local utility provided a $100 rebate on our power bill for signing up our Nest for them to play with when needed during peak power demands.
title: Marginal Utility if Your Life Is Not Structured.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Nom de plume
content: This is what a thermostat should be!  Installation was a breeze; it took longer to enter my WiFi password than to install the thermostat.  I did have an issue where the thermostat wasn't detecting power from my wiring, and I had to call for support.  It was 8:00 pm on a Friday night, but in less than 10 minutes I had a nest specialist troubleshooting the issue, and had it functioning as expected in about 15 minutes (turned out the air conditioning control wire that was connected to the old thermostat wasn't needed for the nest since i don't have AC).  The nest thermostat was extremely easy to install, their tech support is top notch (and available 24/7), and it looks and works great!  It is also fantastic to control the thermostat via their app.  I would give more than 5 stars if I could.
title: Simply the best thermostat.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jacob Kriesel
content: I have a 2nd gen, and now also have a 3rd gen Nest Thermostat. The differences are amazing, and the 3rd generation has exceeded my expectations. I will eventually have a third thermostat as well, and I would not hesitate to purchase another Nest. This thermostat, I'm using it on an HVAC unit that has dual stage cooling. The thermostat automatically senses if the cooling is not keeping up on stage 1, and will turn on stage 2 as needed. It works pretty good in dual stage mode. Another great feature is the new Farsight option. At first I didn't like it because it showed the setpoint, but Nest updated it to give the option of showing some other data, namely the current temperature. It's so much nicer to see the current temp in huge numbers than seeing the setpoint. I know what the setpoint is, so I'm glad they are telling me something I don't know; current temp. All in all, great thermostat. Will buy another one.
title: Great updates over 2nd generation.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Moicico
content: Easy to install, great product, it learns about your heating needs and makes you save money. You can control it with your phone or Amazon Echo. Highly recommended. I had an issue with this Nest thermostat, you have to be aware of the power stealing or power sharing or power robbing situation depending who you ask. The problem is that the Nest thermostat doesn't use batteries and is charged by taking "a little energy from the boiler". In my situation I have a System 2000 oil boiler and every time the Nest thermostat needed to recharge it would turn the boiler on, so now, in the summer the boiler sent heat to the rooms even though the rooms were quite warm. I googled it, read about the power sharing issue and  called Nest who suggested some changes in the wire connection but nothing helped. The System 2000 web page has a pdf document about this problem. I called Nest and they said to call my HVAC company. Nest suggested I put a C wire but the C wire is not what System 2000 recommends and is a little more difficult to install. The recommendation by System 2000 was to install an isolation relay which the HVAC company did and now the thermostat works perfect. I give 5 stars to Nest because after discussing the situation they issued a check for my HVAC expenses that were $360. I talked few times with Dominic who is great!!! He's very helpful, cared about the situation and followed up with e-mails. My only suggestions for Nest to improve is to decrease the wait time when calling the customer support (sometimes was about one hour on hold), and also to mention about the possibility of the power sharing issue in the Nest web page. I recommend the product and I will buy more thermostats now that I know how to solve any power sharing issues.
title: Easy to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Eric B
content: I love the Gen 3 version of the Nest Thermostat. I can use it to not only heat and cool my home, but prepare my home for me before I come home. With integration into ADT, Automatic, IFTTT, Amazon Alexa, and Google Android I can monitor my home and adjust temperatures for different times of the day. For example, Automatic can tell Nest that I'm coming home from work. Nest can then start cooling my home for me and get it to the right temperature before I get there. With Amazon Alexa I can voice control my thermostat. When I set my home to away with ADT security it can automatically set Nest to away. Nest can also tell when I'm not home by looking for motion from itself and the various Nest Protects I have available. When I'm not home, Nest can set itself into away mode, saving energy costs. Finally Nest integrates with my Android phone to auto detect when I'm home or not. Nest may cost more than others, but it will pay for itself with energy savings.
title: Awesome smart home thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Javier Carnicer
content: Unit disconnects from the wifi and it doesn't reconnect automatically unless you go to the unit itself and manually reset the whole thing. THIS HAPPENS EVERY NIGHT. it still works fine but the app feature no longer works and if you want to change the temperature of the house or check anything you have to be next to the thermostat.
title: Disconnects from WiFi

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: j. m.
content: This thermostat wants to be smarter than you. I wouldn’t recommend this one. Regardless of what I ask it to do and what temperature I set it at, the nest does it’s own thing. I find my house at ridiculous temperatures, perhaps trying to save me money, but that’s not what is my intent. I want to be able to just control the thermostat from my phone. It truly has a mind of its own. I also, there are icons on the nest that I’m uncertain what they are without searching them on the internet. And even then, I can’t control that function. Further, I bought the sensors to try to mitigate the control, thinking I’d be able to control my baby’s room. That was not the case. One room would be freezing and others were blazing hot. Not event really sure what the point of the sensors are, unless I had a super fancy HVAC unit that differentiated air flow to specific rooms. I do not have such an air conditioner unit, nor do I think those are common or standard. Lastly,  there is TERRIBLE customer service. They literally have no phone number. I was put on a text chat with clearly a robot who could not answer my questions. If you buy this, you’re on your own, or maybe web searches. This was a total waste of money and I DO NOT RECOMMEND this thermostat.
title: Uncontrollable, sensor problems, poor customer service, DO NOT BUY!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RandyD
content: I've been using this for about a month and a half now. I'm giving it five stars, but will still focus on the cons as the pros are pretty well documented elsewhere. Actually, I have just one main con, hence the 5 stars. There is very limited control with the Google Home App. I expected to be able to fully manipulate the thermostat via the Google app, especially given that Google now owns Nest. Not so. You can do the most basic features that way, but otherwise, you need to go to the Nest app and learn a second interface.
title: Getting past the awe, but still a great product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ashtin C. Hoffmann
content: Had this device on my wall for a couple weeks. The screen kept showing the home icon, which I believe is the starting up process. Couldn't really find how this device was supposed to work. Device was unresponsive half the time. Did every troubleshoot there was to try but it didn't work. When I decided to take it off and put my old thermostat back up. The temperature was set at 78, when I was done switching my old thermostat said it was 84 in the house. There had been times that the best wouldn't even get down to the temp I set before turning off. Do not buy the product
title: Faulty product, doesn't work like they say

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ian M
content: I've got a heat pump, the nest no longer controls it.  I've gone through two of these, one was a refurbished one sent as a replacement from google, it worked for a week.  I spoke with an AC Technician for a major HVAC company, he told me they no longer install these in their new homes when they run a new system, the failure rate is way too high.  I bought the cheapo honeywell that's got alexa integration.  It does the job, no bells and whistles but at least my heater doesn't turn on when I call for the AC!
title: Failed after a year.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sam
content: The Nest worked for a day then stopped working, the charge ran out, wifi is off and the charge is draining not adding. Just got off from a Nest support for 1 hour, told me to try with wi fi off. Still same result, will call again tomorrow and see if they do something or replace it. Other people seem to have same issue and I also updated the software on it if it has something to do with it. Update : it finally worked after the common wire was connected. So make sure the common wire is there.
title: Nest wont charge and keeps shutting down

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Timothy T.
content: Looks great. Works great. Easy install with only one issue. My system, being zoned, required a 5th, common, wire. I was expecting that to be the case but did not confirm until I installed with only 4 wires, found the system was not working, and finally located the information online after an exhausting search.
