Reinstalled old thermostat and the next day I pulled a new 5 wire cable and reinstalled and set up the Nest all in 1 hour. I got lucky. I only wish the Nest had a remote temp sensor option and was very close to buying the Ecobee. My other zones will likely get replaced with Ecobee because of this reason.
title: Nest is great if you have 5 wires, but Ecobee offers remote sensor.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ed
content: This unit was a very easy install. The labels to ID the wires for the heating/cooling systems did not stick very well but other than that the install took all of 5 minutes. Setup was also very easy to and that also included adding it to the WiFi system in the house. The thermostat only took a few days to learn the times needed for heat on/off and those times are easily fine tuned with the phone app. No comment on energy savings yet as the first month after install the temps were 4 degrees higher than normal so energy use was lower than the same period last year. Based on experience so far, I would highly recommend this unit.
title: Easy Install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Wesley
content: I initially set it up to learn my schedule but didn’t like that it began turning the heat off about 90 minutes before we’d go to bed. Tried to turn all the automatic stuff off from the thermostat but it kept doing it. A friend who had one told me he had the same problem and I had to go to the phone app and delete the created schedule. Once I did that it finally stopped turning the heat off. Much happier now.
title: Works, but tricky.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: XQuB1T
content: Following the instructions I shorted out the HVAC system and no longer have AC. I would recommend getting pro installation with it, it will cost me about the same to get a serviceman to fix it. I wouldn't have purchased if I'd have known it would be a pain and I'd be without AC for the day.
title: I would recommend getting pro installation with it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: William M. Conlin
content: Yeah I was one of those guys who saw this thing at Home Depot or Lowes and thought ... Hey man thats pretty cool... then I would see that $270 price and off to lawn and garden I go with my head hanging down.... I picked this up during the Black Friday sales about $110 off ... So even at that $150 for a thermostat is STEEP !!  ... Now it sits on my wall and Im a better man for it.. my pride in tact and voice control bliss.  Come join the club... this thing is all the rage.
title: Nice

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J
content: This nest almost cost me an AC replacement. Since its intall, it has caused my compressor to quit randomly mid cycle and not restart on its own, causing the compressor to buzz loudly while not functioning. I replaced the capacitor and had two techs come service the compressor and check the system. The third one suggested replace this junk nest with the stock unit. Bam, problem gone. I strongly do not recommend this unit. I'll be surprised if this review makes it through.
title: I do not recommend.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shmuel
content: I used for a year I always had issues I hate it I replaces them all with Honeywell T9 With new thermostats I never have issues and even have a average lower electric bill
title: I bought 9 nest thermostats for my house

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AP
content: I am pretty tech savy and this thermostat was not the easiest to install.  I bought three of these units for my home and I connected two of them correctly.  The one in the basement that had a heat pump I thought was connected correctly but in summer my ac didnt work.  When I called a HVAC tech he indicated i connected the device incorrectly. The devices also had problems syncing to my nest app to the same building.  I had to add separate building just to get them on the app.  Eventually i figured it out. Now that the thermostat is installed it works like a charm and I dont regret the purchase.  It makes temp control easy and trackable.  I dont know if I have saved any money on my power bill but I am sure I have.
title: Excellent controller but installation was not easy

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Maryland Techy
content: I had two Nest thermostats for my old house and when I moved to the east coast it was torture trying to control the temperature of the house without a Nest. So I got a new one and, just as before, it took all of about 10 minutes to remove the old one, take a picture of the wiring configuration, attach the mounting, connect the wires, and start the programming which was the easiest part. I'm THRILLED to have a Nest system installed and recommend it without any reservation!
title: Bought it Again!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael Kurak
content: Dear Nest On 3/19/200 I contacted your support line to explain that my new Nest Gen 3 thermostat would not heat once installed. They asked me a couple of questions, and then asked for charge card information to transfer me to an A/C “expert” at Justanswer.com. I was assured that there would be a onetime $1.00 “fully refundable” charge for this service. I was connected to Justanswer san francica. As soon as I was connected to Justanswer I was told that there would be a $5 “Non refundable” charge. (What happened to the $1.00) The first gentleman that I spoke with disconnected me as soon as I quested the unexpected charge. The next gentleman from Justanswer (Geztech)  worked with me for some time. Including having me completely remove my nest thermostat and replace it with my old twice. When I connected the old thermostat, it heated heated just fine. Geztech Tech told me that it must be a broken “White Wire “ between my Thermostat and my A/H???? If in fact the wire is broken, how can the broken wire work with my old thermostat???? The Nest phone help desk is understandable closed. I messaged them as instructed, and have heard nothing back from Nest support I went on line to the Nest forms, and found over three hundred Nest customers with the same issue. I have already been charged $5 that I never agreed to on my card! I will be refusing that charge, and ANY charge from  JustAnswer as none of Their people where able to resolve the issue. Michael Kurak
title: Never would turn on the heat!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DB
content: Tried installing this thermostat today. The instructions are insufficient for the wiring. I used their troubleshooting feature on their website and the conclusion was to contact their tech support. As if this posting I have been on hold for over 30 minutes. The next step will be boxing this POS back up and asking for a refund.
title: Worthless customer support.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Daniel W.
content: My nest worked fine for a day, then it would run my ac for only a minute at a time before shutting it off for a 5 minute "cooldown." Turns out this is a known issue with the Nest if you don't have the blue common wire running to the unit, which it needs to charge.  I wouldn't take issue with this except that their website said the nest was fully compatible with my wiring which did not include the common wire. I had red (power), yellow (ac), white (heat), and green (fan) available in my old thermostat, so i had to run another wire for the common to make it work consistently.
title: Misleading compatibility chart

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Frank
content: LOVE THIS THERMOSTAT! I've only had it installed for about 36  hours, but I can already tell the difference!  There is no longer that window of "chill" before the furnace kicks on to bring the temp back up a degree or two to meet the setting requested.  The comfort is constant and the temperature does not vary from the set temp. The installation instruction and materials are PRIMO!  Step by step, the instructions were so thorough and easy to follow, I couldn't ask for an easier experience!  Also appreciate the back plate which covers the holes and unpainted area where the old thermostat was.  QUALITY ALL THE WAY!
title: VERY ACCURATE AND SO EASY TO INSTALL!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Neil Riley
content: Stuck in a endless loop of logging in on both the website and Android app.  Enter my login details and it cycles for awhile and then brings me right back to the login screen.  Tried resetting password. Tried to contact Nest directly to no avail, the company is incredibly difficult to get a hold of and instead they try to send to you unhelpful links containing FAQ's (not actual help for the problem you are experiencing). While the Thermostat works fine and the installation was incredibly easy, the whole point of this was to have remote access via the app which is broken.  Don't buy, it's bricked for any remote function.
title: CAUTION: All remote features are bricked on the app and website. DON'T BUY

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jess Simmons
content: Amazing support! We installed it and ran into trouble, we only had two wires and we were having problems getting it to work. We called tech support and after some troubleshooting she said we needed the third wire installed and we would need a tech to come out. She sent the tech FREE OF CHARGE! I was so impressed! We made an appointment and a couple of weeks later a local tech came and installed and everything has been working great. The app is easy to use, we are still playing with the learning feature but I have noticed that I haven't had to mess with the thermostat as much. I highly recommend!
title: Great tech support! Love this thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Qwikby
content: The learning feature is a huge headache. It sets itssel way to cold in the summer and way too hot in the winter.  The only real benefit is the ability to control it from your bed on your phone. The amount of time i have spent on the phone with support + the damages this has caused to my ac unit by making it overwork is pretty bad. Considering swapping for something else. I really wanted this to work. Smart is an overused word these days.
title: Dont use the learning feature

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kaylee
content: If you'd like a smart thermostat go with a different unit. After install worked great for a couple days then it started to sort of short cycle our furnace. I can trick the thermostat into keeping the furnace on every so often but can’t figure out why it’s shutting it off before desired temp and giving no error codes. Google customer service basically tells us it’s our furnace but works fine with other thermostat and was serviced a couple months ago. We missed our return window now since it’s only a month. There was an issue similar to this on older models/software but was under the impression it was fixed apparently not. We are out around $250 (sensor was also purchased) and selling to someone else doesn’t seem like a good option since it seems to be hit or miss on what systems it works right with.
title: Not a smart thermostat for you.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tembrock
content: I did spend quite a bit of time on the phone with a tech (on a hot day, don't do that to yourself people) but I'm only pointing that out to say that, although I am fairly handy and savvy with DIY projects I DID need some help with the wiring.  This took some time but I have to say the installation help was SO helpful. I think it was about 50 mins in all with me trying things, sending photos and running back and forth to shut the breaker off.  Also, the tech MADE SURE that I double checked my documentation to see if I had a two phase unit (I believe that was the term) and indeed it appeared I did.  We made one more wiring change and bingo, off to the races. TIP: Take a photo of your existing wiring BEFORE you take it apart.  This would have saved a lot of time.  Also, find your documentation for your a/c unit so you can make sure you're wiring it correctly for the kind of unit you have. In terms of use it couldn't be easier.  Turn one way or the other.  We actually were using more A/C for a while because it was just so easy to dial it down and leave it there.  Later we moderated using the app to bring all the "learned" preferences up by two degrees so we were not running the bill up so high.  Lesson learned.  The app makes it extremely easy to adjust the unit remotely from anywhere you have an internet connection. The rest of the non-wiring related set up was super easy . One last installation note. If you find the controls (dial wheel) is not pushing in easily for the "select" function, be patient and go back and check the mounting screws.  Try tightening them, adjusting them until the act of pushing in the dial to "select" feels effortless.  If it's not mounted snug (as it was for me) it did NOT work so well.  In fact I wasn't sure it was working at all.  It's a very subtle click that depends on it being firmy/flushly mounted.
title: We actually were using more A/C for a while because it was just so easy to dial it down and leave it there

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: cheri
content: Our furnace is 16 years old. we needed to upgrade our turn dial thermostat. This was fast and easy. and worked amazing. but make sure you sync it to your phone because it tries to read your movements at first. now it has been so long it does not jump up our temp at night. But the amazing part is if your not home it follows your phone and keeps the temperature set low. I live in MN so that is a great feature because I always forgot to turn the heat down when I left in the winter. I am very sad I did not buy this sooner
title: very easy and regret not purchasing sooner

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shawn M.
content: I bought two of these thermostats, one for each cooling unit in my house. Although I was able to get them to connect to the internet they would not link to the nest app, I worked on this issue for an hour on each unit, and still had no link. The thermostats are cool looking, and I like the digital display, but for the money, it should connect to the app without issue. I reset the device multiple times, and checked the wiring, ran the connection tests, connected to the internet, received my link code, and each time it tried but would not link.  I had Honeywell thermostats before these nest ones and connection were seamless, and remote management was easy, and the cost was half the price.although I admit connecting the Honeywell units was more difficult, at least they worked.
title: Does not connect to Nest App

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Danny Poppa
content: I bought this to further digitize my house, since I purchased a bunch of Echos on the last prime day.  This thermostat was easy enough to install on my own with the included wiring guide (I live in a 60s house).  I've had it for a year now, and I can't fault it.  It has a plethora of settings from auto temperature control based on your habits, and then manual mode.  The customer service is stellar, I brought up some of the finicky voice command features early on (originally you couldn't call the nest an A/C to Alexa, but they fixed that) and they fixed it soon enough.  They do have experts on the line to help you trouble shoot your wiring as well - I had to do this when my heater was actually the culprit. I haven't tried the cheaper version but I assume its just as good.  Its the software that matters most.
title: Great for Voice Commands.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kaseem Porter
content: A MUST HAVE!!! Don’t even bother trying to save $50 by getting a cheaper thermostat by Sensi, Honeywell etc. Not saying those are bad, it’s just the Nest is simple to install, connects with no problem and has the best/most convenient app. The “Eco” mode will save you money and you’ll recoup the cost difference between the Nest and other thermostats.
title: Nest is the BEST!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tom Trocine
content: I wanted state of the art, smart environmental control in my new home. These seem to work well even though we had a few glitches with the learning mode. For whatever reason it decided to crank the temp to popsicle in the middle of the night, leaving me to wake up finding myself trying to find a blanket. Solved the problem by turning off learning mode and using like a regular thermostat. Now it’s just a fancy, expensive thermostat. At least I can change the temp with my phone....
title: Not sure it’s worth the price.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Westreacher
content: I've had my Nest for a month or so now, so it's time to leave a review. As you can see by the 5-star rating, I am very impressed and pleased with this purchase. Installation was simple (hints: take your time, shoot a pic of your existing thermostat's wiring scheme, cut back copper wires to fresh wire, read the directions), and it worked right out of the box. My work schedule in the summer is insane, so my Nest on automatic is a little scizoid, but it's so easy to manage from the app that I rarely allow the auto-set features to assert themselves. In fact, what I like best is the ability to control the temp remotely. Kids heading over to hide from the heat while I'm away at work? No problem. Heading home from work and want it cool by the time I get there? No problem. Great device, worth the money (bought it on sale and spent the time and effort to get a rebate from National Greed, my electrical service provider).
title: Buy it, well worth the $$$.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Matt P
content: Now that my teething problems have been sorted, I find this overall to be a great product. I live in the Northeast, in an 80-year-old house with plaster walls (without insulation). I use this thermostat for heat only with a "traditional" oil fired boiler with radiators, 2 zones. If you use Nest's online tool by which you determine if the product is appropriate for your house, you will find that it supposedly can replace an old-fashioned Honeywell, 2-wire (Red/White) thermostat. What I discovered however was that if connected using just those 2 wires, the amount of power required by this thermostat proved to be too much.  I don't know how exactly in that circumstance this thermostat draws power but after some research and experimentation what I realized was that in order for these thermostats to work the way they are intended, they also need an uninterrupted power source via the "Common" wire. Without the common wire connected, the thermostats were intermittent in their ability to connect to Wi-Fi and would also draw down their battery to the point where I would have to disconnect the thermostat from its mounting plate and plug it into a USB charger. Luckily, the cables that run from the boiler to the thermostats are newer and therefore had more than 2 conductors. I used the 3rd conductors in each cable to wire the thermostats with the aforementioned "common" wire and since then, my 2 Nest thermostats have been working flawlessly.  They connect to Wi-Fi without a problem, they activate when someone walks in front of them in close proximity, they don't draw down the battery, they don't forget to send a signal to the furnace calling for heat even if their program dictates that they should, and they don't need to be re-booted often.  Added info: I dictate my schedule instead of allowing the thermostats to "learn" and I also have the home/away feature presently turned off only because as it concerns my particular house, with plaster walls and without insulation, it takes too long for the house to warm back up if the heat only turns back on when I walk through the door.
title: Common wire required in older, heat-only installation.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brock
content: This is my second Nest thermostat. With the first one it could no longer connect to my network after about six months. The second unit lasted only 6 weeks and could no longer connect. I tried all the recommended steps without any success. I will be replacing this with the Ecobee and home for a longer life and better results. I will never buy another unit from Nest.
title: 2nd Nest in a row that has had WiFi radio failure

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: taverentech
content: This thing is really really nice.  It did have error when we wired it up exactly as old thermostat, had to guess has to correction (which implies old one was mis-wired) and that worked.  Support was a bit slow to respond.  So, do not throw away your old one until you have booted this up and gotten it past wiring test page.  Its so nice I'm thinking of getting Nest smoke/co2 detectors (2nd gen, not 1st) and maybe outdoor cameras too.  My wife sometimes turn off the A/C so I want to get alerted and be able to turn it back on remotely so my electronics do not overheat.
title: This thing is really really nice. It did have error when we wired it ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Denise Rickard
content: It's been 6 month since I purchased Nest and honestly I regret it. Nest change temp even if you turn off learning option. One day I woke up from freezing it was 48...today nest decide warm up house to 90. As it's approaching one year mark it start struggling with sending signals to cool off air. As I switch to new thermostat I don't have anymore of nest problems. Lots money for such unstable product.
title: Not worth money..lots headache & problems

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Charles Cheeseman
content: Alexa -- increase temperature by one degree. Ok, the temperature is now set to 70 degrees. Awesome! Setup is a little complicated. My heating system is a little older, but I was able to figure it out by looking at a few different YouTube videos. I also called my HVAC company. They came out and told me that I set it up perfectly. Time to pat myself on the back in my perfectly warmed house. Oh -- one of the best things, I've been able to control my electric bill thanks to the app that I can use ANYWHERE.
title: Love this. Works with app AND Alexa.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: LJ
content: The product itself is great. I really like the ability to do everything from my phone, etc. I have to ask though. What does this thing really do that my old programmable thermostat doesn't do? Seriously, does the ability to see how often my system kicks on really justify the price? Does the 'learn' feature (which I don't even use because I work from home a lot) make that big of a difference for people? Is the look work the cost? I am open to suggestions but I just don't see any justification for buying this when a $100 programmable thermostat does everything I really need.
title: Is this really better than any other programmable thermostat?

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mike
content: I bought this thermostat before Christmas. I hooked it up and used the app and Alexa to run it. It was awesome! After a couple months, i lost wifi to the device. I did some research and found that the battery was not charging. I didn't have a common wire ran to the unit. So i ran a new thermostat wire to it and hooked it up. The battery would not charge right. I couldn't get it to hook up to my wifi and it was constantly dying. I called nest and their customer service was awesome! I spoke to an actual American i could understand and told him the problem. He said they would send me a new unit. I had the new thermostat in about 2 days. I swapped out the control units and everything has been perfect ever since. I would totally recommend this thermostat to anyone. It is a little steep in an initial cost but once you set up the scheduling, the money you save in energy costs more than make up the difference.
title: Awesome product, great customer service

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brandon Conley
content: So far very impressed! I ordered the Nest on Black Friday around 5PM, and it was delivered that Sunday evening! Amazing shipping time Amazon! I am a first time home owner so with it comes all of the "learn how to fix" situations. I've never had to, nor helped install a thermostat before so I wasn't sure what to expect. I opened the box and read through everything (very well written instructions), and then looked online to watch their how-to video. It's all so simple that none of that was even necessary, but I had some time to kill away from home so I figured why not. I installed the Nest on Monday evening in about 15 minutes. This time included finding the several separate breakers that control the furnace and AC. It helped that prior to purchasing I used Nest's online compatibility widget to make sure my system would work with Nest (www.nest.com/works). I had an abnormal system so it was requested that I send in pictures to have it verified. I'm glad I did. Within a couple hours a Nest representative emailed me back with a custom wiring diagram using the images I sent to him. This made installation extremely simple. Once installed, Nest did a few updates and walked me through the setup. Connection to Wifi, inputting your location, and naming the thermostat were just a few steps. From start to finish I would say less than a half hour to remove the old thermostat, install the Nest, and then setup and test the system. Overall I am very pleased with how easy everything was, and how good this product is. It's still in its learning stage (only installed 3 days ago and it takes 7 to establish a "schedule"), so it hasn't yet been able to REALLY shine yet. I look forward to seeing everything this thermostat can do in the near future. As a side note, on top of the great sale Amazon was running at the time ($50 gift card with purchase), our energy company also gives you a $50 rebate for installing a Wifi enabled thermostat. So we totaled $100 for purchasing the Nest! I highly suggest inquiring about your energy company's rebates before making your decision to buy or not!
title: Quick and easy installation for an amazing product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Elizabeth B.
content: If you have a dual-fuel HVAC then be prepared to have to schedule an appointment with a HVAC company for $120+ and it is just a regular HVAC company that services your units, not a "Nest Specialist".  Also, you won't know until it is too late but you will install it and think you have done everything right and it still won't work.  The unit clicks and clicks, you know something isn't right.  Then you call customer service... after 2.5 hrs and two different people, they finally say you have to call a technician for $120 to install it because it is Dual Fuel... ummm, I told you it was Dual Fuel at the beginning of the 2.5 hr conversation and you just suddenly realize that a Dual Fuel unit requires the Nest Thermostat to be installed by a "technician"?!?!?  Seems like Nest already knows this but doesn't want the consumers to know because we wouldn't buy it because it adds $120+ to the already $249 which makes this cost $369+.  How many years will that take to recoup your money?  I'm returning it and buying the Honeywell Smart Thermostat, it is supposed to work great with Dual Fuel units and it is cheaper. I will update my review once we install the Honeywell.
title: Dual-Fuel HVAC Owners Beware!  An Added $120+ to Install & 4 hrs wasted.  Not Worth It.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kim
content: Better than I had anticipated! The website was very helpful for showing how to install the wiring! This is extremely easy to use. The  first few days I used the app to turn up the heat before getting out of bed and after that it did it on its own. Any time I go to adjust the heat, it’s already set to what I want. It will tell you how long it will take for the house to reach the selected temperature. When ever you walk within about 10 feet of it, it displays the selected temp and if you go closer, shows the current temp. Extremely easy to toggle through settings. My pictures don’t do it justice. It looks very nice. Very crisp display in person.
title: So easy! Love it!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: R Petersen
content: Like- easy installation. Dislike - -Cannot manually run this. I understand it’s primary benefit is to “learn” our habits and automatically run and save us $$ on our electric bill, but it schedules itself oddly, doesn’t understand when we’re home (which is all the time now during Covid) and turns on and off at odd times. We need to manually intervene all the time. If I could just set a temp and hold when I want to, that would be way better. - they lie when they say it runs without a common wire. They claim it pulls power from the fan wire to charge the battery , but that is only when the fan is running. So if it’s off for more than a couple hours, the battery drains. And you have to pull it off and charge it. Also, it runs in a delayed run mode, where it turns itself off and on every 3 minutes or so, and wouldn’t effectively cool my home. Miserable.  I ended up running new wiring to fix the issue, connecting the C-wire (common).  Now it at least runs, and we only have the problem of no manual operation.
title: No manual operation, make sure you have a “C” wire to connect

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: James
content: At first I loved the Nest. It’s nice to be able to have temperatures set by the time of day. After a year, it just stopped working with the wifi. After resetting it, it finally started working again. A year later, the same thing happened again, and their customer service was non-existant. It’s still not working.
title: Not reliable, long term.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: TMW1
content: My original programmable thermostat gave out after 30 years. I was intrigued by the appearance and reputation of the Nest Thermostat. I decided to give my older home a few modern/smart upgrades and The Nest fit the requirements. It stops the constant running of the AC unit and more accurately senses the internal temperature so that we are comfortable. I am an experienced DIY'er but I needed my wife to re-read the installation instructions to get the rather simple wiring correct on the second try. Since running the new thermostat for four months now, I am still pleased with the performance, the appearance and the information about the settings and energy use. I can't see on my previous bills a dramatic savings, but the rates may have gone up since a year ago. If you are going to buy another thermostat anyway I recommend this one as a top contender.
title: Have more control over your home's atmosphere

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: BayouTi
content: I purchased the 3rd generation Nest in the copper color and I am very impressed with this device!  The installation was easier than I anticipated and set up and wireless connection was a breeze! I have only had this installed for a day but having wireless access has already proven to be beneficial since I rushed out of the house in the morning and forgot to turn down the thermostat.  But was able to do it at work!  Installing the Nest has also eliminated an annoying clicking sound my old programmable thermostat made every time it turned my system on & off.  I love the color, quality and user friendliness of this product!!
title: Wish I had gotten sooner!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jeffrey Allen Randorf
content: I love it but I don't love the fact I can't see the current room temperature as a default setting when I approach the device.  Nest will show the set-point which is useless.  The difference between the 2nd gen and this 3rd gen is the clock.  I've set the 3rd gen to show the analog clock as the default display when I approach.  I suspect the lack of an ability to show the room temperature as a default is a patent issue with a competitor (the competing company that has a round digital thermostat you can turn like the Nest). The approach function works so much better than the prior generation.  And of course the display is larger and the device thinner (but not enough to notice).  The Nest has a de-humidification tap which is important for me. Warning - you need to electrically isolate the Nest from your air handler or furnace.  I used a relay board and powered the Nest with its own 24VAC.  My air handler flatly states you can't mix a smart thermostat with its own 24VAC supply. The device is beautiful, elegant, and has the features I need.  It is only would show the room temperature as a default it would be perfect.
title: Better than the 2nd gen but still no current temperature display as a default.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M masko
content: We loved this initially until after it stopped working after 4 months of use. This was purchased for a Christmas present and by April it had quit. As instructed by Tech Support, we had a HVAC technician come out and check our heating unit so not only were we out the cost of the Nest, but now out the HVAC fee as well only to confirm that it is the Nest itself. We reinstalled our old thermostat and after 5 years, it still works perfectly.
title: Nest stopped working after 4 months of use

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M. Chavez
content: Ive had one before and it took about 10 min to install. Now after 3 hours on the phone with Nest I have to have an AC guy come out and fix the fuse that blew after they had me turn off power 12 times. Pretty sure I got a bad unit to start from amazon and could easily avoided being super pissed off and got hours of my day back if they would have just replaced the unit when it would not stay charged. Not happy with the product or support.
title: If it doesnt stay on the moment you hook it up send it back

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Crystal D.
content: Worked great for three months. I woke up to my furnace kicking on and off repeatedly. Turned it off let it rest turned it back on same thing. Called heating & cooling. Guy took the furnace apart and checked everything. Came upstairs to look at the thermostat sighed and said this is the 4th one this week. Double checked the wiring everything was correct. Couldn't get the unit to kick on. Replaced the thermostat and it worked like a charm. Of coarse I'm outside of my return window and customer service is a joke. Got me a $250 hockey puck as the tech called it.
title: Junk

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Hans
content: I have always been a tech enthusiast and when I first heard of the Nest Thermostat I was immediately interested!  I am the type of person that does not buy 1st generation technology due to software bugs and flaws in design.  I cannot compare the previous generations so I can only write my experience with the 3rd gen. PROS: - Installation: The instructions were relatively easy to follow.  Nest provided a questionnaire to determine the wire setup which was very helpful.  Installed everything in 15-20 mins. - Setup: Easy!  Connected it to my network, updated the software, adjusted the settings and it was up and running. - Performance: It truly is a smart thermostat.  It learned our cooling habits within a week.  It strives to save us money and energy by implementing the "energy rush hour."  Nest and our power company works together to save energy at a specific time of the day which credits our bill $1.25 for every kilowatt-hour we save via Nest. - Build Quality: This product feels extremely premium.  Solid to the touch and it delivers satisfying smooth clicking when turning the dial. **Side note: Amazon customer service was amazing!  This product had a $50 off promotion after we purchased it.  I called and asked if we could get that deal and they obliged. CONS: -  Can't really think of anything.  If I had to nitpick, maybe advertise the "Airwave" function.  It was activated during "away mode" and I was confused when I got home thinking I forgot to set the thermostat to away.
title: Very satisfied with this product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Susan Madewell
content: Loved this thermostat for about 3 months. After power outage I had to remove to charge to get heat working again which is understandable. After charging it would not work more than two days without me having to remove and charge again. 6 months later i finally call support. They can't help me without it being charged so after telling me repeatedly that batteries can not be replaced and I needed to call back after I charged unit again we hung up. They also told me it was because I didn't have a C wire. When I ask why it worked for 3 months just fine they replied it must be having to do updates or something running it down that did not happen first 3 months. I have had an additional 4 months of charging every two days before writing this review. Nest will go in trash when i get home today and I will be replacing with a standard battery unit.
title: Do not buy if you do not have C Wire

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MJ Kirkland, WA USA
content: I am having trouble getting the thermostat to give me a entry key.  I am very frustrated; have worked a week on this already.  Heats the house, but I can't register it or program it.  I'm very disappointed.  Since I have until tomorrow to return it, I will hope I get enough technical support to make this happen.  If not, I'm stuck with a very expensive thermostat which does will not be useful for me in saving money on heating costs.  PS.  The other thing, is this thermostat is reconditioned and as such, does not come with a receipt which includes the serial number  on the receipt.  This means it is not eligible for a rebate from your power company.  Receipt MUST have serial # on the receipt.
title: I'm very disappointed. Since I have until tomorrow to return it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: heyrev
content: Purchased the Nest when we were remodeling our house because of a flood. I read many pros and cons with the nest. Many reviews stated that the thermostat did not show actual temperature and only the temperature that the thermostat is set to. However, it does display the actual room temperature(although it is smaller and harder to see). My brother-in-law installs HVAC units and strongly recommended it. Install was extremely easy and set up was easy as well. The Nest app is simple, but does the trick. You can turn AC/Heat on through the app and it also shows a 10 day history of usage. The "away" setting shuts the unit down when no one is home. I haven't had any issues and have had the unit installed for over 2 months.
title: Worth the money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: shelby
content: I absolutely loved this product for the 2 months that it worked. Unfortunately it started saying it needed to be charged and my AC technician told me it was defective. Since a month had passed Amazon refused to exchange for a new one and told me if I wanted a refund it would be a $40 restocking fee!!! I really loved this product and am super sad that they will not replace Currently having to go through Google since it has a year manufacture warranty. Still a hassle but hopefully I will get my replacement
title: Awesome for 2 months until defective

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: eric
content: Beware. You need a common wire to set this jp properly. I had a 2 wire setup foe my furnace and nest said "you are fine it will work" and setting it up was easy, but the battery in it kept on dying. Nest customer support senior specialist was smug and told my my high end router needed to be put in power save mode and that is why it didn't work. I had a professional hvac tech with 20 years experience come in and he said i needed the common wire. Nest pulses your heat/ac to get some power and that is not good for the system. Now this will work without common wire if you don't want it connected to wifi, but why are you buying a $200 thermostat if you arent connecting it to wifi? Buy a $20 one from walmart if you dont want to have a common wire run or dont care for wifi enabled thermostat. Nest advertising is very shady.
title: Warning. You need a common wire for this to work as advertised

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shawna Dodds
content: I bought two of these for my house. One of them no longer connected to WiFi after about 6 months.  I ordered another one and attempted to get my money back from Nest to no avail.  The second one no longer connected to WiFi after about a year.  It looks like from other reviews that this is common - some issue with the hardware that causes it to malfunction after some period of time.  So, this time I contacted Nest directly and they said they would send me a link via email to order a replacement.  The link never worked, sent me another one and that didn't work. Tried to get it resolved with customer service through multiple attempts.  I'm giving up and going to research alternative products!
title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: S. Wright
content: I love my Nest Thermostat!  Super easy to install, just watch the online video (do a google search).  I had to use the wall plate, the video didn't help much, but I figured it out.  My wires didn't look as clean and straight as the one's in the video (their wires went all the way in, mine had some bare space that I could still see once I inserted), but it works fine so I assume it is OK.  To select a setting you just click the face of the thermostat (no that wasn't intuitive to me at first). I recommend you enter a schedule once you setup your account- for whatever reason might jump to 90.  Others complained in a forum, but  honestly if you put a schedule in it doesn't ever occur again.  It looks super sleek.  It shows a little green leaf when you are being energy efficient on the thermo display and on your phone, and you can even see a history of energy use.  Even though the weather is getting colder given we are now in November, both my electric and gas bill were cheaper this month! I have nest cam's as well, and it was SO EASY to link it to my account.  The nest will eventually learn when you are home/away, and you can turn the nest up/down using your phone.  The phone nest app allows you to see when your furnace is running, and it also shows you the indoor humidity as well as the outdoor temp. There is no monthly fee for this like there is to subscribe your nest cam's. BTW, you can locate the serial number after installation in the nest settings using your phone (just in case you need it for warranty or rebate).
title: Love my Nest!  Control at your fingertips!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mack
content: Overall happy with product I do believe this device was used as the box was a little sketchy.....and it didn’t come as you assume a brand new product with stickers etc would. The ONLY technical support you will receive from Nest is via chat. Try trying to install something via chat, it’s super fun-not! I called my AC guy to help answer some questions about my AC that I wasn’t sure of. Overall I am happy with Nest, it is very cool how it communicates with my google home speaker and that I can control on my phone. But setting it up was not 30 min as advertised, but more like 2.5 hours.
title: Some problems along the way but overall happy

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JMH
content: Everything works great except I can not, for the life of me, get it to connect to the internet.  I've tried about everything in the trouble shooting guide to no avail.
title: Meh

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Glholder
content: I noticed that one of the 2 nest thermostats I purchased was offline. When I checked the display it said low battery.  I had not had any problems with either unit for the 2 years and eight months I had owned them.  After extensive troubleshooting with Nest they have determined that the battery is bad.  It is out of it’s 2 year warranty period and they refuse to replace and it can not be repaired.  The only solution they offer is for me to spend $245 to buy another unit.  Apparently these battery failures between 2.5 and 3 years are very common.  Very disappointed.
title: Internal Battery dead in less than two and a half years

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jonathan J
content: I purchased the Nest Learning Thermostat and it worked ok for about a month for heating.  Then the wifi went out on it.  Google replaced it with a new unit which did not work out of the box.  They replaced that second unit with another new unit which quickly cycled my AC on and off, blowing the circuit breaker.  I had a heating and air pro come out to the house who told me the Nest damaged my AC by quickly cycling it on and off many times.  I asked Google for a refund and they told me to go to Amazon.  But with the 3 bad units I got, now the time window to refund on Amazon has passed.  So, I'm out the money for the Nest, 2 house calls from the pro, and I have a damaged AC.
title: Damaged my AC unit

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Son of a GV
content: So I bought one of the original versions several years back from Amazon but had to deal with a vendor who charged me and never received the product. It took me this long to save up to buy another one. It’s very reliable and looks like it will save me money and pay for itself within about a year based on my usage. This is a definite “So glad I bought this purchase“ but make sure you get it from a reputable vendor. I lost almost $350 the first time around.
title: Love it. One of my top 10 purchases on Amazon over the last year

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Enrique
content: Had an existing thermostat that was installed with the furnace about 10 years ago. The screen went blank but checked and the wires had power. Decided to try the Nest as I had wanted to upgrade but was just waiting. The installation was a breeze the manual and online tutorial was easy and amazing. The step by step instructions and the wire stickers included in the package helped with the installation. It went by with ease, great engineering. Looking at the manual for the old thermostat you need to move jumpers and switches on the board, the Nest was easy and simple. The set up was simple and the instructions on the unit easy to use and set up. Great product and great engineering, system turned on and is working great. Will try out the app and see how that works. Now I will contact my utility provider and obtain the rebate they offer. Easy installation and great engineering.
title: great upgrade

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Automated
content: So I've been living with the Nest Learning Thermostat for alittle over 5 months now. And I've have to say I haven't had much problems. Installation was a breeze, I did have a common wire so the battery stays charged. The update for Farsight is a excellent update, which includes the current room temperature setting. A setting option that should've been from the start. I truly believe that it has saved us a fair amount of money so far. The only problem I had was when they rolled out the Eco mode, that replaced the Away feature. The thermostat would go into Eco mode when nobody was home and a few times I caught it heating to the Home temperature. Pair it with a Nest Cam and Protect to further add to its Home/Away sensing. Overall 5 stars
title: Five month review

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Scram
content: I give this products customer service zero. I’ve had nothing but problems with customer service. They trouble shoot problem long story short fry my zone control board. They admit there fault and tell me techs are going to come trouble shoot waited three hours no show, total 6 hours of my life I will never get back! Supposed to get follow up email from corporate and still waiting not going to hold my breath! If you are in the market for thermostat go Honeywell hear it’s a great product and customer service actually helps!!!!
title: Horrible customer Service!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Richard
content: I am very disappointed in this thermostat. In the past two weeks it has signed me out of access on my smart phone. When it asked me for my password the first time I had to change it. When I then tried the new password on the second time it signed me out, it told me my password was invalid. I went through several attempts to try and reactivate the connection to my smart phone, to no avail. Then Nest support  sent me an automated email stating that they would need 3 to 5 business days to investigate my issue. In the meantime In the meantime, I have no access to the thermostat via my smart phone. This is VERY poor customer service and I deeply regret buying this product.
title: Very Poor Customer Service!!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: maria eugenia gonzalez larez
content: The equipment worked for a couple of months, it started or failed because it could not connect to the network, shortly after, I realized that the battery level was below normal and that Nest 3G disconnects from the wifi and app to be able to manage its functions. thermostat with remaining battery charge. So until it was completely downloaded and I had to use the usb port to charge it directly to the electrical network. After that it began to have erratic behavior, I had to disassemble it, I cannot understand how a team that is the best seller has this problem that is recurrent and finally disappoints when you think you are acquiring a quality product, and it is not like that
title: consider another option !!!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gina J
content: WIFI quit working after one month.  This an extremely common issue with 3rd generation. Google Nest has no customer service phone number active.  Text to chat has been awful.  7 different people including supervisors. Even a Twitter complaint and constant messages and no new unit shipped. Delays and no assistance on resolution.  Excuses. Overall, a terrible experience and awful customer service.  Amazon my next call to see if they want to help their customers. Nest could care less.
title: Google Nest customer service is awful.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gary B
content: When they say it learns, it really does... but kind of like a puppy. Introduce any bad habits, and it's a little bit of a pain to get rid of them. Still, my Nest finds a sweet spot for the heating, and has saved us a few bucks this winter. Somewhat frustrating that it won't connect to my A/C, though (we had no A/C for a week until the HVAC pro found out that it won't work with our unit). So, before you commit to 100% Nest, look into that.
title: Good for the most part

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kristopher D. Penland
content: I was excited to receive this item in the mail, and immediately installed it!  Minus one minor hiccup during the installation process, it was easy to install.  Thankfully, the wire I had misplaced (wrong slot), due to my house's wiring (not the nest), was properly attached with the help of their phone support team.  I have begun enjoying the nest and its associated app, which are both high-quality products!  I haven't seen the cost savings from it yet, but most people say it takes some time to fully realize those benefits.  I love the hot & cold setting for North Carolina weather, and the ECO mode for when I'm away at work!!! The ability to do it ALL from my phone makes it even better!
title: Amazing product! Great for NC weather!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Fishinphool
content: So far so good!  I researched thermostat's until my eyes crossed, and Nest usually came out on top.  Besides that, we have friends and family members who have them so I had easy resources that could help if needed (and our kind friend did install for us, so that was awesome.)  It's the most expensive on the market, but I assume I'm getting what I paid for.  The quality, packaging, and interface reminds me of Apple products, so I was instantly impressed. A screwdriver was included so we didn't have to search the garage looking for the right size (very classy move.)  Time will tell if we remain as pleased as we are at this point, but I'm feeling pretty optimistic. Sorry my review isn't more "tech-y" but it's still quite new to us.
title: It has a pretty face :)

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Robert
content: Great product.  Installed in about 20 minutes, form unboxing to up and running (just be sure you tuck the wire in neatly so that you can press the Nest unit to access its menus). Nice to be able to control heating and cooling from the phone. The Nest's interface is very intuitive.  After about a week of using it, the Nest catches your pattern and automatically adjusts the thermostat schedule. The one thing it doe snot have that my Honeywell controller had was a fan re-circulation option.  This option would kick the fan on every 10 minutes or so just t keep the air in the house moving and the heating/cooling nicely balanced.  The Nest 3rd gen is a nice unit that we can recommend.
title: Good product.  Easy to use and easy to install.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: valerie k
content: It is a wonderful product and easy to use. I put the app on the iPhone and can program it while I'm in bed. No more getting up freezing cold to turn the heat up. It easily switches from heat to A/C. I can track the history and program it for various temperature and times during the day. If I forget to turn it off, I can change the temperature from my app on the phone while away. My only complaint is the customer service stinks. We had some trouble at first getting it set up and called customer service. They did not call us back. Finally we figured it out ourselves. If you have a 2 stage heater, you need to make sure you have the latest model of Nest. The earlier model will not work with 2 stage heater.
title: Top of the line.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gary Blouin
content: This is my 3rd Next Thermostat but my first 3rd Generation version. My heating system went out around Thanksgiving 2017 and I had to replace both the furnace gas valve and my 2nd generation thermostat. In general, I really like the Nest Thermostats due to their eco / auto away, and learning abilities. I was surprised how much improved the 3rd generation thermostat is compared to the 2nd generation. The 2nd generation thermostat was great but the clarity, details and information that the 3rd generation provides easily beats the 2nd generation thermostat. I still have a 2nd generation thermostat in on my first floor and it just looks old and doesn't seem to respond as quickly as the 3rd generation. Overall though, I think (for the most part), the guts of the system are the same (with few exceptions) but the face lift is excellent. Yes, I would like to  upgrade my 2nd generation but don't see myself spending the money simply to upgrade it since it's still doing a great job. When it does fail or I simply decide to upgrade, I will definitely pay the few bucks more for the 3rd gen (or latest gen) vs. the 2nd gen.
title: Visually, Lots of Improvment Over the 2nd Generation Nest Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kat
content: I purchased the Nest thermostat because I knew a friend that had one, and he had told me how much money he saved since he purchased it. I had this professionally installed (I had to get my system checked anyways), but I also assisted in the process. The wiring is relatively easy to install, and appears to be compatible with most A/C systems. I gave this a 4 out of 5 stars only because I felt as though the price was high, and I found it cheaper at Home Depot a little while later. Nonetheless, this product is easy to install, the app makes this product super easy to use and it has saved me already over $70 in my electricity bill. I am incredibly happy with this product.
title: Super Convenient!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Becky J. Welter
content: This Thermostat was recommended to me by my son-in-law. My daughter and her husband have had their Nest Thermostat for at least a month and already feel that it's saving them energy cost. Mine was just installed 2 days ago and so far so good. The installation took less than 30 mins. I hired the installation done by my heating and cooling person who is familiar with this type of thermostat but had never installed a Nest. He was very impressed from the moment he opened the box and loved that there was a tool of nice quality included for installation. It's an investment, and I'm hopeful it will pay off in savings for us.
title: New Nest Learning Thermostat, 3rd Generation Owner

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Konichua
content: Purchased to replace previous thermostat about 3 days ago.  Also purchased 2 year warranty just in case.  Installation was approximately 15 minutes (includes all materials). Also includes plastic white wall plate (as seen in pic). Turn the dial counter clockwise (left) to decrease the temperature. Turn the dial clockwise (right) to increase the temperature. Downloaded the app,  created account,  now the temperature can be controlled from the cell which is awesome! Others in the home can also download the app for use.  Works with Amazon Alexa or Google assistant.  Very pleased with this device overall. The motion sensor illuminates the device upon approach which is also awesome! No more guessing the temperature/humidity. Can't wait for the Nest to "learn" our temperature preferences.  Definitely recommend!!
title: Love the Nest learning 3rd gen!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Awesome Guy
content: Love NEST items. Have them all throughout my house.  Installation is a breeze as they give you most of the material that you will need. I had no issues removing an old thermostat and replacing it with us. It comes with a little screwdriver to get your wires off of the old thermostat. Because of the mounting of my old thermostat, I had to use the back plate. If you do not have to use the back plate, it gives it a smooth, modern appearance. Once you're connected and ready to go you connected to your network and it is easy from there. You will need to download the NEST app for it to work. The white looks great!!
title: Would Buy Again!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Iceman
content: A step up from the average programmable and I was able to get a rebate out of this thing from my gas company because of it. Pros:  Smart phone operation.  I can turn on the fan or adjust tempurature from the comfort of my Lazy Boy.  I can also turn the heat way down while out of town and turn it on with my phone a couple hours out for a warm house when I get there.  7 day programability is also a plus.  I think I have seen some reduction in my heat bills.  Not much but a little. Cons:  I found the auto away function difficult to use.  It would depend on layout but my thermostat can go a number of hours without someone passing in front of it.  Thus, the house would get cold with plenty of people on the other side of the wall.
title: Nice thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tbone
content: It was super easy to install, setup, and to operate. Has significantly cut my heating bill. I love being able to set the Eco mode from my phone when I forget to set it before I leave home. My only complaint is it will not work with Apple HomeKit or Siri. Still works on your iPhone and iPad you just have to download the Nest app, which is easy to use.  I’d love to be able to tell Siri to change the temperature without having to go to the app. Come on Goggle make your product compatible with all devices not just your devices.
title: Great Product I love my Nest but does not work with Siri.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sara
content: I got this on Black Friday for an awesome deal plus both my utility companies (gas & electric) gave me a $50 rebate so it made it super cheap. I am so happy with this purchase. I love that it detects when we’re out of the house and drops the temp to eco mode saving us money. I am able to adjust the temperature from anywhere and see a history of when it kicked on during the day. It was a much needed and perfect addition to our smart home!
title: LOVE!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: K. L. Carr
content: I bought this so I could use the smart features, especially when away from the house. However, the only way to access it through the app is through my email with my email password. This I refuse to do so I am unable to use it as I wished.  Unfortunately, I didn’t find this out until I installed one of the thermostats and it is now too late to return the three that I bought. So, I am stuck w three, expensive, programmable thermostats. 🤨
title: Unless you want to share your email PW, don’t buy these thermostats!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Nate
content: I installed this thermostat several months ago, and it has broken the circuit board inside my Goodman furnace (twice), resulting in over $600 in repair costs. The HVAC technician and the furnace manufacturer have told me the cause of this is the lack of the C wire on my furnace installation. According to Nest's documentation, > If your current thermostat doesn't have a wire in the C terminal: the Nest app won't tell you to connect one. **Do not connect a C wire to your Nest thermostat unless the Nest app tells you to.** The Nest app never told me to connect a C wire, so as instructed, I did not. The furnace ran find for a few weeks, then the furnace started having problems requiring a manual reset every few days. Then it was every day. Then the furnace stopped working. The furnace technician replaced the circuit board and the furnace worked fine again for a few days, but then started failing. Same problem. So, I'm out $600 in furnace repairs and have an unusable "smart" thermostat.
title: Thermostat caused $600 in damages to furnace's internal circuit board

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RandyOfTheRockies
content: I am very disappointed in the nest. We were very excited to be able to control our thermostat from our phones and use the learning technology to automatically adjust the temp in our home. From the first moment we put in on the wall, we had a horrible experience. Its attempts at being easy to use actually introduce a lot of frustration. For example, you use the ring around the end to scroll to various options and enter letters/numbers for configuration. It tries to be 'smart' and enter the number you stop on even though you haven't pushed the button to select it, which is unexpected and results in you entering letters twice. However, it doesn't do it every time, about half the time, which makes it even more confusing. To make matters worse for us, it restarted 4 times while we were trying to enter the setup information, and lost ALL the information we had so painstakingly entered every time. Once we got it configured, we thought we were set. However, once the nest turned our furnace on, it didn't turn it back off again. It kept the furnace running for hours until our house was 7 degrees warmer than we had set it on the thermostat. Even turning it off didn't work. We had to physically remove it from the wall before the furnace would shut off. This happened 4 times. We tried everything because we really wanted it to work, but in the end had to come to terms with the fact that the nest is in fact, a POS. Don't waste your money.
title: Horrible interface, and doesn't work

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ROCC0
content: This Nest is smarter than I am.  It knows everything that goes on in the house!!  Lights up when you walk by it so you see the large temperature readout..then it "remembers" how ofter you are away from  the house and adjusts for  that.  I also have its app on my smart cell phone, and can adjust every thing from anywhere! It is as sleek looking as it is smart.  I'm so glad my old Carrier one broke on a  120 deg. day here in the desert!!
title: This thermostat is absolutely worth every bit of its price - which is NOT cheap!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jerry Rutherford
content: These are just AWESOME! In addition to being able to read them when I don't have on my glasses... my Alexa (Amazon Echo Dot) can connect with them. I have two... UPSTAIRS and DOWNSTAIRS. So if I'm sitting downstairs and the AC comes on because it's hot upstairs... but nobody is there... I can just say "Alexa, set upstairs to 80 degrees" and I get "OK". Never have to get out of my chair! And if that isn't enough... I get a monthly report on how my energy use is compared to others in the area... so I know if I'm wasting energy or not. Dude... I'm living in the future...
title: The Future is NOW !

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: BP
content: Easy to install and looks decent on the wall. It began learning immediately and in less than a week it was controlling the HVAC system as I planned. It turns the heat down at a set time everyday and turns it back up before I get up in the morning. It shows me I am saving energy with the green leaf...and shows me how much energy I am using. Will no doubt help me save energy and money. Would definitely buy again
title: Worth it!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Duff
content: This thermostat is a total waste of money.  It does not keep the temp even b/c there is no differential!  It gets 3* cold before the heat turns back on.  It gets up to the temp you want, then gets 3* cold again.  I have to keep adjusting it all day to keep the house warm. Same goes for the AC.  Surely they could have included a differential in the software for this Nest!  I'm going to take it out as it's useless!!!  Cheap wall thermostats work way better!
title: No differential

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Thankgod4gravity
content: I am very satisfied this with Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation in stainless silver. The is a well designed and well made product. The instructions about the installation and usage posted on the Website is well-written and illustrated. The installation is very easy. I thought I need extra tools but I was wrong. All I need are the screws and the screw driver included in the package. I don't know how others could complain about the installation process but I removed my old thermostat and install the Nest Learning Thermostat within 15 minutes. I also need to use the plastic wall plate and the metal caddy included. I followed the step-by-step programming process and had no issues at all. It does what it is designed to do.This thermostat also could work with Simplisafe security system. After the integration process, Simplisafe could display the current temp in the online dashboard. And Nest thermostat can inform the alarm system to set the Home or Away status.  I am also looking into other Nest products like cameras, door bell and security system.
title: Installed and programmed in 15 minutes

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chris Rock
content: Overall this is a good thermostat. It looks good, install was easy, and it works well. However, the big selling point, that this is a "learning" thermostat, doesn't seem to work for us. We turn the heat down to 62 every night when we go to bed, and turn it up to about 65 when we get up. However, every night, the thermostat sets itself to 67 degrees in the middle of the night, causing our bedroom to get too hot. At least we can turn it back down to 62 degrees with our phones, instead of having to get out of bed and go downstairs to the thermostat. Pretty much every night it does this around 0200, and again around 0400. We finally turned the learning feature off, but that is part of the reason we paid extra for the learning function.
title: The learning function doesn't work

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: vet399
content: I'm a licensed mechanical engineer. My home has upper and lower separate HVAC systems.  Two Nest units shipped. After the 30 minute install, my downstairs HVAC system was malfunctioning. After 6 to 8 hours of trouble shooting, I finally determined the Nest base to be defective. The base was shorted that resulted in the ‘Y’ short immediately upon the thermostat mounting on the base. The defect was invisible and affected the control wiring of the HVAC system. Bad quality control on this unit. Sorry I purchased the product.
title: Bad quality control on this unit

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Pete
content: Awesome thermostat.  Be aware that there are a ton of features and options.  Read the instructions and information on the Nest website.  That will help you determine what will work best for you.  Don’t be afraid to ask your HVAC installer if he/she has installed these before.  If they have not, then make sure to provide them with the install instructions.  As is true with all electronics - they must be wired correctly!!!!  Most installers have trouble with this even though the instructions seem easy to follow to me.
title: Awesome Thermostat!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ATDODD
content: *Update* I received the replacement for the original and it is missing the same freaking part! Both missing the base plate that the display connects to. Bought used to save $30, I've had great experience in the past where new or like new items arrived. This however had a broken face (missing part of the glass entirely) and the wiring plate was missing so it's impossible to install. No quality control apparently on used items. Now I have to wait a week to receive a replacement, when the whole reason I bought this was because our thermostat went out.
title: Bought used, arrived missing key part and broken.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mary Awsumb
content: I absolutely Love this i dont have to lock up my thermostat anymore i can with my smart phone get the house cool NOW from anywhere if the kids call and say i'm hot or cold i can change it while i am at work I have a lock number to keep it so no one can change it. it also can tell if anyone is home or not and learns when to put heat or cold on it has saved me money because it has a setting to economy, knowing when it is hotter and will automatically work
title: keeps the children's hands off thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jesus M. Rodriguez
content: So far so good. Installation was trivial and well documented. They even included a high quality screw driver. I was fortunate that I didn't need the mounting plate which makes it look ugly in my opinion. Usage is pretty easy, need to lower the temperature? rotate to the left. Need to raise the temperature? rotate to the right. Need to select an option on the screen, press on the thermostat, it acts like a button. The Android app was easy to setup as well, you can control the thermostat from your phone both at the house and away. I have not yet tried the iOS app, I'm going to assume it's similar. As far as saving energy and money, I haven't noticed yet since it hasn't been long enough. To be honest, I bought it more for the look and convenience than any actual savings.
title: Easy install, looks great, very easy to use.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: The Technological Consumer
content: The centerpiece of my Nest home automation system.  To think, some time ago people use to have to manually get up to change the temperature thermostat in their homes.  Now, I can just speak a few words to Alexa and my furnace or AC kicks into gear.  I have never had any internet connectivity issues with this unit.  The installation was simple.  I just followed the instructions and hooked the corresponding wires from the central airflow system into this unit.  The packaging was nice.  The price was also pretty reasonable with a well timed purchased and a couple pretty sizable rebates from my gas and electric companies.  Can't imagine living without one of these smart thermostats.
title: Must have.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Frank Kempf
content: Incredibly easy to set up - connected 5 wires to the color coded thermostat hub and the hard part was done! Then, you set up the device with the programming included in the device. You can then use your computer to program finer detail - also used the IPAD app which worked flawlessly. I set it up to use Alexa to verbally adjust the temperature - I can control the thermostat from the comfort of my living room sofa.  THIS WORKS GREAT and was awesomely easy to install and set up - probably took me an hour  to set up on IPAD, Alexa, and my PC. -
title: easy to set up and great software controls

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: John Lege
content: Only buy this if you want to be disappointed ! Worked great for four months then stopped working . Nest said they opened a ticket on it but it has now been six days since the said that . Worst customer service EVER .
title: Worst customer service
