product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: McArthudw
content: What can I say but Wow! This Thermostat is just awesome! You can check and change the temp in your home from anywhere using you Smart Phone!  Better yet, it will learn how you want your house temp to be!  At work and no one is at home in the summer? Just turn the air up in the morning before you go to work. Want the house to be nice and cool when you get home, just turn the temp down from you phone before you leave work. Do this at the same time for two weeks, and the Nest will learn the pattern and do it automatically!  I love this Thermostat!!
title: Great Product!  Well worth the Price

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jay F.
content: Easy to install take the time to look at all of the literature before you do your installation .  Read all of the installation instructions before you start so you don’t run into the problem that I ran into when I let my unit do it’s own thing and it defaulted to Russian which I had to call customer support to help me get it re-programmed.  How’s it it’s programmed in English it works very well five stars love it
title: This thing is awesome

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Timothy Wernicke
content: Our thermostat went out and I had been planning to upgrade to a Nest for some time.  I'm glad that I waited for the Gen 3 as it installs and sets up very easily.  The quality of the integrated software is excellent and the actual unit feels solid!  We'll see how much we save as it learns our home.
title: I'm glad that I waited for the Gen 3 as it ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MartinM
content: I put this at my lake home that is mostly VRBO and Airbnb used.  It goes into echo mode and saves money plus I can change temp remotely if no one is at the lake home.  The biggest reason to write this is for the 5star tech support.  Installing is very intuitive but heat pump ACs are a different animal. I took a picture of prior wiring with old thermostat and sent to Nest Google and they sent me the correct connection pictured above.  Thanks Nest
title: Excellent tech support 👍👍👍👍👍

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jamie DeSimone
content: The house is much more comfortable and worry-free. We don't adjust the temperature of the house anymore, Nest has learned when we like it warmer or cooler and adjusts itself. It sets itself to a very low temp in the winter when we are both out of the house. I like that I can open the app on my phone and turn the heat on while I'm on my home, so the house is a comfortable temp when I arrive. It can be controlled via Amazon Echo, but it is a little clumsy. I REALLY like the fact that it knows whether to heat or cool; I don't have to switch the thermostat anymore. It also controls our whole-house humidifier; keeping the humidity above the level that I set.
title: Smart homes are smart

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rick Deckard
content: Functionality is great. Looks good and (when it works) is nice. However like a lot of people, i received a bad unit. The battery keeps saying that its low and shuts down. When I looked this up, i saw that it was a common problem. I had to go through the hassle of calling nest and trouble shoot and eventually they ended up sending me another one, which now i have to send back this one. I really dont understand why you have to charge this when its connected to electricity. Very bad design on that part.
title: Poorly made product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mark McWaters
content: Three lengthy support sessions took multiple hours each. Second session finally diagnosed a faulty base. Took a week to replace it. Again, the thermostat failed to cool my home. More tech support. No resolution. I reinstalled my old Honeywell and it worked like a charm....But the wasted time took me beyond the 30-day return date. I am stuck with a $223.00 piece of high-tech garbage. Amazon gives me no options. Google says "Not our problem."
title: Buyer Beware! Nest Learning Thermostat DOES NOT WORK!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Katherine A. O'neill
content: This is absolutely the best thermostat I have ever purchased!  Instructions are idiot proof, and we installed in a 40 year old house on a 20 year old system.  Up and running in less than 30 minutes, apps installed on all phones.  Wonderful to go to your phone before you get out of bed and turn up the heat or turn down the ac 30 minutes before you get home to cook dinner.  There is only one change that I would make and that would be to be able to personally set your  "cool/heat" temps manually rather than their automated settings.
title: BEST!!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: lsdav
content: Bought this as a gift for my husband, but really for me, for Christmas.  He said the install was really easy and had it in fairly quickly.  I know nothing about wiring and thermostat installation, so I can't provide any specifics here.  We started "teaching" Nest our times and temps, and it seems to have picked up on the schedule within about four days.  The nice thing is, if you feel like it's chilly, just turn the dial and she'll warm up the house.  Once the Nest has been installed for a few days, you can look at the schedule it has set up, and then adjust accordingly very easily. Example, the weekday warm up is set to start at 5:00 am, which is what it had for the weekend too.  I went to the schedule, moved into the weekend, found the 5:00 am start, pushed in on the dial and had options to change, cancel and something else.  Move the dial to the new time and a new temp, press in again, and it's set.  Super easy. It has an ECO mode and will drop into eco mode if it doesn't sense that anybody is home.  So if you are out running errands for the day, the Nest may drop into this mode to save you money on hearing (or AC) when you are away.  If you have the app on your phone, you can tell it to warm or cool the house from anywhere you have cell service, assuming you have wi-fi at your home and have Nested it up! The hubby said that when he installed it, the Nest seemed to pick up on the type of furnace we had.  Kind of creepy that it knows, but again, apparently made for easy set up. If you just want to run a whole house fan without heat or AC, like when temps are mild and you want air circulation, the Nest can do that too, or so we think for now, it's 21 degrees today so the heat is on!
title: So far, so warm!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jcg878
content: This thing is wonderful. I love being able to change the temperature from my phone in our bedroom instead of getting up to change it downstairs. It was also nice to turn up our thermostat as our plane landed so our house would be pleasantly inviting when we returned home on a trip this past winter. My only complaint is that since our thermostat is in our dining room, it often believes that we are not home when we are (since who goes in a dining room?). I would probably install it in the foyer if I was doing it again, but I just replaced the old thermostat. I think Nest could fix this with an updated app that tells the device that your phone is on the same wifi network, so I'll hope they think of that. Alternatively, we could turn off "auto-away", but right now we are continuing to walk the line between "cold annoyance" and "maximum dollars saved".
title: Love it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kyndra
content: I don't know why we waited so long to buy one of these. The main reason we got it was so that we could lower/raise the temp when we weren't home during the day, saving on our electricity bill in the summer and our propane in the winter. It was a little bit of a doozy to hook up. Our original system is from the 80's and it took many tries to get some of the wires to hook up to each other. We're very happy with our purchase.
title: Love this.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JMMorton
content: I bought this thermostat because I thought they looked cool and figured it would help save some money since the schedules around the house are extremely erratic. It does a job for the most part and installation was easier than other thermostats I've installed in the past. As a side note, don't use this to prank your significant other. We have a 2 story residence and I figured it would be hilarious to turn the heat up while she was watching TV upstairs. Now my thermostat randomly cranks itself up at strange hours.
title: A strange experience

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Wes Duncan
content: Installed this on my 30+ year old Carrier central air/furnace. Wiring was easy except that my unit requires a jumper between RC and RH and putting 2 wires in 1 hole was not possible with the gauge of wiring I have. So I had to splice in and scale down in order to accommodate. Love the features and convenience. One thing I have noticed since running the air conditioning is that the outside condenser unit will cycle the compressor on and off while running. The condenser fan continues to run. The Nest must be doing this because it never did it before. Should save some energy, but not sure about wear and tear when starting up more often now.
title: Great addition, love the features

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kross Hamilton
content: Couldn't be happier with this thermostat. I love the aesthetic look it achieves as well as its usability. Controlling the thermostat from the phone is easy and like the features it comes with. Installation is easy, especially with the video that is uploaded by the manufacturer.
title: Awesome piece of tech

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tommy Jordan
content: After forgetting that my heat was on for two months upstairs and wondering why my downstairs AC was working so hard, I finally bit the bullet and bought a second one for upstairs. I should have done that when I found out I loved the first one. They're easy to install if you're at all technically inclined, and very easy to program. They're also VERY easy to setup with Alexa, so my entire house's thermostat system is now voice controlled, even when I'm away from home.
title: Easy and works great. This is my 2nd unit

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sparky
content: Obviously there are tons of reviews on this item. I have had zero issues with the unit after close to 3 months. The away function when all phones have left the house works every time which beats my upstairs unit where I have to manually do it on the app. The only major flaw is that you cannot do a temporary override of the temp. Well you can but it will change to the schedule at the next scheduled time. Worse it may learn that new temp change if you do it often and put it in your schedule. Much has been written on this, so I'll leave it at that. It would be nice if you could override the temp and select until next schedule or until canceled without learning.
title: Worse it may learn that new temp change if you ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: TJN
content: I'm loving my NEST thermometer. I've been thinking about it for a long time because the old one was very hard to use (especially the scheduling feature). PLUS, I've gotten rebates from both the electric and gas company. Even with the HVAC company's fee to come and install it (NEST provides instructions and a video but I'm not very handy so I didn't want to risk it), my total costs were minimal because of those rebates. We can easily change the temperature on the dial, browser or app. If I forget to change it before going away for the day, it's just a couple of swipes on my app and the temp is set to "away," saving me money and energy. The NEST definitely lives up to its "hype."
title: Why did I wait so long?

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Robecca Schermett
content: This was a Christmas present for my husband for some reason it’s running my furnace on stage 2 if it keeps running on stage 2 only it’s going to cost us money not save us money my husband was looking at it for a year so when I saw it cheap enough I thought it would be a  excellent gift. I will update my post if there are any changes.
title: Very disappointing

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: YMR
content: I bought the thermostat in 2016.  I had a problem in September when my air conditioner started to cycle on and off.  The cycle would consist of two minutes running and about three minutes restarting.  I thought I had a problem with a fan motor.  My AC guy said that there were problems with Nest and I should replace that.  I installed my old setback thermostat, replaced the fan motor and everything worked well.  A week or so later I installed back my Nest and continued to run perfectly.  On January 1, 2018 my heater started to cycle suspiciously the same way as the AC in September.  We had one of the coldest days of the winter season and our house temperature started to drop.  No HVAC people were available on January 1, so I decided to replace my Nest again.  I installed the old thermostat again and had no problems since then.  I wrote to the company, telling them about it.  I don't have a problem with Nest thermostat failing in a year and a half.  I have  a problem with the company ignoring my message to them.  I offered to send them the device just so they could see what is wrong with it.  No answer.  My colleague uses Honeywell WIFI thermostat.  I am buying that next.  It is disappointing that Nest did not even acknowledge my message.  I did not ask for anything.
title: Clean and Contemporary at first, fails a year and a half later.  May ruing your AC and furnace.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ryan
content: According to my old thermostat, the temperature my wife and I like it was 74 degrees Fahrenheit. I installed this Nest thermostat and set it to 74, and all of a sudden my downstairs became an iceberg. I kept bumping it up, it's now set to '78' and it feels like the 74 we are used to. There is no way to calibrate the sensors, I tried restarting the device as was advised online, but to no avail. I have a separate control for my upstairs, which is still using an old honeywell thermostat. It is set to 78 during the day(since we don't go upstairs during the middle of the day) and it feels like a furnace when I have to run upstairs. Google Nest, what good is it having a supposed '10' temperature sensors in the device, if it can't figure out the actual temperature in the room accurately? Need a way to calibrate the device.
title: The temperature sensor is WAY off

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: mschn100
content: I bought 2.  One went on a thermostat for a gas furnace and the other on a heat pump.  Furnace was no issue.  Heat pump looked like no issue but their install process guide on their app said it required a pro.  Paid $100 for a pro to come out who told me we wasted $100 because he was just plugging in the same wires plus one extra.  Not sure what they think a pro is needed for.  Works really well and our utility sent us a check for $75 each once I had them installed so that helps.
title: Convenient temperature conteol

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Zachary B.
content: We’ve had nothing but problems with our nest since we moved into our newly built house. The “learning” feature was nothing but a pain in our rear ends, it would shut off for hours in the summer. Now when it’s -6 out we wake up with our newborn and 2 year old to a 62 degree House. The nest turned off and was not producing heat. I took the nest off and put the original thermostat on and guess what!?!? Heat immediately came out.
title: Nest is terrible!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jason M. Halbach
content: Way cool!! Never had an installation that was so easy!! This thing was designed for the user.. it's functional and the installation was way easier than I've ever experience with something supposedly geared to the customer.. The WIFI interface and setup too, are just plain cooll You couldn't ask for a more user friendly interface. I replaced an electric company thermostat that they quit supporting. They not only stopped updating, they stopped the server. I could no longer use the WIFI interface, which was why I got it in the first place. I begged for a replacement, but they said "CHA CHING!!" I have since changed electric provider, and with this Nest, by bill has dropped more than three quarters.
title: Designed for the user

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kfer
content: Overall- I like the smart thermostats.  They work well.  I have 4 of these.  The reason for my low score with Alexa is because she only recognizes 2 out of my 4 thermostats.  I tried rebooting everything and adding and removing the WiFi, everything, and still it only see the same two thermostats.  I emailed amazon and they didn’t help with the situation.  I ended up replacing my Echo Show for a Google Hub, because of it.
title: Thermostat is Great! Doesn’t work Well with Alexa

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: LaurieH
content: I got two of these and had a profession HVAC person install them.  After 2 weeks, the nests went offline (not connected to app), and I spent severals hours on the phone with technical service to restore service with no success.  Based on the information they shared, they believe the reason was because Nest thermostats are not compatible with Verizon Fios routers (one of the largest internet service providers in the country).  So, if you have Verizon, do not get Nest unless you want to also buy a compatible router. We got these thermostats to be able to set them at a distance.  We're very disappointed.
title: Not compatible with Verizon

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tia
content: We love the nest thermostat. We had one upstairs in the bedroom and we bought one more for the downstairs. It is expensive but it will pays for it self when it uses all the features like auto-away to save energy. I love that I can control from my phone and make it turn On when we are coming back from a long vacation to find the home nice and warm. The con is that the downstairs one is placed in our formal living room which I am not using as much so it senses auto-away and goes on off mode which I have to remember to walk around there to not let that happen. Yes its true we can switch off the auto away feature but I like it as when I am truly of the house and it saves energy. One other strange thing that had happened last year with the upstairs one is that it had automatically turned on to the highest heat setting and I was shocked to see the room temperature very very high without any of us programing it or even touching it. I was thinking that may be my son was playing with my phone and must have done by mistake but then I kept my phone away and still it happened 3 times in that week. Than it started functioning normally may be they must have updated the software or somehow it got fixed on its on and is been working great for us since then. Overall we are very happy with it and will recommend it to all.
title: We love the nest thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Horst
content: Michigan winter are aweful and my furnace would kick on every ten minutes. I calculated my furnace was running 12 hours a day at least. With the Nest it's never ran more than 7 hours. Installation was easy if you watch a few videos before hand. I had to opened up furnace and connected an open wire(not used) to the white common first. Then connected all of my other wires based on the diagram, only issue was where to put red(R1 or R2) which has 2 connections. Of course I connected to the wrong post the first time, but the Nest is forgiving. Setup took minutes, but both Heat and Cool functions are running well. I like seeing how much time the furnace kicks on everyday and being able to remote to turn up, on or off my furnace. Plus I got $100 back from Consumer and $50 from DTE.
title: Glad I upgraded.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: W. L. Culbertson
content: This product does what it ways it will do, but it is harder to use than it needs to be. Here an elegant design has taken precedence over all. It looks good, and it seems to work well. However, the software is clumsy and inelegant. The setup and control instructions are maddeningly cryptic. I know what my schedule is—the thermostat doesn't have to learn it. But, the manual setup was not easy. Who knew there was a copy/paste function on the schedule? I still haven't done the research to figure out how to control the fan. For some reason I don't seem to be able to find the "automatic" setting again. I recently installed a Honeywell internet thermostat at our other home. The controls on this unit were very straightforward and obvious. Granted, it actually looks like a thermostat, but it's cheaper and easier to use.
title: Not As Usable As It Should Be

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alex Yakauleu
content: I bought it to control temperature of 2nd floor of my house from 1st floor. And it very comfortable to use. But, as it is a learning thermostat, it tried to decide best temperature for me itself. One night I wake up because of too much heat. I had to turn off all learning features and control temperature myself now. Anyway a good quality product. For 1.5 month of use had only one wifi disconnection
title: Good quiality

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MetalPenguin
content: I like the design a lot. It actually amplifies the room and the motion sensor is pretty great to. It has various features for display and looks crisp. It can really elevate an appearance of a room. Apart from aesthetics, it works pretty good. My previous thermostat would use to heat more like 2 or 3 degrees more and then would stop but this is pretty accurate. The app is cool and have smart features that are pretty handy. It really learns and sets temperature accordingly, considering outside temperature as well.
title: Glad I bought Nest Thermostat.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Stanley G Nalley
content: The Nest thermostat has good looks and high quality construction, but be aware of two important points: 1) connecting the device to your WiFi network can only be done through the device itself and 2) it does not support "long" WiFi passwords.  To enter your password, you rotate the wheel and click to select the characters in your password.  That method works fine for short passwords, but is tedious for longer passwords.  Setting up via the app would be easier, but it does not work that way.  Even if you are patient enough to enter your long WiFi password, it still won't work.  This Nest thermostat does not support "long" WiFi passwords.  I chatted with Nest support and they confirmed "long" passwords are not supported.  I did not ask what maximum supported length was.  My home network is a google WiFi mesh network which supports full-length WPA2 passwords.  As a google company, it would be nice if Nest products did the same.
title: Well-built, attractive device but no support for long WiFi passwords

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Amanda Duran
content: The product worked well for about 9 months and then disconnected from WIfI and went to a dark screen. Checked all connections at rear and they are fine seems to be the battery, should be an easy fix but even after buying the replacement battery And buying a special set of screwdrivers to disconnect the rear housing the screws are so tight I cannot get any off so I have a $ 230.00 plus thermostat that has failed after nine months and I cannot even get the screws out to change the battery should be better built and have better access to change that battery, what a disappointment!
title: Battery stopped working after just nine months

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Steven L Perez
content: This is a great product.  I purchased a Honeywell model before this one and ended returning it since it would not connect to the WiFi.  This one connected instantly and has been working great.  The auto learning is very cool, it set a schedule automatically after only a few days of use.  Bonus is tha it works with Alexa so I can increase or decrease temperature just by asking Alexa to do it.  Very happy with this product.
title: Awesome!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: HPR
content: As others note, this will pay for itself - eventually - but the convenience, technology and control are alone worth the investment.  This will in fact learn your patterns and adjust accordingly - which can also be modified as needed.  It can be controlled from anywhere, and the additional sensors for other rooms that feed data to the thermostat make it even more productive.  4 stars because, while I installed it quite easily, we had to add a common wire to make it work (our home is only several years old and we were told by a nest pro that many homes will need this) which is a potential additional expense.  Also, the home/away recognition via cell phone is spotty so far - but the other features outweigh these issues.
title: An Meaningful Investment - For a Meaningful Upgrade

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Joe O.
content: If you have or are planning to make your house a smart house then you need one of these thermostats!! Came in a very nice box and extremely clear directions on how to install it and set it up (There was even a screwdriver in the box!) took me about 15 min to install and another 10 to set it up to the wifi and set all my preferences. It has a built in rechargeable  battery incase the power goes out and I cant stress enough how much money I have saved since installing it. You can control it from your phone while you are away from the house and it will automatically sense when you are not home and set your temperature to a economical setting saving you money! There are a lot of options out there for smart thermostats and mabye even some cheaper ones but this is a well built device with more features and easier to use than the others.
title: ... have or are planning to make your house a smart house then you need one of these thermostats

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: YL
content: I love it!! It does what it’s suppose to and so much better than our old thermostat! I’m just so glad my husband finally decided to get one after having issues with our old one for several years. I can see why it’s an issue for some who’s Nest is somewhere where they don’t walk pass often so the Nest can sense them to set a schedule for them, but doesn’t bother us. We love the ability to control the thermostat with an app too! It was also super easy for my husband to install and he’s not that handy so don’t even worry about that. Probably only 30 mins max for him to install the thermostat and set up the app.
title: Why wouldn’t you get it? It’s awesome!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Maseagoe
content: We enjoy having NEST thermostat. During the winter when it would be so cold, 5 minutes from the house I could raise the temperature so the house would be warm when we got there. Sometimes it is a bit confusing on how to do certain things but I google the info and nest provides and answer pretty much most of the time. It has become a good money saver for the seasons. Also did you know you can get a rebate from your water and power company as well as your gas company? Worth your time to do the rebate! we got 150 back!
title: Great eco control!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Eric C.
content: Looks nice, but it's an incredibly dumb device. Out of seemingly nowhere, the temperature control likes to go fracking nuts at 4am. Had to frequently troubleshoot my location/timezone (which is a frequent problem according to the internet). Had to reset because the time was always off. And never would one think that 36°C would ever be an appropriate setting. I'm sure my power bill has suffered greatly. If this is smart technology that Google has to offer, then I'd stay away.
title: Smart is dumb, manual settings please?

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sarah
content: We’ve had our nest for several months now and have really enjoyed it. First off it’s very easy to install. We are not very handy people and were able to have it up in running in under an hour. The other amazing thing is how great it is at sensing when you’re home and adjusting as needed. The app could use a little work but it’s functional and Alexa works great with nest as well. The only thing I wish is that nest had a function for you to let it know you have a pet at home. We went on vacation the coldest week of the winter and it set itself to “eco” which is what it’s supposed to do, it’s just that it dropped down into the 50s and we wanted it just a bit warmer for our Cat. Not a big deal to adjust remotely but would be a great software update.
title: Lives up to the hype

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J. Hough
content: I installed the Nest per their instructions, but the thermostat wouldn't turn on my furnace.  After 3 hours of chat with 4 different agents, multiple trips to turn the power off and on, the final conclusion was that the Nest was defective.  I had to reinstall my old thermostat.  Awful product.  Do not recommend.  Poor quality control.  Do not buy.
title: Poor quality control, defective product.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RdoDoc
content: This was a breeze to install and setup.  Had a question about one wire from my old unit. Called tech support and they were great to deal with over the phone. This unit is elegant in appearance and works perfectly with the app. After a year of unreliable Honeywell server outtages on my previous thermostat I decided to switch to the Nest. A little more money but well worth the price.  It even works on 5 GHz networks.  The other brands limit you to 2.4 GHz. I could not be happier.
title: The Best WiFi thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Barrootz
content: I bought this to replace an old Honeywell thermostat that was started to give me trouble. I am very happy with the nest thermostat. It does much more than my old one and I can do many things online with it including building a schedule, monitoring the humidity in the house and having the fan run when I wanted to. Having baseboard radiator along with central air conditioning all of these features are fantastic for me.
title: Awesome

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Robert Norman
content: What SEEMS simple based on their website and reviews turns out to not be the case. After an hour of of struggle and a few days of “kinda working” ( which I chalked up to it ‘learnimg’ )... turns out was a farce. It was kit connected correctly and was making my furnace click on and off repeatedly. After an hour long chat with their support - I’m told my 2 year old ( so basically new ) furnace is ‘not compatible’, despite taking their online quiz before purchase.  Their suggestion??! “Sell your Nest or buy a new furnace that’s compatible.” (No joke) Uhhhhh. I’m not buying a new $2,500 furnace to get your crappy piece of software to work-sorry Mr. Nest. Moral? I’m out $500+ including installation and now need a new thermostat Sometimes what is proported is be ‘easy and simple’ is the polar opposite. Beware and do your research!!!!
title: NOT easy to install...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: STEVEN LAHEY
content: I love everything but the learning function I’ll turn the temp down but then it will go up almost overriding me a little later because it learned previously that I liked it hotter the day before, the WiFi function is great change the temp in bed on cold morning from the app before AM showers or before you get home from work luv that! And when you walk by it gives you a cool night light to illuminate your way. The ghost in the house loves to use that feature also to freak me out at 330 AM but that’s just one of his many cruel scare tactics 👻
title: It’s a nice piece

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: C. Montgomery
content: Our Carrier Infinity system is only 5 years old and already had a digital/smart thermostat made by Carrier. So, I read about it on the Nest website. Nowhere do they warn it does not work with Carrier Infinity systems.  But, the Carrier Infinity thermostat was so bad I was determined to replace it. We eventually got the Nest working since the Carrier Infinity has a "Legacy" mode, but it required moving wires on the circuit boards of both the inside and outside AC units to convert our system to Legacy mode. It cost about $400 in technician time in addition to the cost of the thermostat. And be sure you have a thermostat wire with at least 6 conductors or that will have to be replaced also.
title: Not Compatible with Carrier Infinity Systems!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: David Tribble
content: I was apprehensive about the install.  It turned out to be almost effortless and I integration with Alexa took only a minute or so.  The heat/cool setting keeps the heat and cool temperatures at least 4 degrees apart, which I found annoying, so I have no difficulty putting it on Just Heat or Just Cool, but all the functions work as advertised.  I haven't had it long enough to assess the learning function yet
title: Not as bad as it looked

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bigusnicus
content: Oh my god I love this thing. I was always so skeptical of why anyone would want a wifi/smart thermostat, but I couldn't have been more wrong. I get being hesitant to pay $300 for a thermostat, but I got this on sale and with a rebate which brought it down to ~$100. If you can get this on sale or can afford it otherwise I can't recommend it enough. Before you get one though make sure you use the online tool from the company's website to make sure it will work for you. I would say for most consumers there shouldn't be an issue but it is an easy thing to double-check. That being said it was super easy to install, I'm not overly handy and even I got it all done in like 15-20 min. It takes longer for it to do its little setup when you turn in on for the first time than it does to install it. The set up and interface with the app are super straightforward and easy. Importantly, if your wifi goes out you won't be able to use the app, but he thermostat will still work. Finally, I live in an area that routinely gets triple digit summer days and winter days down in the single digits, temperature wise. I have been using this since like midsummer, and by letting run in eco-mode and such when I am not home it has cut my heating/cooling bills by 15-20%. And because it learns your schedule (or you can set up a schedule) my house is always at a comfortable temperature when I get home.
title: Was skeptical at whether it was worth it and couldn't have been more wrong. I can't recommend this thing enough. It's great.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Trevor
content: We really enjoy having this thermostat. I find that we don't use the 'learning' function as much because of the 'Eco' mode. When we're gone for more than a half hour it goes to 'Eco' mode and the temperature will adjust to your preset temperature so that the heater or AC (depending on the season) don't run as much. As soon as my phone hits the home wifi the thermostat switches out of 'Eco' mode and adjusts to a more comfortable temperature. It's also nice to adjust on my phone when I'm upstairs and want to cool it down before bed.
title: Love it!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: 69rebel
content: Bought this thermostat to partner with my nest protect smoke/CO detector on recommendation of fire safety expert. Replaced a non-programmable thermostat. Excellent installation instructions comple with job specific wiring diagram. Took me about 15 minutes to replace old thermostat and a about 15 mins to setup and connect with free Nest app. Have been using for 3 days and so far it appears more accurate than previous thermostat. Easy to use directly and remotely within app. Also works with my Echo. So far, I strongly recommend it. In addition to the functionality, it is very attractive hanging on my living room wall
title: Accurate and attractive and great functionality.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: John Doughtry
content: Extremely programmable and intelligent. I had another brand smart thermostat that I replaced with Nest. Energy use comparison between same calendar months from one year prior indicate at least 10% reduction of energy use, month after month. I’m not exactly sure why the Nest thermostat is better in energy management. I set the settings identically the same to the prior smart thermostat. Yet I’ve seen a clear trend that the Nest does a better job, somehow, in managing energy. The “away” and automatic “home” feature is a wonderful way to save energy as well. And the ability to check how things are remotely gives a sense of peace in knowing your home is not going through detrimental AC or heat failure while you’re away.
title: Better than I expected!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Just Some Dude Who Buys Stuff on Amazon. A lot.
content: I hated my builder grade thermostat that came with my new house so I purchased the Nest. I love its simplicity and how intuitive it is to use. It reminds me of how easy it is to just know how to use an iPhone. Which is funny since Nest is owned by Google. But I highly recommend this thermostat. I am not going to try and sell you on how much money this will save you in energy costs. I have only had it a couple weeks. What I can tell you is that it's cool looking, easy to use and I was able to install it myself and I am not known as Mr. Handy around my house. If I can install this in 10 minutes I promise you that you can as well. I loved it so much I bought another one as I have a two zone house. The app works great and I was able to connect them both to my wifi very easily.
title: I hated my builder grade thermostat that came with my new ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Abm
content: I am not that handy, particularly with anything that requires electrical wiring, but after another dad described the Nest as “idiot-proof”, i went online and started to research.  The online Nest guide to determine compatibility with my existing Honeywell thermostat was particularly helpful, with a 3-minute video, that shows you how to determine if the Nest should work.  I listed the 5 wires that i saw on my existing thermostat, and then was told that the Nest was compatible.  My primary aim in replacing the Honeywell was to have something tied in to my WiFi, that i could monitor remotely, and receive a warning if the temperature of the house had fallen (we live in New England, and got particularly nervous this winter when the temperature plunged in late December, while we were away).  I bought the Nest, and as advertised, it was very easy to install, and it worked, and still works well.  It also has a slick, clean design, and the online app is easy to use, so i was a happy customer.  Until last weekend (it has been working for about 3 weeks now), when i saw another dad that had installed one, and said that he had a problem with his Nest, associated with the amount of power it was drawing.  This feedback made me nervous.  Then i was in my basement, and i heard what sounded like short circuit sounds at my boiler.  There is an electrical box that was clicking, sending signals to the boiler, and the boiler itself was then clicking, and not turning on.  I thought that the heat might be off completely, as one of the zones seemed to be calling for heat, and the boiler seemed unable to turn on.  Eventually it did turn on, but i could tell that something in the wiring was wrong.  We called a contractor over, and it turns out the Nest needs a common wire, I think because the Nest draws a lot of power?  I don’t totally understand the issue with the Nest, but after a $300 repair bill, and the addition of a sixth wire, a common wire, the Nest seems like it should work now.  However, the online compatibility guide absolutely did not say anything about needing a sixth wire!  I think this is wildly false advertising, and with Nest owned by Google, i would expect more/better.  I had placed an order for a second Nest, which i just cancelled.  Evidently there is a Honeywell model, RTH9580, which ties into Wifi, and can be monitored online, without this power issue.  I’m so disappointed, and hope that other people don’t make the same mistake that i made.
title: WARNING: The Nest compatibility guide is misleading

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Capt Ron
content: Whoa...this is even better than I expected. Love being able to automatically control heat and A/C without manually switching between the two. Many, many feature including smart technology to save money when using HVAC . Set and forget. Straight forward install and controllable from my smartphone as well as at the thermostat. Many different back plates to cover holes from earlier thermostats. If this thermostat could cook I would marry it.
title: It does it all...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Andrew Lee
content: 2nd unit purchased Last month we bought a house with 3 stories (and 3 a/c units) and decided to update the thermostat. Never has the Nest before and thought we'd give it a shot. First one we had professionally installed and had used for about 2 weeks and we are very happy with it! The app could use some work, but overall we figured out everything we needed to. For our second Nest thermostat I installed it and I thought the instructions were very clear and it was quite easy to install. Encountered a small problem with install and the troubleshooting guide was spot on and I didn't even need to call the manufacturer. We travel frequently and we just love the ability to adjust the temp when away from home! So far, so good. I will try to update again after using them for awhile.
title: So nice we bought it twice!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chin Ping FANG
content: I am in fact not really qualify to rate this product but I had a trouble  experience to install this product by Amazon Home Service. The reason is that I use the Lennox high efficiency HVAC system with its own brand of thermostat which has  different wiring system to achieve the system efficiency. And most technicians not Lennox installer by trade won't be able to wire this system and by default any other none Lennox thermostat used will lost it's original efficiency design. Which means the Lennox system will not integrate with any other brand name device. This is the reason that Amazon Home Service had to come to my house two times without any success, And the Lennox dealer technician has to putt out the Nest device out and put the Lennox own brand thermostat to get the system work right. I wrote this rating just to remain people not any system can put the this device on and you can invite a lot of trouble to your system so check it out before you buy it. At least I leant the lesson now.
title: I am in fact not really qualify to rate this ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Prof100
content: Bought this when Amazon offered a $50 gift card so the net price was $200 and then the local power copy offers another $20 rebate.  Before buying I checked to see if the Nest thermostat was compatible with my heating and cooling system using the Nest website. You need to take the cover off your current thermostat and record where which wire is currently connected.  My system has four wires with a jumper.  Take a picture with your cell phone and go to Nest.com and open the compatibility utility.  It will let you know and provide a wiring diagram for the Nest to connect to your HVAC system. Installation is straightforward and took about a 45 minutes including spackling the old holes and touching up the paint.  I turned the power on and programmed it.  All is good. It takes 10 days to learn your desired temp pattern.
title: Easy installation and great support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DC
content: Best addition to my house yet! (Besides the Nest camera). I LOVE that it works with Alexa, too! I can simply tell Alexa to adjust the temperature, making me super lazy, but I am okay with that! The install was extremely easy. The hardest part was waiting 2 weeks for it to learn and for it to turn on on approach. I thought I had a defective unit until my brothers who also have this thermostat told me to be patient and wait until it is done learning. Magically, it started doing what I wanted it to. I do notice that it seems to turn on my AC at different levels and runs the fan extra. I've been watching my bills to see if it makes any difference compared to my old thermostat. It's too soon to tell.
title: Love my Nest!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Trinidad Aguirre
content: Simple to install, and no need to be a whiz to figure out how to use it. Download the app first, and follow the instructions on the NEST Unit, then a few min. later everything works... It took two days for it to figure out what time of day i want my temps to be set at.  And I dont have to tell the kids to adjust it, nor walk up there to adjust it.  Use my app from my room, couch, garage, or on the drive because I forgot to set it.  Happens right. But it knows already what Temp I want at what time of day. Morning, day and night. awesome. The Nest also, for some odd reason to me, the A/C just works stronger, and better.  It took a long time before, and I had to adjust in 2/3 degree incriments to get to the temp so as to not over work the units.  Now my house is where I want to be at all time...Crazy how this works, and crazy how freaking easy it is.  I just bought one downstairs.  Looking forward to installing and see where this goes as well.
title: Simple, Easy, Dumbless

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: My $0.02
content: The thermostat was easy to set up. It works well. My power company gave me a rebate, which made the actual cost of the unit <$50. The most important feature for me is the remote temperature sensing (extra hardware required), since my bedroom gets much hotter and colder than the hallway where the thermostat is. This device helps mitigate that temperature difference. Overall, I am very pleased with the device.
title: It does much more than I thought

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JayBo
content: Could not be happier after installing this yesterday. Kept an eye on its performance via the app. It is very stable. Installation was easy. But don’t forget to plan for wall repair or repainting if you are replacing a bigger unit.  I bought a matching wall plate too. -- Just bought a second unit for a rental property that we own -- bought it from an Amazon partner company -- used -- like new --- did not come with a manuaol -- but the videos from the website about installation make it simple...
title: Easy & Accurate

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: D. Rusk
content: Installed yesterday with a new 2 stage HVAC system.  Love the technology of this thermostat and the fact that I can control it with Amazon's Echo.  The Nest app is also a plus as I've found it easy to use.  Since I only recently installed it (well, my HVAC installer did) it hasn't learned anything about our schedule so it'll be a while before we get the benefit of the auto programming. A note about their tech support.  I had found support for our Nest cams to be excellent. Not so for the thermostat.  I used the chat feature to ask a very simple question about the Nest thermostat: how to you change the setting so that the fan only runs when the system is cooling or heating.  My installer had set it to run all the time.  The agent had no clue . While he was posting links to Nest help articles that has nothing to do with my question, I figured out how to do it.  When he asked for a photo of the wiring I told him I had figured it out so no need for a photo.  Did he ask me how to set the fan to only run when cooling or heating so he could help the next customer?  Nope!  He just asked if there was anything else he could help with.  I don't blame the agent, I blame Nest for not educating the agent.  Of course he could have asked me to educate himself. Fortunately, Nest has a lot of documentation on their site to help customers answer their own questions.
title: Who knew a thermostat could be so fun?!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sina
content: It's definitely a cool gadget to have. It has smart things that most other thermostats don't have and looks great. Setup is easy as well. When I ordered mine the unit was not booting up, hard reset didn't wake it up either so they asked me to get a replacement. This by it's own shows that these can fail easily. Now the 2nd one works although the temp that it sees as the room temp is always 2 degrees off. when it says 74 it's actually 72. not sure why. I don't believe there is any heat below it from the base either.
title: Cool but unreliable so far!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Greg McCabe
content: I set mine at 72F. No he wiz programming or learning. It is unable to hold one temperature. After going from sweating to sweater each day I checked online and a giant amount of customers have same issue. Troubleshooting has you put thermometers around nest, and that just made me more upset on how much I saw the temperature swings while set at 72F. I tried all different settings and after several weeks of trying to get it to maintain one temperature I just gave up. Worst performing thermostat I have owned. Check reviews off amazon, you are likely to have same issue. Troubleshooting help likes to blame customer for sun or shade or install location. I assume a lot of customers replace their standard $10 thermostat like I did. Same location, same sun and shade bit this device is not as good as tried and true $10 home depot thermostat. I spent so many days trying to set it up and get it working that I missed my return window.
title: 72+/-8F read off amazon reviews

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shawn M
content: This is the best thermostat I’ve ever had in my home. I originally purchased 1 of these just to see how I liked it before buying another for upstairs. After installing it and using for maybe half a day I immediately went on Amazon and purchased a second one for my upstairs. Very easy to install (pretty much self explanatory). I really like that you can lock the thermostat so the temperature can’t be changed by just anyone (like your kids while your not home). The app is great also. Buy it now you won’t regret it. Hit the helpful button if this review was helpful.
title: THIS IS A MUST HAVE IN EVERY HOME!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: P. Newport
content: Not only does it learn how you want the house to feel and when, it saves me money! Also, the local electric company offered a rebate program if we allow them to control it for us during peak demand. I've had the Nest for less than 4 months and it already has made back every penny I spent on it. Great purchase. I ended up having my HVAC guy install it for me, so not as easy for me to install as I had hoped, but not a big deal.
title: This thing is awesome!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: PH
content: This is the second time a Nest Thermostat quit working (I have a few) - in the middle of the coldest night of the year. First time it was an software error. This time the display said not enough power from the furnace - install a "C" wire. I am using this Nest for a couple years and now this error message . I replaced the Next with a Honeywell - and it work right away - without installing a "C" wire.
title: Functionality

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dr. Geek
content: Frankly, I am not saving a dime with this thing.  It is nice and cold when I get home, but it has been cooling the house all day when I was gone.  It thinks it has you figured out, but it doesn't know sh!t.  Impossible to set a schedule without it altering it to think it knows you better.
title: Tries to outsmart you

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bob
content: Easy to install.  Works great. Looks good. Update: I have 2 Nest Thermostats.  They are both configured identically as far as I can tell.  My bedroom thermostat seems to respond to more voice commands from alexa than my dining room thermostat .  For instance  I can set the temperature on both successfully like this:  "Alexa, set the <dining room / bedroom>  to 76 degrees".  However, on only one of them can I successfully specify a relative decrease:  "Alexa, please reduce the temperature in the <dining room / bedroom> by 2 degrees.  Bedroom works, Dining room does not.  Both devices are updated and running the same software version.  Both are in cool mode:  "dining room does not support that" but it works for the bedroom.  There are other differences also, like the ability to change mode on one but not the other.
title: Very cool product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gil B.
content: I love the Nest thermostats. They were designed extremely well with the end user in mind. Very easy, and Nest will walk you through the entire process from the moment you open the box until completion of setup. Maps are available to help with the wiring and make it extremely easy, and they include EVERYTHING you might need to complete the installation including a great screwdriver with both Philips and Flathead bits that stay in the holder magnetically. Everything about this thermostat was well-designed and thought out. A pleasure to install and operate. Ends up saving quite a bit of energy and money. Version 3 has improved on Version 2 by including a larger screen and a slightly thinner body, which are both welcome improvements. I would highly recommend this to anyone who owns a home or condominium unit. Worth the price.
title: I love the Nest thermostats

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Blabbernackle
content: We got a new ac unit and like the idiot i am i had to have the cool looking sleek Nest.  I could have had a thermostat included with my unit but i chose to pay another 250 bucks for this device. Another sham/scam on the people.  We have had it in our home now for about 9 months.  There is definitely a learning curve and I find I still need to just accept that the thing has a mind of its own.  Now I can't even set cool to heat from the device on the wall, my husband had to go on his phone to a make adjustments. I will just say, if you want easy and stressfree in your life , stick with a REAL thermostat..  (Frankly I miss the old simple mercury style thermostats) Definitely not another Big Brother device that continues to invade our lives!  Do you really need to get a monthly email letting you know how you compare to your neighbors regarding energy use?  Do you really need to earn little leaves to prove what an environmentally conscience person you are?  This reeks of BB and Borg mentality- precursor to the socialist society America is heading towards.  Save your money too! UPDATE: It has now over one year since we installed the Nest. I had to replace it at about the year mark because a nest tech determined that a sensor had gone bad. at least it was under warranty so no cost. Once the device was received we had to go through entire set up process. The tech had assured me it was a simple process so I thought we could get it done before dinner at the hottest point of the day. No! Almost an hour later and a phone call we had it working. Our issue  still not resolved, in a moment of desperation, we spent another 40 bucks on a sensor .  Found out the sensor is only accurate to three degrees when communicating with thermostat! Of course there is no read out, but the temp on the app rarely coincides with our desktop thermometer. We have resorted to manually tweaking our settings throughout the day. I still loathe this device.
title: it looks good and that's about it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: lilbubblesfairy
content: this thermostat was pretty great for a bit. Now it constantly wont connect to the internet, even though our internet works fine and has been checked with multiple devices. This means that we can access it by phone or alexa and even worse it wont follow the schedule meaning we are wasting money during the day while we are gone. My old programmable set worked better and was a quarter of the cost!
title: has major issues with connection just after 3 months

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Katie Doolin
content: My husband installed it quickly and easily, he's never installed one before. I love that I can adjust the temp from my phone or by using the Echo. We've been using it for almost a month now and I can already see from the history that it's not running all day like before. It monitors the weather and comes on/goes off when scheduled and convenient for us!
title: Loving It

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lawrence M.
content: i have used and installed several thermostats.  this one is the best i have ever seen.  others drift off the mark.  Not this one.  it is very intelligent and maintains the temperature in the home.  when it sees the temperature outside, and it sees the humidity in the home.  you could not ask any more.  this unit is over the top. i cannot wait to try some of their other products.
title: Exceeds all other thermostates

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Pooja
content: Sorry l didnt like the product at all. Its just fancy and sleek. It was not starting the AC most of the time, obviously in this case you gonna save money. It checks outside temp and based on that decides whether to turn on or off. Believe me for FL heat it doesnt work this way. I had to manually turn on the AC most of the times. Returned it.
title: Just fancy nothing else!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AKS
content: Owner of a new house that came with the old Honeywell digital white thermostat which funny enough the builder claimed is the latest and greatest on asking for Nest the builder said honestly buy it yourself we cannot mach Amazon's price we charge six times the price. Moving on seven months later on Black Friday picked up one to save money and enrolled in a promotion with the local power company which has partnered with Nest.  The install is very easy and simple I believe most can do it.. What is not great is the Nest installation booklet.  One major step Nest needs to add in the book after turning off the AC breakers in the electrical panel usually in one's garage is to check your attic for the furnace switches. (most new homes will have this in the attic). (This where most people installing the Nest will ended up with NO power detected to RC because you blew a fuse).  After you replace the blown fuse because the Nest booklet does not tell you the above information you will be good to go. Lastly from the HVAC company I know who showed me where the fuses are located:  Please teach the HVAC people how to operate the NEST. I had to teach the guy the functions they have no idea how the interface works because the HVAC companies are use to the Honeywell interface, and many people are moving to NEST.  My HVAC company was grateful I knew how the interface worked and how to reset the device when a wire is not detected. So if anyone from NEST reads these reviews please train the HVAC companies on how to use the NEST after they install it.
title: Great device will save you money easy to install but NEST needs to teach HVAC techs how to use the interface.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Richkev
content: I bought a Nest thermostat to replace an older thermostat for my downstairs unit. The reviews are all pretty positive about how easy it is to install and they are not wrong. The hardest part of installing the Nest thermostat was fixing the damage to the wall from the electrician who originally put in my old thermostat. It's amazing what they can hide under those old, boxy thermostats. I have my Nest connected to my wifi and love being able to set the temperatures remotely using the app on my phone. I also bought and installed another Nest for my upstairs unit. Same simple process. Very happy with my Nest  purchase.
title: Easy to install, looks great, works as advertised.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Liz
content: Not as easy as I thought it would be. We had a power issue which turned out to be a blown fuse on the a/c unit itself.  $200 later....  documentation for the nest is great but troubleshooting beyond that sucks.  Recommend you get smart on all the shutoffs for your unit. And find where the fuses are. It’s a $10 part but if you don’t know where it is, it requires an expensive visit from an hvac guy.
title: Know your hvac unit... or you will get to know it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: KT in Michigan
content: This thing is fantastic!  Very well made; easy to install and does everything it says will do.  The fitment guide on the website assisted with the purchase decision.  This company definitely has taken a play from the Apple playbook.  Excellent design, quality feel when holding, logical design, functionality (without reading the manual). My electric and gas utilities both offered rebates lowering the cost of the item significantly.  There are plenty of articles on this product.  Read a few before you but so you'll know whether it has features you want/need.  If you're in the market for a programmable thermostat, I give 2 thumbs up!!
title: Two Thumbs Up - easy install and simple to use.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Christin R
content: This is my second Google nest in less than a year as the first one stopped working with the App. Second one I received after going back and forth with Google support for DAYS!! Was a refurbished piece of junk.  I set my thermostat to 78° and it doesn't turn on until it reaches 80°!! Always 2 degrees off. This is the most recent reply that Google want me to do. It just gets worse with every reply. Could you turn the HVAC power off and remove the blue wire from the C connector? Push the blue wire back into the wall so that the copper tip doesn't touch any other wires. After that, turn the power back on and attach the display. Then, get the power readings by going to Settings > Technical Info > Power. Also, what's the make and model of your HVAC system?
title: Google is the worst. I do not recommend

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kevin C. Kenna
content: Can't tell if I like this or not. After following the instructions, I managed to knock out my whole central air system. The problem is that the instructions say to turn off the power to the A/C, which I did. What they don't tell you is that the 24V to the thermostat comes (or, at least, can com from) the furnace (circuit breaker labeled FAU for forced air unit on your breaker box). The instructions need to be modified with a test to ensure your system is properly turned off before proceeding with the install. What I suggest to anyone attempting to install themselves is to turn off what you believe is correct. If the thermostat(s) are blank (no display), you're good to go. If they are still on (some have battery backup), try to activate your air by turning the temperature up or down. If nothing then happens, good to go. Look for BOTH A/C and FAU on your breaker box. If you find both, turn both off. I'm sure I'll love this once I can escape the nearly 100° heat sans air conditioning expected while I wait for a tech to come out and put things straight. Now on day 3 with no air conditioning.
title: Installation Instructions Woefully Lacking

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Drew Hill
content: This is the second house I’ve installed and used a Nest. After we moved we wished we had our Nest and after six months or so we made the upgrade again. Super easy to install and easy to setup. Does a great job learning what temperatures we like and even noticed a problem with our heater filter caused by constant resets (our other “smart” controller just had a routine reminder but was not analyzing data”.
title: So great we bought it again for our new house.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: irishgu
content: Installed 2 of these in multizone home with heatpump and emergency heat.  Took about 20 mins each.  My only complaint is that I needed to use the back-plates because the old rectangular thermostats covered differently colored paint.  When it cools off enough to shut off the AC for long enough to do the work, I'll mud and paint and retire the the back-plates.  In the meantime, I have stainless thermostats mounted on white back-plates.  The plates should match the thermostat's finish.  Other than that, they're great.  Love the easy access to information, the learning, and the ease of control. Looking forward to getting compatible video doorbell cams.
title: they're great. Love the easy access to information

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Joseph P. Guzman
content: It was very easy to install. Do your research first. Visit the nest website to make sure your system will work with the nest thermostat and watch the install videos. It was super easy, it took 5 minutes to install and 2 minutes to setup. I really like that it shows the total time your unit runs in a 24 hr period. I live in Texas where it’s can be 60° in the morning and then 90° by the afternoon. The option that automatically switches to heat/cool is very nice. The app is very simple user friendly.
title: Love my nest thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Anu
content: 50% of the units are unreliable based on my experience. I bought two of these for my two AC units, and one broke within a year. They had to replace it after painfully proving it to them that the problem was with the unit. The error E74, that the Thermostat shows in case of it breaking down is extremely misleading.E74 (no power on the Rh connection). It gives an impression that no power is not going into the unit, even though the unit itself is busted. Maybe the error show be (The unit is broken, please request a replacement). If you get this error, please check if your breaker is working . The next thing to suspect after that is the thermostat. Good technology, but looks like manufacturing, testig and diagnostics could be more accurate.
title: 50% of the units are unreliable and prone to breaking down.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: David Valdes
content: I'm in love with this thing.  Not only it took me less than 15 minutes to put together and change my old thermostat but it was really great during set up and testing. Since this was my first installation I was nervous and i may have checked the cables and pictures I took a few times. But the instructions were really easy to follow and the quality is amazing. It was a great buy and for sure will do it again. Usually I change it at the same time and now it has learned my times so I don't have to worry about it. I can feel the same temperature during the day without doing anything about it. I will recommend this product to anyone. This is it.
title: Awesome product. Works way better than what I thought

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Scott
content: This worked fine with my Trane XL1200 AC unit, but not compatible with my Trane XL80 furnace. Please check the list  of furnaces which are incompatible with the nest thermostat . Carrier: Multistage furnace Infinity gas furnace models: 58MVC, 58MVB,58CVA multistage furnace Performance gas furnace model 58MTB, 58MEB, 58PHA, 58PHX, 58CTA, 58CTX Trane: multistage communicating furnaces XC95M, XC95, XC80 XV80, XC80, XL80, XR80 TUD2B060ACV32A TUD2B080ACV32A TUD2C080ACV42A TUD2C100ACV32A TUD2C100ACV52A TUD2D120ACV52A TUD2D140ACV52A TDD2B060ACV32A TDD2B080ACV32A TDD2C100ACV52A TDD2D120ACV52A TUHMB060ACV3VA TUHMB080ACV3VA TUHMC100ACV4VA TUHMD120ACV5VA TDHMB060ACV3VB TDHMB080ACV3VA TDHMC100ACV4VA TDHMD120ACV5VB Goodman: Furnaces: DMVM96 DCVM96 DMVC95 DCVC95 DMVC8 Amana: Furnaces: AMVM96 ACVM96 AMVC95 ACVC95 AMVC8
title: Non compatibility list

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Woodworker
content: If you have a dual fuel system you cant install and set this up yourself. Once the Nest detects a dual fuel wiring setup it stops the self installation and tells you to call a licensed HVAC to install. That will add another $150 to the cost of it. I returned it and bought a Honeywell Vision wifi thermostat and installed it myself.
title: Dont buy if you have a dual fuel system

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: S. Roberts
content: Product states it will work without a common wire.  One wasted weekend later I'm forced to return this.  My furnace short cycled all night, woke up to the house at 54 degrees at 4am on the phone with Nest.  They told me to swap my W and R wires, it ran for 2hrs then just stopped.  Sent it back to amazon, what a waste.
title: Dont buy if you dont have a common wire.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Scott Stevens
content: I purchased one for the downstairs and one for the upstairs. I'm able to use my mobile phone to control every aspect of my heating and cooling. As this is the 3rd generation, it can learn my schedule and know when I'm home, though you have to add your mobile as it uses it to know you are home. Both were simple to install and took about 10-15 minutes each. I've very happy with Nest and have suggested this model to friends and family.
title: Two Nest!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: I Bought It
content: I had problems initially because the battery wasn’t charged enough.  I switched my fan wire to common on th thermostat and the furnace temporarily to set up and charge the thermostat.  After a month or so I wanted to use the fan again so I switched the fan wire back to normal and the nest has been able to maintain a charge without a common wire. I have a four wire connection.  Best part is the auto leaning schedule and the home away assist.
title: Must have for every home.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Richard W.
content: Although I wanted to love this product i feel as though I wasted my money.  After about 8 months of usage the unit started to not work properly and now does not not apparently have WiFi any longer.  This lack of WiFi makes the unit a complete waste of money.  I have spent about 5 hours on hold for nest support on three separate attempts and no one ever answers the line. I have also sent  messages and no one responds.  I‎t is the absolute worst support I have ever seen. $250.00 dollars is a bit expensive  for a thermostat that only functions for 8 months! Save your money, buy another product.
title: Although I wanted to love this product i feel as though I wasted my ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kallie Schmitt
content: We just moved and I'm pretty sure our thermostat was broken.  We couldn't stand it anymore and purchased this one after my mom said she loved hers.  We got it all installed, and I love that I can turn it on to eco mode when I'm gone to save on energy.  I wish I could figure the app out so that it would do that automatically...just need to play around with it a little more - I will say the app is not very user friendly.
title: Comfortable Summer

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J. Hodges
content: I smile every time I walk past this thing. It lights up with a crisp, large, bright display...one of those devices you like more after you get it than from pictures or descriptions. That said, I wish it's 'learning' was more effective. As an example, sometimes I wake up at night to hear my heater turning on when I am already too warm. It is nice to be able to turn the heat down without getting up, but I'd rather not have the heater come on at all in that case. Perhaps the Nest is just trying to warm the house up for the morning. Maybe if it told me what it is doing and why, at least on demand, I would feel more confident in its logic.
title: Great device, needs to be able to explain what it is doing and why

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Hubzone37
content: It came down to the Nest and one other...... So I pulled my old heat pump thermostat cover off and snapped a photo of the wires and emailed the support link on Nest website. While I was thinking of which thermostat to order I had a response on how to move the wires and setup the Nest within two hours of the email.... so I was sold on customer service and ordered a Nest from Amazon.
