When it arrived I hooked it up according to the email I received and the condenser would run but not the vent fan :( I called the tech support number and the guy walked me over the phone quickly how to connect the wires and was up in running in 15 minutes. My July electric bill was over $50 cheaper than June's.... I recommend this product!!
title: It came down to the Nest and one other........

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kluv
content: The nest worked good at keeping the hpuse warm or cool but the thermostat would not show the right temperature. On order to make it hot i had to put it on cool and turn it in the 60s. It was noce using the app and not having to go to the thermostat but it did not work well sonwe ended up going back to the old one. It also DID NOT save on the electric bill. It isnt something I would buy again!
title: Wouldn't buy again

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alfredo Perez
content: WARNING! Do not purchase if you do not have a C (common) wire. The Nest will be unable to recharge itself without upgrading $$$ your system. I would have given 2 stars but I don't think this company stresses that enough.
title: WARNING! Do not purchase if you do not have a C (common) wire to your Thermostat.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M. Kuo
content: Love this Thermostat.  It turns on automatically when I get home, and turns off when I leave based on my phone and wifi connection.  Brilliant design. I have never been the DIY type of person, but the installation is easy enough, I literally just read the instruction from the box and viola. Patching up the wall was the hard part.  I could cover up the wall with the plastic plate that came in the box, but I think that looked pretty ugly.  So I spent the time and learned how to patch and paint the hole that was left over from my old thermostat.  If it wasn't for that, it probably will take no more than half hour to change out the old one and replace with the new.
title: So CUTE!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mrs. Gray
content: Stopped working after a few months. This was a replacement for another one that stopped working after a year. But when it is working, it works great
title: If you only want a temporary thermostat then look no further

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: E Taylor
content: Installed the Nest to replace an original 1950’s era mercury thermostat. Wasn’t exactly sure it was going to work due to the age of the house wiring. Furnace and A/C unit was early 2000’s vintage. After opening the box I called customer service as directed in the instructions to make sure the unit was compatible. Call was answered quickly and representative walked through the model of furnace and A/C unit installed. After determining the units were compatible I was sent a wiring diagram specific to my setup for installation. Has worked perfectly ever since. I have the Nest connected through an Alexa device and have had no issues. The only downside (minor) is that Google is moving to their Google Home services through the app so some things are limited like family control. Overall very satisfied with this purchase.
title: Easy setup and install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Josh
content: It looks good, I love the copper, and performs great! I previously had one and I didn't have a C wire hooked up. When I was pulling off the old thermostat I noticed an extra wire shoved into the wall. I pulled it out, and then went upstairs to the blower, that same color wire was sitting there disconnected. I connected that wire up, and plugged it into the Nest, now it's working better than ever!
title: Works better with a C wire installed

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: E Hickey
content: I put Nest thermostats in the upstairs and downstairs of my home in NC this past winter.  I was very pleased with the level of customer service provided by Nest, as I was able to take a picture of my current wiring and the customer service team created a custom diagram that showed exactly how to install the new thermostat. I love the wireless capabilities and the cell phone app that allows immediate adjustment from any location. The jury is still out on utility savings.  One month my home was ranked as one of the most efficient in its class and another month (using the same heating patterns) it was ranked less than the most efficient.  I will give three stars until I see a better ROI and may update at that time.
title: Excellent customer service, but still waiting for ROI

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J-B
content: I love this investment!!! It may seem like a hefty upfront cost but it’s worth it. The product itself is so simple to use and installation was easy! I haven’t had it long so I’m excited to see over the next few months of how it saves my energy usage and money. I like the app you can download and the ability to connect to your nest through the phone. I can change the temperature, turn the fan on check the usage and set my schedule all from my couch. So those who have trouble getting around this is a great feature. Plus it’s super modern and makes my home look super updated haha.
title: Amazing purchase!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Roxie
content: After literally 5 weeks this Nest began failing. The compressor does not turn on with 4-5 minutes of turning down the air and in addition only the fan run running your electric bill thru the roof. Now they are saying that July 17 was when I could return it, today is July 30 and trouble started July in a Florida July 26. Now what I’m stuck with the bill I don’t think so Nest needs to back up their thermostat be warned. First thing my A/C professional said is when do you get the Nest? I’m going straight to Nest and back to good old faithful ways of a Honeywell thermostat. Never in 20 years with a old fashion they say at had an issue now new a/c as of 12/2019 and a Nest less than 60 days nothing but issues. Do not trust all that bologne! I’m upset yup!! It’s July in South Florida and couple hundred later during the worst year in since 2005!  So I don’t waMy to hear there is no return!!!
title: Does not last 50 days!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ASan
content: It was between this or an Ecobee3; I'm not comfortable wiring a C wire that the Ecobee requires so this won out. On top of that, my utilities company is offering a $75 rebate for this thermostat, so that made my decision that much easier. I installed it in less than 15 minutes, and it booted up and started to update it's firmware. I've had it a little over a week, and it's already learned much of our family's habits. 2 kids, a dog all running around the house, it's able to make smart decisions regarding when it shuts off and the temps we've taught it. With Summer on the way, I'll see how it does in learning the AC schedule and how 'airwave' works out. I like having automated tech stuff in my house, and this is working out great.
title: I'm not comfortable wiring a C wire that the Ecobee requires so ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: zachus
content: OH MY WORD I love these SO MUCH!!! Not only did I get a $200 credit on my utility bill it's actually helping me save money. BUT FAR beyond that they are beautiful and work so well. Alexa and Google Home control them flawlessly and I even use the app a lot as well. It's so easy to use. My family came in town for Thanksgiving and they are amazed how they don't get hot or cold at night. It's a thing of beauty. I love that it works with my phone to know when I'm home and away. Obviously like any tech there is room for improvement but WOW one of my favorite things! Enjoy! Install: was super easy, just thought I'd note this. Works flawlessly and was up an going in less than 30 minutes. Comes with everything you need in the box. So nice!
title: One of my favorite things!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: S. Johnson
content: At first I was a little skeptical about these thermostats.  $250 is a lot for a thermostat, let alone $500 for two.  My mom just had a house built & one was installed & she gave her opinion on it so I decided to get 2 for my house.  One for upstairs & the other for downstairs.  Well, let me tell you, not counting the weird weather we've been having lately, compared to my previous thermostats, these Nests are totally worth the purchase.  My gas bill which is usually around $220+ in January was $70.00.  Talking about Christmas coming early.  If this keeps up, they will have paid for themselves in no time.  The fact that it learns your comfort habits & adjusts automatically is totally awesome.  The Auto-Away feature is a huge plus.  Not heating/cooling your home, wasting energy when you're not there saves so much on my bill since my house isn't exactly eco-friendly.  I'm waiting to see how it performs in the summer but w/ all of the neat features, I'm sure i'll continue to be happy with the results
title: My NESTS are the BEST!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Robert Hattan
content: The Nest 3rd Gen is great.  Somehow within the first year of ownership the wifi stopped working.  I troubleshooted with numerous resets, etc but another unit and the problem was solved.  Overall this is a great product if you use the app and now update your Nest account to now use your Google account to login.  It's extremely nice to be able to use the app and have it work with a heat pump system.  Please note the Nest-E model does not support heat pumps due to less wiring capability.
title: Nest 3rd Gen

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Deli's Dazzle
content: This thing is a piece of crap with a mind of its own.  Of all the tech and gadgets I have, this is by far the worst. Stay away.
title: This thing is a piece of crap with a mind of its own

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ScottB
content: We have had the Nest for a couple of years.  We finally replaced it after so many issues with programming and away from home functionality.  Two HVAC people also recommended we get rid of it -- "they have a mind of their own"  "we have so many issues with them" was the feedback.  We're in a hot climate and the Nest would keep turning off or stay off.  it would not do the right "pre-cooling" periods so when we'd get home, the house was still really hot, and would then take a long time to catchup.  the daily programming feature is surprisingly complex for what should be an easy task.  like the idea of Nest-  but just doesn't work as well as marketed.  not worth the money.
title: Never Worked as Promised

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J. Stewart
content: I am liking this thermostat, especially the ability to change the temperature from my phone and see how much the AC has run each day over the past week or so. I also like the thermostat's ability to go into energy-efficient mode if it detects that the house is empty. I will be even more pleased with it if my utility company ever gives me the $100 rebate I filed for but, regardless, the thermostat is worthwhile. It was also quite easy to install.
title: Worthwhile gadget

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: shopper24
content: I like this thermostat very much, I have two.  One works very well the second stopped running after 6 months of use.  I had a heating technician come to my house twice to investigate and found the thermostat to be defective. This man had a lot of Nest experience, many installations and  has resolved many nest issues.  On the second visit I called the Nest help line.  One woman answered asked a few questions then I was put on hold for about 5 minutes and passed onto someone else.  He asked a few technical questions which the heating tech answered then we were put on hold for about 5 minutes. He (his name was Isa) then asked another two or three questions put us on hold again.  This went on for another 3 times.  Each time asking only a couple of questions.  I felt like they were trying to wear us down and hoping I would hang up.  Finally after about 50 minutes on the phone a Supervisor comes on and says he needs to ask a few more questions. When we challenge this and asked why he did not get an update from the individual we were talking to ( each time Isa put us on hold he said he had to speak to his supervisor) he said he did not talk to Isa.  However as we began to speak to him and challenge him he then referred to his discussion with Isa.  Finally he said his only question was to get the serial number of the unit so he could send us a new one.  This took almost an hour! If I was alone and my heating tech was not here to answer their technical questions they would have never sent a new thermostat even though it was determined to be defective after two visits to my home. The conversation would have ended badly. This was extremely poor customer service.  I feel they did everything possible to avoid a replacement and frustrate the customer.
title: Nest has Terrible customer service!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Glendon M.
content: I bought this item through Amazon, as always the item came well packaged and on time. If there is one thing I have ever learned, that is nothing is as easy as plug and play, but first I want to get to the good. Besides what others have said this does show the current temp in the house but it is on the outer ring and in small numbers. Others have complained that the current temp is to small and the temp setting being the focus is a problem for them, I am more concerned with what temp I set it to, not what the current temp is. Once the unit has programmed it's self based on your temp preferences the only reason to be concerned with the current temp is if the unit fails to turn on, or you really have to have that gee wiz info. I bought this to save money not to impress others with the screen and info. The screen is large, easy to read, I like that it turns on when you walk up to it, it is simple to use, the app is great and works flawlessly, and yes it is a bonus that it looks nice. Now for the bad, when I installed it I followed all the instructions, all the wires went exactly where they belong. It is nice that for those with large dual zone systems and humidifiers and all the bells and whistles they have stickers with the wire names provided, they say Y1, RH W1, G and so on. My system only used 4 wires R, Y, W, G and had no jumpers for the old system so my system was not exactly rocket science to wire correctly. I kept getting a fault saying it would not recognize the Y1 (cooling) wire, after trouble shooting on my own I confirmed the connections were good, no wires broken or twisted and everything was good on that end. In this 4 wire configuration there is no blue (or sometimes black) wire which is required, this is a power wire that some systems use to provide constant 24 volt power to the thermostat. If you do not have this wire some systems will still work with this unit with no problem, it simply takes a little power from the RH and Y1 to get its power, and remember it was not recognizing my Y1. I finally call customer support and was on the phone with them for about 2 hours, they were very polite and tried there hardest to help but that night it was getting to late at night and the house getting to cold to deal with it and the thermostat required a full charge to continue troubleshooting. As a side bar there is a mini USB plug on the back of the faceplate that works with android style plugs to provide a quick charge, this is in the event of extended black outs you can recharge fast. So for the night I reconnected the old thermostat and the HVAC worked fine. Next morning I'm back on the phone with tech support. After giving them the case number from the night before we started going through many of the steps again since my old thermostat seemed to work fine that proved there was no problem with the HVAC wiring it's self, so this wire detection problem was a bit of a mystery. After moving wires to different terminals and reading out voltages from the tech info screen for about a hour and a half, they determined that it was a faulty base plate, they were kind enough to order a replacement base plate and even overnight FEDEX it to me, so at this point I'm waiting for a part that might fix the problem. Knowing modern housing construction practices, I still had my suspicions that it was not a issue with the baseplate but was a wiring problem with the HVAC, besides I hate throwing parts at a problem to see what might fix the issue. I had a friend that does HVAC look at the system, first thing he said was I needed that C (blue) common wire connected to provide enough power. I had already tried that and seen that the issue was not fixed, that was because as I suspected the system was not wired up correctly. The common wire was there but not connected to anything, so after rewiring the entire system we got the Nest thermostat to work as advertised. There are two morals to this story, first is that Nest tech support is great and they try everything they can to get you up and running, but in the end you are talking to IT people not HVAC professionals. The second moral is if your are replacing a old "dumb" thermostat or even a newer programmable one but not a "smart" one, and they worked fine before does not mean that the system was wired up correctly to work with this unit. So if you plug it in and it gives you a E80 fault code and you do not have a blue wire or it's not connected to the terminal, chances are you need it, and after connecting it if you continue to have faults chances are your blue wire is not connected properly. If you really are insitant on upgrading your thermostat call a HVAC person to look at your system.
title: Works great now but...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Greg Fields
content: Not such a “device” after all......very frustrating.  I bought 3 of these for our summer home so I could monitor and co tell tempuraturs remotely.  For some unexplainable reason, this product will not let you drop the temperature below 50 degrees.  So, in the world of “good for the earth”, Google has produced a product that is not!!!  I am wasting energy and I waiting too long to return to Amazon.  $1000 wasted that does not allow me to do the only thing I bought them for.  Buyer beware!!!!!
title: Not Too Smart....Beware!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: jason
content: Best money I’ve ever spent! Power bill dropped just over $100 in the first month. By day 90 power bill has been cut in half!!! Easy to install...took approximately 10 minutes. Nest app isn’t the best since it likes to buffer. I use the Google Home app and it’s working perfectly, although it doesn’t provide the same info that the Nest app provides. I keep both apps on my phone...Google to control the thermostat and the Nest app to see how everything else is functioning.
title: Highly recommend!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chance Casey
content: 3rd Gen, $249 new, doesn't work after 3 years.  Tech support said I needed a new "base" (which I am highly skeptical of) so me and my family get to freeze for the next 2 days until it gets here - assuming it's even what's broken.  Although I had to pay $249, I now get to pay another $25 to try this fix.  Should be FREE, NEST!!!!!!!  $249 should be all I pay for life.  I guess they are taking the same route as "smart phones".  So smart to be tossing high-grade electronics in the trash every 2 years to get a "better" one....
title: Stopped working after 3rd year

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bable
content: There are other products in this market now, several cheaper. This performs as you would expect...though I do not have it integrated with Alexa. I own this and an Ecobee. This is more expensive but the part you interact with regularly...the device and app...are much better than the cheaper Ecobee. To me it worth the extra $75 to not be frustrated every time I have to access it.
title: Best device and app interface

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: G. Mays
content: I probably could have installed this myself, but when the tech was here to check my AC at start up he volunteered to install it for me (it went very quickly because he had installed this model in other homes). I really like the "learning" function where the AC knows the daytime and nighttime temps to set and hold. I also like the "home" and "away" controls that I can set from my phone. I get a monthly report from Nest telling me how much energy I'm using or saving by using different temperature settings.
title: A very handy thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brent Robison
content: We had the Nest Learning Thermostat, along with two Nest Protects, and we absolutely loved both products. We were going to purchase Nest Cams, but after learning Alphabet (Google) had purchased Nest, and planned to integrate them into the Google ecosystem, we had to say goodbye. I am not a fan of my personal data and information being collected, behind the scenes, and without my knowledge. We needed privacy laws yesterday in the US.
title: Your Data is YOUR DATA

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Carl
content: This thermostat is neat, but it is not worth the money at all.  it is simply a thermostat with remote control.  but even that does not always work..  it's "smart" features are terrible, and I turned them off.  it struggles to keep the temperature right, for some reason it will keep cooling or heating 2-3 degrees PAST the temperature it is supposed to be at, why in the world it does not just stop when it reaches the desired temp is beyond me.  It does not show the current temp!!  well it does.. sometimes, and only with a tic mark.  it is very hard to see.
title: Shiny, buy not so functional.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ryan M
content: I had been eyeing the Nest thermostats for some time now, but with the $50 discount ($199 on Amazon) and my utility provider (Coserv) offering a $100 bill credit for up to two Nests, I knew it was time. I do not consider myself super-handy, but I have installed some light and fan fixtures so I figured I was up to the challenge of installing my two new Nests. After reading the very simple and straightforward instructions, laying out all the components that came in the box, and killing the power to my AC/furnace I got started. 15 minutes later I had both thermostats installed. 10 minutes later both were synced up with my app and I was well on my my way to the 21st century. I think the install was made easier because my home is only 3 years old and the wiring was super straightforward. My only issues have been related to wi-fi connectivity (the upstairs Nest has gone offline a couple times, even though it is literally 10 feet from the wireless router) and the auto-settings as it learns my preferences (a few times it has set the temperature to 78, which for a 100 Texas summer day is not cool enough for my house).
title: Easy install, and straightforward process.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: mike
content: I bought this on March 3, 2017, and installed it on March 11th. Around the end of March this year it started intermittently losing its connection to Wi-Fi, I didn't worry about it too much I figured I'd just had to resync it to my router. turns out its internal battery went bad and won't charge. So the first thing it does is disconnects from Wi-Fi but you can still work the thermostat manually for a while.  I tried charging it via USB and that seemed to work for about 3 days but it just went dead. and now it just won't charge at all. I really did think this was cool when I got it. I could just lay in bed and tell my echo to warm up the house. I don't know if I'm just being cheap but I don't expect to have to replace my thermostat every year. 2-year limited manufacturer's warranty specifically does not cover  the non-replaceable battery
title: 2-year limited warranty? not if it goes bad

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: L. Singletary
content: I got this NEST thermostat at a discount price compared  to Home Depot, trying to save money and I had an amazon gift card.  This device died after 1 year, completely dead, unable to recharge/ reboot....dead !!! All of the NEST thermostat's I bought from Home Depot are still working after several years.  This one from Amazon was a lemon...probably why it was cheaper...
title: Died after 1 year

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: CH#4
content: We bought two, one for our upstairs and one for our downstairs. We also bought three remote temperature sensors. All were super easy to install. By integrating all these products, we are able to control our home temperatures like never before while saving energy. We have never been so comfortable at night as a complete household (previously, one room was ok and the rest were totally off). These thermostats are fantastic.
title: Work Beautifully

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cityofsteel
content: I can only write this from an installation perspective. It's very easy. If you wires are no straight forward go in there website and everything is there to easily hook it up. Looks great in the wall, installation was so quick and good directions, initial startup is guided much like an iPhone startup, it seems to control the fan speed better then my last Honeywell did. I will write another review after I use it more on efficiency and program effectiveness. Only negative so far. If you put this in an area it can get bumped I think it will fall off the wall and break on the ground. It clips onto the base and doesn't screw directly to the wall or base, and the unit has some weight. I will see how that works out for me and report back if it does in fact fall of at all.
title: Easy to install. Looks great,

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Fletch
content: I had my reservations (and bought the warranty as a result), but this thermostat has performed better than I expected.  Installatio was easy, instructions were pretty well written, and the results have been noticable over 2 months. If the Nest PHONE APP performed half as well as the thermostat, this would be a 5 star review, but I am greeted with connectivity issues or other errors more times than not.
title: The thermostat is great, the app is 'meh'.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: T. Seever
content: this thermostat is the bees knees. purchased this for my home because basically we're like 90% of the population who owns a programmable thermostat but never takes the time to actually set it. This makes that painless. just set it for a few days. let it learn. you're good to go. you don't have to pick the days of the week on some complicated dinky control panel. it's all set up on a nice clear display. installation was also a breeze. don't waste your money paying for someone to install unless you have some kind of complicated, multi zone setup. took me about 20 minutes total to get this installed. if you're looking for a smart thermostat look no further. also, keep an eye out for rebates offered by your local utility company.
title: the bees knees.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RowerEngineer
content: I live in a residential duplex apartment with my significant other and no pets.  So, we decided that this product might help to reduce our heating and cooling costs while we are at work.  Installation was easy and fast.  Learning how to control the Nest was a bit confusing because it operates slightly different from a normal thermostat.  But for the most part you just need to adjust the temperature to your comfort level and it will automatically learn your preferences.  We have had it now for a little over 2 months (May and June) and we have already saved over $50 compared to the same months last year.  And i think these saving will be even higher during the months where the heating/cooling need to run longer to maintain comfortable temperatures. I will try to update this when I get more results. Pros - Saves money - Easy to install - Looks good - Nice large readout - Display illuminates when you walk by, which also serves as a night light (secret bonus feature!) - Easy to use; It's almost so easy that its confusing Cons (Because no good review isn't in at least some way critical) - If you actually try to setup too much of the settings, it is difficult; in the end I just let it auto-configure to my habits, which has worked fine. Other notes: - It seems to run better if you download the Nest app on all phones in the household - I used the wall plate, which looks better than I thought it would since it matches the white trim molding in our apartment - The savings that we were able to achieve were mostly due to the fact that we don't have pets and are able to turn off the heating and cooling for most of the day during work. - Our previous thermostat was very old and did not allow for scheduling the AC.  If you already keep your AC on a pretty tight schedule you wont have the same results I've seen.  But from using other scheduler thermostats, I will say that the Nest is much easier to use and set. In conclusion, I highly recommend this product.  Based on my situation, it will most likely pay for itself within the first year of owning it. And i expect that it will run my AC for a minimum of 6 years, which makes this a very solid financial decision.
title: Works Great, Looks Great, Solid Financial Decision

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gabe
content: We have two of these thermostats. One of them works just fine. The other one is having a lot of issues. I went through all of the steps to fix it with Google Nest tech-support. They decided it was a faulty product and said they would replace it. That was two months ago. It is nearly impossible to speak to a human so I have to go through Facebook messenger to communicate with them-They asked me to fill out the same forms over and over because there is zero communication between the team. I could probably write a book with all of the ridiculous back-and-forth but I will just say, this is one of the worst experiences. I would never buy another one of these because their customer service is terrible.
title: Horrible customer service with Google Nest

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Erie
content: This is a great system, but it needs additional integration to work in full automatic mode. I am an original Dropcam user. Dropcam activated by my location and I could email video clips of activity. Nest bought Dropcam and that functionality was lost. I had to manually activate the cameras and could not email video clips. But then, Nest initiated "Home and Away" and location activation worked very well, although I still can't email video clips. Because of the "Home/Away" capability, I subsequently bought their CO/Smoke monitors and then this Thermostat.  All the devices work together. I really like this system even though I now can't  get "Home and Away" to work automatically.  Tech support has spent hours, days working with me and we still can't get it to work in full automatic (cameras come on, Protect monitors know I am gone, but the Thermostat does not set to Away). The system does work if I set it manually to Away and then back to Home. In summary, it is a great system, their tech support is fantastic and there are some system glitches which I believe will be sorted out. I would definitely buy this system again and I highly recommend it.
title: Great system, needs additional integration

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: John Adams
content: Had it less than a year . Gave me nothing but problems.  Constant internet loss.  Low battery problem .  Added a common wire. Nest did not wnat me to use it said I did not need it.  Changed battery not working at all.  Much Too complicated for a simple job. Bought a different smart thermostat hopefully this will make it better. Very unreliable themostat. Worked great in the beginning stopped working on the same unchanged  heating and hvac system
title: Absolute junk

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Daniel A Joseph
content: I have wanted one of these for a really long time and finally took the plunge but it has been nothing but problems for us.  Seemed to be working fine for about 3 days but then one night it just died and so did the heat in our house. We tracked down a charger (doesn't come with the unit btw) and then we thought we were back in business until it happened again. It turns out that the unit wasn't drawing enough power off of the furnace running to stay on, so then it started quick-cycling the furnace - ie, turning it on for seconds at a time every few minutes. This woke me up all night and I could not figure out what the heck was happening until I read about people with similar issues. It seems it *might* be fixable to have an electrician come out and wire an additional power wire but that seems like overkill for an already expensive unit. Also, even when fully charged, I had a hard time with it overriding my other zones (would just blow cool air on its level, even on eco or "off" while the upstairs wouldn't heat. Everything resolved when I unplugged it and I finally got a good night's sleep again last night. Sad to send it back because it really is pretty (hence the second star) but it's just not functional for us.
title: May not be compatible with zoned AC without additional wiring

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RiverasPayne
content: I turned off the smart part so it would turn on when I don't want it to and it still turns on. The temperature changes all on it's own through out the day turning on when no one is in the house. It's not smart at all. Why would it need to be on without anyone in my home? Makes no sense. It's ridiculous. And of course when it acts up I can't return it. Not buying anything from Nest ever again.
title: Not smart at all

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JEN
content: I'm head over heels for this thermostat. I installed it myself and it took no time at all. I did do a little prep work the day before that took all of 5 minutes. Luckily, my wiring already included a common wire to supply the thermostat with constant power and I just had to connect that wire to the actual furnace. I did buy a fancy metal wall plate, but opted for the white trim plate that comes with the nest. The fancy metal trim plate was not what I expected. The actual install took 7 minutes, the programming and setting up the Wi-Fi and my preferences took another 15 minutes or so. I have been a little obsessed with watching the heat status while away from home, but my gas bill will thank me!
title: A MUST have for anyone!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: yuri shin
content: Nest died after 1 year, after troubleshooting and testing the wires and trying to attach the nest onto another base in my home, it's determined the the nest itself lost the charging feature and died.  I have 2 in my home bought at the same time, installed by a pro AC guy.  This one is a defected one.  Could not find a phone number to call...trouble shooted everything listed on the site.  After google bought it out, seems like we cannot find a person to help.  After determining that this Nest was a defected one through facebook chat with nest, it's been 2 months and 2 weeks after filling out some paper work with NOTHING to show.  Now with the heatwave & fires in CA, we are literally DYING and burning to death.  HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  ZERO HELP.  So disappointed.
title: The WORST customer Service or NON EXISTENT

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Pierre El Capitan de Castanets Enimigo
content: UPDATED REVIEW: We have two nest thermostats in our home.  We love the modern look and interface.  It works well as a thermostat and the app has been flawless. The only negatives are the nest doesn't do a great job of knowing when we are away (perhaps the app needs to be open 24/7) and I don't see a way to turn on the AUX heat on the heat pump without turning on the outside compressor.  Perhaps I will solve both with time. Nest customer service is outstanding.  One of our thermostats came with a scratch.  It wasn't horrible but it was noticeable.  After my review Nest contacted me (see below), and I was able to get a replacement stat with no trouble. ORIGINAL REVIEW: Came scratched  :(
title: Three Stars

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rawls Enterprises
content: I actually think it's operating my homes Central A/C system much different than my last so-called Honeywell smart thermostat. Love that I can operate it from anywhere I am via the app. and I do think it's learning my house. I know it's learning me and when I get home and leave. But I think it's using my compressor less often than my last which is saving me tons of money. I love it.
title: Absolutely love this thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: T. Anschutz
content: The documentation that comes with the thermostat is sufficient to get the device installed and operational, though I highly recommend thoroughly reading the instructions before installing.  Installation was easy, as pretty much everything needed comes with the thermostat, including hardware and even a screwdriver.  Online documentation for verifying compatibility and aiding with installation are also good.  Configuring the thermostat and connecting it to home wi-fi network was easy and pretty intuitive, and installing and pairing the mobile app was also easy.  About a week after installation it had self-programmed its own schedule.  I was able to get a discount on my homeowners insurance for installing it, and I'm noticing a savings on my heating and cooling bills.
title: Helpful smart thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: leeloo
content: One of the main reasons to get Nest, was that it was supposed to work with Alexa. Well: Alexa can't turn it on or off - that's pretty major, I would think. Everything else is great: beautiful device, installation was easy, the screwdriver it comes with is a very nice tool... The Alexa integration is embarrassing - Google should do better than that!
title: Disappointed with the Alexa integration

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cheyanne
content: We got our nest about a year ago and it has a hard time turning our heater on. It will say it's ok and show that's its active but no arm is coming our of our vents and the furnace will be off. Also if you try eco mode and set the temp to not go below 68, it wont turn on till I'm the temp is below 58. I hate this thing the only cool thing is controlling it from our phones, but that barely works.
title: Terrible

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Beth
content: This is nest #2 and the month without it was miserable and expensive..I didn’t realize how this clever little gadget is steadily saving you money ..just moved to a new house and thought I could go back to the old school thermostat but the second I got that gas bill I ordered this ! I hope the rebates come through too from your utilities company  ..now 1961 house is back in 2020 ..thrilled
title: I couldn’t live without it ...saving $$$$$

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Steve Hux
content: I like the Nest 3 thermostat concept, being able to control it from my iPhone. The Nest is a good looking instrument and does a good job controlling the temperature in our home. Two complaints: there were no installation instructions included with the Nest; I found them online and printed them. The Nest app was supposed to generate a wiring diagram...that didn’t happen. After I completed the installation the system began to function as advertised. Two days ago the system went offline and troubleshooting showed the battery was low. I reduced the display brightness and after the battery’s charge reached 3.8 volts the Nest came back online. Bottom line:  Lack of documentation and failure of the app to produce a wiring diagram turned a thirty minute installation into a three hour project and I’m still puzzled about the battery problem. 4 stars out of 5.
title: Where’s the documentation?

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Max Prax
content: I've never used any other version so I can't compare but it's just amazing to be able to control your thermostat from anywhere. Alexa integration has been Rock solid as well as the ability to set daily schedules. I don't even have a Google home but it's no big deal. Initially I had trouble with figuring out the orange cable and where that needed to go to get the AC to work under the heat pump setting. After that out it's been fine and didn't need to hire anybody to install it it's pretty straightforward.
title: The smartest and best-looking thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Stacey (or maybe her Husband)
content: I like feeling like my house is all sci-fi now even though it is worth less than my car.  I paired this thermostat with a new HVAC unit for my wife.  It has been very convenient for her.  When she is feeling ill, she does not have to get up to change the temperature and be comfortable.  I can also secretly adjust the temperature without drawing attention to myself.  "Maybe it was the kids who messed with it."
title: It doesn't matter who touches the thermostat now

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DWray
content: I installed the night I received it.  It ran for two weeks, then had an error message with a wiring fault.  After spending the whole day with tech support, It was finally determined the base went bad.  Numerous tests which all showed my system was fine.  They are sending me another base only, but it will take 4 days to get it.  So, back to my mercury switch until it comes in...
title: Ran for 2 weeks

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Theresa Cisneros
content: We thought it worked great this winter, until summer! When used with the air conditioning, it kept starting and stopping constantly!! This could have ruined the compressor !! That's a very costly problem. Until NEST fixes this, I would not recommend buying this product.
title: NEST has an expensive flaw!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Eric
content: Excellent packaging, simple to install and wire, comes with screws, little screwdriver to remove the old unit.  Also a back plate to cover up the old square unit.  The level is nice and the wires are super easy to connect because no screwdriver is needed. Easy to use and setup.  On setup the screen goes dark and it was not clear what the system was doing for a couple minutes.  Overall, very impressed with the Nest.  Works great on our Geothermal system.
title: Functional, Friendly and easy to install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mark (Bump)
content: I had a very hard time setting the schedule.  The first time it worked fine, but trying to change the schedule took several days of effort as it seemed to remember parts of the old schedule randomly.  Even still it often changes the temperature arbitrarily.  I have it connected with my Google Home devices and reliability is maybe 80%.  Disappointed in light of the price.
title: Difficult to program, randomly changes temperature.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: kutedragonboy
content: Love it. The installation was so dumbed down for consumer; I don't know how you can't install by yourself.  There's tons of youtube videos from NEST and other buyers to walk you through it. NOTE: you don't have to use all the plates they give you.  So convenient to control everything from the NEST app.  Let's see how the NEST learning thermostat performs down the line with claims of "learning your behaviors".  Man..makes us humans so LAZY now LOL.  I use to have to walk up to my thermostat to see the temperature.
title: Love it and Install was EASY BREEZY.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: cac2001
content: Ok so we decided to have this installed when we replaced our AC and I am very happy with it. I have an app that allows me to change the settings from the comfort of my bed one floor up. We have a small child so it comes in handy especially at night  with the weather’s mood swings sometimes in the same day. It has a range for heat and air and it’s adjusts on it own. It was warm this morning so the air was on to keep it at our desired temp. By the afternoon, it was quite chilly and it changed from air to heat. It also learns your preferred settings after a few days!
title: Smart choice

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Debra Yale
content: After installing this thermostat our AC condenser unit started spontaneously shutting off. We had two HVAC repair companies out for two service calls (total cost of service calls was $300+) after which we determined the problem was with the Nest thermostat. We subsequently removed the Nest thermostat and replaced it with the old thermostat and have had no issues with the condenser since that time. I would never buy this product again.
title: Poor quality product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Adam Greenberg
content: Defective POS I had one installed by Tesla that works and they wired me for another. The new one has a battery that won’t hold a charge. No way I have to waste hours returning the POS
title: Defective POS

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: chey
content: Worked well at first, had it about four months, and now it’s not adjusting to temperature correctly??? This is the third Nest we’ve purchased (in three separate homes). The other two were bought at a main retailer, this was the first one we got off Amazon. The other two had no issues. Won’t buy this on Amazon again, will continue to spend the $20 more at a major retailer.
title: Research the retailer more

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jester D
content: So far, not as good as my original Nest. I moved and lost the base to my old Nest thermostat , so I ordered this one. Temperature is off by 4 degrees. A $200 product should not have this defect. Apparently this is a common problem. Waited three days for a one day delivery. Not looking forward to sorting this out. I have very limited time to deal with defective products.
title: Good, not great, inaccurate.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AHMED E. HUSSAIN
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Loved the way it packed and the tools that comes with it and it is very easy installation. Does not require subscription for nest it will work with just a normal account with nest app.
title: Best fancy product you can buy and it really works

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Marlon Wright
content: Heat  function  worked perfect for a month then starts to blow cold air. Takes over 2+ hours to heat house from 60 degrees to 70 degrees.
title: Heat function worked perfect for a month then starts to blow cold air

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: BART
content: Installed two of these and they work great. It took me only an hour each that would have been less without interruptions. They were easy to install and program. As a mechanical contractor I have installed hundreds of thermostats, many programmable and they were a pain in the um. This would have been by choice for some commercial applications that needed remote monitoring. Years past we used expensive programmable controllers to control the heating/cooling in areas that needed remote monitoring. Wow how technology has simplified control of hvac.
title: Installed two of these and they work great. It took me only an hour each that ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jacky
content: Gorgeous, perfect and fast delivery, 1 day, free with Prime!!  Copper color is incredibly hard to find. In Los Angeles when I did a search for it I only actually found one and it was a very long ways away from me! I was really happy that Amazon delivered in one day! Now I hope it works when the gift recipient  actually has it installed! I'm assuming it will! I have had one since the 3rd generation came out and had the first before.  I find the convenience of being able to adjust the temperature using my iPhone or even speaking to Alexa is incredibly comforting, easy and something I've come to count on over the years.
title: Bought as a well appreciated gift!  Must Have!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: BillK
content: I recommend avoiding the Nest thermostat for two reasons. First, our family room Nest went offline every two months until we added a c wire. Second problem is that Nest changes my room temperature settings without my permission. There is no way to disable these “Seasonal Settings” in the Nest or its app. I object to Nest deciding on that’s best for our home!  So one star rating is well deserved
title: Avoid, especially for multizone homes

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: nwmsdoc
content: I purchased the 3rd Generation smart thermostat from Nest with some trepidation for a second home that really needed temperature control remotely. After reviewing the nicely laid out online tutorial (and video) regarding installation, and not being particularly handy with all things electrical, I set out to install the product myself. My iPhone picture of the original wiring went into Nest, their new wiring diagram came back, and I nervously started the process of unhooking wires, labeling, re-hooking, mashing wires down to get the new attractive Nest instrument in place. Firing the system up, it ran at full heat without an ability to control. Completely panicked, and not wanting to re-wire my old thermostat, I called Nest technical support on a Friday evening. 24/7. In short order, I had a female tech person on the line; she patiently had me send my original wiring diagram and what I had done. She then had me unhook the wires and re-wire (one wire was incorrectly directed by the initial direction to me.) I turned the power back on, and shazam, the system re-booted, and the functionality is actually more than I thought possible. Clean, attractive, very easy to use, the app on my iPhone works well, and the darn thing works like a charm. From beginning to installation, and with use, this product is first rate. The technical support, if you need it, is truly first class. I highly recommend this product, and I rarely write reviews.
title: I purchased the 3rd Generation smart thermostat from Nest with some trepidation for a second ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jonathan Barnes
content: Very happy with this Nest Thermostat. At first I thought it wasn't going to work because I had a Carrier thermostat and everything I read made it sound like Carrier wasn't compatible with Nest. Nice news for me is the Carrier I had was only the thermostat not the heater. In any case I learned I can just disconnect all the Carrier from the heater and use the same wires for the nest to go directly to the heater. What a relief. As for the thermostat itself I love it because I can set the temp up from the phone just before I leave work and have the house warm by the time I get home. Another plus I didn't read prior is how nice the usage is recorded on the app. It will tell you the daily usage. Love it. Love it. Love it.
title: For a home with out much tech upgrades this is a great start.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Grandma
content: Looks and works great. Just needs an easy way to “hold temperature “ when you leave for extended amounts of time. I had to go in and change every temp for the week so it would hold temp. Seems silly they missed that feature
title: Nice unit but needs a simple hold temp setting

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Thor
content: These are super easy to install and a great addition to anyone starting a smart home. They look very nice and the seller here is offering quite a discount. Arrived quickly it looked great. I thought this thermostat had the ability for geofencing so that it could pre-cool when the owner was driving home but I cannot find this feature. Otherwise this is a great thermostat.
title: Looks amazing and can be added to Google home.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Aaron Lewis
content: This product is absolutely amazing I have been recommended by friends and family to buy a smart thermostat for a very long time but it’s very expensive so I never wanted to buy it but now I am so glad that I just took the hit for one check and made this investment not just a convenience but it also has save me a lot of money as well on my power bill
title: Love it so much

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RiverOtter
content: All I have to say is that as my first smart thermostat, Nest has worked like a charm. The local energy provider has a rebate program to reduce usage during rush hour, and I have had the company access my thermostat to provide warnings when the peak usage is in session. My only con is that the room closer to the A/C gets colder than the bedroom where I have my thermostat located, leading to temperature difference. I will need to remedy it.
title: Excellent Thermostat after many years of use

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DJ Berg
content: Install could not have been more spelled out and simple. Hardware provided was perfect, including an optional backing plate to cover up the otherwise hidden ugliness from previous thermostats. I found some nasty holes behind mine and the plate covered them up perfectly. Setting up WiFi connection was easy. Linked up with my existing Nest smoke detectors too. Looks nice on the wall. Crisp colorful display and the controls give a good tactile feedback. I’m impressed with the amount of control you can put over your furnace, which is again made simple to control. Great for the most novice and advanced users alike. I especially like being able to run the blower fan to circulate air without heat or A/C running. You can even set times of the day for the fan to run. Very happy with this thermostat so far and will update if I have any issues down the road.
title: Easy to Install, Exceptionally Effective

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Nic
content: Works great... install is super easy using the NEST website which basically asks you which wires you have and then allows you to print a sheet that shows you exactly what wires go where.  Installation took me about 5 minutes and setup took about 10 minutes due to all the settings/tests.  Looks great, easy to use and controlled with my Alexa and smartphone.  Should have bought one when they first came out!
title: Awesome Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M. Padilla
content: The manufacturer created the installation instructions for a complete novice which is great as long as this thermostat is replacing a thermostat with the exact same wiring (and labeled the same).  I spent significant time on line figure out how to wire this to my system because the information provided with the thermostat was really minimal.  I am happy now that I have it working; however, I nearly sent it back due to the installation frustration.
title: ... the installation instructions for a complete novice which is great as long as this thermostat is replacing a thermostat ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Matthew S.
content: Do not buy this thermostat if your system doesn’t have a C wire!  You will have to physically remove the thermostat from base and recharge it using a USB cable for 2 hours after several weeks. This was particularly enjoyable in the heat of summer.  Phone tech support doesn’t exist currently. When I installed it a few months ago, phone tech support told me the unit would charge off wires other than C and it would be no problem. In my case this proved not to be true. Now too late to return. Do yourself a favor and check your thermostat wiring before buying this product especially now that tech support is so limited.
title: Don’t buy if you have no C wire to your thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jason Phelps
content: This is third unit I've purchased... leave them when I leave a house. Have 1 in my current house and 1 in my cabin... it's great I can control the temp at my cabin so pipes don't freeze. Love this project!
title: Love my Nest!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ronald A. Beck
content: i understand that beginning in August, 2019; Nest products will not work with other manufactured products like Amazon Alexa, Lutron, etc. I purchased my thermostat less than a year ago with “works with Alexa” clearly printed on the box. I’m on the phone now and on hold for an hour with the thermostat team. Obviously nobody has a clue.  I was just getting ready to buy Nest Cams. Glad I didn’t do that yet. At least when Lowe’s decided to cancel their home automation product they provided refunds. Don’t trust Alphabet.
title: warning!  Do not buy unless your whole ecosystem is Nest. Will not work with Alexa

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: tanzip
content: After one year of operation the Nest thermostat stopped detecting motion then stopped working. Displayed message that battery needed recharge. Didn't know it had a battery. Recharged using USB as instructed and worked for one day. Then indicated needed recharge. In three sessions, the support chat staff ran me through 90 minutes of testing and app downloading then asked me to send a video of the Nest not detecting motion. I got no answers to how to replace battery or get the unit tested or repaired. Seems they just want the consumer to give up. I'll stop wasting time with them but won't buy their products
title: Terrible support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Doomstang
content: I love my Nest.  It was easy to install and has worked really well for me so far.  There is room for improvement like being able to see beyond 1 week's history in the Usage section.  My biggest complaint has been the reliability of the Nest web service.  I don't need to change my thermostat temp very often now that it has learned my methods but when I do, it seems that half of the time it can't connect due to Nest's web services being down.  They fix them within an hour or so but offer little/no explanation and then it just happens again in a few days. I hope they get their web connectivity issues under control because I really do love the thermostat.
title: Great thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: CRAIG NELSON
content: We had older thermostats on a split system (one upstairs and one down) the old thermostats could not control the temp properly. The nest thermostats resolved that issue our house now has a uniform temperature. Many great features. Easy to set up. Wi-Fi works great. Also have a sensor in the master bedroom which allows for accurate temperature in the master bedroom. Great product highly recommend.
title: Great Wi-Fi thermostat easy to install.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jim Nero
content: Still loving this device! Power bills went down and the house is always the right temperature! Absolutely a breeze to install.  20 minutes from box to install, including set up. Don't forget to check with your state energy programs and utility providers for rebates and program credits.
title: Absolutely a breeze to install. (Update after using for several months)

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Miguel A. Portes Jr.
content: I had to order it twice thinking the first one was bad. very simple install but I couldn't get it to work. I even had the electrical/gas company come and install it, but they were on successful as well. Mind you I have a pretty neal gas furnace. I guess it's just not for me I will try some other brands down the line, ONE HAS TO WORK WITH MY FURNACE EVENTUALLY
title: Blah!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M. H.
content: I was SO excited to receive this product in the mail. I have been wanting one for over a year now! Unfortunately, I received it and was ready to install it. I was required to create a google account for the nest set up, download the app, etc etc... just to find out it isn’t compatible with my ac/heat unit. What?! How disappointing! Luckily, I found out within my return window and will be getting a refund.... but dang, I was so excited for nothing.
title: Check compatibility!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: kstay
content: I moved into a house that didn't have a programable thermostat, so I thought I'd give the Nest Learning Thermostat a try.  I love the idea of a "learning" thermostat, but it hasn't exactly shown itself to be an 'A' student.  After several weeks of manually adjusting the temp at the same time, it hasn't learned my preferences/patterns as it is advertised to do.  This teacher is getting frustrated.  Save yourself the hassle and find a wifi connected thermostat that also gives you the option to program it yourself.
title: Doesn't seem to enjoy "learning" as advertised...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael Docherty
content: Love it so far. Easy to install. Only thing that irritated the crap out of me was the fact amazon offered free next day shipping for prime but yet it auto updated to 2 day shipping and took a day to even process. At that point I would have just drove down to lowes. 5 stars for Nest, 2 stars for Amazon. **UPDATE** we used it all through the schorching hell of Arizona and it helped wonderfully being able to start cooling down the house as I’m coming home from work. My electric bill has definitely been better!
title: Works great

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JG3
content: Product seems versatile and a/c is working. My problem was that when it arrived it was obviously not new. It had been opened and the installation screws had sheetrock on them from a previous install. Also it was registered to another person! See photo. I had to do a factory reset and redo all my settings to correct this. I paid for and expected a NEW item.
title: paid for NEW and got USED item.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sherzod Odinaev
content: I've been using the Nest for few months - absolutely love it. The product packaging was well thought (it even included a very nice screw driver!), directions clear, and installing was a breeze. The back plate that came with the product fit the old thermostat are 99%! I installed it within 30 minutes (I was just staring at the manual and the wall, not believing that it could be so simple to install). I had one of them ancient thermostats, and only had 3 wires to connect. Further online setup was easy too: create account, link your Nest, and see it in action from your phone. I like turning on the fan from wherever :) I havent looked into savings yet, but I'm sure it's doing it right. Not going to list all it's features - probably everybody knows it by now. It works, looks very cool, gives you great control, and once I hook it up with Alexa/Google Home, will be even better. Highly recommend the product!
title: Makes you and your home a smart combo!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mac
content: Nest thermostat wont connect to App at all. Tried many times connecting and re-installing the app, didn't work. Tried resetting thermostat, even that didn't work. Customer rep was not at all helpful. They were just pointing figures to internet vendor. I will not recommend this product to anyone. Worst customer service ever.
title: NEST wont connect to App at all.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: francisco
content: I had the unit now for 7 months, it was working flawless and noticed the reduction on the energy bill after installed. all fairy came to an end when the unti start loosing the battery power and shutting down the AC in this hot summer. Recharged  the battery manually as indicated using the USB port in the back the first day and it work back again for 2 hours losing the battery charge again and shutting down the AC in the middle of the night. recharged the battery for over 8 hours to the same result. Researched on this matter and it seems to be happening to plenty of people with this model, it seems to be a known problem from Nest. Nest support is not easy to reach using the chat or the phone. It was a great thermostast when was working from new but something expensive like this should be more reliable.This issue makes the unit unusable.
title: Nest Learning thermostast battery issues.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: An Nguyen
content: I should have gotten this one a long time ago. But I waited. I guess the third gen is probably better! It was easy to set up for. There was several videos online which are 6-7 minutes long that go through the installation process. I had to call Nest Support the next day because I have heatpump at home, so the wiring is a little different. After a few minutes of research after I sent them the pictures of my old thermostat's wiring and the new one, they advised me to move one cable to a different terminal (I had one going to the * terminal for heatpump/special connection), they advised me to move it to the O/B terminal.
title: I guess the third gen is probably better! It was easy to set up for

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael J. Greener
content: After taking three years to make up my mind, we finally bit the bullet and bought two of these. We also sprung for an installer -- cost about $ 150 to get the two working, also got them working on our Iphones, so the whole works was hands off for us. We like them very much, and already have seen some savings in electricity ... they look good, too.
title: Cool!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: A. Colombo
content: Easy setup. Liked pairing with echo and viewing alongside my cams in the Nest app. Unfortunately, the temperature is showing 2-3 degrees higher than actual. Nest says it's most likely due to my router which is on their incompatible list. I expect better from Nest, especially given the price of this item. Deciding wether to keep or return.
title: Check Nest compatible routers before you buy.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shane
content: I was very hesitant on buying this because of the cost. I read and reread the reviews here on Amazon and internet, a lot of the negative reviews are because this device had to learn the household and make sure you connect all cell phones/tablets it reads your movements in the house. I installed it the night I received, 15 minute install, very easy at that. It's been connected for just about the weeks and can see it learning everyday, my unit hardly turns on any more, house stays the temp it set at. I think in the last three weeks, I may have averaged 10 minutes a day running the heat. I will know more during the summer months in the desert
title: No more constant running

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AR Diamond
content: Love the ability to let it switch automatically and the ability to adjust over my phone if needed. We're home most of the time so we really don't take advantage of the scheduling so much as preferences for who is up and who is asleep and whether they are hot natured or cool natured.  Probably over kill for us, but I still like it. Shows the weather outside on approach as well.
title: Nice to not have to switch between heat and cool anymore

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JayRay
content: One day it just stopped connecting to the internet and now its just a $20 thermostat. Every time I need to change the setting, leave the house, check temp... anything related to this thermostat, I have to walk to it UPSTAIRS!!!!!!!!!!! and change the setting.  Its just a fancy $20.95 thermostat.
title: Beware of buying 3rd gen

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Drewatfsu
content: Stay away from NEST. I bought this thermostat and installed with no problems. Worked fine for a few months but then one day I couldn’t get the AC mode to blow cold air, it would only blow warm air. Since the NEST was working fine for months, I thought it was my AC unit and called the repair service. Turns out the AC unit is just fine, the thermostat has some kind of short, something they’ve seen a number of times. They told me to call NEST support which I did. After multiple individuals confirming the same information and sending them the invoice from the carrier professionals along with their diagnosis of a defective thermostat, they finally agreed to send me return label and would replace the unit. I got neither. So, stay clear of NEST and don’t buy this item from Amazon because they won’t replace or refund either.
title: NEST bad thermostat and bad service

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cathy Pedego
content: Easy to install; instructions are easy to follow.  For me the best feature is that I can control the thermostat from anywhere on my iPhone app.  I forgot to adjust the temp knowing the house would be empty for the weekend; saved me from having the AC running all day/night.  Conversely came home one cold morning and turned on the heat before I arrived to a nice toasty warm home.  Great product.
title: Nest T3007ES Learning Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: F.Y.I.
content: Nest refuses to allow the Thermostat to heat or cool to a scheduled temperature if in away/eco mode. Come home at 6pm and want it nice and toasty by the time you arrive? Nope. Still in away mode. The single biggest problem with Nest.  LET ME SET MY SCHEDULE! If there is no activity after coming to scheduled temperature then go back to away mode. But for f’s sake, follow the schedule.
title: Nest thinks it knows best.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kevin Naylor
content: I bought two of these for over $400 and Nest does not stand behind them.  They have been installed for less than 6 months and periodically (might be every time the power goes out) stop working.  When this happens they need to be reset manually.  Since they are installed in summer seasonal rental units the risk of my pipes freezing up because they decide to stop calling for heat is much higher than it was when i had old school $20 honeywell thermostats.  I now have to throw them away and buy new ones, amazing this company continues to sell these.
title: Nest thermostats only work sometimes

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Marshall W. Ashby II
content: worked fine for a few months, then dead battery on thermostat, followed by a replacement from Nest. This led to 6 weeks of working fine again, before another dead battery.  To be clear.. dead battery means nothing works.  Tech support and documentation will tell you that it will still work without a C battery, but it uses Rc and Rh to draw power only when the respective cooling or heating are engaged. In my case, the cooling Rc was on enough to charge with no issues, but the heating wasn't enough.  Now i get to either install a work around or run a new cable. I wish i would have gone ecobee as they don't require the constant 24V to work.
title: DO NOT INSTALL WITHOUT A "C" Common Wire!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sbmargo
content: The Nest is the best thermostat out there, but it is expensive. I found it on amazon for less than other places, $215, and our old thermostat had died, so I ordered it. It was easy to set up. If you’re wondering whether your HVAC will work with it, there is a place on nest.com to determine that. There is also a chat, to which I uploaded a photo of the old thermostat wiring. Happily, on the nest website I also found that so cal Edison and so cal gas both give rebates, and since the rebates total $225, we are net $10 ahead.
title: Most Californians get rebates on gas and electric

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Courtney Stahnke
content: Had it a year, already replaced one with a bad wifi receiver. Now having another wifi problem and customer service isn't picking up the phone. **update, now having another wifi problem that seems to be related to the app. This thing is junk**
title: It's junk

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Sire Esquire
content: Worked for 1.5 months and just straight-up died on me. I live in Florida and waking up to a house filled with swamp-butt and night sweat is unlivable.
