content: Guys, I have no idea when or how this thing “learned” that I like it hotter than the deepest pits of h*ll when I sleep, but apparently 75 degrees at 2am is in my preference?! Also, I had to pay an electrician to install an extra wire because the thing kept dying and I’d have to charge it nightly in order to get any heat in the house (NOT fun when it gets down to 15 degrees). Gave it 2 stars because it looks cool.
title: Awful “Learning” Function

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: natdeja13
content: Overall the next thermostat works well. I haven't figured out how much it's actually saving me yet because I do have an older gas furnace but compared to the thermostat I had before it's got to be saving me some money. When installing it was very touchy with the dial and you really had to watch what you were doing. Also, the day that my neighbor and I installed it was registering very high temperatures in my house because of all the touching/ body heat from our fingers. After we stopped touching it, the temperature did go down after a few hours and then it registered properly. I did call the nest support and the person who helped me was very patient and answered all of my questions. I give the support 5 stars as well!
title: Good thermostat, a little touchy, great tech support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mandy Lytle
content: My only issue with the thermostat is that it stopped connected to WiFi after we only had it for a month. Tech support was great, and we are getting a replacement, so that is nice. I hope it just is not a regular occurrence. I love that it connects to Alexa and adjusts itself as it learns the temperatures you like.
title: Good product, great tech support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Morgan Awtry
content: We have had nests in the past but this particular one, or both actually  (we bought 2) go off line on a daily basis several times a day.  We cannot get through to customer support and their website will tell you to turn off, reset router etc, or that your system is incompatible etc..  You will never talk to a live person.  We have high speed fiber and no internet connection issues.
title: Goes offline daily

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: G. T. George
content: I am experienced in installing these devices.  Was on phone with 3 different techs for total of almost 3 hours! Installed, uninstalled, rewired, installed, etc, etc. Finally came to conclusion this Nest had a mind of it's own.  Techs tried everything & seemed knowledgeable but were at a loss to fix the problem.  I reinstalled my old Honeywell with no problem. I suggested to them that since I had spent so much time that I should be rewarded with a complimentary Nest thermostat.  All agreed and thanked me for my patience but said it was up to management.  So far I've received nothing and won't hold my breath!
title: Good tech support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Helen M. Bessette
content: Awesome thermostat with a lot of potential. Easy to install, works as advertised & needed very little setup. This is going to be part of our 'smart home' setup, with the Nest security system & smoke/CO2 detectors all linked. Also connects to Alexa or Google assistant for additional control if wanted, however is not necessary at all to get full functionality. Nest phone app makes remote control a breeze.
title: Great system with amazing expansion potential.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Justin
content: Setup, look/feel, performance are easy and excellent! Nest controls are simple - you turn it up or down to make you comfortable, it learns and programs itself. How it does this is complex and elusive - I gave up trying to figure out how the Nest does it. But in a short time after installation, I found myself more comfortable and having to make less adjustments then with my previous wifi thermostat. I believe Nest operates the furnace more effectively in addition to more efficiently. I read it has 10 sensors - I'm sure this is more than my previous Filtrete 3M wifi thermostat. Build quality and snappy response to app and Alexa are a big plus. Nice that the unit connects to 5ghz ac wifi. Thumbs up, just get one!
title: performance are easy and excellent

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Eric Slick
content: The details make this thermostat worth it. It'll tell you how long it will take to cool down and how long before it turns on. No more fighting with our old thermostat and guessing at the temperature.  So far the learning aspect has worked very well. Love it.
title: What a Relief

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: 1RadMomof5
content: This thing is GREAT! Works so much better a standard thermostat in every way (nothing else to compare it to). Easy to install (as long as u know where the colors go; suggest taking pic of old thermostat wires BEFORE disconnecting). If needed, 1-800 tech support is available. Also, this color goes well with our decor.
title: FANTASTIC!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mike H.
content: Heating season was fine. Then cooling season came around. Nest would REPEATEDLY, turn AC on and off. I'm talking about every 20 seconds, until it burned up my system. It started doing the same thing on the NEW system after it was installed. The installer recommended trying a different SMART thermostat. Sure enough, no more problems. BAD Experience with such a Highly Noted product.
title: Beware....

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: lukynepro
content: It seems to work well at first. Later I've had nothing but problems with it. Some kind of warning almost daily. Then went off line for hours. Not good in 90's. I left it at 3 stars because it would be my favorite if it worked all the time. Had to replace it for something else.
title: starts off good

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Monique Hrbacek
content: Installed in May, broke last night(mid July). Past return timeframe. Warning, per our HVAC tech, this thermostat has a history of breaking easily and does not work after a surge happens. Bought a Honeywell smart thermostat today, much better choice and cost friendly.... this is now my $200 regret!
title: Broken already

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kurt Michael Zoellmer
content: Buy two thermostat .. one works fine ( until now ), the other one after a few months loose his wifi connection .. try everything to reconect to my network and nothing .. also this one lost his capability of charging his internal battery .. i have to charge throw Micro USB to operate my air conditioning unit .. too bad, lost a lot of money .. DONT WASTE YOU MONEY
title: Don't waste your money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jesus G. Villafranca
content: Excellent device. Easy to use and program. Great investment and money saver in the long run. I recently purchase a home and one of the first investments and improvements I did was to purchase the Nest Thermoset 3rd Gen. With this used home, the AC unit was replaced along with all the duct work. I wanted to make it last as long as possible and at the same time, use it as efficiently possible. I have research online and yes, when you are not home during the day due to work (lets just say between 8 – 5, M – F). You should turn the AC completely since it just wasting energy cooling/heating an empty home. You should set a programmable thermoset scheduling functions to start the AC about an hour before you arrive and that will save you money in the long run plus make the equipment last longer. The current thermostat that was placed with the house, it was very simple and the scheduling function was hard to get it configure. The Nest changes all of that. On top of that, you can view the amount of energy used per day, set auto schedules manually or allow the Nest to program itself, plus it has an excellent and easy to use interface. I highly recommend this to anyone. It is somewhat pricey but it seems to be a onetime investment purchase that will last for years and will definitely pay itself in a year or even less due to its money saving features.
title: Excellent device. Easy to use and program

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jane A
content: Has cut down on my bills and gives me more than enough data to see how many days I heat, etc... I installed it myself as well by looking at the wiring and googling things a bit.  Just make sure you have the wires that you need for it already installed in your current thermostat.  Most people do.
title: I Love  IT

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jay
content: The installation process is straight forward and there are helpful videos that can be found online to walk you through each step of the way. The ability to control your home’s temperature from anywhere in the house and beyond is quite a luxury and it now comes at a reasonable cost. The added abilities to track your energy usage over time is great for anyone who would like to save money on their utility bills. The unit itself is also gorgeous and can fit into any home decor.
title: The added abilities to track your energy usage over time is great for anyone who would like to save money on ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J. Davis
content: Installation was super easy and despite the fact that I am still working out issues with setting the system up for my particular system I would still recommend the system if you want to install it and set it up yourself.  In addition to the system being simple and easy to use, the customer support really is available 24/7.  If you are unable, or unwilling, to find the solution to your issue on their extensive interactive support section you can call and talk to a person that will make sure that if at all possible you will have a way to keep your home temperature controlled until a replacement unit arrives.  You do not have to be a contractor to install this thermostat, two screws to hold the base to the wall and a couple wires pushed in to the base and you are done with the hardware install.
title: Easy Install, Great Looking Unit, and Excellent Customer Support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Martha Zarate
content: Loved this until it stopped working. It can’t find the network in my house. We’ve tried resetting it but it is still having issues. I bought this in 2017 for at least $250. Should I have to buy a new one 😡. No one has reached out to me. Now I have to find something else.
title: Network issues.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jeff Morris
content: Complete waist of money.  Look at the photo! Not only did it double my gas and electric bill it does not work as described.  I Call in to return the product a couple weeks ago and still no refund or return label sent.  When I called in to explain that the product was not working correctly they said “we can send out a nest professional at a charge to you!”  I kindly said if I need a expert to hook up a thermostat there is something wrong” I used to built houses and have hooked up several thermostats in my day.  DO NOT WAIST YOUR MONEY
title: Complete junk! Check out my photos as proof.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Amazоn Customer
content: Works great so far!!  Followed all instructions from nest. My previous basic Honeywell thermostat didn't require a common wire nor does the nest I purchased. I read in many places that c wire for nest is good to have so its not robbing power from my R wire.  My wires that were ran to thermostat to air-handler unit had blue c-wire not being used. Just make sure you verify you are connecting 24v from your air-handler control board to thermostat and don't trust wire color. So far everything is working fine....
title: Great so far......

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: HC
content: After we bought the Next thermostat, we installed in our vacation home, for its online remote control capability, however, after we installed it, we found out it only turn heater on for a few minutes, then it would stop. we called service, to no avail, product specialist has no clue. We thought maybe it will take time for it to learn and be normal, after a month, it still does not work, never heat up till the set temp, only heat for a few mins. Now we are asking for return, the next support line had us hold for 4 long hours!!!! this company is crazy! in over market their products and no support.
title: Dissapointed

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: H.
content: Compared to my other smart thermostat (different brand), this one was easy to install and the tech support provided all the details needed for a seamless install. The complete kit included all the parts you will ever need for the install. After a month of use, the thermostat works very well and without any problems. It also doubles as a small wall clock which is quite nice!
title: A Great Smart Thermostat that is Easy to Install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Westchester, NY
content: It's all about the user experience.  We have a simple application -- gas-fired steam heat in a century old house.  The Nest functional and visual design are excellent.  The online documentation quickly identifies your specific application and provides a nice wiring diagram, and the installation took all of a half hour even with my compulsively careful approach.  In operation, the thermostat works well.  It overshoots the target temperature when heating by a couple of degrees, but no more than is probably optimal with an old steam system.  The visual display is informative.  My only quibble is with the IOS app I had to use to set up the weekly heating schedule.  The user interface for setting the times and temps is not intuitive, and setting up the schedule took a while to get through -- probably longer than installing and activating the device.  But it all works beautifully once it's set up.  Nice concept -- eliminate the installer, have one device that's smart enough to be adaptable to many different heating and cooling applications (plus monitoring etc), and invest enough to make the user experience simple and straightforward.  It's so obvious, why didn't I think of it?  Well worth the small price premium....I might even invest in the overpriced connected smoke and CO detectors.
title: It's all about the user experience

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: asdf
content: fantastic note for 2 wire systems: charge the nest via usb first. with 2 wire, meaning no dedicated power, the system works by “leeching” power. this worked fine for me, but needed to charge the unit once. after that, it safely stays above 3.8 volts.
title: get it, great product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: KMcD
content: It's 93 degrees outside today.  I'm wearing sweats and a flannel shirt.  It's so cold in here i can see my breathe.  My husband is complaining that it's too hot in here.  MY TOES ARE BLUE!  HOW CAN IT BE TOO HOT!!!!  Husband zero starts.  Thermostat works like it's supposed to, 5 stars
title: I'm FREEZING

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: N. Ketter
content: My home was built in 2016 so has a pretty modern heating system. According to the compatibility check on the Nest website the Nest should have worked. It didn't. After several hours of fiddling with it, reading support pages and pinging Nest I returned it. Disappointing.
title: Couldn't get it working...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: A Shah
content: nice product - took advantage of Black Friday and Service provider's rebate program. The product works great. very easy to install. It makes little humming noice. It can be only noticed if you are within 2 feet radius. I checking all the wiring and connections but still it is there.  Rest all okay.
title: best in market

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alexandria Copeland
content: Junk. Requires a specific voltage from our furnace, which if it does not receive renders it useless. We have had 3 technicians try to resolve, the last one a Nest professional. I wish Amazon would allow me to return, but it is outside of the return window. Going to wash my hands of Nest and get an Ecobee.
title: Does not work with my NEW furnace voltage

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AWESOMEAIR
content: Installed this in less then 15 minutes. Very simple and easy to do, directions are very straight forward. My only issue was a wiring issue because I was unaware if I had a conventional unit or heat pump unit. I wired it incorrectly at the beginning and it was pushing cold air when it was winter. I called in and they walked me through switching the wire over and now it works perfectly. My total time on the phone with Nest was 1 hour and 28 minutes. So if it's peak time to call I recommend waiting until off-peak hours to call. Other then that I love it !!!
title: Wiring is the only issue !

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Joanne V
content: Definitely think this thermostat is paying for itself! Love the ECO mode and the automatic away feature. No more worrying about turning up the air when you leave the house for the day or even longer. Plus you can adjust it from your phone so when you're on your way home from vacation you can get it cooled down before you get there! Also, love the report you get showing how much energy you've saved.
title: Definitely think this thermostat is paying for itself!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Charlie B
content: My wife loves the big display with the easy to adjust ring.  Great improvement over what we had in the past that was hard to adjust.  I should say that I have an indoor/outdoor thermometer not far from it, so I have no issue with the contents of the display. Particularly like the way it works with my iPhone, making it easy to set up and control.  It was easy to install and set up (I even took the opportunity to improve the location so it has a better view of 'people' and rewired the mess the A/C installer left).  Also have a Nest Protect paired with it.  Right now I am waiting to see how it "learns" as it is coming on earlier than when I set the old one manually, and as result I may be running the heat more.  NOTE: I have only used for heat and will have to wait for summer to see how it works with cooling.
title: Love the big display

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mike B.
content: Easy install for both device and app.  History is useful, it would be better if it maintained history data longer than a week. It has a very solid feel, not flimsy  plastic, should last a long time.  Using the App to check settings while away has come in very handy. the included plate sufficiently covered over the unit it was replacing.  Scheduling was easy.  Eco default settings should me customized on set up, if using eco mod (51F default low setting is too cold especially with pets).
title: Easy install, useful functions

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: W. A. MACGREGOR
content: Be aware that the Nest is not compatable with all HVAC systems.  I installed mine in January and my furnace never really functioned the way it was supposed to.  When I tested my AC system this spring, it wouldn't work.  After changing the control board in the furnace and various relays, the HVAC tech noticed that I had a Nest and he said they found them very problematic.  He swapped out the Nest for a basic thermostat, everything worked fine.
title: Nest not compatable with all furnaces

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rita
content: I love this thermostat!  It knows when I'm home and when I'm away.  I'm saving on my utility bills.  I can turn it from eco to my desired temperature before I get home.  It even tells me how long it will take to get to that temperature.  You can view your history for the last week.  I recommend this to anyone who wants to save money.
title: You need this thermostat!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lady.Bway
content: Works great while it’s working, but doesn’t work for long. I purchased this 6 months ago and it had completely stopped working. Luckily Nest customer service is easy to deal with and they are sending a replacement. This also accrued wither he 2nd generation nest thermostat.
title: Great until it breaks down

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Marj
content: Tech support is really bad, no phone support.  Google linked Nest to my google account and there is no way to unlink it.  They know where I am at all times and that is a no privacy at all.  it seems the only solution is to purchase another thermostat of different brand.
title: Google took over Nest forces a link account - no privacy!!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Red
content: This appears an excellent product. Yet, I'm only giving it 2 stars because even though I followed their specs for verifying it works with your system the 24v compatibility isn't really correct. I DO have a 24v system but mine wouldn't work. According to Nest support if it goes over 24v, at all, it is not compatible. Mine tested at 27v on the cooling side. Based on the expertise of my HVAC guy this is normal. So beware of the actual compatibility before you buy. I returned it and bought another brand and it's working well.
title: This appears an excellent product. Yet

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Miguel Castro
content: No complaints so far. First of all, it just works. My old one was on the fritz and was powering the HVAC on about 5 seconds after turning it off so just having a working unit is a plus of course. I'm digging the programmability and remote access a lot. The fact that you have way beyond "wake, leave, return, sleep" is awesome. The fact that it learns how long it takes to get to a certain temperature in your home is awesome. The auto-away is nice though I don't use it in its fully automatic fashion. I work from home and my kid is home-schooled so we don't have a regular away-schedule. In any case I do have an "away" temperature set and can set it manually a click when I want. But with iPhone access from anywhere in the world, that's all you ever need. The aesthetics are great. It DOES show you the current temperature, not just the "set-to". Would love to see NEST come out with "extenders" that don't hook up to the HVAC but communicate with the main unit and contribute to the room temperature calculations.
title: sleep" is awesome. The fact that it learns how long it ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: J25
content: So far, this has been everything it was supposed to be and then some.  We really just needed one we could access via app and this one was the most reputable.  After a week we are VERY pleased.  I had to contact their customer service line during installation and they were fantastic--and spoke clear English to boot!  This went in an office setting where the thermostat isn't always accessible to "touch" so we needed another way without installing a new HVAC unit for our section of the building.  This was a viable, workable solution.  If it always works like it's working now, it will have DEFINITELY been worth the money.
title: Outstanding

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Scott Sparkman
content: I have several Nest thermostats and they work great.  Easy to set up and easy to control via my app.  It does learn our schedule and adjusts accordingly.  We have an older system and I was afraid it wasn't going to work but so far so good.  I highly recommend the Nest learning thermostats and any of the Nest products.
title: Love it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gerard T. Vertucci
content: It's only been a couple of days, but so far everything is working great.  I can speak to the ease of setup.  I have electric for cooling and gas for heating, and even though they more or less scare you into hiring a pro to set it up, I found that with 6 simple wires already labeled properly on the old thermostat that it wasn't an issue at all.  Took me under an hour to replace 2 thermostats. Only thing so far is that the Home/Away Assist didn't automatically put my home in "Away" mode when I left the house.  Maybe it needs to learn a pattern, but if so it wasn't in the instructions that I saw. Overall, it looks sleek and easy to set up.  I would definitely recommend it.
title: but so far everything is working great. I can speak to the ease of setup

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: TMack
content: Love it. Reliable connectivity to wireless in our house. Simple operation. Easy to install without a pro. Performs better than expected. Has a great feature that shuts everything off when you leave the house (based on your cell phone not being at your house)
title: Love it. Reliable connectivity to wireless in our house. S

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Stephen Schwartz
content: once you get the hang of this unit it is a dream to set up and to use. great remote access. a bit unconventional in that the face doesn't always show the temperature but as soon as you approach the unit the display springs to life. not the cheapest unit on the market, but it is a great product worth the investment.
title: great remote access

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Keith Hasson
content: Ok so I love the thermostat and didn't even need a "common wire" as everyone says you do... HOWEVER, there is one big issue with  the schedule... I have mine set to cool down to 72 at night.  The problem is, AC units should not run if the outside temp is 60 or less... Last night it was 58% outside and 73 inside and my AC kicked on.  THIS IS NOT GOOD FOR THE UNIT AND WILL CAUSE DAMAGE and they have NO SOLUTION FOR IT!  Atleast before with IFTTT you could set a rule but once you migrate your account you are HOSED!  Need a Fix Google!!!!
title: How many AC units will fail before they fix this??

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: sherman
content: I was super excited to get out of the Stone Age and start making my home smart. While the Nest looks flashy and makes you feel like your house could be smarter, it just doesn’t deliver for the price point. There are some things I love about it... But the whole smart predictive capabilities are just not as smart as they make it seem.
title: Just a nice looking thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Laura Gayle Green
content: Want to make sure your home is cool/warm enough when you get home? Get a Nest. Want to save money with an ECO setting when you're away? Get a NEST. Have an elderly family member who may want to change the thermostat using a voice command (through the Echo) or on a phone? Get a NEST. Want to have a precise reading on how much energy you spend heating/cooling your home? Well, you know the answer. I love my NEST.
title: AWESOME device

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Allyssa Batten
content: I love the Nest. I am very sensitive to temperature changes so the Heat & Cool option is wonderful. Able to set a range that I find comfortable all year long. It has learned our work schedules well enough that I am able to keep the house in the 70s in winter while keeping my gas bill reasonable. The ability to change it via app is very handy as well at night when you're having a too-hot-too-cold battle with your husband (or just generally).
title: I love the Nest

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: T.shin
content: We've gotten to the point in adult life where Christmas are more functional than exciting...but once in a while we can find one that covers both categories! Purchased on black friday so we only paid $199 instead of $249, and the installation was completely painless - as long as you are comfortable with using a screwdriver and level then you should have very few problems with this. I thought the wall plate looked a little cheap compared to the stainless steel finish, so I created my own wood backing plate and simply marked/drilled holes for the Nest right over the top of it. No issues whatsoever. One thing I have noticed is that the furnace doesn't kick on as quickly as the old thermostat when the temperature fluctuates, although I have to wonder if that is part of the energy-efficiency the Nest is built for. It isn't really a bad feature, just different from what we are used to. All in all, I am more than happy with the Nest!
title: get the Nest - it's absolutely worth it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Barb
content: Bought this for our home, arrived the day the furnace decided to quit. Perfect timing! Furnace company installed with the  new furnace. We love it, and love that you can program it to come on and off when needed.
title: Nest Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: S Kunz
content: Installation was really straightforward and easy with the online tutorial. The learning feature seems to be limited to our schedule, as to when we turn the heat on, and off. That worked really well in the colder months. Also, it's nice to not have to worry about forgetting to turn the heater or AC off with the Auto Away feature. It doesn't seem to build a refined profile though, depending on the temperature "feel" in relation to humidity for example, as far as I can tell. All in all, it's less impressive than expected, there's no other way to put this. Most of the time it's off now since we're in Southern California and rather run the whole house fan than the AC when it's warm. The Nest thermostat thus is a lifestyle gadget that, after evaluating it for ~6 months, we could actually easily do without.
title: Less impressive than expected.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Margaret Barnett
content: Absolutely love it.  Can change the temperature from anywhere.  I didn’t wait for it to learn my habits, just set it to go on about 15 minutes before I get up and about 30 minutes before I go to bed.  No more fiddling with it, it’s all automatic.  Even when I leave the house, I want my dogs to stay comfortable so I don’t change the temp much.  House feels warmer.  Looking forward to my next natural gas bill.
title: Easy install, preset or let it learn about you and get on with life

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: consumer
content: Great product not very friendly with some devices like viviant. Installing it is fairly easy. We love using it wish we could get it to work with viviant. Cant wait to see the bill for heating to see if it is any better.
title: Great looking unit.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Fast Fords Forever
content: Was able to directly wire to my Mr. heater Big Max heater in my shop. My big complaint is you can only set the temperature down to 50°, I would prefer to set the temperature to just above freezing when I am not in there. The safety temperature can be set up as low as 35. When the thermostat is turned completely off which can be done on the app.
title: Works with Mr Heater, Big Max Shop Heater

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kevin
content: 1 thing it does is save you money on your heating by disconnecting from wifi randomly and not running your heating system. If you live in Minnesota like me where it gets well below zero this time of year, this device is way too unreliable to trust. Dont be surprised when you come home to all your pipes burst and your basement flooded becuase this device NEVER NOTIFIED YOU THAT IT ISNT WORKING. Amazing idea, and really cool when it works, but it CANNOT BE TRUSTED
title: Not reliable, DO NOT trust it.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Linda Guzman
content: So far so good. Installation was pretty easy to my surprise. I am saving between $20-$50 a month on my electricity bill. I wish I could give 5 perfect stars but their App is somewhat difficult to use. It’s hard to set a schedule through the app. Other than that, we are very happy with our Nest.
title: I’ve had this for about 7 months now

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Invisible hoverboard
content: Doesn’t work with Lux 500. It kept throw me e74 error code saying the power cable doesn’t have power. I have confirmed the cable has power. Returned it cause I’m pretty sure it doesn’t work. After reading the review, nearly 15% one star, I’m wavy even if it works cause I don’t want to worry about long term support. My current thermostat works reliably at least.
title: Doesn’t work for my setup

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: BenM
content: This is an outstanding thermostat. In conjunction with the app on my Android smartphone and Apple iPad, it is easy to manage, works well and I was able to add a Nest doorbell so the app has both on the same page. Very easy to make adjustments to temperature and time on the app, but not so easy on the thermostat itself. Nest seems to have really stepped with this product. Very happy with it.
title: Nest is Best

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brianna Edwards
content: Easy to install, not as easy to operate. We have had some problems with our Nest changing temperature on its own, heat rising, etc. (which is a problem as we live in Florida!). Overall, we have saved some money on our electric bill. I am sure that any issues we have will disappear as we learn to adjust our Nest.
title: Operation is Confusing

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: jconn21074
content: I have had the first version nest for years. We just bought a new home and installed this one. They are the best thermostat on the market for sure. Easy to install and set up is simple. I have installed for friends as well. The new features of the Nest are cool visual adding the clock. Simple set up and programming makes this above the rest hands down.
title: No need to look at other thermostat units. This is the best!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: William C. Maguire
content: I really like the Nest - it is physically very sleek looking and well made. It took my 20 minutes to put in and I can remotely control the temperature and my property manager can too. There is an off function that supposedly will keep the home at above 40 degrees. I haven't tried that feature yet but it would be ideal when the house is empty. My property is in Maine and fuel oil is very expensive so I'm trying to see if I can reduce my costs.
title: Very easy to install and multiple people can control remotely

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tom Guelker
content: I have had this for about 15 months.  The only gripe I have is the filter reminder does NOT work.  I replaced the filter in November, and told the V3 I changed it, and here it is July and no reminder yet even though I have changed it every month since then without relying on the thermostat to tell me.  I would give it 4.9 stars because of this.  Otherwise, well thought out design and app.  It integrated with my Google Home and SmartThings network easily..
title: It integrated with my Google Home and SmartThings network easily..

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Stephen K.
content: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it!  Independent verification that it works... our power company sends us notes that tell us what our "Rank is compare to similar homes in the area."  Now it's been a hot summer, so I'm sure we're using more overall - however, relative to our neighbors, we have improved about 25 spots.  We were always like #95/100 (we're not hogs, we have 6 people in our house).  Since getting the Nest we've improved on a quarterly basis to #69/100.  Now, i have really tried to adjust setting based on history and usage to try to minimize the usage consumption - but it's at the same temp or lower than last year.  So, proof that it works.  Very cool!
title: It works, no kidding

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: K
content: We've been wanting a Nest thermostat for a while, so I bit the bullet and grabbed one when they were on sale. This took minutes to install and compared to our last thermostat with buttons that not everyone understood, this is a breeze. Our old thermostat would run the system non-stop and it still never cooled well which is a problem living in Texas. With the Nest, we know exactly how long it will take to reach temperature and doesn't need to run half as often. Time will tell how much of a difference it'll really make in our bills, but I love it so far!
title: Awesome

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: P3 Tactical
content: Works very well, however there are some eco setting which the end user is unable to adjust or disable. For instance, the Nest will not heat/cool to a specific temperature. Example, if the nest is set to cool to 68, it will wait until the room is 70, then cool until the room reaches 66. This im sure saves considerable power, but I would like the ability to adjust this. Especially when you have one thermostat for multiple floors, this cause an unpleasant fluctuation in temperature. Everything else is great!
title: if the nest is set to cool to 68

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ryan
content: Absolute garbage. Original unit failed after 1 month. Both replacements from google failed as well. Google attempted 3 months later to have me “return the unit to amazon” even though I was on a 2nd replacement unit from GOOGLE. Do not recommend. Trash product, seek alternative options.
title: Garbage.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mario Rios
content: I connect the wires as shown on video and diagram, when it checked the system to see if it was properly connected it past the test. Something went wrong and had to call a professional to check the connections and found out one of the wires was not connected where it supposed to be
title: Please make instructions clear

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Savannah.x02
content: Tried to install this in my apartment... just because I have a heater with a built in backup the nest wouldn’t let me set it up without the use of a Nest Pro Technician... an additional 130.99$ cost plus tax that I was not expecting. Would have returned had I not opened the packaging
title: Apartment Wiring

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kent D. Pearson
content: I've owned the product 4 years and liked it.  But recently Google (which bought the company after I bought the Nest) forced all users into 2 Factor Authentication.  Too much hassle to just change the thermostat a degree.  I deleted the Nest app from phone.  I've also disconnected the 2 Nest Thermostats from the network so as to prevent Google from making money from my data.  If this policy isn't reversed, in the near future I will be buying two competing thermostats that don't require 2FA.
title: Good until Google crippled it with Forced 2FA

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: tsjazzman
content: I was very pleased with the whole purchase and instalation process. The product is as good as advertised and working well in our house right now. I didn't purchase the Amazon Instalation plan because I wanted to have our AC guy installed the product but if you don't have anyone, it might be a smart idea to purchase the instalation package with the product. I highly recommend this product to anyone who's looking to improve the energy consumption in your house.
title: Superb Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rick S
content: So easy to connect. After screwing with the Honeywell Lyric for 8hrs trying to connect through my router and register, I gave up on it and bought the Nest. What a pleasure to work with, had it going in less than 30 minutes. I did a 2 wire install on a Williams wall heater. Buy a 24V transformer, connect one lead to "C" the other to "Rc". Connect one lead from heater to "W1" the other lead from heater goes in "Rh". That Nest is SLICK! Glad I gave up on the Lyric. I installed this at my lake house where I needed remote control.
title: Really cool device.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: jacob ritorto
content: It's elegant and doesn't look like some rubbish you glued to your wall.  I had initially bought the Ecobee4 initially but returned it because its "toss it on the wall and see what sticks" feature set struck me as half-hearted, half-implemented, broken, sparsely-tested, poorly-thought-out. Now that I've seen both, I have to say that Nest need to step up the feature set just a bit with just a few more carefully-designed, curated features.  Hint: Calculate heat loss for me? Enable controlling more settings from my phone?  Would be a snap.
title: It's very good and elegant but the austere design aesthetic has been taken too far. I hope they release more features soon.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RH
content: I have been waiting to buy something like this for some time.  It went on sale AND I found a rebate from my energy company AND I just bought a couple of Amazon Echos..  Made total sense.  I was a little nervous about installing it, but I watched a great video on youtube and it turns out it is easier than I thought.  I just took a picture of the old wires, turned off the power to the furnace and proceeded to switch it.  It came right on when I turned on the power and worked.  I'm just getting used to the controls, but I enjoy being able to control it from the app, the nest itself, or a webpage.
title: I have been waiting to buy something like this for some time

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: sinerge
content: One night my heat pump stopped heating, so we had to switch to alternative heat.  After my HVAC person inspected the system, he said the O terminal is always energized, causing the HP to remain in cooling.  The HVAC person said that he sees this all the time with nests and recommended getting another brand.  The nest support rep confirmed that he sees this once a week and it is an issue with the display and not the base plate.  They are working on a fix and it impacts all generations.  I chatted with nest support subsequently, as they did not deliver the replacement part when promised, only to get the most frustrating and ridiculous customer service every.  Maybe I should go with a different brand...
title: Heat Pump Issues and Bad Customer Support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alex H.
content: Wonderful product, nice and clean looking and the automatic learning of temperature settings throughout the day is great. Having the ability to adjust temperatures from your smartphone is a plus. I would have given 5 stars but at the end of the day it's still a thermostat and not a miracle $ saver. While it does save you money if used correctly. I feel most people will set it and let it learn and then never change the temp throughout the day to help with cost efficiency. Would be nice if the thermostat could check the outside temp and the inside temp and then suggest a temp that could save you money for that day without causing you to freeze or sweat to death.
title: Very nice thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Krista
content: Don't buy it, it's junk! I  Installed my unit and it worked wonderfully for about a week. Woke up one morning a quit heating and would not shut the fan off. I called my HVAC  Person and he came and did a check on it and found out that it was the  Nest thermostat unit. Because I didn't install it right after purchase my return window is over but if they don't refund my money it's the last business I will do with Amazon! Quit selling junk and you won't lose customers! In addition my HVAC  Person told me that this is common with the nest thermostat! Don't buy it, it's junk!
title: Don't buy it , It's junk!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: LM
content: What everyone said... I don't believe I have to add anything new to profess how FANTASTIC the Nest is... Though, I'll throw Windows Phone users a bone here --- this is WP8x and WP10 compatible :D Look for "N10" (Free, and perfectly functional)  or search "Cozy Nest" (works on WiFi only) or "WellNezTed" (great, but costs a whopping one dollar) on the store.  I'm sure there are others. So yeah... This is a fantastic product!  We've noticed as much as a 30% reduction in our bill, month-on-month despite it being Winter.  We absolutely love using this as a "remote-start" device via the cloud.  What a convenience!
title: Windows Phone owners... this one's for you.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bryan
content: This is the best thermostat on the market, but I have one request: I'd love to be able to develop apps for it, and I can't. There are all sorts of cool little apps I could add to it, but have no way of doing so. Their current developer program is thoroughly complex and difficult, and doesn't even allow programming directly for the thermostat itself. This is very unfortunately, because there are so many cool things you could do with it. Oh well, it's still the best thermostat ever made.
title: The best thermostat of all time, just wish I could code apps for it.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Domenic
content: Worked immediately! As long as you have a C-wire, the Nest will work right out of the box. The setup couldn't be easier. A built in level in the install plate is a nice touch. Nest really knows how to make the process easy. The operation of the unit is just like the old dial thermometers so millions of people inherently know how to use it. Even the older generation will know to just rotate it to change the temp.
title: A built in level in the install plate is a nice touch. Nest really knows how to make the ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Laxmom3000
content: Prior to purchasing I did verify as suggested on Nest website my existing thermostat wiring would work and watched an installation video on you tube. The packaging was slick, and very easy to install. I’m a woman, and usually defer to my husband for these things. I’m very proud I was able to install it and set it up without any issues. Cannot wait to see how we can have some energy savings compared to our old programmable thermostat.
title: Fantastic looking and easy to install and set up

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lisa Marney
content: Arrived on time.  Easy, simple to install - clear instructions. Took me about 1.5 hours with 3 kids interrupting, dinner,  getting homework done and getting ready for bed.  Easy set up on the thermostat itself and to the computer.  Went back a bit later and set it up to my phone.  Works as expected so far.  My house was HOT today at 70 - which was the setting we kept our old one while at home to be at low warm.  Will look forward to watching the trends as it "learns" our preferences.  Will update in a few months.
title: Easy set up, as described.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Richard L. Wheeler
content: We are both learning each other's quirks, the Nest and I. Needed to have professional help as our place is older and has electrostatic air cleaner along with humidifier for winter. Bough a temperature sensor for upstairs but the system seems to have difficulty finding a balance between the two level of our place. It is more user-friendly in some aspects and not so friendly in others. Wife is fairly homebound and it does not like that we leave the fan on all the time to use the air cleaner. But we are just entered our second or third week of use, will see.
title: Not your grandfathers thermostat.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Linda Donahue
content: UPDATE: I cannot begin to say how disgusted I am with this product. After 2.5 years, it started developing major issues with connectivity to my WiFi. Nest support is ridiculously slow, and after 90 minutes was told I should move my router ... which is built-in by AT&T Uverse. Can't do it. I was told that since my warranty expired last November, I'd have to buy a new device. So, for $250, I got a device that only lasted 2.5 years. Nope. I'll replace it ... not with a Nest. I cannot begin to praise this thermostat enough. I love that I can control the temperature remotely, schedule the temps, and that the Nest knows my schedule.
title: Makes My Life Smarter

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cheetahfox
content: We have had this set up for 5 days now and we are liking it. It's already learned out activity. I like having the app so we can use eco temps when we are home but start heating the house back up if needed before we get home. So far so good....
title: So far so good...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: ROBERT MARTIN
content: Not happy with this product, never complained on this sight before , but I have been getting such a run around with their tech support, I feel like returning this piece of junk, I have had it over a year now and was set up, had to rewire boiler but I got it to work, love it and keeps my house at the right temperature!
title: Not happy with this product, but I'm happy now!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: jennynoel
content: I love this little device.  It was easy for me to set up, intuitive to figure out how to set it and control it from either the wall unit or my computer. I'm considering getting one for my parents.  I signed up for the "rush hour" rewards, where the thermostat will alert you of an upcoming time where there will be a considerable strain on the power grid, and Nest will precool the house prior to the rush hours, and will turn itself down to conserve energy during - the power company pays me for decreased usage during these times.  How cool is that?  I'm sure I've already saved money on my electric bill because this thermostat is so smart.  Totally worth it.
title: Love my little Nest.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Philip W. Robinson
content: Exactly what I expected! arrived very quickly and was extremely easy to install and set up. I wish I had ordered this product first! About a week ago I ordered a “used but like new” Nest 1st gen thermostat and paid $189. Upon arrival I found the face screen was cracked and the dial intermittently worked making the setup difficult and nearly impossible. I should have spent the extra $11 and got this, 3rd generation thermostat in the first place! The 3rd gen is staying and the 1st gen is being returned.
title: Easy install

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lynn B.
content: My Nest programmable thermostat stopped working after six months. There’s no help from Amazon due to Covid-19, and it says that it is outside the return window, so basically I’m out $200 for six months of use. This is truly unacceptable from a company that has been making $10k per minute during the quarantine!! I am furious!!!
title: Rip-off and R.I.P. to my Nest!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: dacrew873
content: I like being able to control the temperature remotely, but the interface seems clunky. I kept having the temp change up and down on me without my changing it, I think the calendar settings are difficult to use. Overall glad I got it though.
title: Pretty nice to control your temperature remotely

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Yuqian
content: The wifi stopped working after a month, so can't use the app. After several chat with technical support, they said the problem can't be fixed, they would send a replacement the next day, waited for 2 weeks, no replacement received. Tried to call the support number, said they don't take phone call this moment. Tried the chat, said have to ask the senior support, waited online over 30m, no answer. Totally waste of time! Very disappointment customer, don't buy!
title: wifi stopped working

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chase Vaughan
content: This thing is awesome. Right now you might not think too much about your thermostat, but this one is absolutely beautiful and does a great job managing the AC usage in my house. Whenever you walk by and it wakes up, you feel like you're in the freaking future. Programming my old thermostat was so tedious I never took it seriously. Now I can do the programming from my phone as easily as creating a calendar event. It's pretty, it's smart, and it's really cool. If you're teetering on the edge on whether to get it or not, I would nudge you toward the buy side.
title: Awesome, fun, and beautiful

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Abdussalaam Ahmad
content: Easy setup and easy to add to wi-fi.  I was thinking that it was not worth the money but bought it anyway.  I was wrong; it is worth every penny.  I love how, when I set it up, it does a diagnostic to make sure you furnace/AC/blower work.  Once it is hooked up to the internet via wi-fi, it does everything itself; updates, location, weather, etc!  You have to do nothing but look cool and hi-tech!  Very nice purchase that I highly recommend.
title: Highly recommend

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SheilaE
content: My husband got me this for Christmas.  We also have a Google Home.  Our old thermostat (a Honeywell) was a bear to set - and I have to say, this is a breeze.  The phone app- showing humidity, history, schedule- perfect. I LOVE the Home/Away Assist that works with the phone.  No more running out and leaving the heat - that I may have turned on for just a few minutes to take the chill off- on all day in an empty house. It's also great fun working with Google Home to turn the heat on as I stay buried under the covers.
title: Makes life a little more comfortable (while it saves you money)

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lisa
content: The Nest is amazing I could never go back to a regular thermostat after buying this.  So easy to use and works so well.  Learns and adapts to the environment and how we set it.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase.  Extremely easy to install and setup.
title: Could never go back to a regular thermostat anymore

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brian Arse_nault
content: I've heard people in person scoff at the idea of a thermostat connecting to your wi-fi and operable through an app (do you send email to it? Next we'll be connecting our blenders to the internet.. /yuk). But when you consider how much of one's electric bill is made of heating and cooling costs, it makes absolute sense to have such an arrangement (nerd-confession, I'm probably checking the app as often as people look at Facebook). In case you were wondering, yes, you can still use the Nest if your internet connection drops. You would then use it like any other thermostat. You don't HAVE to have an internet connection to use one, but that's sort of the whole point. Ok, on to the meat part.. If you have at least a minor grasp of wiring you will have a very easy time setting this up. I just moved into a new house and had planned to buy one of these for it. On our first night I was so annoyed by the interface of the existing t-stat that I just replaced it with the new Nest. They idiot-proof the installation with the help of their website. Just tell it what wires you have and it will produce an image of where you should land each one. It's a lot more straightforward than the t-stat I replaced in my previous house. Once the power is back on the Nest is very easy to use. You interface with it by turning the outer edge left or right, and confirming selections by using the thing as one giant button by pressing the lower edge around 6 o'clock. It's got a little thump of tactile sense to it, a very smooth operation. Program it for what your personal cool and warm limits are - think, I want the house to get at least this cold before the heat kicks in or, I want it to get at least this hot before running any A/C. It will suggest you play with the temps for the next few days while it accustoms to your habits. Using the app is what makes this device shine though. The Next will provide you with a simple seven digit code to enter into the app to sync it up to your phone. Connecting to it that way will allow it to know whether you are home or not, and adjust the temps based on whether it should bother heating or cooling at all. If you're away and you do notice the A/C is on because it's particularly hot that day, you can just override from a distance. The app will keep track of how much heating/cooling occurs on each day. I'd imagine some owners see a challenge there, of how to get to the lowest number. More than one user can interact with the device through the app, so if you live in a house that fights over t-stat settings I suppose you can do it from the comfort of the couch now. In summary, it's a definite five star device, and I'm very pleased with it.
title: You would then use it like any other thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ronald A.
content: this is becoming a nightmare for me. I thought Nest was a 5 star product but it isn't. I bought 2 thermostats in 2016 and one of them has died. (according to the technician the power unit died) I have been trying to apply the guarantee without success. they ask a lot of questions, proofs, which is ok, but is seems they are trying to put a lot of obstacles to desperate the customer. even this bad experience, i bought a new one, install it and it is working well for one day. So i have one unit that is not working. only has 1 year (the warranty says 2 years) and Nest is not helping me to get a solution. Not sure if i had an exception of the product, but for sure the customer service and guarantee process is a nightmare
title: the process to apply the guarantee is a nightmare

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: T. Hunsaker
content: This is my second Nest. Left our first when we sold our home, we used this in concert with our power company's Energy Saver Plan to lower our monthly bills during the summer by $10-$20 a month. Installation is a breeze, the included screwdriver and wire flag/stickers gave me everything I needed to yank the old unit off the wall, and get this one setup in under 20 minutes. I do wish there was first-party support for external temperature sensors to better regulate the air throughout the home.
title: Quick install, easy operation. Save money and gain control!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Reg9
content: 2.5 years in service and the wifi went out.  When it failed, it also failed to maintain the temperature.  My home was very hot when I arrived to find this crashed NEST unit.  Upon further inspection it appears that an IC got quite hot at some point (See photo).  After a couple internet searches it is clear that others have reported a similar issue.  Google has informed me that if it was in warranty (it wasn't) that I voided the warranty by "tempering" (sic) with it.
title: Failed

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SS
content: I read mixed reviews on this thermostat but decided to buy it anyways.  I'm not disappointed.  I love it!  It's beautiful to look at and I love that not only can I control the temperature from my phone but it can also double as a weather app.  Would highly recommend.
title: Love the Nest!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jimmy R. Hammond
content: After multiple calls and emails to the Nest technical support team regarding the compatibility with my oil forced air furnace and my Rudd AC system, I was advised to get a professional installer. I called my regular electrician to do the work, but when he arrived he told me he had never done one and thought I should seek someone that had done Nest installs before. I then hired a recommended person thru Amazon to do the Nest install and when he arrived  he told me I needed a C wire and that I should call the HVAC company that installed the heating and AC unit. I gave up and returned the unit!
title: I then hired a recommended person thru Amazon to do the Nest install and ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dylan Henline
content: Got this for my mom and she had a friend install it. He switched the wires and wound up bringing the house to 90 degrees in summer. Read the directions carefully and this thing is a dream! Set the temperature from anywhere, create schedules, and have it cool or warm when you're nearby
title: Reas the instructions

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Roseann C.
content: Received as a gift and the return date had expired before I received. We had non stop issues with it not cooling the house. Had a technician come out to confirmed wired correctly and set up correctly and it was ok. After a couple months we went back to our old thermostat and the house has been fine. I am upset I cannot return it is a lot of money to just waste.
title: Didn’t work!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Trojansky
content: So far so good. I was hesitant but setup was pretty easy. No need for electrician. Take a pic of your wires beforehand! Works well with the app...need to “add” the thermostat after you setup the mobile app. Home is just your profile. Usually about a minute delay before Mobile request to actual heater coming on (we have very fast WiFi). That would be only complaint so far but not that big of a deal.
title: So far so good. I was hesitant but setup was pretty easy

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chums322
content: I have cut my electric bill in half by using this thermostat. I live in a 700sqft. apartment my weekly bill is about 15$, after installing this baby I was able to caliberate it and schedule the thermostat so it only kicks on when it sees my phone. So far my weekly bill has dropped to 6$ a week. Obviously this might not be entirely accurate due to the weather change and lack of time that I have had the best in use. But I highly recommend it.
title: AMAZING!!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Krystal
content: I have 3 of these in 3 different houses. Easy to track electric use. Works with heat pumps. Saves money on electricity due to eco mode. Tells you when there is an error with your system. And can be controlled from anywhere. Worth the money.
title: Worth the money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MN BoHacker
content: Works great. I had no problems installing the thermostat and getting it working with the Nest app. Easy to set the temperature schedule. I've been using it with a smartphone app and with Alexa. The thermostat changes temperature within a couple of seconds of a voice command to Alexa. I love the history display of when my furnace runs. It showed me that even when the outside temperature averaged -10F, my furnace only ran half of the time. It has also been interesting to see that it takes over an hour for my house to recover from an 8F night setback. The pre-heating function for activating the furnace in order to get the temperature up to the desired temperature at the specified time lets me know it will be warm when I get up regarding of the setback temperature and the outdoor temperature. I should have changed out my old programmable thermostat long ago.
title: Easy to use and furnace operation history is great

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ed B.
content: Almost 30 days.  So far so good.  Love the fact that on app I can visually see usage and settings per day and times.  Works with Alexa but funny part is other than testing it out with Alexa never used it that way again so far.  It works well enough no need to adjust so far.
title: Overall good product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tismobeach
content: Doesn't really work. Thought this would be awesome but after installing it, it's been nothing but a disappointment. My A/C doesn't instantly turn on when I want it to, It does appear to enable my attic exhaust fan like my previous thermostat and it was incredibly expensive. I think I'm sending it back and going back to my old thermostat. Just not worth it.
title: Not worth it.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lake remodeler
content: I've had my eye on the Nest thermostat for years...primarily for the aesthetics. We recently had to replace our aging AC system and I decided to upgrade to the nest. It is fantastic, controls temperatures perfectly and I really enjoy the very simple learning features. It senses your presence and if you haven't walked by in 24 hours, it reverts to eco mode. We have a weekend house so this is a great feature. This also controls the downstairs level of our house so we simply set it for 78 degrees during the late evening and then 73 degrees during the day. I'm not sure how much energy it will save but it works and looks great!
title: We love this thing

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: KR
content: I had no interest in a thermostat at all.  Just the old arrow up and down thing and that was it.  But I kept reading about the NEST and a few friends had the NEST and I did some research and decided to order it (there was also a 50 dollar off deal, I think). I installed it myself (highly recommend making sure you have a C Wire before purchasing) and I have zero experience with electrical anything, especially installation, but the Nest website walked me through if the wires we had were compatible.  Once it arrived, I had the old thermostat off and the Nest installed in under an hour (again, zero experience in installing anything electrical related).  The instructions were incredibly clear, easy to follow, and I had no trouble getting it up and running.  Once it was connected to wifi, we just adjusted it to what we were comfortable with and let it "learn" from our weird heating habits.  When we were gone for an extended period of time, it would go into Away Mode and lower the temperature to an acceptable cooler temperature while we were away and when we come home, the Nest would sense we were back and turn the heat up to where we normally liked it.  It takes about a week, but it really does learn what your habits are and then it just takes over and programs itself.  You can change it whenever you want if you're too cold or too hot and it keeps track in the app on your phone how often you used it for the day.  We've cut down on our heating costs just from the Away Mode - even when we nap and it doesn't sense any movement, it doesn't heat as much and we love that because we don't like waking up all sweaty from a power nap.  Those little things add up.  I never thought I'd like or write about a thermostat, but we love this thing.  It's kind of reminds us of the Hal 9000, and we sort of expect it to take over the house at some point, but it's so awesome, we're okay with it.
title: Nest Is Neat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: susan neuenschwander
content: I went on-line to nest.com to see if it could replace our 20 yr old Honeywell wall manual unit.  It said it did....and showed a picture of where the wires would connect.  I took a picture of it.....was so pleased we could actually use this!  My husband who is typically very handy would NOT have connected the wires correctly.  My photo from the NEST site saved us.  No issues......worked as soon as we got the internet hooked up to it.....which took a few times but it wasn't the NEST fault....it was our goofy internet.  But all is well and I LOVE the way it looks and the way it lights up to tell me the temp whenever I walk by it!  I still have to figure out all the cool stuff we can do with it, but we live in the frozen tundra in the winter and it will be a relief to know if our furnace ever quits!
title: Very pleased with this product!  I should have upgraded years ago.....but happy I waited for the 3rd generation!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: TeamB
content: I just installed it last night and it was very easy to install.  For those that don't have a C wire (Common Wire) please read this.  The unit itself is awesome. This is our first Nest product.  Still learning how to use it, but we can already that we will absolutely love it. Ok, for those that don't have a C wire.  It's true that the Nest unit may still operate without this hooked up if your HVAC system provides enough power through the existing wires.  If not, here is a work around. First, shut off power to your HVAC / Furnace.  There is a wire marked G both on the Nest unit and your HVAC.  My color was green but yours may differ. In your HVAC / Furnace unit, open up the panel (again not before you shut off power to it at the breaker) and you will see all of the wires going to the individual letters, just like on the Nest module.  Move the line that is on the G connection and put it in the spot with C connection.  This seems like a big job especially if you have never opened up your HVAC unit, but it's very simple.  This was my first time doing this.  Just watched a YouTube video to figure it out. With the above completed, make sure that you remember the color of the wire that you just moved.  Install your new Nest module.  Connect that wire into the C connection and you are done.  This will provide enough power to your unit and you won't run into that error code.  If your Nest doesn't turn on, make sure that you have put the panel back on your HVAC unit.  There is a kill switch in most newer models that will shut off power to the system if the panel is missing.  The Nest unit will not turn on if this panel is missing from the HVAC.  If it still doesn't power on, make sure you have reset the breaker. The G wire, doesn't really do anything on newer HVAC systems.  It is the independent fan control for the system.  I never run my fan without the A/C or the Heat on, so this wasn't a big deal for me.  It allowed me to fix the C wire issue without buying anything new or running new wires. Good luck! And enjoy your Nest!  Hopefully this helps anyone out there with the same issue.
title: Very Pleased with Nest so far!  Installation without C wire included

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Christine M.
content: I wanted to make my new (actually old) home that was built in 1927 as energy efficient as possible. So I ordered the Nest and an Alexa. My home has been totally updated including new electrical, gas, and plumbing lines, therefore replacing the thermostat with the Nest was a cinch. I am a female in my early 50’s therefore I have had to adapt to the tech era unlike my son who was born with a video game controller in 1 had and a cellphone in the other. Just kidding, but the whole process took me about 10 minutes. Integrating it with my Alexa was simple as well. My “old” house has become one step closer to becoming a “smart” home. I love the fact tgat I can control my thermostat when I am away from my home. Win, win!!
title: So easy even I could do it, by myself!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: GDH
content: Purchased primarily for the remote access capability for a lake house. To date its everything I had hoped and more. Had some issues with the compatibility checker from Nest in that the initial schematic they provided had the furnace kicking on when the AC was supposed to be running. Not good when its 98 degrees outside. However,  tech support walked me through the trouble shooting and rewiring of the unit for our system. They stayed with it until the system worked correctly and this was on a Sunday afternoon. In use for only 2 weeks, to date very impressed with the overall operation.
title: IT WORKS !!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Aimnkill
content: That is my second "smart Thermostat". the first one was the ecobee3. I can already say that this is much better than the ecobee but still there is few stuff missing from the Nest app. For instance the fan schedule should really have an advance schedule option, the existing one being to basic. otherwise it's just SO easy to install, and look pretty good on the wall. I wish Nest had released some remote temperature sensors too.
