content: this is by far the best learning thermostat on the market. after trying two different wifi thermostats that did not perform as expected I bought the NEST and I love it.  I love it so much in fact i'm now replacing my current smoke alarms to Nest alarms and will eventually have a house of Nest thermostats, smoke alarms and irrigation control.  These are great products folks and I strongly recommend you give them a try, they are wonderful and you'll love them too !
title: this is by far the best learning thermostat on the market

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bad in Bahston
content: Been running Nest 1 and Nest 2 since they first arrived on the market. Finally decided to upgrade both models based on rebates and some of the latest features (far sight) and better displays.  While both units are still learning my schedule, I love the bigger display and Alexa integration. Simply say "Alexa, set the house temperature to 70 degrees" and boom, the heating units fire up.
title: Best Nest Ever!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jennaven Henninger
content: Works as stated. Love it and I get a $75 energy rebate from my utility company. Very happy and it is located in hallway by bathroom door so it makes a very nice nightlight for night time bathroom trips. It lights up as you approach. It tells me the humidity level in the house too. WOW!
title: Follow instructions.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tim K

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Virginia customer
content: The Nest 3 thermostat worked fine for two years.  But in the middle of the night, set to air conditioning mode, it failed and displayed error code E108.  I spent some time at Nest's website trying to solve the problem, but no luck.  I waited ONE HOUR on the phone to reach tech support.  The very nice technician walked me through a fix--removing one wire and replacing it.  (The Nest support website did not spell out this solution, which it should have.)  Then the Nest worked, but only for two hours.  Now the same error message again. I called back, and was put on hold for 2 1/2 hours!  To add insult to injury, the "on-hold" music must rank among the worst, most annoying, repetitive 20 seconds of audio.  It would serve the Nest executive who chose this music right if he/she were tied down and forced to listen to this rot for 48 consecutive hours! When I finally reached a tech, he told me to remove the blue wire and not put it back.  Finally, this fixed the problem.  But why this could not have been spelled out on Nest's support website is beyond me.  Turns out that earlier that day, Nest updated its software, and THAT is, I believe, what caused all these problems.  An incompetent software update.  And it was a failure on the part of Nest to not inform its tech support people that there had just been a software update that was causing problems. The Nest thermostat is a very expensive product and after spending all that money, I expected it to work and work and work, just like my 7-year MacBook Pro computer does.  My prior thermostat--a Honeywell--was still going strong after 20+ years, till I replaced it with a Nest.  I am very disappointed that it failed. I am again on the phone, on a lengthy hold.  What a terrible waste of time.  I wish I could bill Nest for all the time--5 hours!--that their failed product is causing me to expand today.  A big boo and thumbs down to Nest!
title: Would NEVER buy this product again - failed totally - 5-hour wait for phone support

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

I also had an old $100 gift card so I was able to use that for the Nest products!! If you are questioning yourself, just go ahead and buy it! You will not be disappointed!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Pete Mayne
content: The Nest has a major flaw and for some reason the Nest people want to keep it a secret. Purchased in January, the unit appeared to work fine until there was a need to use the ac. At that point, the unit would only run the ac for a few minutes, shut down and indicate that it would resume cooling in 5 minutes. Consequently the house never got below 80. The initial customer service rep was fine, she had me swap wires around till we got the ac to run. Although the fix meant reversing the heating and cooling wires such that it appeared that i was heating the house but in fact the ac was running. Obviously not the fix I wanted. She told me that she would have to turn the call over to an advanced tech, and that person would help me reach a permanent solution. After 2 hours on hold I gave up and decided to call again in the morning. Once again, the initial rep was fine and once again I was told an advanced tech was required. After 10 minutes the initial rep got back on the line, took my number and email and assured me that I wouldn't be on hold for more than an additional 10 minutes. He was right, as soon as he put me back on hold I was hung up on. During our brief conversation, he mentioned a common wire issue. That was enough for a decent search that provided numerous complaints and a couple fixes. What I learned was, if you have an existing 4 wire config, you will more than likely need to install a common wire. The common wire allows for constant charging of the Nest. The Nest needs power and with a 4 wire config, the Nest steals power from the running of the heating or cooling wire. What the tech told me was that in "Settings" under "Tech info" and the "Power", look to see what the "Vin" reads. It should read 30 or higher. Mine was at 10. I have just added a common wire from the Nest to the hvac, now my "Vin" reads over 30. I hope that fixes it, I really want this thing to work right. Bottom line is don't waste your time with customer service, it would have been more helpful if the just had an answering machine tell me to Google "Nest thermostat common". And yes, I know Google owns Nest.
title: Beware of 4 wire config with Nest, needs 5th "common" wire to work properly.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chad Baldwin
content: I like this a lot, the best part about it is the remote capabilities, I accidentally leave the AC on all the time, and being able to link it up to my Amazon Echo and SmartThings (using 3rd party code) is really nice too. The only reason I knocked off 1 star is because it seems like the auto-learn / auto schedule feature doesn't really work well for my usage. Maybe it's better for others. I debated whether I should knock off a star because the unit works perfectly and the feature would work for someone that has a more consistent usage pattern. The Away / Home sensor is based on a motion sensor built into the Nest, not on the GPS location of your phone or anything like that. Also, I can't really use that feature because I have 2 dogs and a roommate and I usually like to keep the AC on just so my two huskies don't get too hot, nothing too cold as I'm sure they're more than comfortable, but just enough to keep the house from getting too hot. And I also don't want to sweat out my roommate. Not to mention, I get home at different times of the day from work, and my girlfriends schedule is inconsistent. So we usually just use the Nest On-Demand. We are constantly changing the temperature all the time. I used to have the auto schedule turned on, and after a couple weeks, the schedule it generated was insane, like every 10 minutes there was a temperature adjustment. Pros: Easy to install Easy to set up Easy to use Remote management is awesome Cons: Not a fan of the Away / Home sensor Auto Schedule doesn't really work well for those who use the thermostat on-demand.
title: Works great!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Purenrgy
content: ***UPDATE**  After using this for 3 months I ended up putting my old thermostat back on. Aside for my initial review below, this thing doesn't work half the time. I lived in this same house for over 5 years and the last 3 month have been terrible. Just trying to get this thing to kick on was terrible. I sweat more than ever and now that the Texas heat is kicking in I had to get rid of this piece of crap. Never had this issue with my stock unit. My place would consistently stay around 80 degrees and whenever I tried to get this thing to turn on the air it would just say it will be at my set temperature in 2 hours! I turned off all the 'features' trying to just get it to blow the AC and it would not work right. After looking around the net there seems to be an issue with this thing working because it share power and recharges from the standard wiring. I replaced this with my standard unit 3 days ago and everything has been great sense. DO NOT BUY THIS THING! Its way over priced, doesn't work properly and there are other options if you want a high-tech unit. END UPDATE*** A bit underwhelming for the price. I was pretty disappointed from opening the box when the first thing I seen was the base plate did not match the dial. I ordered the bronze one so it would look good on my wall but now it has this huge white plate under it and looks like crap. Installation was pretty easy. I didn't shut off the power as it recommends (it doesn't damage the unit) but if you are not experienced with wiring make sure you do so you don't see sparks! Once plugged in the setup was quick. I connected it to my WiFi and it updated right away. All was looking good then I got to the features. I don't know, maybe it's just me but spending several hundred for a unit that connects to WiFi and has an app the options are not much better than your standard plastic square unit. The indicator faces you see photos of on this page are pretty much all you get. Pretty generic and no customization. The only cool thing about this is that it will sense when you walk by and you can have it display the Temp, Time (Digital or Analog but boring uncustomizable fonts) or the weather if you are connected to WiFi. You can't have it display multiple ones either. So if you want to have it show the time and temp when you walk by you're out of luck. So overall, I wouldn't recommend spending so much money because you certainly are not getting that much out of it. The app is pretty much the same. It's only real purpose is if you want to change the temp from your couch. So I won't be using that at all.
title: ** 3 Month Update: 3 months later I removed it all together** Underwhelming. Base plate is NOT color matching.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: KGib
content: Great product, but do your research. We purchased two 3G Nest thermostats to use with our high efficiency variable speed HVAC units. They did not function well with our units and we had big temperature swings. The thermostat caused our unit to constantly kick into stage 2 heating, which was louder, instead of using the stage 1 heating. Our HVAC contractor mentioned the reason is that we cannot adjust the 'dead band' on the thermostat, which controls how many degrees a temp will drop before the system kicks back in. Most thermostats allow the function of manipulating the dead band, but the Nest does not. Therefore, we switched to manual Honeywell thermostats which work very well with our home. Do your research prior to purchasing as this is great in concept, but does not work with all heating/cooling systems. ***Edited my original rating after I contacted The Nest customer service and after a long discussion, they agreed to provide a refund (minus cost of shipping back to them) due to the incompatibility issue.
title: Do your research prior to purchasing as this is great in concept

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: David C McCue
content: I set the temperature and it decides to change it to eco mode if I don't walk down the hall every 30 minutes. It also can't hold a temperature.  If I set it for 70, it will let it drop to 68 or 69 and then build it up to 71.  My 20 year old unit did a better job of keeping a set temperature. on the positive side, it looks great, it has the phone app to let me turn on remotely and does support almost unlimited schedule changes in a day and each 7 days are separately controlled.
title: Too smart for its own good

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: mattmos
content: This is my second Nest Thermostat.  We left our first one in our previous residence and could not live without one in our new home!  It was easy to install, although I struggled to print out the guidance for wiring from the website.  I didn't really need that picture but it did frustrate me.  We managed to save substantially with our earlier Nest and fully expect similar or better results with this one.
title: Love My Nest!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: R. Jeffrey
content: I installed this in a vacation cabin that we spend time at a couple weekends a month.  I am not a handy person, but I was able to install this myself with no problems quickly.  I used to turn the heat completely off, and when we would arrive in the winter it would be absolutely freezing.  It's been really nice to be able to keep track of the temp in my cabin while we are gone (it's in snow country), and turn on the heat from my phone prior to our arrival.
title: EASY to Install!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Caeleb I.
content: This thermostat is very easy to set up. If you own a modern home, you'll have no problem with the compatibility with it working with it. With that said, the instructions tell you to take a picture of your current thermostat connections before you disconnect it. This is the most important step. I used the picture to google and cross-reference what my thermostat (Honeywell) had and had no issues installing it. The only other option I would consider would be the Ecobee. It has a display that tells you more information (plus has Alexa). Overall, this looks pretty slick mounted on the wall.
title: Simplicity

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cookie Jar
content: Our old, programmable thermostat was a better choice for us.  After two months of use, I put it on a preprogrammed schedule to get the comfort we wanted.  This didn't really learn anything about our temperature needs.  A new programmable thermostat would have been less aggravation, more convenient and a lot cheaper.  Ability to control with the smartphone is an unnecessary perk.
title: programmable thermostat was a better choice for us

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cody
content: Probably my favorite purchase of the year, self setup was easy after confirming with nest support that my HVAC system was compatible & getting the correct wiring chart. 45 minutes later and we were up and running!
title: Easy setup for an amateur that can turn a screwdriver.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Edwin Siemion
content: Ok, superb product but you have to make sure your settings are right for when you are away! I thought it was set properly and ended up with my furnace turning on when I wasn’t home...long story but it was my fault. Works excellent after I figured out what I was doing wrong. Noticeable drop in bill. Your savings will depend, but it will pay for itself.
title: Works excellent after I figured out what I was doing wrong

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: cody Lee Jackson
content: I love this thermostat the response time from turning on and off is instant no delay like my old thermostat. I also love the Google integration. It works well my all my goolge home speaker hubs and and smoke detectors. It paired to my network by learning from my other paired nest products. Walkthrough with the app was a breeze. I also purchase a temperature sensor with this and they work well together also.
title: Great investment and little to no time on install.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: sbchastain
content: You can use your phone for this. Works great.
title: Awesome product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: NH RE Investor
content: LOVE THIS THING!!! I have a second home and I can monitor the temperature at the house with my phone regardless of where I am physically located. I also have rent the house off of websites like VRBO and AirBnB. I know have the ability to turn the heat up before a guest arrives so the place is warm when they arrive, and make sure the heat is turned down upon their departure. I am not physically in the house enough for the smart programming to determine when I enter and leave a room, etc. I did not install. My electrician installed, but he had some experience with installation as he installed with at one location and the Next thermostat was not compatible with some aspect of that homeowner's furnace or wiring. The electrician tried working with the furnace manufacturer, and it was a waste of his time. I believe he spoke to a Nest representative and the Nest person was knowledgeable and explained how to get the Nest thermostat wired correctly for that particular furnace.
title: Great Product!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: D. Marsh
content: The thermostat works but it was not brand-new as portrayed in the ad. Definitely used and definitely not blue.
title: Buyer beware

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: swever
content: Received as a Christmas gift had it installed and it stopped working within three months!  Had a heating and cooling place come out and check it out they said usually its the battery but that wasn't even it.  Product was a huge disappointment and a waste of money.  Product is very poorly designed to only function 3 months!
title: Product was a huge disappointment and a waste of money

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Phyllis C.
content: 59 female here and I installed my Nest myself with no problem. It's easy it operate and so is the app. I've got it running with Alexa too. It's attractive and I just love it! We had a Winter blast this week in Dallas with snow and I heated my house on my way home so it was nice and cozy when I arrived. The setup is easy and was up and running in no time at all...literally within an hour of delivery!
title: Best purchase ever!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Stephen N. Jaffe
content: We got this product on the recommendation of my son-in-law.  He and I installed it in about half an hour with no problems.  Because the thermostat learns our patterns and turns off when we are not at home, I have a much reduced natural gas bill.  When home you can easily override the temp. setting to raise or lower it.  And I can remotely control the house temperature on my Smart phone.  A much better method of controlling the heat and cooling of my house.
title: Nest 3rd Gen thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Swgirl
content: I've now been struggling with this thermostat for 3 months. I've tried letting it "learn", I've tried setting a schedule, I've tried various other settings and my house still struggles to maintain a comfortable temperature. I've used a Honeywell thermostat I the past and I regret switching. The Nest is more expensive and less reliable.
title: More expensive and less reliable.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Humski
content: Way more settings. We have one upstairs and one downstairs. No longer have to go upstairs to change the temp. Just use the app. Can automatiflip between heat and cool so during those pesky fall / winter months makes it easier to maintain the right temp. Especially from day to night.
title: So much better than the generic one in your house

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Nik007
content: Please note that if your thermostat is battery operated, then you may need to charge nest regularly. I missed this point. Since the Rh wire does not charge it (in my case), I need to periodically charge it by removing the disc.
title: Good product

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mark Jordan
content: We have two of the GEN2 units in our main home, and when the daughter moved into her new house, this was one of the first upgrades that we did. Having these types of thermostats clearly save money and do a great job doing it. You can control them from the phone app, yes including two different houses such as is our case, on one app. We would highly recommend having one of these in your house. They work, and work very well.
title: Highly recommended if you want to save money.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chansen
content: We've been using our Nest thermostat for only a month of so and we haven't needed the heat on much this fall so it's taken a while for things to kick in. I've noticed a few weird things in the "learning" part of the schedule. I've had to tweak a few times to get it to maintain the schedule we want. I'm also a little concerned about it learning adjustments we might make on a particularly cold day. I'll keep an eye on that. I do like the fact I can check it from my phone and set on away mode while we're gone. Looking forward to seeing how it does in the winter.
title: So far, so good

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jenny
content: I bought this for my parents for Christmas and they LOVE it! They had an electrician install it, and he has an older version installed in his home, so he was able to show my dad how the app works. He also told my dad this version is much nicer than his, and seemed a little jealous haha. The copper color looks beautiful and matched their decor perfectly. According to my dad, this is a must-have!
title: ... bought this for my parents for Christmas and they LOVE it! They had an electrician install it

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Raju
content: It changes the temperature as it likes, and its not what we want. Often I have to resent it back to what I want. The settings are not very intuitive or easy to use. Needs lot of improvement. Not upto the mark for the price hype.
title: Self-learning is overdone

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael A Brannon
content: I love my Nest. It works like a charm, is feature rich, and looks real sharp. Honestly, as a new homeowner, I was dreading installing it. I'm terrible at any kind of electrician work. But it really could not be easier: take off the old one, red wire snaps in here, blue wire snaps in here, black wire snaps in there. Screw it onto the wall. Presto, you're done! Took me about 8 minutes start to finish.
title: Super pleased

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Darshan SM
content: I did not feel the use of this device as much. I would rather go back to old scheduled one. This one has fancy app but my old device doesn’t. It is something fancy which you will check first few days, then you will not.
title: Not worth the buy - not satisfied

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael A. Stein
content: Surprisingly easy to install and set up for use.  I would echo the other highly positive reviews and add only one piece of advice. If your current thermostat doesn't include a common wire and you have spare wires in the bundle, go ahead a include one in the installation.  You'll save yourself time, headache, and possibly freezing if you do. To make the story short, the NEST uses an internal battery that recharges with low voltage from the control system.  In systems without a common wire, it's not unusual (as in my case) to find the battery doesn't recharge properly and the thermostat will go to sleep.  NEST technical support was very helpful in getting it going again, but it's better if you can avoid a problem from the start. Google "Nest common wire" and you'll find ample advice and videos about how to do this.  Use the one that looks most like your wiring setup.
title: Surprisingly easy to install and set up for use

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Bret
content: Received a USED thermostat.  The Nest came with a dead battery and two screws missing.  The bezel was scratched and a hair was wedged between the bezel and the screen. So far I can't use it because the common wire needs to charge the unit.  It's been three hours and the unit doesn't start up -- however, I at least have a green blinking light, yeah. NOT WORTH $250 FOR A USED PRODUCT!
title: Received a USED and scratched Nest.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: mavie
content: I love the nest my parents have one in their house and I absolutely loved using it there. So I had to get one for my house but it's the best thing ever. I highly recommend them if you leave and forget to change the thermostat you can do it with the app
title: Amazing

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Stefan de Kok
content: Easy to install, easy to use, and easy to program to save energy. My only little gripe is that when I set it to Away mode I want it to stay in that mode. I have 5 Nests and I use away mode to switch all at once to Eco, sometimes when I am in fact away, but often when it is nice out and I just want to open the doors/windows. When it senses movement it promptly goes back to Home mode, and triggers the heating units with the doors open...
title: Great, if only the "Away" mode would stay until I want it to be back

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Patricia
content: Removed my Honeywell and installed nest, I ordered from Alexa deals with $199 and I am able to get $50 rebate from PG&E. The installment was a breeze, it's just the 2nd day after installed, I would really like to see what Next can do for me to save the bills.
title: I would really like to see what Next can do for me to ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M. Watkins
content: GREAT idea. Great thermostat. CAN be difficult for the less technologically savvy person. All in all, I am pleased despite the price. Hopefully it will reduce my energy consumption and end up paying for itself. The features are really nice such as the (Auto-Away). Why heat/cool a house while one is not there. The (Leaf) energy icon is nice as well. The display itself is bright and appealing. Many other options on-board as well.
title: Expensive, But Pleased !

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: David Vigil
content: Typically do not write these reviews, but I'd like to share my experience.  I have a technical engineering background, so anything techy that can be improved with some intelligence I like to try out.  For the most part I'm convinced if it is not broken, why fix it.  However, if it isn't broken, but can be improved then it should be looked at. Going into this I had two working 5 wire carrier thermostats.  I had them programmed with Home, Away, and Sleep schedules.  The problem with these thermostats was they were static schedules. I also could not differentiate between weekdays and weekends, so schedules that were set for the weekdays were not preferred for when our family is at home on the weekends.  The temp swing was almost non existant on these, the target would be at 74 and the units would turn off exactly at 74 and turn back on at 75 for cooling. This constantly ran our units. In the end I debated between Nest and the Ecobee.  I like the added sensors of the Ecobee, but I didn't like hearing their system had a very poor backend. I chose to go with the Nest and see what happens. I ordered two Nests Gen3 units and was going to install one for our upstairs unit and one for our downstairs unit.  It took roughly 30 minutes to get both units installed.  I did write down my previous settings on my old thermostats for reference for the Nest. There is nothing special about how these are installed versus any other thermostat out there.  You have wires and you have terminals, there are clamp style terminals like the Nest have and there are screw down terminals like my Carrier has.  My home is fairly new construction so the C wire was already being utilized on my existing thermostats.  It is a nice touch the Nest has a level bubble installed on the base.  Once mounted and the Nest plugged in I went through the basic setup of connecting to wifi, identifying the system wires, performing an update and testing the system.  All good. I noticed shortly after that both of the displays glass was starting to pop off on the lower right hand side of the display, right above the sensors.  The upstairs Nest was actually allowing light to leak out the side of the glass.  I push them both back on and they appear to be flush again.  A few days later they started to pop off again, so that is when I issued the replacement through Amazon (Amazon is amazing for returns by the way).  During that time however the farsight and nearsight sensor became unresponsive.  I had to wave my hand several times for the screen to come up. I tried resetting the unit several times without success.  The units also seemed to disconnect from my WiFi, now I've heard of this problem before with other customers and I use enterprise grade wireless access points (no linksys here), so I knew it couldn't be my wireless having an issue.  I figured I just got faulty units and was waiting on the new ones. Once the new ones arrived, I simply pulled out the unit and plugged them in to the existing bases I previously installed.  Setup was a breeze.  After a few weeks with the new units I've had no wireless disconnects,  the farsight and nearsight sensors are spot on and very responsive with very little movement. I guess I just got a bad batch. A few things to note.  I was skeptical of auto-leave at first, since one of our thermostats does not have good line of sight into our living room, but it has been working just as expected if not better.  The +/- 1 degree for the temp swing I see it as a good thing and have never seen the thermostat go more than that on the set temp.  If its set to 74 it runs and shuts off at 73.  Our previously stats would hit the target temp at 74 and stop instantly and was always trying to be at that exact target which constantly ran our units.  The airwave feature is nothing new, our previous carrier stats shut the compressor off and ran the fan for a few minutes also. All in all I'm happy with my purchase and I would recommend the Nest to anyone else.  There are some display options I wish they would include that have already been mentioned by other customers. The option to have both time and temp displayed at the same time would be a nice option.  I'd also like to have the option to have current temp, set temp or both displayed and not just the set temp.  Let me choose what I have displayed and what I want to view.  What information is pertinent to me, may not be pertinent to others.
title: Needs more optional display options, but got the job done.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: KevsW
content: I'm not sure if there is much of a benefit over the Nest e, but this one definitely look nice. It seems to be doing a better job than my old thermostat of keeping a steady temperature with my radiant heat.  We'll see if it saves money when the a/c kicks in  for the summer.  I do love using my phone and Alexa to check the temperature.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: rraid3n
content: Easy installation and looks better than my old thermostat that was over 10 years old. I can be away from home and turn it on with my phone with ease. Learning programming schedule is saving me the trip to go upstairs to turn on or off and change temperature.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kestes

There's nothing worse than coming home after a long day to a hot house! With this I am able to make sure my air is on while I'm away. Now I am guaranteed to come home to a nice cool house!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Alken
content: The is my 3rd thermostat so I’m partial to the brand. I had purchased 2 previously and was looking at another brand but decided to go ahead with a 3rd nest because it just works great.
title: Great Thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: FonduPots Garage
content: I installed this Nest in my home. I just purchased the home and the previous thermostat was a non-programmable unit, basic beyond all means. Needless to say, the Nest was an upgrade to that unit. Installation was simple. And setup of the Nest was also simple. Took a week or so to let it figure out my schedule and then it started to adjust automatically to my preference of settings. Now I hardly have to touch the temperature. I like how it knows when I leave and goes into Away mode to save energy. Saves me money. I am looking forward to buying other nest compatible products for my home.
title: Great value, looks nice, easy install.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ashley Ventrella
content: Works well when our sleep schedules are normal. I love how it turns the heat very low in the winter during the night hours because we are all under covers anyway. However if I am having a hard time sleeping I will be on the couch shivering and ice cold.
title: works well for people with a consistent schedule

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Mekalk1
content: Bought the thermostat and finally installed.  I was reluctant at first because my father-in-law installed the last one.  Seriously, if you have a thermostat installed already, the installation of the Nest will be a snap.  I am not Mr. Fix-it, but this was probably the simplest project that I have taken on.  I was done within 30 minutes and that was with going up and down stairs to turn off old thermostat and turning on the new one. The nice thing about this is that if you are a techie, you will love it.  Suggestions: 1)  Have your wireless credentials handy. 2)  Set-up a nest account 3)  Give other members of the home their own sign-in. 4)  Get a little better screwdriver (the one that comes with the unit is cute, but I wanted something more manly  :) 5)  See if your electric company offers a rebate (mine did and it knocked the final price down to about $100) This is worth the purchase.  Nice job nest!
title: Simple and easy to install - worth the price!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jeffery
content: I have only had this product for a few days but so far I am very pleased. It was very easy to install, literally took me 20 minutes, and I was even cooking in between. The nest so far is proving to save me money and heat at proper times. It is fast to learn on what and when I like temperatures to be at. The app that you can download really helped out with the first day. Since I was at work, my girlfriend sturggled with it for a little. I was quickly able to figure out, adjust and learn on jow the device works.
title: Nest  is quick and easy

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rob D.
content: *a heat pump is used in places where the temperatures are milder. A bit more complex Today was my second day without a working thermostat. Since I've owned this 17 months I've ; called support 2 times for setting that inexplicably changed used support online 2 times for instructions on resetting learning my schedule. It happens enough that it's listed used private  message on Twitter most recently. The unit failed last night and began blowing hot air when set to cool. I did support suggestions based on Nests site. Very well done btw . Then called it in The tech had me verify the setting I just checked and then wanted me to trip the *heat pump breaker and begin trouble shooting wire connections inside thermostat. It was 10:30pm so I said I'd call back My A.C. tech came by next say. He said these devices are problematic on *heat pumps. He gave me a temp thermostat until I  get a new one. I tweeted the very responsive support team. They were wondering why I didn't call back. First, I  heed the unit 2, I knew nothing had changed in the wires.  Who would anyone  touch them. 3. I asked if there was a software setting I could change or update. No They needed to do more e troubleshooting before awarding me a new device under warranty. I didnt see the need, I told them what my tech discovered and knew. Also his boss and team members It ended with me having no new thermostat.  It would cost too much to get a tech  back out, reinstall it and check an unknown thing before they're replace a known non-working device. Communication ended. Now I'll will buy an Ecobee wifi thermostat.  Too bad. My house is full of nest devices. I do not recommend this unit.  Much time was spent on it over 17 months just to lose it in the end. Happy heating.
title: Cool til its hot

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Shadow
content: It was my first investment into smart thermostat while looking to reduce electricity bill. And it does what it promises. Very fancy, futuristic looking dial. It adds to your lounge in terms of display as opposed to being bulky out of place accessory.
title: Fancy looking smart thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Arthur Cianelli
content: Broke down and replaced my Honeywell Mercury mechanical 28 year old thermostat and am I glad I did ! The old thermostat was 5 degrees off in the thermometer department. Our furnace would cycle as it approached the set temp. I thought it was normal as it did it for 28 years! This one keeps the furnace on until the desired temp is reached. I have a two wire system, red and white, red had 29 volts on it constantly, I measured it, attached the wires went through set up with a breeze, wifi connected with no problems, Still exploring all the features it offers, now to see if it can withstand the test of time,, stay tuned
title: Solid design

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Taylor
content: We bought this on Black Friday and it is now May and our thermostat does not work. We’ve been in contact with Nest support and hired a certified heat and air repairman who gave us documentation that the thermostat was faulty and he had to replace it with our old thermostat that works perfectly fine it’s just not smart. Now Amazon won’t give us a refund on a faulty product because it’s “past the return date”. Don’t buy.
title: Stops working after 6 months. Seriously, stop scrolling and look for a different brand.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: What me worry
content: system will not charge without the common wire and when the battery is low it will not cool and shows no sign of why and no codes. tech support sucks

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: TJ
content: If you have a new or fairly new system, then this is the thermostat controller for you!  I love this thing!  Learns your usage patterns and adjust the temperature accordingly.  Not a fan of the Eco feature though, as it does not allow you to set at your desired temperature.  I love the app for my phone more than anything!  Get one and you won't be disappointed.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dan Cal
content: yesssss get it, easy installations  just check comparability with your current one. go online and check before you buy. love it i control my temp from my phone.  if im away i turn the heat down. if im in bed i turn my temp up.  definatelty a must get.
title: Yessssss buy it will make your life easyier

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: JaxBchKay
content: Installation was easy, and the app makes it easy to use.  I will say the away feature is nice for saving money but if the nest is in a main room and you aren’t walking through regularly it sometimes thinks you’ve left and switches to eco.  It’s easy to fix with the app or walking by the nest but can get annoying sometimes.  Overall it’s great and I’d recommend it.
