I have integrated it with the Wink system for my home automation, and it does an excellent job of using energy efficiently when I'm gone. Because I travel for work, I don't have to worry about setting it to save money; it knows that I'm gone and will choose an efficient setting. It's already paid for itself in utility bill savings.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: EAW
content: Very elegant and looks terrific on the wall.  The Good:  very easy to install; simple to operate from the wall; very nice display.  The Bad: Very unpredictable while in learning mode (came home to the house at 62 degrees and with radiator heat it took hours to get back to 69 degrees); the apps are very confusing, difficult to adjust, and no way to even copy a single days' programming so if your schedule is the same during all weekdays, you still need to enter each day manually.  I believe the device is aimed at learning the programming on its own.

Recently my friends remarked on how nice my copper thermostat looked! I couldn't believe it, it really does look that good! Enjoy!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: G. James
content: We went "all in" to the Google/Nest ecosystem.  We have the thermostat, cameras, Protect, and Secure.  One of the advantages of having all the items working together is their "Home/Away assist" that lets you turn on or off cameras and set the thermostat to eco mode when you enable the security system.  Unfortunately, it doesn't work on the thermostat most of the time.  We enable the security system which sets our home/away assist parameters into motion.  Certain cameras turn on or off, and the thermostat should go into eco mode, but it doesn't.  Most of the time.  Sometimes it does, but there is no rhyme or reason that I can discern as to why it works or doesn't work.  There are multiple reports of this behavior online and I do not see an effort by Nest to fix the issue. Additionally, I am concerned about the internal battery.  The thermostat will not work without it, and Nest does not sell replacement batteries or a service to replace them.  So after a few years you have to throw out the whole thermostat??  That's incredibly wasteful but will keep the revenue stream going for them if people keep buying new ones.  I know I won't be. Do yourself a favor and don't get this device.
title: Doesn't function as advertised, and internal battery will eventually fail.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Zerohedge

If I wanted something that needed to be babysat I would have gotten a cat instead.

author: Joshua Davis
content: It was a little difficult to set up as the thermostat caused a short in my furnace and I had to open it up and replace a fuse inside of it. The device then malfunctioned the first night I had it and jacked my heat all the way up to 89 in my house. I thought i was being cooked to death. After the first day of snags it has since righted itself and is working just fine. It periodically disconnects from my wifi, as does the Outdoor Cam i have. I am not a computer guy so i am not sure of the cause of that.
title: Works Good

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

I did have an HVAC pro install it, which I'm glad I did because he had to "create" a common wire.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Patt Sheldon
content: I use the Nest for a second home because we were coming into a very cold house that took a whole day to warm up completely in the winter and a long time to cool down in the summer. Having the Nest means we can turn it on from home, which is 3 hours away, or even when we're halfway there to ensure we walk into a warm and welcoming home. I also find it helpful if I want to get up earlier than planned and turn the heat on from my bed 15 min before getting up!
title: ... completely in the winter and a long time to cool down in the summer

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: TCA
content: Got two of these and love them. Very easy to install. I had some odd wiring to deal with and did the chat thing with Nest Customer Support and we got it all sorted out in short order.  I highly recommend and your local utility company MAY offer a rebate for installing these...check it out!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Drew
content: Wow, so easy to use the Nest app as well. I love being able to set my thermostat on the way home from work - from my phone. Also being able to see what it's currently set at while im away from home to make sure no one runs up the bills when im not around!!! LOVE IT
title: LOVE IT

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Amy R.
content: I had some reservations as I was updating a 17 year old thermostat, and about the inability to see the current temperature as mentioned by some reviewers.  The Nest thermostat hooked up like a dream and I felt super-tough hearing my air conditioner roar to life during testing.  The current temperature is always displayed, even when it's off. It may not be in the large typeset but when activated will indicate the current temperature, the desired temperature and the approximate time it will take to achieve the desired temperature.  Then, as the device is set to "on, " once the desired temperature is achieved, it will display largely.
title: Taught my old HVAC new tricks!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: rocket
content: No longer connects to internet less than one year after purchase. Tried three different routers.
title: No longer connects to internet. Had less than a year.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Christina Marie
content: What I ordered was a Nest 3rd generation thermostat. What I received was a 2nd generation. We ordered this to continue our smart home conversion. When things weren’t working (smart home) we called Nest and this was how we found out. Per our serial number we had a 2nd generation. Amazon was helpful enough to refund our money. However, we actually preferred a replacement and was told they could not guarantee we would receive what we ordered (what it was advertised as). Ummm....really??? Ok...that made no sense. So we took the refund and purchased the 3rd generation Nest at Home Depot. Buyer beware...make sure, if you decide to purchase one of these from Amazon, you check the serial number. Serial numbers beginning with “02” are a second generation. Serial numbers beginning with “09” are a 3rd generation. I want to add that I used the thermostat received for about 2 weeks and it worked fine and looked very nice on our home. I didn’t get to use it long enough to give it a proper review. I gave one star because we did not receive the product advertised.
title: Buyer Beware

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: karen diamond
content: Not compatable!!!!  And now that I’ve tried to turn on AC I had none! Of course the window of returning this expensive item has passed !!! Shame on nest for not giving exact specifications!!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Robert Williams
content: Works as expected, although I'm not sure for me that it's significantly better than just a regular programmable thermostat.  I've yet to notice the learning features working as well as I'd hoped.  It is really nice to be able to change the temperature through the web interface, and the auto-away detection is good.  Also you can set a min and max temperature and it will heat or cool as needed, which is very convenient.
title: although I'm not sure for me that it's significantly better than just a regular programmable thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Missi Mitchell
content: We LOVE our Nest! It’s so great to be able to control the temp in our house from our phones. It’s awesome to be able to use the Eco feature to save money when we’re not home, and then be able to adjust the temp to our preference before we come home!
title: Get. This. Thermostat.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Martoch the Destroyer
content: This thing is really cool.  Set up was easy with the Nest App (From the Apple store) and it's very easy to control/configure.  The only gripe I have is my wife and I both wanted to be able to control it from our mobile phones but you can only set up the device on ONE account.  Our only option was for me to set up her account on my phone.  Really a minor thing, in the grand scheme, but that's the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.
title: Great device as long as you only have one user or are willing to share your account across multiple devices for multiple users.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Donald & Alisha E.
content: Thus product typically doesn't work well at all. Was told be professionals NOT to use this ever. Our bill increased by half and it ran on energy heat/air. The entire time until we replaced this unit.
title: Look out for increased energy bills & your unit may switch to emergy backup.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Christopher M Caselli
content: Great device!  I can set the temperature from anywhere, it quickly learned the times and days that I change the temp, and it integrates with the Nest Protects that I have to automatically change to "Away" mode when my phone is out of the house and there's no movement detected (I don't have any pets so that isn't an issue). Had an issue figuring out which wires went where when installing it, but I found that their website had much more advanced wiring diagrams than the ones included in the box.  A few clicks there and I was able to fix the problem myself without their support.  Haven't had any problems since then.  My utility bill hasn't gone down my much, but every little bit helps!
title: Really like it!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: W. Phelps
content: I am not impressed. Given the price of this thermostat, I think one should be able to expect reasonable quality control and not have to spend hours troubleshooting a defective product.  The brand new unit that I received read the room temperature some 2 degrees warmer than it actually was, resulting in a 2 degree cooler house.  Before someone tries to tell me that it needs to "Learn" - for my initial testing I have learning off and am just running with a simple fixed schedule. Nest support was very responsive, I'll give them that.  The wanted me to turn off the wifi and see if that helped (it didn't).  While I was testing it I took some measurements with an IR thermometer and noticed that the case of the Nest is at least one degree warmer on the right side than the left, at least with the display on.  I'm also running without a C wire; not sure if that can cause internal heating or not but Nest Support says not, so I guess we can rule that out.  In any case I can't see putting up with the hassle, there are other choices available.  I'm going to return this one...
title: Expensive & inaccurate thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Todfather
content: Got as a birthday gift. Have been using less than a week and has already learned our patterns of when we are home and not. App is easy to use, can schedule adjustments on temp, but haven’t needed to. 😀

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Doug King
content: We have a boiler-only system with radiant heat throughout.  I had the same concerns others in my situation would have which center around the start and stop timing for the boiler.  I read the reviews and looked at other solutions but finally decided the Nest 3rd Generation was the best product for us.  We've had the Nest Learning Thermostat for about two months now and I couldn't be happier.  It works as described which keeps the house at the proper temperature by coming on early enough so that the house is at the proper temperature at the proper time and shutting off before we suffocate with heat.  I like the Nest app on my phone which has useful information and remote access/control. We are very pleased with this purchase!
title: Just What We Needed

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jaymay
content: I read the reviews - positive and negative.  I decided to give the NEST a chance.  I have come back from trios twice to find it unbearably hot.  Today it was 90 degrees when I had it set at 68.  I got it because I travel all the time and wanted to be able to control the HVAC remotely.  The wait time to speak with a tech is ridiculous. When you do finally get a tech, they're not helpful, although they are very pleasant.  I wish I could return it.  But, I think the return period has passed. So , I just burned up 250 plus the cost of installation. Don't buy it!
title: I give up!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Slickd
content: This is a great item and continues to get better. It even works with our alarm system to set the house temperature to echo mode when the alarm is set. The display is very modern looking and easy to read. Installation was a snap.  Customer service is fast and accurate. I emailed them to confirm my wiring and got my response the next morning along with additional helpful information.
title: Great product, great customer service

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Andrea Creamer
content: I love this thing. So easy to install. Change temp from my iPhone. We leave for Iceland in February and it’s nice to know I can control the thermostat from abroad
title: Amazing

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: DMG
content: Imagine my frustration after installing my Nest Gen 3 thermostat, wiring it up just as Nest directed, connecting it to the WiFi, updating the software and start the testing process, only to have it not work with my furnace.  It's not as though I am running an old system, it was updated to a new Bryant furnace 4 years ago. I had talked to Nest beforehand to verify that it should work.  Based on that, I placed the order.  After installing, and an hour on hold waiting to talk to Nest on the phone (with their endless and useless prompts to go solve all of my problems with their website; mostly out of date content) I finally got through.  Gerard was helpful and apologetic through out the call.  I sent him photos of the wiring (R, Y, G, W), the old thermostat,front and back. Apparently newer, high efficiency, higher end furnaces aren't (in many cases) compatible with the Nest.  Ultimately, the Nest thermostat is just an old school thermostat with a pretty face.  The old mercury bulb having been replaced by electronics. I wanted the Nest to work, I really did.  My near new furnace proved too high tech for this product.
title: Doesn't work with any but the simplest of HVAC systems

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Storm Beck
content: Good thermostat.  Its nice to be able to turn on the heat/ac in preparation of my arrival and have the entire house cool/warm when I get home.  Plus begin able to turn off the heat/ac if I forgot to before leaving the house is a great plus.
title: worth it.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: david elias
content: Great looking device and easy to operate, no fiddly switches, remote app works well Only 2 criticisms 1.  I don't like the fan to turn off and on when cooling or heating cycles. You can program the fan separately but you have to specify a particular period or have it come on 15 or 30 minutes and hour. Nest should think about a setting that would keep the fan running for 15 or 30 minutes after cooling or heating has stopped . If cooling or heating is called for within that period the fan simply stays running. With this option you would have a continuously running fan as long as cooling or heating are cycling without the need to try and figure out specific time you want the fan to run. It's not particularly energy efficient to have the fan running when you don't need it 2. There is no option to vary fan speed.
title: Great product just a few criticisms

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ellie K
content: I wish I could say this is 100% reliable... but it's not. It constantly loses power and displays the error message - It regularly comes up with the e74/e73 (...) wiring error code and says it's not getting power. When I readjust the wires, it seems to work properly again. Wait 10 hours or so, and we get the error message once again. We live in Maine, where we can't have a house without heat in the winter, especially if we are away, as it could cause a bigger issues of frozen pipes. We are not sure what's up with the Nest, have called Nest support 3 times and and they think because it corrects itself each time I readjust the wires, that it's fixed. We love being able to check the temp when we're away, see our energy usage. We have steam radiators, 1930s house, rewired for the most part, except for the heating electrical. I asked our plumber about this and he said it could be that it's requiring higher voltage constant and it's only getting 12v.. though I according to Nest, it doesn't work with 24v systems. He also said he doesn't like them because I am at a loss. At 1 month out we are convinced the support folks at Nest can't determine why it keeps losing a power connection -- we've had an HVAC technician come to the house and we've had to spend $500 to add a relay switch and add a wire.  So careful, if you have a house that's got an older heading system, this might not be the best solution.
title: Wish it was more reliable - good in concept

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lauren G.
content: I live in a 80 year old rental house in coastal CA (2200 sq feet) that has a single thermostat, with gas heat and no AC. The house is very poorly insulated (no weather stripping, etc.) so it's quite drafty when the outside temp drops below 60 F. With the existing, old programmable thermostat in the home, we were often cold in specific rooms within our house, while the upstairs of the house would get all of the heat. The home was being heated rather inefficiently and our energy bill was close to $500 in November. We decided to see if the Nest Thermostat could help to regulate our energy costs a bit more. While I know the device is better suited for homes with both heating and cooling units, we're expecting it to help with lowering our heating costs. Installation was simple and I have DIY fear. It looks great on the wall and with the analog clock visual, it is helping to teach my young children how to tell time properly.
title: Bought it to help lower heating costs in No. Cal.

The setup was a breeze (so easy a caveman can do it!) and after the setup it is smooth sailing, like those commercials for the easy bake oven, set it and forget it! Anyways, I digress, but I highly recommend the Nest to anyone contemplating investing in one. product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: einsteinboricua
content: DISCLAIMER: I returned mine, not because I was unhappy, but because I saw little point in having it. I bought my Nest during a Black Friday sale. It was $50 off and after friends raved about the savings they got, I figured I might as well join in the fun. I never unpackaged it because then I realized this was an impulse purchase. My home is about a year old. Its HVAC system is brand new and it's all being control through a Honeywell programmable thermostat, which in essence already has all of the functionality of the Nest built-in, save for the "Learning" phase and the ability to control through WiFi. Then I began talking to coworkers and friends about their experience. They all said the same thing: they took the Nest off from Learning and merely preprogrammed it to turn on at certain times to control the temperature. However, they all liked the ability to control via WiFi in case they knew they'd be out of the house longer or wanted a specific temperature for when they arrived. So in reality, I was paying for just the WiFi capability. Don't get me wrong: the Nest has lots of promise if your thermostat is the old kind (the one with the sliders). But if you already have a programmable thermostat, then this is seriously throwing money down the drain. You'll get little benefit for a larger price. I won't recommend any competitors, but I can say that the thermostat my house came with is more than capable of handling my ventilation needs.
title: Besides WiFi control, what else?

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: StanDiego
content: A great smart thermostat with some neat features and excellent build quality. Pros: This thermostat supports dual fuel system, can be set to automatically switch from heating to air conditioning as necessary, has a geofencing feature that can automatically switch to "eco" mode (adjusts to energy saving temperature that you preset for both heating and air conditioning) by using your smart phone's location service to determine when you're away, and it can be configured to sense more than one phone so, for example, it won't go into eco mode when you leave the house but your spouse/significant other is still in the house. The Nest has a learning mode where it monitors when and how you adjust the temperature to build a custom schedule. Alternatively, you can manually create your own schedule manually. Cons: The thermostat is very sensitive to protruding wires interfering with the operation of the push button function (pressing in on the thermostat). This is really not a big deal as it's easy to push the wires into the wall to avoid interference but there should have been a warning in the documentation. If there was, I missed it. The manual programming is a bit of a pain with a less than ideal method of creating entries one day and time period at a time. It would be so much more efficient if you could select multiple days simultaneously and/or drag an item to extend it to other days. The last item I'm disappointed with is the Nest has no capability to back up your settings. I spent a great deal of time creating the configuration, some with the help of Pro Support. If for whatever reason, the unit lost the settings, I would have to start over from scratch. I'm disappointed that the iPhone (and Android) app doesn't allow me to save the settings to a configuration file that I could use to restore settings if ever necessary. Nest customer support: Outstanding support, some of the best I've ever had with any company. I have a somewhat complicated system, a heat pump with auxiliary heat and a high efficiency gas furnace which I use as my primary heat source, with 8 wires going to the thermostat. They call this a dual fuel system. I visited Nest's website before my purchase to check compatibility. The compatibility guide recommended I call them to confirm compatibility (they recommend this for all dual fuel systems for good reason). The agent I spoke to was very friendly and knowledgeable, confirmed compatibility, and even emailed me a wiring guide for my specific system. After purchasing and receiving the thermostat, I called the "Pro" group (free of charge) with additional questions. They were experts, extremely knowledgeable, verified the wiring for my system and guided me through initial setup  and configuration to use my gas furnace as primary heat source with the ability to quickly switch it to heat pump if I should ever desire. I was extremely impressed with my support experience.
title: A whole new level of smart

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

title: Very worthwhile investment.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lynne Marie
content: I have a lot of observations to make about this product. I'll start with what I was faced with first. I live in a 2 story house, purchased last July. I live in South Carolina, where it's very humid and we rarely use our heating systems. The heater with air handler is located in the attic. The house was built in 2003. No one has ever replaced the contractor-installed Bryant brand heater. I've had these heaters before, and they are annoying. Whenever I replaced them in the past with a Trane furnace, my bill was cut in half and none of the ridiculous traits of the Bryant happened anymore. Those being the following: Cold spots in different places all over the house. A long ignite time, which means it's blowing cold air on you from the vents before it finally ignites. Too long to ignite. Uneven heating everywhere. Too hot upstairs, too cold downstairs. When the temps got below 35, it was unbearable downstairs unless I cranked it up to 70, which is a high temp for me on the thermostat in the winter. My AC condenser was replaced recently, so in the summer the air conditioner handled everything very well. It is a 4 ton unit and unrelated brand to the Bryant. (not a very good plan, but at least the AC works well). The AC has none of the issues that the furnace has. It works great. There's a problem, though. Because past owners pieced together a different AC system, the two systems are not as efficient as they could be. They also just can't put in a furnace and make it all work. Not the kind of efficiency furnace I've bought before. I just needed a furnace, but not an AC unit. So, I set out to talk to all these Trane installers. I love the two stage AC units from Trane because they only go into the higher mode when they really have to. The answer I got? "You can't change out only one unit. It has to be both." (something I knew from previous houses, anyway). Installer: "That's going to cost you $13,000.00" Me: "Gulp. I know that they really need to both be married up, in order for them to work well." Installer: "No other way, with this pieced together system you have right now." The problem with this? I didn't have the cash. Lowes would only loan me $6,000 at no interest. I always went for no interest loans in the past. Wells Fargo would only give me 5,700.00 but I could not combine both of these financing options. No one would loan me (or anyone else) that much money. I could've gone with a personal line of credit at my bank, but it was 10 - 12 %. Banks are a lot tighter with home improvement loans these days, since GE sold its finance division to a company called MySynchrony. GE gave me 15,000.00 no interest for the first year once. Not anymore. So, I set out to get 4 more quotes. Same answer from all of them. So, I was stuck with running downstairs to turn the heat down at night because I felt like I was going to suffocate upstairs, then running downstairs in the morning to turn it up to get it warmer down there. Then I remembered the Nest. It's expensive, yes. But .....it is better to at least try to spend $248.00 instead of 13 grand. (All the quotes I got were pretty much the same.) At the very least, I could incorporate it into a new system in the future. Install: Easiest install of any thermostat I've ever performed. I've always done my own installs because I liked Honeywell for many years, but there are no screws or difficult, cramped holes to put the wires into. You don't have to read a book to figure out which wires to use and guess what kind of system you have. It already knew, once I installed it. It's connected to the Internet through your WIFI. If I'm upstairs with the heat on and it gets too hot up there, I just pick up my iPhone, go to the app and adjust it. If I want to go downstairs in the morning and know I have it set to 65 down there, I just heat it up a bit on my iPhone before I get out of bed. It learns. I'm not quite sure what it will learn from me, because I'm retired and usually keep things about the same. But, the programming was extremely easy, both on the unit and on the iPhone app. Change it anytime I want. I was at the doctor yesterday. Realized that just my dogs were at home and I had started the AC this past weekend. (You can switch between heat and air any time you want on the iPhone or iPad app...awesome. ) So, I just turned up the AC to a warmer temp because my dogs aren't too crazy about it being really cold. Before I got home, I set it back to 70 for AC, where I like it. I was bed-ridden after some spinal injections this past weekend. I was praising this thing for making my life comfortable while I recuperated upstairs. Before, it would've been absolute agony to go downstairs all the time because South Carolina is in Spring already. You never know what the day will be like. I just changed it when I needed to on my iPhone. The WIFI was easy to connect, once I realized that you turn the unit itself with a rotating dial either left or right, then press on the choice you want. No annoying methods to type in your password like it is on a Bluray player to login to an app like Netflix. Those are a pain. The screen is motion-sensing on the unit, so you just have to walk by or wave your hand to see its settings. It seems to also get my systems to the correct temperature WAY faster than my Honeywell thermostat did. Seconds vs minutes. Now: I've saved $13 Grand. For now. It's made my furnace manageable in a two story house. I can save up the cash for a new system. It has a mode called Airwave that is supposed to save you on AC costs. I'll know in July and August if that works well. I believe it's going to save me a lot of money and allow me the time to save up for the new system that I really want. I will have my installers just leave the Nest there. It's an incredible product. I've not found one bug with it yet. It's only been about 5 days, but it is already telling me it is learning. Love this product. So glad I bought it. It's the best piece of technology I've bought so far, besides the iPad Pro. Thank you Nest. You saved me a lot of money for now. A few months later: This product is already saving me a lot of money. It's already saved me $40.00 this month on electric. One thing I wanted to mention was someone was complaining about the way it displays the temperature. I think that it is just a matter of getting used to it because there is a rare occasion that the large number in the middle and the smaller number are not the same. What I've noticed is it gets my system up to the correct temperature way faster, and so I'm really not so concerned with the smaller number anymore. I also saw that someone was complaining about the Away function if you don't walk in front of it often and waking up to a cold house. I'm retired, so I don't really need a regular Away function. I go out at really different times, so I went into the settings on the App and turned that off. Problem solved. I love that my air conditioner doesn't run as much as it used to, and I noticed I don't have as much cold air coming out of the vents when the heater is working. I also get an email of my usage each month from Nest. (see image) The leafs mean you've set your temp to an energy-saving setting and will also show up on the dial. And It's still saved me 13 grand. Win win for me.
title: Just an amazing product that saved me 13 grand --- for now

author: searay270
content: I am giving four stars only because of the difficulty I had with installation.  The replaced thermostat had a rectangular electrical box, and all modifications provided and referenced in the Nest kit are for a square.  I crafted my own piece to mount the Nest to in order to hide the old electrical box which I couldn't simply pull out of the wall without creating a larger hole.  What should have taken about 15-30 minutes for installation ended up taking hours with multiple trips to Home Depot to try different things to cover the rectangular hole.  Every other part of the setup process was incredibly easy to follow though.

content: Too bad...... It would not work with our system. It blew hot air on AC setting and on heater. I love in Arizona, so I'm pretty sure we need the cold air to work. We rented a home in California which had a Nest thermostat and it was pretty cool. Amazon has the best customer service and returns.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Gracie
content: We bought this during the black Friday weekend on Amazon, taking advantage of the $50 saving.  Neither my husband nor I are handy so we were a bit skeptical about the installation so before we have made the purchase, we watched the installation video online [...].  After we watched the video, we knew we can do.  Then we check compatibility, go to --> nest.com/works.  We ordered and in two days, the thermostat arrived.  We followed the installation video, step by step, and just as it said, we finished installing the thermostat in less than 30 min.  Remember to follow step by step and pay attention to every details (like shutting off the power panel breaker for the AC unit, etc.)  We ended up using the plate that was included to cover the holes on the wall (see picture). Setting it up is just as simple as using your smartphone.  We only have it for two days so we don't know how much money we will save but for sure, we will get rebate money back from both electrical and gas company.  And as far as seeing it in action, not yet because our house temperature has been a degree higher than target, so the heating unit hasn't been turned on yet (but we did test it after installation to make sure it works).  So far, we don't have much complains or concerns regarding the product, hopefully, this thermostat lives up to its reputation and we do save money in the long run.
title: Easy to install and use, but can't say we love it yet.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: steelew
content: could use more customization but so far it works well. The good: keeps my house at a very even temperature Issues: Nest wanted to tell me that my system was not standard and that it might not work AFTER I went to the website to verify that if would and I had uninstalled my old setup. Their site to check if your setup is compatible might not be very trustworthy. Custom features that it needs: 1.Always on mode 2. Custom display mode. Show more than the current temp OR time OR weather outside 3. A widget on android 4. Custom colors on the Nest UI 5. Weather animation / screen saver that plays all the time 6. more fan duration times 7. It's own voice commands... "Hey Nest". You have to use your phone (Nest app) or Alexa. 8. Web setup instead of setting it up ON the Nest itself (enter a code online on your account)
title: could use more customization but so far it works well.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Zach
content: Overall, I really like this thermostat. I wanted to get a smart one that I could control from my phone (and away from home). I had it narrowed down to this one and the Ecobee. We don't really need the external sensor. Additionally, from what I read, the Nest was more designed to learn from how you used it. That latter aspect meant that I could install it and my wife and I could just adjust it as we saw fit and it would begin to learn from us and our patterns of use. I really didn't want to go through the rigamarole of setting up a really crazy schedule that I would have to change because you never get things right the first time around. As for its learning, I think it's done a decent job. The times I catch us really adjusting it is when we do something less normal which makes us want it hotter or colder in the house for a shorter period of time, which is just life. One thing I'm still getting used to is how far it allows the temp to get from what we have it set for. So, in the summer, if we have the temp set for 75 in the house, often the Nest will allow it to get all the way up 76 before it cuts the AC on, and then it runs the temp almost all the way down to 74. This is cool with me, as it means the system actually runs less often, but it does take a little getting used to. The old Honeywell thermostat would kick in all the time, not letting the temp get over that 75 degree mark at all. Final note: Customer service has been excellent. I have a RUUD unit (pronounced like "rude" and totally appropriate). Apparently RUUD units are opposite most others on the market in regards to when it has to send power to the unit for cooling and heating. The install would have been pretty easy except the base unit (which you plug all the wires into) was bad, so they had to send me a new one, and I had to dig a little into the programming of it with the help of the Nest support people. Their help was excellent, but if you have a RUUD unit, realize that your install could be a little more involved than most others (it would probably be worth your while to hire a Next Pro to do the install). Overall, though, I really like it. We're only about a month or so into using it, but I don't have any regrets about choosing it, despite the convoluted install. Good unit, and the other Nest products are pretty cool too (I got one of the Protects and will eventually replace all my smoke alarms with them).
title: Solid smart (and wireless) thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dr. Kristie Foell
content: CHARGE YOUR NEST BEORE INSTALLING! I have now purchased and installed two Nest thermostats, one reconditioned and one brand new. Both of them came with a nearly-empty battery. This led to massive frustration when trying to boot up the system after installation. I spent nearly an hour on chat support when my first Nest refused to go on-line; finally the agent figured out it simply needed to charge fully. Since my second one was new, I assumed it would come already charged; no such luck! After initially getting on-line (and taking forever to install a system update), the Nest went blank and had to be charged before I could proceed; in the middle of winter in Ohio, after I had already disassembled my old thermostat, this was pretty scary! Fortunately they can be charged fairly quickly, about an hour using a mini-USB (charger for most android phones). Please do this BEFORE you take your old thermostat off the wall and install the Nest! You'll thank me! Once you figure out installation, charging, programming, etc., the Nest thermostat is a really cool device. It "learns" your habits and anticipates your needs, so I now wake up to a warm house in the morning (it learned what time I usually turn on the heat, then started heating before that time). It also dials back the heat an hour or so before I go to bed. If Nest gets it wrong, or you just change your habits, you can always override it manually, or program it to a new schedule, or even turn the heat (and A/C) on and off remotely. That latter feature is the reason I opted for Nest instead of an off-line thermostat. If you forget to turn the heat down after leaving the house, you can do it on your smartphone. Actually you can even tell Nest to sense your smartphone and it will turn the heat down for you when you're out of the house. All in all a really great product despite the annoyance of start-up!
title: CHARGE YOUR NEST BEORE INSTALLING!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Nav89
content: I purchased my Nest about a month ago, and it's been a real trial trying to get it to operate correctly. Long story short - I found out that the actual backplate (with the wire terminals) is faulty, and that there was a current drain. The result was that - even without the Nest attached to the backplate - my AC condenser would run continuously. Without stopping. Forever. I would have had a working thermostat on the first night if the backplate hadn't suffered from this defect. Upon first contacting them, they suggested I get a "Nest Pro." That "Pro" didn't even know how to operate the thermostat, gave up after two hours, told me I needed an HVAC technician to look at my low voltage control wiring, and sent me a bill for $130. The HVAC technician scratched his head for another two hours, said that he thought my transformer was bad, and sent me another $130 bill. I bought a new transformer and control relay for $60. Same issue... My old one was behaving perfectly, and that was another $60 down the drain to *not* fix the problem. I finally got out my own test equipment and traced the problem down to a voltage jump across the AC relay control wires. Remove the backplate: voltage jump gone. Bingo, bad backplate. Over an hour on the phone with Nest support, during which they had me try, among other things, "waiting to see if the voltage drop disappeared in 5 minutes..." They finally agreed that I was correct and sent me a new backplate. The new backplate arrived, and it fixed the problem entirely. GREAT. It works now. But the cost (in both time and money) has stacked up considerably. I'm now out the cost of the thermostat, plus over $300 in needless (and fruitless) technician visits, plus about ten cumulative hours of my own time. I've swapped out the Nest and my old Honeywell T87 at least six times now, only to return to the venerable, wonky, but functional Honeywell. I'm not a dunce. I've got an engineering doctorate, and I'm a university engineering professor. I have wired many a control circuit, but neither I nor the technicians I brought it expected the issue to be the faulty Nest hardware. So, to Nest: Your product looks great, and it works wonderfully, now that I've resolved your screw-up. I love the idea of a smart thermostat. I've got an old home, and energy bills stack up, so I see great potential for your product to save me money in the long run. Unfortunately, a manufacturing defect in your brand-new hardware required my time, my money, and my frustration to diagnose. As a result, the total cost of my working thermostat is close to $600, so that "long run" just got twice as long. If I could do it again, I'd run in the other direction. Maybe I'll update my star rating if the thermostat's magical, unicorn-powered smartness wins me over... but that'll take a lot of unicorns.
title: Thermostat may be great, but poor quality control cost me lots of time and money.

author: Dale McDonald

While i can control it great on my phone, it continuously reboots itself whenever i try to make a selection on the physical thermostat (as in doing anything other than spinning the dial). author: MHPetiwala

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: B Todd 🕶
content: I purchased the Nest thermostat to replace my downstairs Honeywell unit that was installed by our homebuilder.  It is quite possibly the best decision I've made in my quest to make my home "smart."  From the sexy display to the intuitive nature of Eco setting while we're away, this product has met and exceeded my expectations. I've only had my thermostat installed for 3 days and I have purchased a second unit to replace the one we have upstairs.  Get one!  You won't regret the decision.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Paola Martinez
content: I love that I can control the temperature on my phone.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: M. Welch
content: The Nest Connect does for thermostats what the iPhone did for mobile phones.  I installed this in a newly purchased home myself in less than 30 minutes using the easy to follow instructions and YouTube videos.  I interact with it daily, monitoring my energy use, changing the temperature, and turning on the heat before I return home.  Elegant and transformational technology.  Highly recommended!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

I'm sure we're saving on energy usage because of the feedback it gives and the flexibility for using it.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Arthur Rios

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kurt Engelskirchen
content: Put back old programmable unit that worked for 10 years no issues. Had technician trouble shoot when furnace would not work on coldest day in a decade. Technician says sees lots of these units go bad. Not made well. Mine failed after 6 months. For a $250 device that is unacceptable.
title: Failed after 6 month on coldest day in a decade.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Eric M
content: Works great.  Would be 5 stars if NEST would display the room temperature as large as the set temperature.  Currently the room temp is displayed on the outer edge in small font.  Other than that it works great.  You definitely need the C wire.  I installed mine to a hot water Utica boiler.  Check the wires coming through the wall chances are you have an extra wire and all you need to do is trace it to the basement.
title: Easy to use and program.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: REAL REVIEW...
content: Never would power on properly, I have the C-wire, had an AC installer check all the wiring, still no power.  Returned it.  Really liked the options that Nest provided, so disappointing that it wouldn't work properly.
title: Power on Issues, Returned

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MamaHouse

title: Five Stars

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Daren Giles
content: Nice system, a pain to install if you have a heat pump. Spent 3- hours on the phone with Nest tech support. Had to call a HVAC tech. They found the Nest schematic had 2 wrong wire locations. Also found it $40 cheaper at Costco a week later. No cost matching available sad to say.
title: Nice unit, no price match after purchase

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MELITTO3
content: I own a Carrier Heat Pump, this NEST is compatible. Maintains great comfort levels once it " learns" it's working environment. Built in battery means no worries. set it and forget it, operable via WI-FI and cell phone.
title: Maintains great comfort levels once it " learns" it's working environment

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: luan
content: Hardest part of installation was removing my old thermostat. Follow online guide take pics before removing connections and use the labels provided.Simple installation and everything you need is in the box, even a drill bit(no drill).Looks great and is super user friendly. Works great with Alexa.
title: Great, user friendly and compact

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Rob Fizer
content: A great system, but can be a little complicated to set up if you have certain heat pumps, apparently. I had to use a forum where someone had my problem  - which was that on some heat pumps the w1 wire and of ob are interchangeable. So by following nest instructions all I got was heat. But after some googling on different forums I figured it out and love it! The only reason I have 4 stars is the lack of detailed information about different types of heat pumps for set up, and the fact that I wished it displayed more info on the default screen than just a clock or the set temperature.
title: Worth it!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: K Y
content: Before purchasing, make sure the Nest thermostat will work with your existing wiring and HVAC as there are some compatibility issues.  That said, I had none.  My nest works great, looks even better, and works with my Alexa, so I'm one step closer to becoming George Jetson.
title: My nest works great, looks even better

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Lightvalve
content: The Nest 3rd generation learning thermostat is a high quality product that help save energy and ads the convenience of being able to control the temperature be remote via app or web browser.  It worth the extra cost over the life time of the product.  See video for more detail Nest Learning Thermostat, 3rd Generation https://youtu.be/kNeE0rrG3_U
title: It's a nice product that adds to comfort and convenience.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Brandon

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Theo G

It has been able to adjust to our daily movements into and out of the house and has adjusted the heat accordingly. we travel a lot and it is nice to be able to see what our system is doing on our cell phone and the ability to turn up the heat before we get home is great. Installation took five minutes and it was simple to follow the directions to get started. This really is a smart thermostat.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Philip in New Jersey
content: I have 2 zones and bought 2 units.  Installation of first was just as instruction book described.  2nd unit screws ran into a stud and I stripped the screws with the screwdriver (my bad).  Customer service sent me new screws within a day.  I reversed out the bad screws, drilled a small guide hole through the same holes into the stud, and put the new screws in no problem.  Thermostats work great.  It took some looking through the options on the app to get our phones synced so the auto-away feature would work.  Through the app, I set up Nest cameras to automatically turn on when thermostat goes to away mode.  Several well thought out features.  Its no suprise this is the highest rated smart thermostat on the market.
title: Great thermostat works as advertised

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: AKAAMARTY
content: Very good thermostat. The best in the market.  This is the fourth one I bought, which was a gift for my in-laws.  I own three in my house, two zone heating and one for the central air.  They all work great!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Beth M. Smith
content: Nice ifeatures, display, and interface with iPhone/ipad software.  Unfortunately,  the product and software are unreliable.  We purchased two thermostats.  One had a defect and the internally battery would not recharge so the unit kept shutting off and we had no heat for several days.  We also had a probem with the interface with the internet.  You had to physicaly touch the wall unit so the internet interface would work.  Per customer service, thies is a software bug they are working on to correct. Since we bought the units so we could check on our house when we were away this was a deal breaker. Last year, Next had a major recall with is smoke alarm gesturing interface which caused hte units not to work properly.  If the products worked as advertised they would be great.  For now, the hardware and software are too fragile and unreliable.  I recommend you not purchase them until the bugs are fixed.
title: Nice features, too bad the units are unreliable

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tiki

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: K. McCo

Yes, it's expensive, but I've had no buyers remorse.  It's a joy to use, and I would do it again.

author: Khanh V
content: Well after about two months with one its started to not able to take the push click. Therefore, we were not able to change settings on the device.  I then called Nest tech support.  This is when I realized I had made a HUGE mistake with NEST.  The first three times I called the wait on the phone was close or over an hour long, so I gave up.  Today I called again and waited almost an hour before I got a live person.  He then passed me to their level 2 support after reading his flow chart.  I then waited for another 15 mins for level two support before the phone dropped.  At this point, I really don't know what to do.  I thought' Comcast was bad but I don't think I have waited for a total of 4 hours on the phone and still can't get a person that will help me with a defective product.  So buyers beware.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: mccowan
content: Worked great in the winter. Turned the ac on and it pushes hot air. Researched a little and went through the troubleshooting only to find out the solution they gave was not even an option. Removed the neat and put the old thermostat back up...works like a champ. Not impressed.
title: Worked great in the winter

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Eric Kerr
content: Do not buy! Said it was compatible with my system. Once installed it causes short cycling on my ac. I looked online and this is a common issue with the thermostat. I spent 3 hours with customer support. Solution was to uninstall it and it needed an additional wire. They canceled the first time same day. Second time no one showed up. And then again the third time.
title: Do not buy!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Stealthmimic
content: Nest doesn't clearly state that they do not support installations where stranded wire runs to the existing thermostat. There is a very obtuse reference to stranded wire and use of wire nuts in the skimpy documentation in the box, but it is totally unclear. I found this out after waiting on hold for an hour an a half (yes that's right, an hour and a half!!). Wouldn't have done it except it was near freezing out and since it was Sunday there was no one else to call. After much frustration and completely marginal Nest phone support from a somewhat snooty, dismissive, evasive and ultimately unhelpful second level Nest support guy, I finally had to call a local "Nest Specialist" and for another $260, they installed solid conductor #18 gauge wires to my thermostat location and everything started working - go figure(?). The installation of the unit itself seems pretty straight forward but you need to watch out how the back plate is secured to the wall as use of the bezel to change settings requires pushing on it and this can work the base plate loose if not well secured (and it must be perfectly level, too!).  Nest doesn't provide any form of wall anchor other than a couple of drywall screws. They do provide a small highly stylized and basically useless for anything else screwdriver, though. It bares an uncanny resemblance to a large suppository which should have been some sort of harbinger of what was to come. The directions that come with the unit are minimal, written in microscopic, faint gray print and for anything important, eventually they point any hapless consumers to the Nest website. Telling a customer, "it's on the web...", for a product like this is so millennial it's maddening. In Nest's case it's like saying, "Oh, you just need to find the shoelace.  We buried it in a snow bank in New Jersey. It's white, so it might take you a while to find it. But don't worry, once you find it we'll be happy to not to tell you what it's for or ever respond to you on the phone..." (BTW:  THE BIG SECRET: The hidden access number is #7. It is not listed on their support call-in options, but it can save you at least 13 minutes of hold time listening to inane xylophone music and an occasional disinterested comment from a VRU voice that sounds like the illegitimate sister of Star Trek the Next Generation's, 7 of 9 character). Begrudgingly, the thing does work. When it does it looks like the eye on HAL, the computer from '2001: A Space Odyssey'. No doubt Google will be using it someday for some nefarious purpose. I'd guess the on board microprocessor is packed full of additional capacity that will make this thing a 'gateway' for other products and services downstream.  For now though it does give you wireless access to control your HVAC which is nice and there are all manner of other things a true geek could noodle, fondle and fiddle with for hours. All I wanted was to be able to turn the heat on from bed in the middle of the night. Oh, and by the way, I'm trying to figure out how to sue them in small claims court to get them to cover the $260 in unrevealed wiring costs. Unfortunately I've yet to find directions on how to contact them for legal matters -- must be in that snowbank somewhere in New Jersey. Beware. Take care.
title: BE CAREFUL!!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: TRUE HD
content: Performs as advertised with two concerns.  I would like the display to be always on. This means that you can always see the display info -black display is default.  Also, the Farsight feature should detect you up to 20 feet.  It can only detect you when you are approx. 3 ft.  from the device, not 20ft as stated on Nest.com's support site.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: R. Sherman
content: I ended up buying this thermostat directly from Nest.com because they had a promotional discount on the 4th of July.  I was very happy with this purchase as there are rebates for Southern California Edison and SoCal Gas for buying this thermostat with continuous rebates throughout the year.  I really do love this thermostat, not only is it incredibly functional, it's very beautiful on the wall replacing an ugly old school Honeywell system that was easily 16 years old. Things I love: *  Installation was very simple and Nest makes it easy by going online first and doing a compatibility check and shows you a wiring diagram you should print off.  I'm no electrician and could easily do this install in about 15 min once I had the diagram and the tools in front of me. * The integrated feel - it connects to your wi-fi, you have an app for iPhone (and I believe Android), you can control it online in a traditional browser.  Besides doing it's job it's keeping track of energy usage and helping to show you where you can be saving.  Plays well with other internet of things, like Amazon Alexa and IFTT * The trim plate - the ugly old Honeywell system i had left a large square mark on the wall, the trim plate that came with Nest easily covered that up and it looks beautiful. *  Senses when you walk by or approach and lights up to show you the current temperature, and outside temperature (gleans from wifi weather) * Intuitive interface, you press in the lower part of the thermostat to bring up a menu and you rotate the dial and press again to make choices, very simple and easy-to-use. *  Partnership with energy companies - besides a rebate with gas and electric companies, they have a partnership with a solar company in my area I'm going to check out.  Strong partnerships like that can lead to highly efficient systems and reducing cost (hopefully). What I don't like: *  As a geeky nerd, I'm a little disappointed that I have to use the interface to connect to my wifi.  If you have a very secure wifi password that is long, this will be a test of patience.  In other devices, I'm used to it broadcasting it's own connection that you can securely connect to and set the password on with another device, like your iphone.  I wish this kind of option were available, or other kind of pairing ease-of-use. *  The auto-schedule that tries to learn your pattern in the first few days can be a little grumpy.  For example, I had my power off on a hot day when installing.  Once I got it installed it was quite warm in my house. I turned it on and immediately set to 65.  I later adjusted that, but over the next few days it set itself to 65 until it figured out that wasn't a normal thing.  Overall, I like the auto-schedule, it's just in the first few days you'll be scratching your head.  * Don't do like me and set to 65 if you'd be happy at 71, for example.  Just set your ideal, not a drastic temperature. * When you first turn it on, it may not be immediately apparent how to achieve what you want.  I put it on hot/cold (by accident) and was trying to figure out how to just cool the house when I was staring at the heating screen.  Stick with it and it will get easier in a day.  The iPhone app is a lot easier to deal with, but once you get used to the interface, you won't give it a second thought after 2-3 days. * Cost..  it's expensive.  Nest had a 4th of July sale for $50 off which made it attractive along with the rebates is like $175 off.  But, you do get a lot more for your money. Final thoughts: If you plan to do more home automation, or already have a home automation system, be sure to know if this will work with it.  For example, at the time of writing this I'm considering a SmartThings Hub system by Samsung which apparently Nest does not have a working partnership with Samsung on, so Samsung doesn't have a supported connection to Nest thermostat (although there are developer work-arounds that work).  It does work well with Wink Hub system.  This isn't an endorsement for either SmartThings or Wink Hub but it's a good idea to know this information if you have the desire to integrate and update more items in your home like lighting, locks, sensors, etc that require a hub of some sort.
title: I was very happy with this purchase as there are rebates for Southern ...

author: SF geek
content: I really like the ability to easily manage the heating schedule of my ancient steam radiator heating system. The one star reduction comes from not understanding that I had to pre-charge the thermostat with a USB cable since it was not properly charging when I initially hooked it up to the wires. Also, I wasn't able to see the voltage on the line when initially hooking it up so it was hard to debug the lack of charge. product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: B. J. Quaye
content: Imported 2 x of these for a Samsung EHS Heat Pump System in the UK. It functions exactly as the UK model but with the useful extra features. I had to use a 24v AC Transformer and Din Mounted Relays in an adaptable electrical box. We use 50hz in the Uk but I'd assume the Nest Thermostat rectifies the AC to charge it's internal battery. Many UK Heating Systems use 230V Control Circuits Hence the relays. The Alt Heat controls an old existing Oil Boiler should it be required. Cooling also available from the Samsung EHS via the Nest though rarely required in this climate. The timer/setpoint facility is ideal for off peak Electric with the Heat Pump. Had a intermittent Wifi disconnection issue that seems to be improved from an update yesterday. I disabled the Early On Function but overall a Great Product
title: Imported to UK, controlling Samsung EHS

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Savvy Cyclist
content: I have had the Nest product for a few days now and I am especially  impressed with the interface design.  As a product manager, working in technology,  I can tell a lot of creative thought went into the product. However,  there was an issue with the installation that was poorly documented.  The newer thermostats with WiFi need a common return path requiring a 4th wire for a furnace only system.  When I hooked up the system without the return wire, the draft inducer motor ran all the time.  The voltage was floating without this grounded return wire.  Nest should state this since its more common than they describe.  I was able to open up my furnace and connect the 4th common wire.  Nest wanted to send out an electrician to do this which would have taken time and money (which they reimburse).
title: I have has the Nest product for a few days ...

Worth every penny, and qualifies for an energy rebate from my local gas company. 100% satisfied, and that's saying a great deal from this frugal comparison shopper!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: wraak
content: This product is highly overrated. I wanted to like it, love the display showing weather, but it rarely does what a thermostat needs to do. I have a script to turn off my WiFi at night and this could the root of all problems: The device will not reconnect 4/5 times. When it does, despite showing the weather and the WiFi connection as ok, it has sync issues between the app, the website and the Nest Thermostat itself, and requires constant reboots through out the day. today was the worst, and will be returning, I prefer to keep the house cooler, but somehow the thermostat thought I wanted 71 instead the set temperature of 68 set in the app. I set it to 68 while showing 67 as temperature, I check again after 20 minutes as I notice heat fan still running, and it’s showing 69, so I set back to 68, 20 minutes later it shows set temperature 70, repeat this again after heat has been running for over an hour and It’s now 72. The only way it would respond at this point was to do it from the thermostat itself and not the app. I decide to start fresh and delete the schedule, despite never having 71-72 set on the schedule or manually. I delete the schedule, check back an hour later and the schedule is back there. I delete and refresh the app and everything still shows in the schedule. So I decided to go on a computer web browser and repeat the steps. After I remove via browser, the schedule shows back on the phone. So I delete from the phone and finally it syncs to website app and device itself. I come home later that day and attempt to update temperature from the phone as it’s showing set temp at 67 and in house temperature as 68, I set 69, and the heater doesn’t start nor does the app update to show heating, I walk to the unit and restart after an entire day of nothing but head ache, and it restarts showing 65 as in home temperature, that’s a difference of 2 degrees within 20 second. So temperature itself is inaccurate and it’s nearly impossible to control via wifi. The device was completely frozen the entire day and acting out. It’s going back. What a dissapointment and waste of my time. It also rarely detects I’m gone from home to set the AWAY feature with eco temperatures. Another issue is that NEST is known for not having an anticipator feature or maintenance band for the heater fan so it heats one degree past set temperature then issues the command for the fan to stop however because the heater is still cooling off it will run yet another degree over. So generally speaking setting temperature to 68 will result in 70. Which usually means I’ll start opening windows to cool off a bit. My previous basic Honeywell thermostat did not do that as it anticipated the length it would take heating elements to cool off and issue command much sooner. The end users have been asking for Nest to add a .5 temp increase feature but Nest doesn’t listen. Of course Nest will throw some bit about it protecting your heater by not running short intervals close together which can supposedly damage your HVAC. Maybe that should be in the hands of consumers who better know their homes/climates. I don’t live in a cold climate so generally heating the home to just .5 degree over doesn’t mean I need to reheat within the next hour. My home is well insulated, with insulation in walls, so it doesn’t drop fast enough to cause heater to go off on these short intervals, so really this feature is a must. I also can’t trust some cloud provider to store the data, or what information they have access to by having a Unix system running in my home network. Not to mention the simple fact that updating settings via cloud is very laggy, as proven in my case, when syncing back down to your home connection and highly ineffective. Instead of connecting directly to my thermostat when in home (the most common usage), you connect from your phone through your ISP out all the way to some server in USA, that sends back a command down to your Nest Thermostat. Who knew I would miss my basic thermostat after growing frustrated with this thing.
title: The dumb learning thermostat

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: RWM
content: I am very satisfied with my Nest generation 3 thermostat. I was going to originally purchase the second generation Nest to save a few bucks but am glad I went with the third generation model instead. THE GOOD - Very easy setup and fast install time - Nice big display that can be seen form a good distance away - Superb software with intuitive thermostat controls that can be navigated with the thermostat click wheel - Very clean and user friendly mobile app - Very premium feel enhanced by metal outer turn wheel and high quality display - Auto/Away feature that senses when nobody is home and goes into away mode after certain a-lotted timeframe - Is able to connect to a wide variety of "works with nest" devices including the Amazon Echo (works great with my Echo) - Convenient and saves money on the energy bill THE BAD - Though it is one of the top smart thermostats it is still pricey at $249 retail - The thermostat displays the "set to temperature" as opposed to the "actual room temperature" in big bold numbers which seems like it should be the other way around - No Geofencing features THE BOTTOM LINE This is one of the best, if not the absolute best, smart thermostat out on the market. I am a previous owner of a Honeywell Lyric thermostat which is not even in the same playing field as the Nest. The Nest trumps the Lyric in almost all aspects of design and functionality except for one. This one feature that the Lyric has and Nest doesn't is Geofencing technology. Although Geofencing is a great feature to have on a thermostat and the Nest does not have it, The Nest still reigns supreme in the smart thermostat category.
title: The King of Smart Thermostats

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Monkey's Daddy
content: Though part of me has coveted a Nest since first hearing about it, and then kinda went geek-wild when a friend got a first generation, I never took the plunge.  I had a 7-day programmable thermostat set up for exactly the way our family loves.  If we occasionally forgot to turn it down before we left, well, I'd let the thought of higher heating bills serve to remind me next time.  Now that I have a Nest I do love checking the temp (and RH!) from work to make sure my wife didn't leave it turned up after leaving. It has learned our schedule and, with very few hiccups, blended in almost seamlessly. But the setup was not perfect.  The unit arrived with barely enough charge to turn on, and not enough to keep running.  January in Wisconsin is not when you want to receive a message that your thermostat is turning off to charge.  Over the next few hours I kept a delicate dance going of pulling the Nest off the wall to plug into a wall cell phone charger and then hooking it back up to turn on the furnace.  Why doesn't Nest, who is thoughtful enough to include a very nice reversible screwdriver in the box to aid in installation, not put a big warning on the first page of instructions to make sure the Nest is fully charged before installing? I also wish the screen was brighter.  We have a Nest Protect in the same hallway as the thermostat, but the Protect is battery powered.  To save battery life I turned off the Protect's night light feature to use the thermostat's proximity sensor and light (since it is hard-wired).  The sensor is not as far-reaching as the Protect, nor is the screen light as bright.  The wife is already lamenting my decision with gusto. The pictograph history is also not terribly clear or intuitive.  On my phone I routinely cannot zoom in enough to see all the events and notifications for a day. None of these things makes me regret the purchase, though combined with the price it is certainly reason to pause.
title: It's really good; it's not perfect

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

content: Installation and set up were painless.  Easy to use. I like that I can monitor energy use, temperatures, and control the fan from anywhere that I have internet access, and via my phone. I also get energy reports and can look up usage by the day. The Nest also learns when you are home or away, and sets itself accordingly. Works together with Nest Protect, and shuts off the air if the Protect senses smoke from a fire. It also looks really slick. Very impressed!
title: I'm impressed with how well it works!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Cindy S.
content: Don't throw out your old thermostat! At some point (likely after your warranty expires) you're going to need it again. Here's what they don't tell you: when it works, this is a great product. Really. For 2 years I loved it. However, when it fails, there is no fallback and you simply cannot control your heat or air without pulling the Nest and installing something that works. When ours failed, just over 2 year warranty mark, my wife started getting "battery low" errors, and then it would disconnect and black out leaving her with no ability to control the temperature in the house. in other words, there is NO mechanical fall back mode. If the battery dies, you lose function. Period. Support had me pull the unit off and plug it in to charge with a micro-USB cable, which merely postponed the problem till the battery drained again. Meanwhile support asked me to go get my multi-meter and start measuring voltages. Really? The old thermostat has worked flawlessly for 10 years. Put it back on today. Wish I had someway to recover some of the ridiculous cost. That's a lot of money down the drain. Guess I have a pretty paperweight.
title: this is a great product. Really

Anyway, it was time for my yearly system maintenance so I called my AC company for that and the guy installed it for me. He wasn't a Nest pro but he figured it out so I'm glad I had them install it. Just be aware it might not be as straight forward as you think. Aside from installation issues I love the device. But here in Florida, end of December, we need neither heat nor AC so I haven't really used it - but the functions are very cool. And it looks high tech.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Goldengate
content: I bought a Nest thermostat for the upstairs of our house and loved it so much, I bought another for downstairs (taking advantage of the $199 sale for 4th of July weekend). Setup was very easy. My system had one strange wire, so the online wiring tool told me to email a photo to support. Ten minutes later I was chatting with support and they created a custom wiring diagram and emailed it to me. As I installed the upstairs thermostat, the common wire came loose and I didn't realize it -- Nest support walked me through troubleshooting it and getting it going. When I installed the downstairs thermostat, it took me about 15 minutes.... I could do this for a living now! The Amazon Echo integration is flawless, much better than with my Rachio irrigation timer. "Alexa, set upstairs to 73 degrees" and boom, I don't even need to get up, the air conditioner turns on. Downstairs I can do this from bed, wow, this is like Star Trek! The thermostat's "learned" schedules can be problematic... Based on one or two days' use, it created an automatic schedule that actually didn't match our lifestyle or our schedule so I disabled that feature. Here in California our air conditioning use is much less predictable than places where the evenings are warmer and the summers consistently hot. Yesterday the high here was 90, today the high is 75, so no a/c today but the automated schedule would have run it anyway. Not just a toy -- I like the feature that runs the a/c fan for a while after the compressor shuts off to get every last bit of cold air out of the ducts and into our home. Overall, I am very happy with our Nest. Now, our Nest camera, not so much, but that's a whole different review. Hope this helps.
title: I liked this so much I bought a second one for downstairs. Easy to install, easy to use, great phone and online chat support.
