product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Edward Babb
content: I love this thermostat.  Beautiful design, and without the cover plate, it has a very small footprint.  Installation was tricky, as the instructions seemed to indicate that the "C" wire was not needed, but it was.  The battery drained in hours without the C wire, and it did not seem to operate the fan.  Checked out numerous YouTube videos, and found that the C wire really was needed.  Since the wire was present in the wire bundle at the mounting location, I hooked it up, and then nothing worked.  The Nest did not even turn on.  Eventually I discovered that the other end of the wire was disconnected at the control box in the attic!  Once I connected that everything worked beautifully. Some complain that the display should show the current room temp, not the set temp.  If you spin the dial slightly, it will show the current temp as well as the set temp.  Not a big issue, but might be nice if there was as option to change the default. Overall, a great product, but expensive. If you need more than one (I did), be ready to spend some real cash.
title: Great product, once you get through the installation.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Michael Bures
content: I considered getting earlier versions of the Nest thermostat, but I kept putting it off primarily because of the price and owners' reviews that indicated some dissatisfaction. I'm glad now that I waited. There was a temporary $50 mark-down this summer on the new 3rd generation version, so I bought two for slightly less than $200 each. Each box included a nice Phillips/common screwdriver, and installation was quick and easy for my central air/gas furnace systems. All functions are very intuitive. You can let the Nest program itself based on your first week's use, or you can set or modify the programming yourself. Remote temperature adjustment and programming via wifi has proven to be equally easy, and it is handy for when your routine changes. Did you leave home earlier than usual and forget to set the thermostat back? No problem! You can do it via the app with just a few clicks and swipes. Even better, you can link your mobile phone numbers to your account, and your Nest thermostat will automatically adjust to its "away" settings when it detects all mobile phones linked to the account have departed. There are other cool features you can read about elsewhere. Suffice it to say I was impressed enough with the first two that I bought a third one when they were marked down again during the Black Friday/Cyber Monday weekend. The Gen 3 Nest does everything and more than I would have thought to ask from a thermostat. I'm a very satisfied (3X) customer.
title: I'm glad now that I waited

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: NickH
content: Overall a great gadget. A big upgrade in functionality, style, and technology over my old digital programmable thermostat. Setup was made very easy with the website, instruction booklet, and app. Follow the steps, give it as much information as you can, and it'll steer you in the right direction. I'm fairly handy around the house, but I felt like almost anyone could have installed this unit within an hour or two. Its only been installed for a few days, so I can't comment on energy savings or long-term durability, but the front-end experience was very nice. Quick shipping, nice packaging, easy instructions, easy install, and slick user interface. I have a heat pump A/C system, with emergency/aux heating strips, along with a variable speed AHU fan. Nest was able to control all of the functions right out of the box, and has plenty of capacity to handle upgrades like humidifier/dehumidifier, filter, 2-stage heat or cool, etc. Having the Android app available to change temp from anywhere (especially while laying in bed in the middle of the night) is great. Changes are instantaneous. Within 2 seconds of touching my phones screen I can hear the unit kicking on.  If anything, it may be too fast to react.  I can be clumsy and if I accidentally set it the wrong direction I wouldn't want my system kicking on and then immediately off.
title: Great gadget, and most feature-rich thermostat available on the market.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Fred
content: We have a house with three HVAC systems: not our choice, but that's the way it works out with a small house added to twice over 70 years.  So I purchased three Nest thermostats.  The cost was partly covered by by my local utilities (ComEd; $100 per; limit of two and Nicor Gas $50 each). Packaging is beautiful, instructions are clear.  Each Nest comes with a very nifty screwdriver, which is the only tool you'll need.  Working and reading carefully, the first one took me about fifteen minutes to install.  The second and third took less than five minutes apiece.  Basic process: you use the labeling / terminal markings on your old thermostat to identify the purpose of each wire (in my case, four).  Then you plug them into the labeled, spring mounted connection points on the Nest mount.  Click on the display, and you're good to go. The real joy is the simplicity of operation.  You just turn the dial to get more or less heating/cooling.  After a couple of weeks, you never touch the dial again; the Nest has figured out what you like and programmed itself.  It notices when you're around, and it saves energy when you're not.  The phone app and the web interface are models of clarity. Fiddling around with three different, tacky, unclear, disconnected old-fashioned thermostats was a tremendous time-waster and caused far too much hassle ("Did you turn it down?  What about upstairs?").  Now it just happens, and it is such a pleasure.
title: Smart enough to be wonderfully simple.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Haley
content: Has some glitches with the app but overall useable and a good product.
title: Works well

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Joel
content: I can honestly say this was by far one of the easiest products to approve of.  The design is sleek, simple, and looks great on the wall.  The installation was extremely quick considering what was being installed.  There was a page on Nest's website that I had referred regarding wiring for my old thermostat vs Nest wiring prior to the Nest arriving so I was easily able to get the Nest installed.  I highly suggest you find that resource on their site and look at it prior because it made the switch extremely easy.  The bonus of Nest is that they includes a screwdriver, the stickers to label wiring before disconnecting old thermostat, and the plate for behind the Nest.  I was hesitant to spend the price but it was well worth it once I was able to actually see the quality. I love the functionality of the Nest.  I see no issue with how they have the display.  The screen is black when it detects no motion, turns to the set temperature upon initial motion detection, then switches to the actual temp along the edge after a few seconds.  I generally am more concerned with the set temp if the system is on rather than the actual temp so this is not something that bothers me.  I like that I can control the system with my Echo or Nest app.  The away feature is another added bonus.  This is a purchase I am completely happy with.
title: Great addition to the house!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Walt
content: Fantastic device with an bright screen, easy to use interface, and sleek design. 5/5 Install: Was extremely easy to install, came with a built in level to ensure it was on the wall straight (the engineer who thought of doing that deserves a bonus), came with its own tools to install. 5/5 Nest Support: Before buying you should go to the Nest website and check the wiring guide. If you want to be 100% sure of compatibility, remove the casing of your old thermostat & take some pictures of it. Then go to the Nest website and chat with an agent. You can send them the pictures and the will confirm which models would work with your domicile's wiring and email you a PDF of the instructions to use. 3/5 Software/ Networking The only issue I have with this device is trying to get it to connect to the internet. It works fine if you have a home with your own network that you control, but if you live in an apartment which has central wifi controlled by a password it is a huge pain to get to connect. With out being connected you will lose a lot of the advanced features, including the novel temperature control app. The software/GUI on the device is great and easy to use, the App for Android is great and easy to use, getting the Nest to connect to a network was a huge pain. 5/5 Does what is was supposed to do, controls the temperature effectively and efficiently. Easy to change or program it.
title: Sleek, bright, easy to install.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Kepa Zubeldia
content: Does NOT work in most foreign countries. According to Nest customer support: "Currently the countries supported to use Nest products are the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Belgium, France, Ireland, or the Netherlands" as of December 2016. The web site for Nest Home is misleading in that it suggests the thermostat may work in Mexico, middle east, Russia, China, or a lot of European countries, but that is not the case. The problem is that the thermostat synchronizes the clock and the weather information with data gathered from the Internet. To get this data it needs a ZIP code or a Postcode during the configuration of the Nest Home account. No way around it. So, unless the ZIP code or Postcode for that country is supported by Nest, it is not going to work right. Even the clock will be off. It seems like this thermostat is very much USA-centric, with a handful of countries as an afterthought.
title: Does NOT work in most foreign countries.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Chiengineer
content: Good, but still lacking ability for user to calibrate temperature. I replaced a programmable thermostat with the Next smart thermostat. I like the 3rd Gen, but it is still lacking one feature that I believe is mandatory in any instrumentation: allowance for the user to calibrate it. My house was built in 1919, and the thermostat is located on a partially interior wall (just inside of a sun room) with southern exposure and no insulation. On my old thermostat, I could manually compensate for the fact that this wall is typically 3 degrees hotter than all other areas of the house. When it's 74F in the living areas, the wall around the thermostat reads 77F. Nest does not allow manual calibration to compensate for this. As a result, the A/C runs continuously even after the house is cooled down. Obviously, the Nest is doing a good thing by forcing me to relocate my thermostat to an interior wall (the correct installation location). However, it's still a PITA to do this, and there is no need for me to relocate the thermostat if the Nest had the ability to be calibrated. Bottom line: Smart devices are great, but they still need human intervention to work correctly. I feel that many people will install this device with the same mistake without realizing it. Please give thumbs up or comment if my advice helps.
title: User Cannot Calibrate Temp, Be Careful What Wall You Install Nest On, LESS Efficient if Installed Wrong!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Tester
content: I purchased this unit to control a Carrier Infinity System Heating/Cooling System replacing its proprietary thermostat.  Before purchasing, I used NEST's online wizard to confirm compatibility.  Unfortunately, despite the wizard's confirmation of compatibility, the NEST thermostat is not compatible with my system. In light of my experience, I recommend also searching NEST's blog [...] in order to confirm compatibility.  Had I  one so, I would have learned about the lack of compatibility prior to purchasing. However, high marks for NEST support in working with me to see if the NEST thermostat might be suitable, and high marks to Amazon for its return policy.  I have other NEST products (another thermostat, and the NEST protect smoke detectors); they work wonderfully and I strongly recommend them.  5 stars for product; 5 stars for support; 4 stars for not highlighting incompatibility issues.
title: Great Thermostat, Great Support,  Unfortunately Not Compatible with Certain Carrier Units

Spent an hour on the phone with NEST support, (who are fantastic btw,) but it just doesn't seem to work with my system. Once I get a common wire hooked up to my system, I'm probably going to buy again to see if it'll work.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: The Animaster
content: The one I received has an ugly bump on the motion sensor part. I’ve never notice this ugly bump in any demo unit at Home Depot or in online reviews. Why does mine have an ugly bump? I’m returning it. $2 more now. Please make sure the next one doesn’t have an ugly bump. Are we receiving previously-returned merchandise by ordering online? Seems to be a trend these days. My Nest looked as if it was handled previously — slight marring on the back and the stainless steel was — blemished. It did not have that “wow” factor or the scent of fresh electronics. I’m disappointed. Hoping my next one doesn’t have any ugly bumps, marrs, scars ... most of all hope it works. For $219 (previously $217) it better damn well be perfect. Update: got a second one. Compared. Turns out the first one also had a slight gap on the right side. Second one had a slight marr on the steel wheel. Turns out the first one has a better shaped plastic area though! After installation though, that bump and everything disappears... I’m putting this one star from last. Had fun installing it too — of all wires to touch, R and C did!! But it was a lesson that needed to be learned — and thanks to this I now know the inside of my HVAC unit, and where to find the fuse. Thanks to YouTube. I almost called a Nest “Pro” but they were all closed. Saved another couple hundred bucks in labor! Will upgrade this to 5 stars if my correspondence with Nest customer support goes well. So far when asked the question — they don’t have a straight answer. Is it a design thing or a bad batch??
title: Blemishes and imperfections

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: SkekTek
content: It looks very nice, it was super easy to install, and it works better than I expected. I have a large home with old style (read: massive) radiators. With my old thermostat I had to manually compensate heat lag. For instance if I wanted the temperature in the house to be 70 degrees I had to set the thermostat to 63 because the large radiates held so much heat. My children, being the prodigies that they are, never understood this. They would turn the heat up to 70 and act like they were were dieing when the temperature was flirting with 80. They would panic and turn the temperature all the way down (inevitably leaving us with a near frozen home the next morning) , even though I explained to them that burying the needle wouldn't cool the house down any faster. The Nest automatically learns and accounts for this. If I want the temperature to be 70 degrees I can actually set the thermostat to 70! I don't know if it has actually saved me any money (yet) but I like the fact that I see my day to day energy usage. As of right now the system only stores 2 weeks of energy usage. I wish it would store the data indefinitely. I also wish it would display, store, and graph the inside and outside temperatures.
title: Great product.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: xenoc
content: This is a very well constructed, solid and beautiful bit of technology that does one thing well - keeps your house in the temperature range you want it.  Installation was very simple (and Im a modest handyman at best) and took 15 minutes.  Connection to my Wi-fi (Apple Airport Extreme), set-up and app downloading and setup (iPhone 6S) was also simple, intuitive and flawless.  I was concerned about the reviews that reported being able to see only the target temperature and not being able to see the ambient temperature but found that both were displayed and readily accessible (although the target temp is larger).  Its also very intuitive and simple to program relatively complex temperature settings for different times of day, when you are work, on vacation and other variations.  One of the few examples of technology where the developers clearly thought long and hard about the users and its simple and intuitive set up and interface are really outstanding particularly for those who really don't want to find the instruction manual every time we want to make a change.  Highly recommended!
title: superb technology with the user in mind

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: mBrane
content: I purchased two for my home.  Labelled one "upstairs" and the other "downstairs."  Easily added both to master account.  Love being able to work with this from my phone.  Installation was *very* easy... just follow the directions closely.  My downstairs unit was pretty simple (gas heat and AC unit).  Upstairs, there is gas heat, heat pump, *and* emergency heat strips.  Don't be scared!  If you can match colors, you *can* do this yourself.  Took around 15 minutes for downstairs unit and 20 for upstairs (more wires, so I actually labelled them as directed with the sticky labels that are included right in the instruction manual.  Both unit auto-detected correct wiring without a hitch. The intelligence works well; without setting a specific schedule, I adjusted as needed and now no longer need to do this.  They seem to have learned my family's routine.  Also, when I went on vacation recently, it automatically went into "eco" mode and kept my house at a cool 65 degrees.  As soon as we walked in the door, the downstairs unit detected us and started warming the house back to normal. Love, love, love this!
title: Love my Nests!

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: kasey barton
content: simply the best, better than all the rest ~ okay, waited so long to jump on this, yes, cost was a concern.  What was I thinking, this thing is my favorite new "toy".  It has become like a lil buddy, a friend that has my back.  The installation was amazingly easy & quick.  A few slight glitches in setting it up, my fault not its fault.  Now that it is up and running I am amazed at how much it has improved things in my home.  It flawlessly turns on/off at my preselected times.  But, wait, there'more!  If I leave and forget to set it back I just go into my app and adjust, not that I really have to.  This little nest learns when I leave and sets back on its own, smarty thing.  It also looks oh so good on my wall, was the highlight of my holiday gatherings with family & fiends gathering around to meet this gem of technology.  Have you guessed, I love this thing!  I have 2 more thermostats in my home, waiting for decent sales to update those also.  The energy savings will surely pay for this nest shortly, heat goes down in winter, a/c gets set up in summer when I am away.  Guessing there are others on the market, but I am sticking with this one!
title: it just rocks

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: MaherIsALoser
content: I really like the NEST form functionality, ease of use and information capture. However, I purchased two for using with my echo and I can't get them to connect. They make it seem that the app is very easy to use and as you will read from other reviewers-not true. Hell, finding the right app is a chore in and of itself. I went to the Apple store and they're two apps that state NEST and one is for an education system and the other for another Google product. They don't make it easy on the NEST site because this is a Google owned product and Google and Amazon are in some type of war right now. I am sure many of you have a Google Play account but I don't; I only use the Apple store and signing up for Google Play and all of the information they want from you is absolutely too much. Damn it, it's too much! I have never seen a request to surrender so much information so I won't use this app. I hope we start getting some EU type privacy for consumers in the US. TP-Link is also part of the Google system and personally, I just don't want Google in charge of my entire life. But that's me.
title: Don't believe the hype about connecting to Echo; Google is in control of the app and they're in a pitched battle with Amazon

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Jessie
content: We got a rebate through our state or federal or something, so it was only $144, I think. It does some of the things it is advertised to do. It does control temperature. It does look cool. Being able to control the A/C from my bed is basically why we bought this. So in that respect, I like it. BUT my old one basically did the same thing, and honestly, I think it kept the temperature more consistent than this one. Sometimes, with the Nest, a 73 will feel hot, but the next day a 76 will feel quite cold. I haven't noticed any savings in our power bill, but Nest insists on telling me I'm "more Eco-friendly than 87% of the Nest-users around you" in emails. Who really knows. The Home-Away assist thing functions sometimes, but not all the time. That could be because my Motorola Moto X sometimes reports me at home when I'm really not, so I couldn't fairly dock a star for that. The "Airwave" feature just runs your fan to circulate the air without the A/C running, which I actually love, and I wish it would turn on more frequently. Other than that, this is a thermostat. It works.
title: Basically, it's a $240 app that lets me turn the temp down from my bed. Too bad, I really like that feature...

I disconnected the Nest and connected the old thermostat, which worked reliably. This proved that there are no power issues with the wires as they said.I cannot talk about all the good things they say it does because it never worked but their technical support is overwhelmed with calls and if your unit does not work out of the gate, bring a fan and get ready to wait on the phone.

author: VRinSLC
content: I’m so tired of its glitches. I have no idea what “behavior” it uses for “learning”, but created schedules are definitely based on our adjustments. Waking up to house excessively warmed up (in winter) or cooled down (in summer) on Nests whim has become so frustrating that I have finally turned off all of its “smart” features. When one adds to this absolutely horrible stability of network integration with other Nest products (in the past year had to reset all the devices numerous times as that is the only option that customer support will provide), the only usable and desirable feature remains the ability to control it remotely. But then again, there are less expensive thermostats with that functionality! Would not buy again this thermostat. Or any of the Nest products, to that end!
title: Crap

The only real difference between V2 and V3 is that it has farsight and little (unnoticable and unneeded) larger display. For those wanting to use V2 for cost reasons, won't terribly miss anything much at all. The functionality, scheduling and reports are pretty much the same from the app. That's why it gets one star less. Update 2: If there is a software update coming that could include actual consumption of natural gas / electricity for cooling, I think that would be actually cool that would help me complete consumption stats at home / become the missing link in home automation / consumption data.

author: Bonnie California
content: I installed this myself when the electrician referred on the Nest website wanted to charge $200 for installation of first and $150 for the second - $350 to install two Nest thermostats! So I followed the directions. Took me about 90 minutes. Would have been an hour or less but I had trouble when it first powered up, took me awhile (and a phone call to the help number) to figure out to unplug it and plug it back in; it had not been seated properly. Once it was, it was much easier to use. I had a hard time with initial setup until I learned how to manipulate the screen (there should be more direction about that). I have another one to install! Going to do that in a day or two and I hope it goes smoothly!

Yet it had only been on the market (generation III) for about 2 months so that wasn't possible. The 2nd Nest support tech sent us a new base unit.  It doesn't work. Several hours of electrician time later and because of his scheduling it's no longer returnable. Not the end of the world however while perhaps others did well with this product we found it to be high-tech garbage.

author: Paul Goodwin
content: First month after having Nest my heating bill was the highest in 2 years.  The Eco temperatures are set so far from the norm by default that the furnace had to work overtime to get the temperature back up.  Home assist is spotty at best.  This is not what i would consider "smart" as all the decisions are still left to you and it cost me $ the first month.  Also had to figure out how to get it to work well with a standard At&t router.  I called Nest support first, they actually preferred that i try to go through Amazon then standing behind their product.  No idea that there is a known issue with their equipment and some routers.  Then i called AT&T they fixed it in about 5 min.  Nest is weak as hell.  I might see if i can sell mine and get an Ecobee.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ms. T
content: Update 5/24 - I hate this thermostat more every day.  It seems like it goes to sleep (away mode is disabled) and doesn't see that the temperature has risen above the set temperature until I open the app, then it suddenly realizes the temp is higher and will kick the ac on.  I can see turning off the screen to save battery, but the stupid thing should never go to "sleep" like I'm pretty sure it does.  Today it let my indoor temp get up to 79 when I have it set for 75!!!!  This is unacceptable.  For a so called smart thermostat - it sure is dumb!  I can't wait to replace it with a real thermostat that actually works the way a thermostat should. Like others have mentioned - it's temperature reading is not accurate.  Now that it is warming up in houston, the temp reading is 3 degrees lower than actual temps (I set another thermostat right next to it to check it -  the actual inside temp will be 78deg, the thermostat is set to 76deg and it reads 75deg so it doesn't ever cool to desired temperature unless I overide the schedule, oddly enough, as soon asi i go in and set the desired temp down a degree or two, then the temp reading will suddenly jump a deg or two to at least get closer to the real temp). I find that I am constantly having to open the app and set the desired temp lower just so it will kick on and cool the house below 78deg.  This is really unacceptable for a "smart" thermostat that costs this much.  Like others, I will probably replace it with the Ecobee in the near future.  Right now, the only benefit I get for all the money I spent is that I can control it via wifi.  But I could've spent a lot less and gotten the same thing, and a thermostat that actually reads the correct temperature.
title: I hate it!!  Doesn't read the temperature correctly!!! requires a lot of baby sitting to get it to function correctly

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Dale Yuzuki
content: Surprised that it took a broken programmable thermostat for me to realize that the main benefit of a Nest is energy savings. Yes the Nest is expensive (the broken Honeywell would have cost $150 in parts alone, but would have only needed one for a two-zone system), but realizing the energy savings over time (we'll see if it's 10-15% as I read on the Nest website) it should pay for itself soon enough. Installation was a snap - the instructions are really clear, we have a somewhat typical 2-zone, 4-wire low-voltage thermostat system with a red 'common' wire from a house built in the 1970's. Took less than 30 minutes to install two of them, and the white faceplate covered up the unpainted area perfectly. Love the ability to remotely set the HVAC onto 'eco' mode, or to turn it up/down from my phone whereever I may be (including in bed late at night or early in the AM). Be sure to look into rebates from your electricity or gas supplier, they may offset the cost of installation. (The one offered locally was for $100 off of a professional installation.) However in my case being handy it was definitely an easy-to-do project.
title: Love the ability to remotely set the HVAC onto 'eco' ...

author: Christopher Reid
content: I have both the 1st and 3rd generation Nests.  The 3rd gen is nice because it has a bigger screen that wakes up when anyone is walking by, so it's very visible.  I've also recently gotten central AC, so it's fantastic that it controls both so seamlessly.  I've removed one star because of the occasional disconnects.  As a wired product, I expect to be able to connect to it any time.  Both the 1st and 3rd gen units seem to have a battery that trickle charges, and after enough regular use, they need to be disconnected and plugged into a USB charger to properly recharge them.  I have many other wifi products that don't have issues like this.

content: Absolutely worthless with my system. It would run the a/c compressor but not the fan or the fan would cycle on and off continuously (every 5-10 seconds). I uninstalled it and went back to the original thermostat and the system worked just fine. Unfortunately I did not think to return the Nest prior to the end of the 30 day return so...no refund. I was told by the Nest technician  that I would need to have an electrician hook up a separate power wire to make the unit function properly. Not sure I want to incur that expense so this Nest will probably end up in the trash.

author: Robert J.
content: This is probably the coolest thing that I have bought in the recent past.  I had no issues connecting this to my network (even though this took forever and I wish that I could have done this in the app). I can confirm that this does work (somewhat) nicely with Alexa.  There are some things that could be improved but those are Alexa Skills development issues.  It is pretty fun to name your device to something random like 'arc reactor' and then say: "Alexa set 'arc reactor' to 68." The Nest app has a bit of a learning curve but once you figure it out its pretty nice.  (press and hold schedule to copy schedule form one day to another)
title: All around great product.

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Amy B.
content: Thought this would be an upgrade from our old basic thermostat. Boy was I wrong. Power goes out during a terrible snowstorm and our generator kicks on like it always does. With our old thermostat, the generator would continue to run our heat. With the nest, an error message comes on, the heat kicks off and refuses to come back on. Customer service tells my husband he has to go outside in two feet of snow and manually shut off my generator, go down in the basement and shut off the furnace, unplug electrical wires, leave live wires out, told him to use electrical tape to wrap two wires, and then it kicks back on. Who is this lady from Nest customer service and how is she qualified to give my husband instructions on messing around with our generator, my furnace and electrical wires? He doesn’t know what he’s doing with this stuff! Is it safe when my power gets restored and kicks back on? Will there be a spark? Isn’t the beauty of a $20,000 built in generator system that we SHOULDN’T have to go outside and manually shut off and turn my generator on to get the heat on? Absolutely ridiculous!!!
title: Power goes out during a terrible snowstorm and our generator kicks on like it always ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: EReviews
content: This little guy has performed as expected and more. I have yet to see if it will actually save me money but I have noticed that the system has been cycling less. I am aware of the temperature range / swing and am fine with this. The remote management is great and the installation was easy. The instructions were clear and the website allows you to see if your system is compatible (wire wise) with the nest. It connected to my wireless system immediately and the firmware upgrade came over quickly. I wish that you could schedule the firmware upgrade or actually install it immediately (this could become an issue in the future if a firmware update bricks something) but this has so far not been an issue. The nest does tend to be a bit noisy on the network but I was able to manage this by placing it on its own separate vlan and doing some qos. Overall, I am super pleased with this product and would definitely purchase it again.
title: Wire it in, twist it, set it, heat with it, cool with it

The reason I know this to be true is that I have a digital thermometer in the same room and it always shows 1 degree cooler than what the Nest says. This is only in the heating mode. Once it gets cooler out and I start running the air conditioner I will be back to follow up. Don't know it'll run a degree cooler (or warmer) on AC mode. This device replaced a fully functional non Wi-Fi device which did not exhibit the same temperature anomaly. More to follow ...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Thien-An Nguyen
content: Update 10-18-15: No network connectivity issues since my last update. The Nest app and website connects to the thermostat each time I go on and new temperature selections reflect on the thermostat in approximately 2 seconds. I wish the thermostat could use your phone's location to recognize that you are at home to prevent auto-away from activating without the use of third-party apps. Its not too bothersome and I admit auto-away is handy for the times where you stay late at work and can rest knowing electricity isn't being wasted to cool/heat an empty home. Wished there were graphs in the app and website so you can see and compare your usage comparing week to week, month to month, and eventually year to year. Scheduling temperature ranges for the Cool/Heat mode is quite useful and easy to do on the website and app. For seasonal transitions and bipolar Texas weather this is a blessing! Update 9-14-15: Still working great. The thermostat has begun to start setting auto-away when I leave now. I'm not sure as to how much money I will save using the Nest, but I hope to see the Nest live up to what it says it can do. The Nest app has worked almost flawlessly with only 2 errors in connection shortly after I first set up the Nest. My Netgear router appears to work well with the Nest. Original review: Installed the thermostat easily without any problems. Connected the Nest thermostat to a new Nest account online which I had no problems doing and connected it to my google account. The Nest phone app appears to work quickly and the Google app accepts voice commands for my thermostat. The far-sight feature is very responsive with a very clear screen display of the temperature (or time if you choose to have that display instead at a glance and temperature show up when you get closer and touch the thermostat to make adjustments). Hopeful to see how convenient this thermostat will be and I will update with how the learning software works after I give it some more time.
title: Great thus far

The tech support was fast and friendly, but if the website was easier I could have done it all myself. All they did was tell me to charge it and do a system reset which wasn't all that hard. The set up is simple as long as you charge it, I could not find any information on needing a charge or how long a charge lasts. The positive is it's easily programmable, and easy to use on your phone. Very simple to turn the heat up and down, and the unit feels very solid. Good buy, much better than an old digital thermostat. You can turn the heat up and down without connecting to the internet,

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: Ray K.
content: I never though that an appliance, like a thermostat, could bring me such joy. I almost did not buy this due to several previous reviewers warning that there would be problems with the functionality of this thermostat if I did not have a Common (C) wire. I took a step-by-step approach to reassure myself that this would work with my current system. I removed the facing of the old thermostat to determine which wires were coming from my furnace; then I went to the Nest website which will tell you if your wiring setup is compatible with this thermostat (just click the boxes indicating which wires you have). Voila, it was compatible. Great customer service experience #1: Even though the Nest website assured me that my system was compatible, I was still thinking of the previous reviewers' comments. I took a photo of my old thermostat's wiring system and emailed it to Nest. A couple of minutes later, I called customer service; they pulled up my photo, told me which colored wire goes to each lettered location on the Nest thermostat, and gave me that added reassurance. I do not consider myself handy around the house, but I had no problem removing the old thermostat and installing and wiring the Nest. When I began the online process of linking the thermostat with the Nest app, I had some questions which I could not readily find answers for in the literature. That is when I experienced ... Great customer service experience #2: I called Nest support on Thanksgiving Day, and a real live person answered. The first words out of my mouth were: "Thank you for being there on Thanksgiving". He walked me through the process until the thermostat and app were communicating with each other, and he sent me a link to their knowledge database. This morning, when I awoke, I had a whole new routine. I reached over to my smartphone, launched the Nest app, and turned on my furnace ... all from the comfort of being snuggled under my comforter.
title: Changed my life ... for the better!

author: T. J.
content: Very nicely made product. High quality materials and looks great. Good UI once you get used to it. Setup is super easy. I was surprised that is comes with a screwdriver. The online setup guide is interactive and will email you the wiring diagram based on inputs from your existing wiring. Once installed it was easy to connect to WiFi and my phone app. If you use a long WiFi password it is tedious to enter it. Easy to pair with my Google Home. Works with my Google mini so I can warm up my house from night time sleeping at 63 by saying "Set temperature to 66 degrees" while I am snuggled in bed. Learning my patterns has been a little off. I am not very predictable but it has set all my weekdays the same even though I wake up an hour earlier on 2 days. It was easy to manually change that in the app in the schedule section. The weekend days are separate.
title: Check that your system is compatible before opening package. (Mine was)

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: L J.
content: Bought these to compliment my smart home upgrades (recently installed wireless garage door openers that can be operated via my smartphone). Bought 4 of these for 2 homes with 2 zones each. Took 1/2 hour for first install. 20 minutes for the others. The biggest problem was the way my existing (badly installed) wiring came out of the wall. Had to do a little surgery... The Nest install web site and video make the install quite easy and confirm exactly which wires go where on the Nest. Beautiful design. I like the plate they provide to cover any holes in the wall behind. Love the ability to control all 4 units through the Nest smartphone app. Or we can control with Alexa in each home (Alexa, lower first floor to 72 degrees!!). Also, the learning function is very neat. Yes, these are pricey. But, I believe they will save money over the long run, particularly if you are replacing a non-programmable thermostat. Now, if I could control all 4 thermostats at one time with EITHER Alexa in either home, that would be really neat! Next upgrade, smart plugs and alarm systems that can be controlled through smartphone and Alexa...

product: Google T3007ES Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation, Stainless Steel, Works with Amazon Alexa, 1
author: B. Sutton
content: I've only had it installed for a few days, and love it! I opted for the White version, and I'm glad I did. It looks great! Very simple to set up, and lots of nifty features. If you need any help, check out the sub for Nest on Reddit. Please over there are great about answering questions fast. I have a Google Home and a few Echo's. The Home seems to have better command support for things like the Nest, but both work much the same. Home: "OK Google, set the temp to 76 degrees." Echo: "Hey Alexa, set the Nest temp to 76 degrees." I have my Nest named "Nest". The default is "Living Room" or something similar. Since I only have 1, changing it to simply "Nest" makes the Echo commands more intuitive than having to say "Hey Alexa, set the Living Room temp to 76 degrees".
title: Great addition to my smart home!
